Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: G0al
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is a very nice hotel. Checking in was quick and efficient, the receptionist was warm and friendly. She gave me free breakfast coupons as soon as she found my information in the system. Although it is a little bit pricey, the quality and location of the hotel is worth the money. The location for this hotel is just perfect. The Navy Pier is just straight down the street, shoppes and restaurants are within minutes of walking out of the hotel. The only complaint that I had was that the pool was closed for an indefinite time. They suggested the option to go across the street to the Marriott for swimming but it is very inconvenient. Imagine walking out of the pool, out of the hotel and crossing the street in your swimming suit in downtown Chicago. Other than that, the room was very clean, spacious and had a very good view of the Magnificent Mile. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2012
Reviews.Content: I'm a hotel snob and Intercontinental Hotel did NOT disappoint me. I wanted to treat myself on my birthday so I flew out to Chicago for the weekend and the hotel was very grand and the location was fabulous! Starbucks was in the lobby which is a must and the staff were very courteous. I was able to walk to all the museums and all of the major tourist spots such as the Hancock Center and the Bean and SHOPPING! it was indeed very magnificent, hahaha! I was there for three days and i enjoyed good food and good company and i will surely come back to this hotel next time i'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: msg1225
Reviews.Content: For a large chain hotel with a lot of conferences going on while we were there my sister and I felt the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. When I arrived at my room I requested an extra luggage stand, it arrived within minutes plus extra pillows. The door man was very helpful and explained the workings of the hotel. The outrageous charge for wifi is so over the top, it is free at small chain hotels! It is free in the Starbucks down in the lobby. The room was large, the beds very comfortable, the bath was well supplied, and the linens comfortable. The location is great, close to shopping and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Twovets
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay here. I was not disappointed. The staff was very nice. The concierge was excellent and directed us to wonderful places to eat. The room was very nice, clean and quiet. We didn't need to depart till after check out time and they were very helpful with letting us check our bags until departure. I love, love, love the location. It is central to all things we were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Rich W
Reviews.Content: I stay here 2-3 times a year and each time I return with a warm welcome and greeting. The staff is amazing as most have been there forever and remember all guests, their friends and more. There is no request they will not accomodate. I am guaranteed my upgrade as a platinum ambasador. My only negative comments is this is a convention city which brings me there and now they charge as much as $75 to handle a package. There is no excuse to charge $25 for a small package and $75 for a large package. I think they forgot what business they are in? Charge a minimal handling fee as a service for a business visitor is okay - make it a revenue center and become as impersonal as the airlines.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal Says - Great Hotel Great Service Ok Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: I like the Intercon and the Fairmont type hotels. They take an old building keep the high ceilings and the wide halls and then take this shell and put in modern everything. So many hotels take the old infrastructure and put in window heating and cooling units that are noisy, cheap doors so you hear people in the hall, small bathrooms and crowded sinks. The Intercon in Chicago does a very nice job blending the two. I was upgraded to a suite but it was too much an entire second room bigger than the bedroom. But the bedroom is great. Wifi is free with membership in their rewards. The concierge was great with suggestions and reservations. Across the street is the Purple Pig. It is an upscale meditteranean restaurant with an emphasis on pork. It is served in ways that make your mouth water. They take no reservations and I have walked away in the past because the wait was 1-2 hours. The concierge got me and my customer in with a 5 minute wait. He showed us on the map every where to go in the area. So now for the restaurant at the hotel. Michael Jordans is the steak restaurant there are several in the country. The prices and menu in the bar were just too over the top. Two hamburgers and 2 ok wines came to $70 with a 20% tip that the bar put on the bill whether you liked it or not. For two people this is just wrong. Given you are surrounded by good places to eat, stay at the hotel ask the concierage for reccomendations and have agreat time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Joeavg123
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Intercontinental in Chicago. It is THE place to stay! Great location and great staff! Can't say enough good things. Just awesome. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Intercontinental - Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl92
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better. The hotel staff was wonderful. Rooms clean. Starbucks onsite and wonderful concierge. Would definately stay there again. Have a kiosk in the lobby where you can print your boarding pass. This is the first time I've seen this. Very handy - worked perfectly. Wish they had seating in the lobby where you could enjoy a cocktail. Love the lobby experience - especially when traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds & pillows”
Reviews.Author: QueenofCaffeine
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 1 night at the InterContinental, but I hope to go back soon. The staff were friendly, professional & welcoming. The room was clean & quiet & a perfect temperature for sleeping. The bathroom was roomy & updated. The only disappointment was to excitedly find a makeup mirror attached to the bathroom wall, but it was mounted for a six foot person.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhmazing American Girl Doll Package”
Reviews.Author: Tracybozz
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from an overnight stay with my daughter for an American Girl weekend. We booked the AG package and from the moment we arrived until the time we left, we were in heavan. Jonathan Roby the Room Specialist was awesome and upgraded us to a suite which was totally not expected. We arrived in the room to the AG doll bed & tiarra and later in the day returned to cupcakes, chocolate mile and popcorn left for my daughter. Included in the price was a small breakfast in the morning but the waiters allowed my daughter to have the buffet for no additional charge. The hotel is in a great location, only 5 blocks from the Water Tower and AG store. We stayed in room 2645 of the newer hotel and I would not hesitate to stay again. Great room, SUPER comfy bed, great smelling sheets and one of the best staff around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_R_Grant
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Chicago is a lovely old hotel with an unbeatable location on Michigan Avenue. Our room was on the smaller side but tastefully decorated and comfortable. The art deco pool area was very attractive and worth a peak even if you don't go for a swim. We had room service for dinner, and the food was on par with the rest of the experience at the hotel. We had no complaints about the level of service we received or quality of accommodation. The InterContinental is very convenient for both shopping and sightseeing. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Historic And very clean”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business this week and was very impressed. All the extra charges like 17 dollars for Internet and 57 bucks for parking did not amuse me but overall a very nice property with a very interesting story begins it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RetaginTN
Reviews.Content: Unlike many of the reviewers on here, I had excellent service at the InterContinental Chicago. No service complaints whatsoever. Anyone I spoke with there was extremely gracious and helpful. I will agree, however, that they do go a bit overboard charging for each little thing. $7 for a bottle of water is a bit steep...don't you think? The room was nice and comfortable but not anything out of the way as far as luxury was concerned. Still no complaints there. I understand some people saying it is a bit worn out but I didn't feel that way at all. It's a lovely, old hotel. If you want something new and modern, it may not be exactly what you're looking for but I like this sort of hotel. I travel so much that I welcome a place that's not the same old thing all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: lololives
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel very early - before 6 AM. We were exhausted and hoping without optimism that there would be a room available. The man at the front desk was incredibly helpful. Even though a single room was not available he let us take a double and then switch to a single when it was ready. It made a huge difference to our first day to be able to grab a few hours sleep. The rooms were beautiful. Honestly I wish I would have kept the double room because it was much more spacious and had more furniture - not just the extra bed. The furnishings were better than expected - even with a four star hotel. We slept very comfortably. I found everything to be clean and the lobby was impressive. You can take a self-guided tour of the historic building - they will give you instructions. I thought that was a nice addition. The location can't be beat. We walked almost everywhere we needed to go - the Art museum, to the theater, to the famous hot dog restaurant. It was so convenient to be able to walk out the door and have endless options for eating, drinking, and shopping. It was wonderful having a Starbucks right in the lobby. I always woke up before my husband and enjoyed going downstairs for a cup of coffee and to read the paper. We went to ENO and felt they were arrogant and borderline rude. We thought it would be fun to try this ultra-trendy wine and chocolate restaurant but we were really disappointed. We asked for advice on the best menu items to sample but the attitude of our server was almost comically snobbish. We ended up spending an insane amount of money for two glasses of wine, a few bites of cheese and a piece of chocolate - all while receiving bad service. That was one of the most disappointing parts of our entire trip to Chicago. I recommend this hotel because all of the staff were friendly and helpful because the rooms were nice and comfortable, and because the location was great. We got this hotel for a song because it was the off-season and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “kind of worn out”
Reviews.Author: Sveenz
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago definitely had its best times a while ago. There is nothing I can really complain about and the building surely has its charm, however there are better properties to stay at in the windy city. The overall service is ok but the staff would not go out of their way to make you feel special. The wait for check in was about 20min. What I didnt like was the fact that everything costs extra. The value for price ration wasnt too good. Internet access costs, the bottle of water in the room isnt complemetary either and there is not even a small selection of free TV on demand. The feel in the room is a bit strange and my room had connecting doors to both neighbouring rooms. The bathtub is old and the bathroom not really appealing. The furniture in the room is chipped and worn out quite a bit. There are no slippers in the room and amenities are limited. There is no safe-deposit box. I expect that from a wannabe 5-star property. Meeting facilities have their charm but everything is arranged like a maze due to the age of the building. I liked the Starbucks that is integrated into the lobby and the bar on the other side of the lobby has a great selection of beer on tap. The Michael Jordan Steakhouse is excellent, great atmosphere and good food. For business travel the hotel is ok but I wouldnt come here for romantic get-aways unless the rate would be more attractive.

Reviews.Title: “The most difficult review I have done”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddylev
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels and resorts all over the world, and never have I come across a review as difficult to write. I will start with the good, and then the bad. If i could give half stars I would give this place 3.5 The good 1) Location - directly on Michigan Ave 2) The rooms - nice, clean, bed was comfortable 3) Dining/Bars - lots of options, even though we are elsewhere 4) The doormen will get you a cab in less than 30 seconds The Bad 1) They will nickle and dime you for every last penny, and i felt cheated a) the mini bar has no price guide. I drank a diet coke from it and was charged $7.12 after tax. I understand you pay a premium for the mini bar, but this is above any beyond what should be legal b) the gym they charge you $12.00 a day to use it, or $15.00 for your entire stay. I have never seen any other hotel in my life charge for use of a gym c) parking is $57.00 a night. This is a high rent district, but this is still about $10.00 higher than average d) our shower was 100% stopped up when we got there. They had to snake the drain during the first night e) coffee had not been replaced from previous guest Full disclosure - I paid $89.00 a night through priceline for this hotel this previous weekend. Would i come back for that price? Absolutely. Would I pay the $179 weekend advertised rate? No chance. There are other properties that make you feel more valued and you wont feel like they are trying to take every last dollar in your waller

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow and more wow!”
Reviews.Author: jmb578
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights from February 17-20 as we celebrated our wedding anniversary. This hotel is just perfect! It was well worth the $97 a night deal that I got from Hotwire. When they heard it was our anniversary, they worked hard to make our stay extra special. We stayed in 1461 and had a great view of North Michigan Avenue. The room was super clean and plush. I loved the robes and slippers! The location is perfectly situated in the middle of all the action on North Michigan Avenue. Plus, it is only three blocks from the Red Line subway, so traveling in from the airport is simple. There's no need to rent a car. Chicago was made for walking! Thank you, Intercontinental, for such a special weekend. We loved it, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very nice, but the room itself was subpar.”
Reviews.Author: sw552704
Reviews.Content: We booked the room on Hotwire. This was the first time we used a third party booking service. I'm not sure if the hotel holds lesser rooms for these services, or how it works, but it so happened that we ended up with an older room, outdated bathroom, and paper-thin walls. The staff was prompt and friendly, and the hotel was clean. The location was second to none. If considering this hotel, maybe spend the extra for a newer room. Also beware, parking at the hotel is $57 for every 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite place to stay, in fact I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: g m
Reviews.Content: Our friends talked us into staying at Intercontinental. The room was average for an upper end hotel, and was not very clean. The pool was closed for repair, and the check in staff was less than helpful when we tried to change rooms. The room was very noisy with what seemed like some kind of plumbing issue? The bed linen felt very low quality and the bathroom sink area was not in great shape - some of the finished areas were pealing! Not what I would expect of a 3 star hotel let alone a 4 or 4.5 hotel. Go to the Marriot across the street, same great location and a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful unusable pool.”
Reviews.Author: greenchipmonk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient location for walking to nearly everything. The valets are very helpful and polite. The entire staff seemed to be very professional. The room was a bit of a disappointment in both size and cleanliness though. We found someones socks between the bed and wall and some toys under the bed. I was also a bit shocked at the daily rate for wifi. Nearly $15 and $20 for normal and high speed access. The biggest disappointment was by far the non functioning swimming pool. This pool is gorgeous. It is obviously a big selling point as it is pictured on their website and most of their literature, including the free postcards in the room. It looks to be at least 10' deep and huge. Unfortunately it was closed and had no water in it. This wasn't mentioned until being told by the bellhop in our room. He had no idea when it is to be reopened. The kids were ready to leave. Fortunately the Marriott across the street allowed us to use their pool. It was very nice of them to accommodate us but their pool is not nearly as nice as the one we thought we were getting. I later found out from an employee that the pool has been empty since October. Better call to make sure that you can swim in the pool first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but could use some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: EnaTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location for a tourist stay in Chicago. A short walk from the loop, museums and shopping areas, and plenty of restaurants and coffee shops around to fuel up for more sightseeing. The rooms could use a bit of upgrading though. The desk chair in our room was visibly worn and the heater/ac unit very very loud. So loud, it made it hard to hear the television and we turned it off at night. There was also this mysterious screen next to the television that we thought was for internet usage and gaming (?), but we did not need it because we had smart phones. For the life of us, we could not find the off-switch of that thing and it glowed this blue light which was annoying at night, so I ended up pulling the plug. On the up-side: the beds were super comfortable and the bathroom nice and clean. Internet is available at this hotel, but highly over-charged. You can get free internet at the Starbucks downstairs. We got a great rate through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “An all around great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joni56-11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, comfortable beds, and excellent service. It is clean and friendly and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel in a Fur Coat”
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: For the life of me, I can not imagine why this is rated as a 4-4.5 star hotel. It is a nice property, and if stars were awarded solely for location, the Intercontinental would be tops. It was amazing to pull to the side of Michigan Ave. and hand the valet our key. The staff on the street were very motivated and friendly, and helped us into the lobby very courteously. But precisely at this point, the experience stopped being amazing. The lobby is fairly mediocre with nice touches, but it is very small and there is no traffic pattern. At busy times, people checking in will get mixed into people waiting for concierge services. The front desk staff were nice, but not incredibly efficient or overly concerned with providing superior service. They were competent at best. The set-up of the concierge desk is very impersonal and the staff look and act simply like more front desk staff. The staff seemed to portray the same aloof, forced-interest in the customer that I had experienced at the front desk. The room was even less impressive. It was at the end of a long and serpentine hallway, and the room directly across from it was both unmarked and had a door that look like it had been scratched open by wolves. I am not kidding. The door across the hall so damaged that it looked like it was in a neglected apartment building. Once in the room, it was small but reasonably appointed with two full size beds (I hadn't slept in a full size bed since high school) and a very small bathroom. Upon further inspection, the room had dust on the fixtures and wall hangings, stained duvets in the covers, and crumbs in the carpet near the walls. In the bathroom, the faucet fixture was missing the fake white pearl on the cold faucet leaving an exposed screw. The bathroom also featured two panels that looked like fuse boxes that were disturbingly loose against the wall. All night long, there was something that sounded like a very loud shower that ran whenever the heat was on. I heard this sound whenever I was in the hallway on our floor. At times I also smelled a bad odor in our room throughout the night. Finally, in terms of amenities, I can not figure out the 4.5 star rating in this hotel. I went out to get some ice and looked on my floor, plus the next two floors up from my floor. I then picked up the floor courtesy phone and asked where I could find some ice. I was told that the seventh floor was "the ice floor". Are you kidding? I did find two ice machines on the seventh floor. Again, they were very competent. Everything is an up-charge, from $57 dollar/night parking (which is comparable but still MORE than most Chicago properties) to internet, in room services and more. Michael Jordan's restaurant and bar are nice, but I was referred to Walgreens to bring gelato up to my room. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Oenology wine bar rocks!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQpacific
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Ã¼ber-average but the Oenology wine bar was an awesome experience. Would give that 5 BIG points. Totally sexy wines, presentation, education, pairings, tasting notes....loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SaintmarkLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 2 days last week. The reception area is nice and there is a Michael Jordan restaurant, which is always pretty decent. Staff were friendly and the rooms large, with more luxury items than some IC hotels ie bath robes. In room safe/TV/internet. Good beds. Location also good. The hotel is spread out a little, so cant be sure of all rooms. But overall have to say it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KevinWhitePlains_NY
Reviews.Content: Classic hotel on Michigan Ave in the middle of Chicago. Rooms are small and the HVAC system was noisy, but the bed and bathroom were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: Great Property, everything in this hotel was flawless. Jodi provided great concierge services. Friendly staff, the rooms were very clean and spacious. Next time im in Chicago i'll be sure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, but not my favorite Intercontinental Property”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: THis hotel has such a rich history on Michigan Avenue. The architecture of the original lobby is striking, and the pool upstairs is a 'must see'. That being said, the rooms here are a bit small...and a bit dated. Just a touch though. I am a big fan of Intercontinental, and you will NEVER have a bad hotel experience with them. Never. The rooms are impeccably maintained and serviced. The beds are wonderful. Cleanliness is a religion here.... Chicago is a town of great hotels, and so many others are newer kids on the block....and they have exciting offerings. I stay here some, but prefer the Park Hyatt, the Four Seasons, the Pen, and others. For value though, this hotel is hard to beat. It really is.... I love you IC, but have to be honest. :) Ill be back though....always return once in a while!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Michele V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel on January 21, 2012. Great location, but service a little to be desired. One of the coldest days in Chicago and NO HEAT in our room! Someone brought up a space heater that barely got warm. When I called and said it wasn't heating up, they said, "takes a while to heat up." They never even offered to relocate us to a room with heat. When I asked about changing rooms, they wanted to charge extra. I was told, "We are giving you a free breakfast." We stay a LOT in Chicago and we have a lot of choices. Very disappointed in the service. On the upside the breakfast and the breakfast staff were great. Upon checking out I complained again to Front Office Day Manager and she gave me her card and said upon our next stay contact her and she would upgrade our room. Sorry, but after that stay can't say there will be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mag Mile Spot”
Reviews.Author: fmperucca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice though it can be expensive (we got a good deal), but it is the perfect place to stay if you want to be in the heart of the shopping district in Chicago. Very courteous and helpful staff. Room was great, but I was disappointed that there was a $14 charge for internet connection (you can go to the Starbucks in the lobby and get a free connection).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly personnel, clean facility”
Reviews.Author: florida1950
Reviews.Content: My husband was here on business and I came along just to keep him company and check out downtown Chicago. From the greeter at curbside to the bellmen, valet and front desk personnel all were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was a nice size and very clean. Two comfortable chairs for relaxing. TV on the smallish size but adequate, however, had to have someone come up and "jiggle" wires to get it to come on. Also a friendly employee. Love the button by the door that indicates "do no disturb" or "please clean room". Very convenient. The bathroom was awkward to use. No towel rack for the hand towel. Had to drape on the sink which resulted in a wet towel several times. The toilet tissue was behind the toilet and difficult to reach. We resorted to "resting" it on the tub. The small ledge was not conducive to personal effects. And lighting was poor. HOWEVER, it was very clean. I wish there was a lobby where you could sit and watch the foot traffic on Michigan Ave. They did have a Starbucks and a hotel bar with limited access to "people watching". The bar food was very good. Nice staff, very helpful without being intrusive. The Starbucks was very busy but good service quickly. Lots of business people on computers. Fun to check it all out. Good view of Michigan Ave. We ate at Michael Jordan's Restaurant at the hotel. Nice decor, good staff, not remarkable food. Not bad just not great. A tad pricey but to be expected for the location. On a side note, we enjoyed the bar food so much more. All in all a good visit and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: tcanyon
Reviews.Content: I scheduled a business trip with the additional purpose of entertaining clients in the evening. Overall I found the hotel clean, good location, helpful staff. But what made this trip the most worthwhile for me was dining in the Michael Jordan Steakhouse in the hotel. Definitely a top notch experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky_Kat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for a leisure weekend with my husband and niece and it could not have been a better experience. From Stan who greeted us and took charge of our bags, to the front desk check-in to Sam who delivered our bags and was a wealth of information on the hotel and surrounding area. Our room was clean, nicely appointed and a decent size. The staff everywhere was wonderful. We ate at Michael Jordans restaurant and at the Continental and at both the food was good and waitstaff courteous and attentive. The hotel is right across from Nordstroms and within a few blocks of other great stores. This was meant to be a special weekend for our niece's 18th birthday and the Intercontinental certainly played it's part.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location, bell service horrible.”
Reviews.Author: amimtravel
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was very satisfactory. Our room was a good size with a Michigan Avenue view. The lobby is attractive and front desk, room service and housekeeping attentive. The bell service was horrible. We waited 45 minutes for our luggage to be brought "out" from the bell closet and one of the bags was lost. If we had been flying a commercial flight, we would have missed our flight. The person manning the bell desk said he could not leave to go retrieve our bags and there was no one else to assist. This was unsatisfactory and not up to par for other hotels of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: fmaspavan
Reviews.Content: It's everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. We spent 5 days there and I have 0 complaints. Room was very nice, so was the bathroom, hotel staff was more than kind and friendly, the restaurant is very good, breakfast was amazing. Location: right on Michigan Ave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Unbelievably Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Brick B
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is an attractive hotel in a nice Chicago location. The poor rating is a result of the condition of the room when I arrived. I checked in fairly late, after a day of travel. My biggest surprise (or shock) was finding the bathroom door nob covered by a condom. The bathroom did have bath towels, but no hand towels nor washcloths. The carpet had very obviously not been swept. If I had not been in need of sleep, and had I not heard the clerk tell another person at check in there were no more rooms, I would have requested a room change. At least the bedding was fresh. The next morning I reported the condition to the front desk. No apology, just a "we'll make sure the room is cleaned. That evening, the carpet still had not been swept, but at least there were no surprises on the door nob. Great exercise room resulted in poor vs terrible rating.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: sombrero6
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels, I have to say I expected more from this hotel. Upon check-in there was VERY little seating anywhere in the lobby. Also this presented a problem at check-out, as we had to check our luggage when we had to leave our rooms upon check-out the last day. We had about 2 hrs to fill, no seating, no hospitality room for a group of about 15 and no where to wait. I will also add that we had to wait about 1/2 hr to retrieve our luggage from the bellman, therefore our bus had to wait 1/2 hour for us, too! There were some disappointed kids with us, as they had to walk down the street to the Marriott hotel to swim....the pool was inoperable or under repair. Mind you, it was 15 degrees out! As for our room, it was very noisy, I finally figured out we had a room behind the elevator and we were hearing the gears, as it went up and down. The maintenance men were working on the elevators for our entire 3 night stay. I did hear several guests talking about how hard it was to keep the most comfortable temperature in their rooms. This was true for us, as we sometimes had to turn the heat off at night due to the noise of the fan. I finally laid a towel down in front of the door to keep the draft from the hallway from coming in to our room. The Continental Dining Room serves a very nice breakfast.....If you don't mind spending $28.00 for a bowl of oatmeal. My husband objected and they did bring his bill down to $14.00. There were 3 of us who ate the breakfast buffet, the bill totaled $84.00. Our last morning we ate at Starbucks right in the hotel, for less than $10.00....very reasonable! On the plus side of all this, we were near good shopping, cabs were easy to get, the Chicago restaurants are wonderful. Michael Jackson's Restaurant is right inside this hotel, which is a fun place to go! If you go, try to get to Giordanos Pizza....delicious! This was a great adventure, but I have to say we enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn and Suites at 320 Michigan Ave much more for much less money! To add to the fun, visit Garretts Popcorn and the Hershey Store!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: duckioo
Reviews.Content: Great location on the magnificent mile. Good hotel. Nice room although a bit small, newly renovated, comfortable with classy decor. Excellent service. We couldn't find our way back to the hotel after parking our car in a nearby garage but somehow found the back door. It caught the hotel staff back there by surprise but they were very friendly and got someone to help us right the way. Check in was fast and staff were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, gym good enough, not superb”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights, my third stay. The IC is still a good hotel, clean room, nice bathroom, a gym. Staff also very friendly and alert. But it's not sticking out anymore. Quite some chains that give you a modern room with a fresh look ... The IC is a bit stuck where they were 20 years ago while the competition moved on. Or maybe there are simply a lot of people I don't know that fancy this particular style. It's a good room, but don't expect any surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Service, Comfortable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: It's hard to go wrong with an InterContinental Hotel and the Chicago Michigan Avenue location is no exception. Service is what stands out from the moment you drive up to check out. Get used to employees who look you in the eye and know what you need, even if it's just a friendly hello. The rooms are well appointed. Perhaps no more or less than you'd expect. Ask for a junior suite (room number ending in 01) and you'll enjoy a fantastic view of the Wrigley and Tribune buildings, the Michigan Avenue bridge, a sliver of the river and even the Sears Tower, off in the distance. Only oddity is the lobby, which lacks suitable seating for meeting-up or people watching. Then again, there was a giant Christmas tree in the smallish lobby, so perhaps seating is seasonal.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Laceytom
Reviews.Content: Great historic hotel. Big rooms. Pool is under renovation. Great MJ steakhouse and wine bar in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent room”
Reviews.Author: jadubya
Reviews.Content: August 2011 - business stay for a week. Perfect location on Michigan Avenue. Room was outstanding since I had a view of Lake Michigan and South Michigan Ave from the 26th floor. Indoor pool was excellent as well as access to Lakeshore Drive / Navy Pier to run every daily. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: reyty1
Reviews.Content: My friend who was visiting Chicago invited me to stay there. I made the right decision to accept the invitation, as the hotel was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: JennyBNashvilleTN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was central to most of what we wanted to see and do in Chicago over a long weekend. My adult daughter and myself were in the city over a long weekend. We felt safe day and night on foot and on the trains and bus. The CTA has a $14 3-day transit pass ride the trains and bus all you want. The hotel staff was very accommodating. The rooms were very private, clean, and large. We felt very safe in this location of the city. The restaurant in the hotel is Micheal Jordan's steak house and a Starbucks is adjoining the hotel's lobby. It has great looking business center although we did not use it. We also did not eat at the restaurant although we found out too late how terrific the dessert menu looked - it had a fantastic looking chocolate cake we would have loved to have enjoyed in the room late one night with some starbucks! The room rate we had was $149 before tax for a double. It was a wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay there again on another visit!

Reviews.Title: “2 day escape”
Reviews.Author: bsch899
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed on the 30th floor of the Intercontential on December 28th and 29th of 2011. I booked the room with my priority points and was very pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and quiet. My wife is a very light sleeper and she said she felt like it was the quietest hotel room that we've ever stayed in. The location is perfect. Itâ€™s within walking distance to all the major attractions. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: Location is prime for shopping on Michigan avenue and visiting all the sites that Chicago has to offer. However, Valet parking is EXTREMELY expensive. We booked a standard room, had no view, but the room was updated. Only issue: counter space in the bathroom is lacking and shower drainage issues. Our package had breakfast included, which had an excellent variety and quality of food. Will definitely be staying here again due to the location!

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, average room”
Reviews.Author: BartFargo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days and was unimpressed, especially given its nameplate and rating. While the room was clean and quiet, the furnishings were a bit beat up and tired. It's an old building and the bathroom had really weak water pressure and the plumbing made a lot of noise. However, overall it was satisfactory and the staff were very friendly and helpful; I'd still recommend it as long as you get a good rate.Â

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising and Scams!”
Reviews.Author: CAGreenTraveler
Reviews.Content: I apologize for the stark title, but, sadly, it is accurate. We selected this hotel for our family Christmas vacation in Chicago, but what a disappointment. The hotel was our top choice because of the wonderful (historic?) indoor pool. You can see this major amenity advertised on their website. Here's the hitch: it was closed! And it's been closed since October! There's no mention of this on their website, when you call or even at check-in. To boot, the staff was not remotely apologetic! Our whole family was disappointed, not to mention the many other families we came across who were equally angered. I suggested to the hotel they put a notice on their website, but they said "corporate" controls the website! To add insult to injury, we were scammed the the hotel's own concierge. We were told a theater show we were interested in was "sold out," but they could get us broker tickets. We believed the concierge (naively) and decided we'd pay the extra money, only to return to our room, go online and see the show was not sold out! Plenty of tix available directly online through TicketMaster, at original list price. What a scam! When I finally was able to speak with the highest level manager "on property" at the hotel, he was a cold as a fish. "Too bad" was his overall response to the false advertising on the pool, to ruining my kid's time in Chicago and to scamming us out of $150. Oh, he did offer some $15 wrist band to a local kiddie amusement--gee thanks. BTW, my husband and I USED TO BE loyal customers of the Intercontinental Chicago--guess things have changed over the years. The management team there needs to learn what hospitality and business ethics mean. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good located”
Reviews.Author: Gosia B
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room ,clean bathroom .Very good located .Friendly staff .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Michigan Ave Shopping”
Reviews.Author: WIStLuciaBride
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Valet Parking as you enter, helpful bell hops, beautiful tree and decor in lobby, helpful front desk with minimal wait for check in on one of the busiest days of the year, room had excellent views and swank furnishings like window seat, spa like soaps and bathroom, very comfortable beds, quilts, and furnishings had lots of comfort and storage, robe in room was a nice touch, concierge was very helpful with dinner reservations and gave us a bottle opener (although I had to come down 15 floors to lobby to get it). LOCATION IS THE BEST! We were able to come back to the hotel to unload our many bargain finds throughout the day! Cons: Price, pool which is spectacular in photos was closed (offered use of across the street Hotel...um, no thanks), Charging for internet access, background music, and games on in room computer was ridiculous ( Starbucks adjacent to lobby provided). No offering of cookies and hot chocolate/coffee/hot cider in lobby in evenings as other hotels provide to their guests this time of year. No free breakfast. In room fridge was missing, used spot for our storage instead, ice machines only on 1 level, in room coffee maker was tiny and ho hum, room was relatively expensive with all extras at high additional costs, Just a general lack of festive touches other than tree in lobby. Valet was ho hum dirty and in basement that stunk for pick up and EXPENSIVE (over $55). So we loved the LOCATION but will try another hotel on MI Ave next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: vhaywood
Reviews.Content: InterContinental Chicago is perfectly located on Michigan Ave and gives a unique experience to anyone visiting Chicago, whether on vacation or travelling for business. The hotel has so much history and character, it's fascinating to hear some of the stories and see the incredible architecture. The pool is definitely a highlight. The staff here are exceptional. From the Doorman and Bellman to Concierge, Reception and Housekeeping staff...everyone is warm and welcoming and genuine. Michael Jordan's Steakhouse is an experience in itself and the food is incredible. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. Friendly and professional staff, perfect location and a fantastic restaurant... Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: indytravelergirl
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Michigan Ave for shopping/restaurants. Very nice Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Scott L
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not have been any better. The hotel was decorated beautifully. The location was absolutly perfect for restaurants and shopping. Everything was an easy walk away. Our rooms were very spacious and the views of Michigan Ave. and the beautifully, holiday lit Wrigley Building were gorgeous. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and went out of their way to accommodate our requests. Everyone raved about the comfortable beds and the bath amenities. With a large Starbucks attached to the lobby and Michael Jordans Steakhouse on the property, things could not have been easier. We are looking forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Couples weekend away - perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nezzer88
Reviews.Content: 5 couples stayed here while on a weekend getaway. Rooms were just perfect, I can't believe people find something to complain about. We asked staff for places to go for dinner and they were very accomodating, even calling the restaurant to ensure we could be seated. Beds were very comfortable and the decor was very modern. Starbucks in the lobby was great as well. The best part was the location, couldn't ask for a better starting point to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Average or below in all respects, except for location”
Reviews.Author: Calvin L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 on a leisure trip to Chicago. Hotel is very dated, with some rooms that just aren't good enough. Front desk staff was rude. Will not be staying here again - prefer the Swissotel and the Hyatt properties (Regency is similarly priced, and Park Hyatt is 3x more) and a list of boutique hotels in the area as well (Kimpton, etc). Pros: -The only hotel that opens onto Michigan Avenue, very close to all of the excitement -Eno Wine Bar has a great selection of cheeses -Rooms are clean Cons: -Some hotel rooms just make no sense - our first room was tiny and had a window overlooking a ledge (effectively no view), and our second room had two windows that looked out onto a brick wall (actually no view) -You have to pay for everything - internet, gym, and the pool (which was not available due to renovation...) -Entire hotel was very old, not in a classical sense but in a ghost story one -Front desk staff was rude

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: olalaoparis
Reviews.Content: It does not get better than this. It is located right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile and it has 2 entrances, on a side street and on Michigan Avenue. We booked a superior room and were upgraded to a Michigan Avenue suite. It was very beautiful and the bed was extremely comfortable. It is only a short walk to the Navy Pier / Lake Michigan, to the river, to the water tower and the Hanckock Building - and a stone's throw to geat shopping and the best designers stores in the world. There is an Italian restauran about one block away that is our very favorite in Chicago, called Volare (highly recommended). I think this hotel has great value for what we paid. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: SBF2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were treated very well by all the staff. We had a higher floor room overlooking the Magnificent Mile. The room was comfortable and well appointed. All the staff we encountered in the hotel were friendly, efficient and extremely professional. The wine bar food was good but the service was far from it. We would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: We_L0ve_Italy
Reviews.Content: Nice , older hotel, great location, good buy. Clean rooms. Our King delux was quite spacious. The only complaint--we had to wait a very long time for the bell man to bring our luggage from storage. Otherwise, pleasant stay in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disinterested Staff and a Loud Dog”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: We had a nice day walking around Chicago, and wanted a peaceful evening in the room. Unfortunately, that wasn't on the menu at the Intercontinental. We heard a barking dog in the next room. One of those little yappers - sharp and piercing. We called the front desk. We were assured something would happen. An hour later we called again - the same person made the same assurances. We decided to go out and get a light, late dinner. When we came back it was much quieter, so we assumed something had been done. We settled in for bed. At 12:30, the yapping started again - this time, mixed in with howling. That prompted our third call. A different manager was on duty and made more assurances. Fifteen minutes later he called us back and offered us a different room. The dog had been quiet during that time, so we said we'd decide and let him know. A minute later we finally hear the phone ringing in the next room (yes, this place has uncomfortably thin walls) for the first time. Why wouldn't the people causing the problem get moved first? The dog was quiet until about 9:00 a.m., when it was abandoned again, and started yelping non-stop. We sped up our packing and got out, and will never return to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just bad luck for us”
Reviews.Author: lytsout1
Reviews.Content: My 2 star rating is based on our experience alone. The hotel seemed very nice but I think we had some bad luck. We arrived before our room was available, which I have no problem with. We sat in the bar and had a drink. But as we sat there, I figured hey, we're on a mini vacation, I'm gonna see if I can upgrade our room. I spoke to one of the managers at the front desk and he upgraded us for free because we had to wait. We were put into a room on the 25th floor. So far so good. The room was not at all what we were expecting. It was extremely small. The main room had a king sized bed, which is what we wanted. But the room was only big enough for the bed, a small desk immediately next to the bed, a closet and a dresser. Without question the smallest room I've ever seen at a hotel. The bathroom was pretty good size though. Oh, I forgot to mention the digital thermometer in the room told us the room was 91 degrees, and it felt like it. It was roasting in there. I lowered the thermostat as far as it would go and I opened a window a few inches (it was very cold outside). We dressed quickly and left the room for a night on the town. When we returned, the digital thermometer read 85 degrees. Still very hot and made for a very uncomfortable night of sleep. I worked in hotels while in college, so I hate to bother the staff with my problems. But after a very sweaty night, I called maintenance in the morning. They arrived a short time later and stated the problem was fixed. A couple hours later, it was still in the mid 80s and the vent was simply blowing air, not cold air. I went to the front desk and they immediately gave us another room. The 2nd room was very nice. A large main room with a king sized bed and a very nice view on the 32nd floor. If we had this room originally, I would probably give this hotel 4 or 5 stars. Although we did not have a great experience, I do believe this hotel is very nice. The staff was great and handled our problems very professionally. The hotel is in a very good location. I just wonder what upgrade we got when we first arrived. The first room we had was so small, I can only guess the upgrade was a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, beatiful, old world, medieval styled Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ZzZzzzzzzzzzzzjjhh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at the Intercontinental Chicago on 12/9---One of Chicago's many older grand, gorgeous Hotels, right on Michigan Ave. Close walking distance to Navy Pier, Water Tower shopping, Millenium Park--The Bean and ice skating, Trump Tower, John Hancock Center, and the Palmer House Hilton Hotel and much more! Rooms are very comfortable and updated with all the amenties included. Very quiet room, beds are extremely comfortable and pillow topped, did not want to get up. My room had a great view down Michigan Ave, it was on the 17th floor---hotel has 26 floors it is on the larger size Recommend seeing the Ballrooms on the 3rd and 4th floors located in the Historic Tower---they are medieval styled with armour standing on either side of the entrance to one Ballroom. Pictures of kings, queens, and knights in armour, even fountains in marble dripping water, also the woodworkand chandliers are amazing! Only disappointment was that their historic Junior Olympic sized pool was closed due to the City of Chicago shuting it down for some strange reason---However I was able to use the Chicago Marriotts pool across the street for free, just bring your room key, so not too bad! Overall excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Hotel on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: livetutravel
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the recommendation from several travel guides. Considering its unique history, convenient location and good value, this hotel just gave me a wonderful experience in the Windy City! I believe I made the right choice! The location is unbeatable! The hotel opens its main door directly facing Michigan Avenue. All the shopping and fine dining are great. There is a bus stop right in front with services to the museum campus and the Loop. Grand Red CTA station is 2 blocks away. Two bus routes to Navy Pier Park stop at Grand/Rush. Going everywhere is very easy! I was given a big room on 21/F in the historic building facing Michigan Avenue. The view was so nice! There were 6 big windows on 3 sides of the room! It cost me US$120/night including taxes. I consider this very good value for the location and size. Noise was a bit of a problem despite the high floor. Overall, the room and the hotel interior might look a bit tired and old but actually not too bad for a historic building. Of course, not to compare with other new modern hotels like the Trump Tower. Totally acceptable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Valet wrecked car”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: Couldn't figure out why everyone else was getting their car so quickly yet I was standing there for quite a while. When I went up to the attendant they started stammering (never a good sign). Now, I get to go get 2 estimates. Kicker?? Still charged me for the service. Doesn't matter how good hotel is or how ideal the location after this.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and noisy heat”
Reviews.Author: cmsknyny
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan avenue, yet old and tired. Heat in room is so loud, hard to sleep. Needs a Shot in the arm. The staff is good though!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent pick”
Reviews.Author: The_Chevalier
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellnt service and a beautiful room, amde my stay just perfect. A good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “golden mile”
Reviews.Author: steenie1
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great historic swimming pool (on 7th floor I believe). Should explore the first 2-4 floors where the old shriners used to meet. Rooms were excellent, -we chose the tower which has a great view if you choose a room facing south. great location on the golden ,ile, so was easy to walk to everything with the children. Would be my first choice to go to for shopping or a trip in the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations, great food, perfect location. Here's a tip for newcomers.”
Reviews.Author: ereynihc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple days to do some shopping in Chicago and enjoy the city. The lobby of the hotel seems to stay busy. The room we had was awesome. Not sure if all the rooms are that nice, but I've posted pics of our corner tower room. Here are some tips. 1. This our first stay at this hotel. We were offered to join the frequent traveler/rewards program for free. By doing so, our room was complimentary upgraded during our stay. So if you are not a member of their rewards program, now is the perfect time to join. 2. The car parking is very expensive. I parked for 6 hours and it was $32. Don't drive/park unless you must. 3. Awesome location on Michigan Ave! There is a Starbucks in the lobby, Michael Jordan's Steak House in the hotel, and shopping across the street. This hotel is a the start of most of the Maginificant Mile shopping so once you go out the door, you can walk and walk to all the stores. 4. The gym was nice but there is a charge to use it. The fee was included in our room rate, but they do charge others to use the gym. The pool was closed as well. You had to use the Marriott pool if you wanted to swim. Watch out for that. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Historic and a Great Location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Meister2
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is a beautiful, unique hotel originally built in the 20's as an exclusive club, it now serves as a Stylish hotel. Our stay over a recent holiday provided us with a nicely appointed room overlooking Michigan Avenue that included a marble bathroom. Michael Jordan's steakhouse recently added off the Lobby was a great place for a drink or a meal. If you have a moment take a short tour of the hotel and you'll see some fantastic architectural features. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived at the Intercontinental Chicago after midnight. Check-in was awesome (as we were the only ones checking in). From the outside, the hotel looks beautiful and elegant. The lobby was decorated for Christmas and was very festive. We requested a room in the historic tower, after reading several Tripadvisor reviews, saying the rooms/bathrooms in the tower were more spacious. Our room was on the 20th floor and was spacious, but was in desperate need of a facelift. What really turned me off was the $7 bottle of Evian, with plastic cups to drink it in. And if you wanted to blow dry your hair, you had to use the old dryer attached to the wall that you had to hold the button down to keep the air coming out. We could've been at a Holiday Inn Express and paid much less. Our room overlooked Michigan Ave. and it was very noisy with traffic and sirens. The computer in the room was annoying-it glows all night long. But it was convenient to use for ordering room service and check out. The service at this hotel is very good. We ordered room service at 1am and had breakfast delivered one morning-very quick in arriving. There's also a Starbucks in the hotel that was very convenient. The best thing about this hotel is the location-right on Michigan Avenue. Everything you want or need is within walking distance. Great shopping and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel, but for the price, I've stayed at much nicer places.

Reviews.Title: “"Classy, old world style."”
Reviews.Author: lpucker
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great Michigan Avenue location. It was built some time in the 1920's so it has all the class and charm from that era. The pool is unique and beautiful with an architectural design that you don't see anymore in this modern world. I am planning another trip to Chicago and will stay here again because I love the "old world charm" of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Intercontinental Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Intercontinental Chicago on Michigan Avenue for 6 nights in November 2011. Mt room, 2216 was spacious and comfortable. My overall experience was good, and I would both recommend and stay again at this property. As usual, The Good, The OK, and The Bad The Good - Check-in. Fast and friendly. Seriously, I think I was checked-in and on my way to the room within 3 minutes. The check-in employee (Jason I believe) was super nice, welcomed me back and had me on my way in quick time. Well done. - The room. Clean with nice large bed, soft/fresh towels and a warm shower. A comfortable room to spend 6 nights in. The bed, a king-size was comfortable with a selection of pillows (6 or 7) with different materials and such. Well done IC. The room included a large working desk, a comfortable sitting chair and a window looking to the north towards the Hancock Tower. The room had a "homey" feel with a comfortable feel. - The bathroom. Clean and solid. The amenities are not spanking new - but they were nice, worked well. Across from the bathroom - the hall closet. It was large and had 10ish hangers. The closet needed to be a bit large because there was not a large dresser of drawers - but all worked out well. - The room quietness. I did not hear a peep from anyone (neighbors) throughout my stay. A nice positive for me. - Cleaning service. My room was nicely freshened each day and the staff paid attention to details (new lotion bottle, hand towels, etc.) Well done and appreciated. - The "one touch" hotline. I called one morning because my large floor-standing lamp was not functioning. Not a large issue, but I wanted to use. I called the hotline and the lamp was up and working that evening. Thank you. - Fitness center. Not huge, but worked well with new/well maintained equipment. While there was 15ish pieces of cardio equipment (treadmills, ellipticals, bikes) - on a couple of mornings they were all full prior to 06:00. Each piece of equipment had a TV and the locker rooms were quite expansive and well maintained. Note that to enter the fitness room prior to 06:00 you need to go to the front desk so they can update your room key card. The front desk visit was quick and painless - and again friendly. - Laundry services. As promised - on-time, folded well. - Michael Jordan restaurant bar. We did not eat, but enjoyed some beverages in the bar. The staff were quick, friendly and knew how to pour a drink. The atmosphere was busy and quite fun. - Location. You're in the heart of the action, especially if you're shopping or enjoying the North Michigan avenue area. You will be about 3 minutes from the Chicago river, 2 minutes from the Nordstrom mall (across the street) and about a 15ish minute walk to the Water Tower Mall/Hancock Tower. You cannot get more central to this area of the city. - Check-out. Electronic over the television. Quick and painless. - Doormen. Always friendly. Helped me with some tips across the stay. They were the first and final employees and interacted with - and they did a fine job. The OK - One morning I needed my laundry picked up (around 06:00 on a Friday morning), so I called the "hot line". A couple issues with this. First, I waited on hold for 15+ minutes. Not good. The second is that the advertisements that run while on hold discuss the "beautiful pool facilities..." They're closed. The pool option is across the street. I didn't want to swim so the pool being renovated did not bother me. But - if you're on hold for a while and want to swim, the message may irritate some. It's a detail. The Bad - Nothing. And nothing close during my stay. I recommend this property whole-heartedly. From the service, my quiet - nicely appointed room, and the employee interaction which was always friendly and returned value. Well done IC. Enjoy Chicago. Jeremy

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Exceeded my expectations (which were admittedly low)”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Intercontinental properies and have had mixed results. Most were just OK, and some were downright bad. This one was quite good. Maybe they have improved the brand? Room was OK. Location was great. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2009Virginia
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room was nice and clean. Front desk were not particularly helpful or pleasant. Maybe just having a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “â€œI never stay here again!â€�”
Reviews.Author: Edward P
Reviews.Content: Great location- great staff !!! Ð�nd that is all !!!This hotel is a full a disaster-older,worn, smelly,expensive,paid internet and $55 a day parking !!!? I've never seen a dirty old carpet and curtains, and just the standard is!!!?Were sheets with holes and lots of dust everywhere!!!! The toilet does not work,terribly noisy air conditioners!!! ice machine, only on the 7th floor!!! I never stay here again-my family and friends also!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room with the best location”
Reviews.Author: pauhana1111
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location - next to the Tribune building & the Chicago river. The bell hop was joyful and friendly and the front desk was able to check me in at 9am, which I appreciated. The rooms were very clean and the beds really comfortable. Restaurants, shopping, and architectural tour boats abound within one to eight blocks. The nonexistent lobby is the only criticism I have of the hotel. There are only 4 chairs in the lobby so it's difficult to use it as a gathering place or to meet someone there, and only one of three airline kiosks was working to print boarding passes. You can check-in for your flight in your room on the computer, but then have to print the pass in the lobby. Starbuck's off the lobby was convenient, as was Argo Tea and Corner Bakery just outside the hotel. We did not eat in the steakhouse but I hear it gets good reviews. The CTA train station to the airport is about 7 blocks, from which you could walk or take a cab. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: desimd
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the mile. Very convenient to just about anywhere, except a metro station. The first night was a disaster... the air-conditioning was loud enough that sleep was impossible. They did move me the next day to the historic tower that was much better with a larger room. The Starbucks is very convenient, but with long lines in the morning. So if you're in a hurry, forget coffee. The check-in receptionist was very brief and to the point, and "Any questions?" was all she said before handing me the key. Overall, the location is worth everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel near Nordstrom's”
Reviews.Author: MassVacati0ner
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago choice is a solid hotel with character with a great location on Michigan Ave, across the street from Nordstromâ€™s. I saw a couple of rooms, in addition to the one we stayed in, and they do very in size and layout. This is a historic hotel with the character and variation that older properties frequently have. The breakfast buffet at the Continental restaurant is very good - and there is also a Starbucks off the lobby. There is also teh Michael Jordan's steakhouse off the lobby that reportedly has a great "patty melt" (cheeseburger) The public rooms and ballroom are impressive and have a lot of architectural detail. Service at the hotel is very good. The hotel is a solid choice with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Could use an update”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: The staff here was great, yet that can't change the fact that this is one of the poorest InterContinentals I have stayed at. Location is great, but the rooms are very small and feeling pretty old, the pool was closed (use the Marriott if you like --- who wants to walk across the street to swim??), shower water pressure weak and the room service food was poor. The intercontinental by the airport is a ton better, san francisco is awesome, toronto and NYC great, but Chicago is hurting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful pool area!”
Reviews.Author: xpuha23
Reviews.Content: Was in town for one night and selected hotel because of location. Checked in early and they had a room ready (good service). Rooms are a little small but manageable. Wine and cheese bar is nice and taxi's are easy to get. Great place to stay for the night. I would agree with others that it is a little pricey but it is Chicago.I had to search 3 floors before I found a working ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “grand bldg, not so grand service”
Reviews.Author: TrottingDr
Reviews.Content: i had a suite and thought the hotel was a decent first class... the bedroom had a drought coming from a window and it was -750 degrees. not surprisingly, the a/c could not keep up. i would call them three times that night, last call at 4am. not once was i offered to be moved to another room. this is unacceptale.

Reviews.Title: “Location - 5, the rest ...”
Reviews.Author: daytripperJ
Reviews.Content: Great location and the staff was super nice too, ...but the rest is just an older hotel, period. I want to give it more than 3 because of the location and how easy everything is...but I just can't. The bathroom is SUPER tiny, ...don't even try getting ready to leave the room at the same time as your spouse...forget it! Some of the appointments are very tired and in need of an update. Wall paper, fixtures, etc. Nothing terrible, but noticable. I would go back for a quick weekend trip. The staff was nice and helpful, and as I said, the location is superb! If I could give it a 3.5 I would, but I just quite can't give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip - liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: NoTurnsOnRed
Reviews.Content: This room was really comfortable (great bed), and the staff was friendly. The location is also prime, and bonus points for taxis always being available for a quick restaurant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave707
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location near shopping, restaurants and some of the attractions of downtown Chicago. Room was typical for an older property, relatively small but certainly adequete. Heat/cooling was tough to control...stayed on constantly so it was tough getting the room at a constant temperature. My only other complaint was have to go from the 20th floor to the 7th floor to get ice. The only ice machine was on the 7th floor. Very efficient staff, handled the large check-in crowd very efficiently. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not great”
Reviews.Author: PJZinLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work in October 2011. Room was ok, clean, modestly appointed. Nothing wowed me here and nothing was a true disappointment. Location is great. The in room computer would not shut off and i had to unplug the monitor to get rid of the blaring light at night - that was minor. Contrast this with the next night where I was at the Grand Hyatt in SF which is a great room - no comparison between the two and almost the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ereap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel over the weekend of Oct 14, 2011. The hotel was old inside, rooms adequate size. Very nice accomodations near all shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing. Would definite stay here again. Staff could not have been more helpful !

Reviews.Title: “ASA Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: RBG-Halifax
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, typical of the old building type. Great location. Uncomfortable bed & desk.

Reviews.Title: “Really Horrible”
Reviews.Author: aisha a
Reviews.Content: This InterContinental Chicago hotel is really horrible. First, they charged me for a service that I did not have; I ordered a pick-up service from the airport and when I left the airport no one was there with my name and waited for 15m and no one showed up. So when I asked them to remove it from the bill, the guy said â€œhe was there and the hotel is outsourcing this service so the company will charge the hotel and I will charge you!!!â€� and I was like I did not get the service I did not see anyone so I donâ€™t need to pay you $120 for nothing and you donâ€™t need to pay the company for nothing!! All of this was after calling the manager who is number in a card in every room and no one cared until I talked to the counter again. Second, the business services! The business center is outsourced too and the rates are really high so the employee there advised me to go the Marriott hotel which has better rates. So Iâ€™m staying in a five stars hotel and still need to use other ones. There is something looks like a PC in the room but itâ€™s not. I tried to use the files I had in a hard desk it does not work well, the Microsoft version was really old and the keyboard was sticky. On top of that, they donâ€™t care!!! I needed to repeat my safe from six night just to convince them that I did not see any one in the airport but I still get charged for nothing. Basically, I stayed in InterContinental all over the world, this is way from a five stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, interesting architecture, feels like a big hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sugarsgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for shopping and Navy Pier. You need to be a walker to get to the museums and Grant Park. The bellmen, concierge and live humans in the lobby are better at directions than the computer "navigator" in the room. It is a bit creepy to have a big computer screen greeting you by name every day. Oh, there's a surcharge for most uses you might be lured into doing with the creepy computer. I was here for a work related meeting. The food provided by the hotel for breakfasts and lunches was very good and the service at the sit down meal was quick but not intrusive. I was roomed in the new tower. The room was adequate. But a colleague was in the historic tower - rooms bigger, bathtub larger, hallways more interesting. To use a exercise room - you pay a surcharge! However, I did go look at the swimming pool and if only this meeting didn't suck up all my time I would have been doing laps in that art deco treasure. I would suggest that folks who are interested in architecture should wander over to the meeting rooms and floors of the old tower. The ballroom balcony ceiling is painted, the restaurant and the area near the rooms with Robin Hood theme names have amazing wood beams that are painted. Some Moorish influence. I'm not remembering all of my "ahs" for the building - but these details made it a better than average meeting hotel If I was going to Chicago as a tourist, I would only stay at this hotel if the price was discounted. The meeting room rate seemed high to me. The daily parking cost is $55. No free wi-fi areas Perhaps if it hadn't been raining, the place might have been brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: TvlAgentGeorgia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book on a discount website for our first romantic getaway sans-kid. We got a great deal for three nights at the Intercontinental, and we were not disappointed. When we arrived, we requested a room in the historic tower (which we figured we wouldn't get, considering we were already getting a good deal), and we were told we could upgrade for a fee. We decided against it and were perfectly fine with the room we got. It was on the 25th floor, decent view (partial lake view), spacious enough for the two of us, combo bath/shower, and clean. When we had any questions regarding where to dine, the El, etc., the concierge was more than helpful. He booked a reservation for us at a nearby restaurant, and as soon as we were seated the waiter brought over an appetizer courtesy of the concierge:) Nice touch. The hotel was right in the midst of all the shopping and a close walk to practically everything, including the El. We were more than happy with our stay and the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that I wasn't totally blown away by the room. It was great, but not exceptional. The pool, however, was divine, and I certainly welcomed the sauna in the ladies' locker room after walking in the chilly rain. I didn't use the fitness room, but my husband did and he said it was serviceable. He paid the extra fee one day, then used the pool for cardio during the rest of our stay. All in all, it was a perfect getaway to a fabulous city, and I couldn't have asked to stay in a better location. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: SeabreezeNh
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a 3 day weekend at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago.This was my first visit to Chicago and i was extremely pleased with the hotel. The location is hard to beat. Right in the center of attractions and shopping.Staff was very accommodating and friendly. We were upgraded to a deluxe king room and it was very spacious. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: SAHM88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located within the shopping district and close proximity to down attractions and good restaurants, e.g., Mortons and Lawrys. The hotel looked very classy and was always bustling with activity. Front desk staff was polite and the buffet breakfast spread was accepable. I stayed here on two separate occasions and found my experience to be 'so-so' for a 4-star hotel. During my first visit, I was given a room on the 15th floor which overlooked the roof of the lower floors, thus compromising the view. In addition, the room was dusty and I suffered mild allergic reations. The TV did not turn on at the beginning and I discovered the plug was loose. The electrical wires/cables were a mess (with those behind the TV covered in dust) and in sore view below the writing table. On the first night, I discovered what looked like an underwear of the previous guest wedged between the wall and the bed. Front desk staff apologised and got someone to remove the offending clothing the next morning. For my 2nd visit, I was given a room on the 31th floor, which was smaller than the one on the 15th floor. The view was great and I don't have complaints about the room except the electrical wires were, again, somewhat messy and could be seen under the writing table.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the InterContinental Chicago. Check-in was fast and efficient and they even allowed me to check in early. The hotel lobby is grand and beautiful and the large Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient. My room on the 20th floor was large, comfortable, stylish and very clean. I had an amazing view of the Chicago Tribune and NBC News buildings. One pet peeve I have with large hotels is too few elevators but this one had so many I was never waiting too long for an elevator. Every one of the hotel staff members I encountered were very polite and accomodating. I forgot toothpaste and they brought it up to my room within minutes. My room had a computer for use but internet was about $16 for 24 hours, so I used the free wifi in the Starbucks downstairs. The hotel location could not be more perfect, right across the street from Nordstrom and many great stores. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenalidomide
Reviews.Content: Downtown, situated on the Magnificent Mile, with amenities to burn, this is a great hotel-- close to all the down-town attractions, within walking distance of all the city-side amenities and shopping opportunities of this premier midwestern city, the Intercontinental offers everything one might need for a pleasant stay in Chicago. Premier rooms, excellent service, a great location in the heart of the shopping district, it's a wonderful option

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sashamom
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this elegant hotel while visiting Chicago for our nephew's wedding. Our room in the historic tower was very large with a comfortable bed and excellent bathroom. The view was partially blocked by the roof of a close by building (we were on the 19th floor), but we did have a partial river view. The hotel location, a few blocks from Navy Pier and about a mile from Millenium Park and the Art Institute, made for some excellent sightseeing. Although we didn't eat in the hotel restaurants (other than the lobby Starbucks for a quick breakfast), the hotel catered the wedding reception and everything was fabulous. And the check-in and checkout processes were excellent, we even had the same delightful bellman for each.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service is great.”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerman
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for business and stayed for 4 nights. The lobby is a bit small (not a big deal), but I thought the rooms were quite spacious and included a couch along the window. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. In the rooms, they had an in-hotel internet type service that was complimentary. You can search the area for restaurants, sites, etc. which was a nice touch if you didn't have a computer to search online. With that thought, it was $14.95 for 24 hours of Internet access. The closet and room door had a bit of a space issue. I can't quite explain it, but it just felt off. Not a big deal, just an oddity. Also, the bathroom amenities/service was a bit funny. For example, I had a bath mat the first day, but then it disappeared until the last day. Sometimes there were no washcloths, and I was missing a bar of soap the first day. Just little things I noticed. I did forget toothpaste and had to call down twice to receive it, but even though it was in the "mini bar" for a cost, they didn't charge me for the tube which was nice.
