The hotel has a Starbucks attached, along with Michael Jordan's steakhouse and the hotel restaurant. I had breakfast there one morning, and the french toast was really good. Prices weren't bad, but the breakfast buffet was $27. The location is in the Magnificent Mile and I walked to Millennium Park and then back up to the John Hancock building to catch the view. There are restaurants all around the hotel, with plenty of variety. Taxi service was available without a wait each morning. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: LandseerCT
Reviews.Content: InterContinental Chicago on the Magnificent Mile is a quick walk to shopping, restaurants...everything. My room, on an upper floor in the Historic Tower was spacious, impeccably clean, and well appointed with everything you expect in a fine hotel. The bed and bedding: very comfortable with crisp clean linens; the bath: supplied with adequate towels and high quality toiletries. The staff was courteous, professional and attentive. From the moment I arrived, I was made to feel like a welcomed and treasured guest. While this was a business trip, I would certainly return for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Building and Views a plus, service and value a minus”
Reviews.Author: vino
Reviews.Content: I am an ambassador club member and have stayed at many Intercontinental Hotels. This hotel does not offer an executive level. No inclusive breakfast or cocktail reception. Reception failed to supply us with fruit, water or welcome letter until contacted on the second day. Chef Concierge simply handed me a printed sheet of paper, when I requested a steakhouse and pizza suggestion. I guess we were meant to eat at Michael Jordan's inhouse steak shop. When questioned he did recommend Gino's East for pizza. We were upgraded to a Historic Suite,because of our ambassadoor club status, we had booked a Miracle Mile Suite. The historic room had great views. A separate King bedroom and sitting room. The pool is beautiful, however, if you are not training for the olympics don't bother. It is split into lanes for swimming laps. Although "One Lane" is reserved for lounging it is quite confined, and someone was swimming laps in that lane when we visited. On our last night we popped into Eno Wine Bar. We had two flights, samplings, of chocolates. Each flight was $11.00 for bites smaller than a hershey kiss. We order wine. The bartender overpoured one glass, and instead of serving us poured the ounce out. Overall, we have had better a experience and value at other Intercontinental properties. In comparison, next time I would stay at The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my Suite! Beautiful and great chocolates and fruit!”
Reviews.Author: Bellacraftella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental Chicago this past weekend. It was awesome location just steps to Michigan Avenue Deluxe Shopping, The Water Tours, The Marilyn in front of Chicago Tribune, and River Walk. The room was beautiful and the staff very helpful and friendly. I recommend this property highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: bortonoverseas
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the InterContinental for a family wedding and it could not of been better. The hotel was wonderful, old world elegant, the bar/restaurant ( Michael Jordon) was so fun and great cheeses in the wine bar. The food & service at the wedding was perfect Enjoyed the historic swimming pool to swim laps ( which is 80 years old) great tile and perfect lap pool. My massage was one of the best I have had in along time, she was so professional and knowledgeable !! Will definitely stay there again. Great location as well , right in the middle of the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor sevice, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: No doubt it is located on bustling Michigan Ave, however it is a very old property. The first room I walked in had musty odor. After waiting 20 minutes I was changed to another room on a different floor which had similar odor with no bathroom amenities. It took another 30 minutes to have some shampoo and soap.Under the phone on the work desk, there were some old crumbs and dust under the phone.

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Chicago - Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lois P
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Google and it is a good choice. Location is great. The "L" is only a few blocks away (used it to go to U.S. Cellular Field to see the Tigers/White Sox). The staff is very friendly and helpful and our room was clean and quiet. Loved the shower spray! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again. Thank you InterContinental Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: prasz
Reviews.Content: cannot expect a better location to be in when visiting Chicago. The rooms are OK. nothing to rave about - but good enough. easily accessible to the CTA and the buses. Can just walk all over the place (even to the Navy Pier)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdunne12
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Intercontinential was amazing. The staff was quick to help with any questions we had and the room was impeccable. The location right on Michigan Ave. was also very ideal for shopping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...nice decor”
Reviews.Author: procus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location,close to all the shops on the miracle mile , a few steps from the river and the hugh Marilyn Monroe statue and the hop-on hop-off sight-seeing bus has a stop there also . Starbucks down in the lobby is handy for a quick breakfast. The newly opened Michael Jordan steakhouse is lovely .. was nice for a quiet night-cap after a long day sight-seeing but drinks are pricey . Hotel room was ok, quite small, nicely decorated but beware of bathroom door as one of us got stuck inside luckily he was not alone in the room ...i had to bang the door extremely hard from the outside to get him out so be careful before you close the bathroom door ...we mentioned the incident when checking-out and the staff member didn't seem too interested and we got no apology!!!. Wifi is not free in this hotel for the price of a night stay thought that it would be included very disappointing . Don't forget to go up and have a look at their swimming pool it's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the hotel's not bad either!”
Reviews.Author: KeithLacey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on the beginning of my Route 66 adventure - Room was decent size not too big thou. I think I got one of the newer rooms - I hear the older rooms are bigger. Pool is fantastic! I heard also that you pay $12 for the pool but you can be rest assured its not; its all free except for the Gym - this you must pay for I'm afraid but with plenty of parks nearby I went for a run down towards the Bean (Cloud) - found a running route along the waterfront which was cool. Room service is very expensive plus I parked my car there for 1 night only as it was $55 a day! Just down from the hotel it's $38 so moved there but I found out the hard way that when I was going back up to the hotel to put my luggage in it was a nightmare to find the hotel; I was going crazy and so was my GPS! Because it's down a level from the road the hotel is on my GPS thought I was above and things got very complicated very fast. I think it took me 45mins to find the hotel; definitely not worth the savings on the parking - like it was only a 3/4 min walk to this car park! You learn I suppose... Starbucks beside is great especially with the free wifi - I think it was $25 a day for internet in the room - rip off. They need to rethink that one especially when you add tax onto it. Overall thou the Hotel is good just a little on the expensive side. I think there's a new steakhouse opening up there this month (Sept 2011) a Michael Jordan or someone famous like that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended if on business in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pasturgeon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at multiple hotels in Chicago, I believe the Intercontinental to be one of the best for business travel. The rooms are moderately priced, the hotel is conveniently located, it has an excellent restaurant in Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and the business amenities are sufficient for any business traveler's needs. The staff was courteous and helpful. There is also an excellent refurbished pool to go with a sufficient gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, though A/C problems made the nights uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: dsr1122
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the week of the insane heat wave that hit much of the US in July. I think it was 105 during the day, and in the 90s at night. My room was on the very top floor in the old tower, and the AC couldn't keep up. I had the thermostat set at 60, and it was probably closer to 85 in the room. I mentioned this to the staff several times during my stay, and they temporarily fixed it twice, but I just gave up. The hallways to my room were oppressively hot. Aside from the temperature issues, the hotel was great and I would definitely stay there again. The location is great, tons of bars and restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Saultites
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a family weekend at the end of August, and had a good experience overall. We got a good rate through Expedia, but still had to pay the $55 a day parking. I could have parked at a garage around the corner for less, but didn't want the hassle. I agree with the majority of the reviewers about the high points of the hotel. Namely location and pool. We walked to everything we needed within ten minutes (American Girl, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Rainforest CafÃ©). Service was good, and the Starbucks was handy. I had a bit of trouble getting to the hotel, but that was more of my own problem since I didn't realize Wacker and Michigan Ave. had an upper and lower level until I experienced it myself. My GPS was not very clear. But that's not the hotel's fault! I would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay...a bit on the pricey side”
Reviews.Author: FABOregonUSA
Reviews.Content: I really have no complaints about the room in the Historic section of the hotel which has been refurnished (not sure when but it was in very nice shape). Sound insulation (especially, to adjacent room) was pretty thin...fortunately, they eventually went to sleep. I thought just under $6 (including tax) for a small bottle of drinking water was excessive (nice touch would be for them to leave a couple of small complimentary bottles when your base room rate was $300 before taxes). Everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: StormSevens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the labor day weekend in Chicago at the intercontinental on Michigan Avenue. The location of this hotel is absolutely incredible, great shopping on the miracle mile, 2 blocks from the river and new marilyn statue and a nice walk down to millenium park. We had a wonderful time at the intercontinental, our room was very large in one of the towers. Having a Starbucks located at the hotel was very nice and we enjoyed wine and cheese at ENO which is located on the 1st floor of the intercontinental. Just an overall great stay and we have decided to stay here for all of our chicago trips due to the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental lacking intercommunication”
Reviews.Author: JonAntony
Reviews.Content: After recieving a confirmation call that we would be arriving with our dogs the next day I was feeling pretty good about this hotel. However, upon our arrival, they were not aware that we had our dogs with us. Consequently, they were out of dog crates, which we had reserved weeks earlier. Because we were not able to crate our dogs, we were not able to get any service unless we arranged it in advance. At checkin we were also placed in the wrong room. We were put in a small room in the newer tower. People with dogs are supposed to be placed in the more spacious rooms in the historic tower. This error was however promptly corrected when I went downstairs to ask about the dog crate.\\ The public space in the hotel is truly beautiful. The rooms are nice enough but the furniture could use some replacing. The real problem with this hotel is a lack of communication on the part of the staff. Another instance of this occurred when I went to retrieve my cell phone from my car which was parked in I waited over twenty minutes by the concierge before she said it might be with the valet. She then had the nerve to tell me to go check with the valet instead of getting it for me.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, Not 4.5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Chris416
Reviews.Content: Well I checked in after staying at another hotel and was not overally impressed. I was given a room on the 25th floor, The room was really dusty, it was very apparent as you can see the dust particials floating through the air as the sunlight was coming in the window. The room was small and could use updating. One of the mornings they were having a staff evacuation drill, and it was announced over the loud speaker in our room early in the morning multiple times. Not something I would expect to happen in the morning. The manager addressed the dust and the early morning wake up calls, but I would not stay here next time. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bugsygraf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family wedding and it was awesome. The lobby is beautiful as well as the rooms. Service was great and the architectural details are amazing. The ballroom for the wedding reception was breathtaking, with 2 levels and winding staircases. The rooms are very nice, albeit a little on the small side. The bathroom was very nice with a shower and separate tub, which was very nice for our kids. The workout room is great and the pool is absolutely beautiful -- not to be missed. The location can't be beat either. We were within walking distance to everything we needed on Michigan Avenue, including top-notch stores and restaurants. Overall it was a great place to stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment. Grand Old Dame - emphasis on OLD, and not so grand”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I had booked this thinking it would be a great hotel and location. One of those was right - the location on Michigan Avenue was very convenient to everything I needed. However, from the moment I checked in, the experience was pretty much a disappointment. I am a member of their Ambassador program so I went to the special check in area for Ambassadors. The woman seated there seemed a bit distracted when I showed up so I just waited for her to look up and acknowledge me. She said she was checking me into the "historic tower" - when I hear that, I ask does that mean it is older rooms and not renovated (hey, I've been traveling long enough to know what these things mean...). She said the rooms were larger in the historic tower and that's where I would be upgrade as an Ambassador. I went to my room, keys in hand, and when i stepped off the elevator on my floor, I could tell I was not going to like the room. Older hallways, fixtures, dimness of lighting etc. It wasn't a good sign. I went to my room and noticed the do not disturb sign was on the door. I thought it was odd, but I used my key, opened the door, and... The room was still occupied by someone! Their luggage was there any everything! I couldn't believe it. Major security blunder. I went back downstairs, went to same check in and she acted all surprised but found me another room. Went to that room and it was definitely a smaller room than my first room. Too tired and hot to go back down again, I just took the room since it was only for the weekend. Immediately I noticed here were no drawers to out my clothes in. There was a small closet with louvered doors that didn't really close right. It did have a safe in the closet for my valuables. The room was dark even with the fluorescent lights on. I had to turn every light on in the room plus the closet light to feel like here was even any light on. The bathroom was kind of dirty - mildew on tiles, a rusty shower head, scratchy towels (one had brown stains on it as a "clean towel"). Toiletries were nice though. On day of checkout, I was in the bathroom when all of a sudden, a hotel staff member entered my room and asked when i was checking out!!! I didn't hear his knock since I was in the bathroom. Mind you, I had the do not disturb sign (the electronic kind, not the hangtag on the door) ON. To me it was a last straw. I called downstairs and asked that the on duty manager call me. The only positive thing out of this hotel stay was that the manager did call back, I explained calmly to her what had happened with my first check in and now the maid coming into my do not disturb room. She apologized and promised she would both take care of these issues and give me some extra points. She did both. However, in some ways, the visit did a lot to diminish the InterContinental brand in my mind. I have stayed at nicer properties such as their new one on Howard in San Francisco and it was great, this "historic tower" at a grande dame of Michigan Avenue was bad... Just bad. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilRio
Reviews.Content: This is one of those large US city centre hotels. No charm or pleasant surprises, but no nasty ones either. Great location on the Magnificent Mile, within walking distance of the main shopping district and many local attractions. Rooms are cramped, though.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel with a 5 star location.”
Reviews.Author: Madison3030
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan avenue. Hotel was as I expected based on the reviews I read from tripadvisor. The rooms are small. Too small. I think most people have grown accustom to larger rooms at any price level. Where the room disappoints there is nothing else about this hotel that wins you back. I should have stayed at ANY other hotel. I had friends who stayed one night at the inter and two more y the embassy suites nearby. Embassy was nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Jerry S
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location Beautiful architecture Cons: Grumpy staff Slow service Tiny rooms No place to store clothes, except closet

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...would return!”
Reviews.Author: mom2twns06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago and stayed at the Intercontinental for one night. We were able to check in at 10:30a and had absolutely no problems. Staff was very nice and helpful. Our room was a corner room with a great view and clean. There was some wear and tear on the desk but for one night it didn't really matter. They do need to invest in a exhaust fan for the bathroom as it steamed up and it appears that it is causing the paint to come off as there were several areas on the walls and ceiling that had been damaged. Overall a great stay for the price I paid through hotwire.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed here early June 2011. Upon checking in, the desk staff were extremely helpful and whilst we had booked a standard Double-Double room, the staff helped advise us on an upgarde and then worked out that it was cheaper to Join the Ambassador Club (as we were staying 5 nights), after which we got a free upgrade, free in room internet, a free movie and free use of the fitness club, so for us, we thought this extremely good value. You could not beat the location, being right next door to the Tribune building and opposite Nordstroms on the Magnificant mile. From here, we could walk to the shops, downtown, millenium park, navy pier, restaurants, beachses and just aabout everything. We stayed in teh historic tower, as whilst we could have got a better view in the new tower, we were advised that the rooms were much bigger in the historic tower and they were. We had 2 doubles and a rollaway bed and still had plenty of space to open out suitcases and walk around...the room was huge. We didn't try any of the dining options, as the Michael Jordan steakhouse was still under cosntruction and whilst I liked the look of Eno, it probably wasn't the place to take young teenage daughters, as it is the more adult, winebar type place, that appealed to me and the win list looked great. We hate Starbucks coffee(as most Aussies do), so we disn't use the starbucks eaither, but found a great cafe (Baci) atound the corner in east Ohio st that made Lavazza Espresso, which is where we had outr breakfasts. The concierge recommended a great Breakfast place (Yolk) within walking distance towads Navy pier. We also ate out at other concoierge recommendations, such a sa great d=restauarant next door and portllos and Unos, both Chicago institusions, and only a couple of blocks away. Parking was very pricey and we used a salf park station behind the hotel for overnight parking at $25 rather than the $55 the Hotel charges, but teh hotel allowed multiple re-entry valet parking. As we only had a car for 1 night, this was fine. Close to public transport, with busses both north (to the zoo, Lincoln Park, beaches) and south (downtown, the museum campus, Hyde Park (miuseum of science & industry/University/Obama's house) outside the front door. The 12th floor art deco former olympic athlete pool form the 20s was fabulous and in keeping with the whole art deco Chicago theme. The gym, whilst smallish, was reasonably well wquipped, but a bit clasustrophopic with no windows, and having cardio equipment on carpetted floor isn't probably the best idea when people sweat on it. Overall, we loved the place and would definately stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, perhaps a tad 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueRay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights before embarking upon Route 66 to LA. We wanted central and convenient and it's certainly that. The room was clean, furnishing and appearance a little tired, but frankly ok., certainly nobody would accuse it of being too big! The swimming pool was big but probably in need of a refurb, though it had a quaintness about it. Getting around the hotel can be a little confusing as there appears to be two major lift areas which take you to separate parts of the hotel. The view from the window was industrial but a price worth paying for location advantages. It's adequate not earth-shattering.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to the Intercontinental Brand”
Reviews.Author: Jumpniner
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location. Offer attractive deals compared to similar luxury properties in downtown Chicago. While the staff wasn't of the caliber of other properties in this tier, I found them to be extremely helpful and willing to go the extra mile for guests. In this era of customer service, that counts for a lot in my book. Much to their credit, I think they are trying to make the most of the property they have to work with. Cons: For the price, the hotel had little to offer other than location. Rooms were small and poorly equipped for any type of technology (few wall outlets for computers, etc.). My room lacked a TV remote (to the hotel's credit, a remote was provided within 2 minutes of requesting one). The pool, while quaint, was showing heavy signs of wear and there was a cockroach walking amid the plants. The pool attendant had run out of pool towels and was giving out hand towels. She was very kind and apologetic, but it would seem like a quick call to housekeeping to get regular towels might have been a smarter move. I waited for 20 minutes at the concierge desk to pick up a package even though I was the first person in line. 3 or 4 other guests waiting for simple things like dinner recommendations were not pleased at having to wait so long to get their questions addressed. My bottom line: Definitely not up to snuff as a four star hotel, but a good value for downtown Chicago none-the-less.

Reviews.Title: “Always First Class”
Reviews.Author: Patrick R
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Chicago is one of my favorite hotels. Whether staying in the South Tower (now called Historic Tower) or the North Tower the rooms are clean, well decorated and designed for both work or relaxation. The Eno Wine Bar is "EXCELLENT". Lastly, the hotel staff does a fantastic job whether at check in, throughout the stay and at check out. GIven a preference the InterContinental Chicago is at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to Impress”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a simply a gem. From arrival to departure we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The odd bar and restaurant situation leaves a lot to be desired, but on our departure day they peeled away the temporary walls to reveal the new Michael Jordon restaurant. It should be very impressive. As an Intercontinental Ambassador member, I worked with the hotel to ensure our rooms were exactly as I expected. The front desk was one of the most responsive group I've encountered. The bell staff were so knowledgeable about the area and Chicago in general that I never needed to wait in line for the concierge. Perfectly situated on the Mag Mile, it's so nice to come home every night to such an incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Great Hotel / Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GEOII
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, went to the bears pre season game, girls went shopping. All was good. The Historic tower is much preferred to the main tower, though both are good. This last trip we were in the Main Tower. The pool was fantastic as ussual, even if you are not staying come to see, it is worth the trip. TWO Gripes - gripe #1 was room service order that took forever to get and then was wrong and gripe #2, the valet for the cars takes forever and is expensive. Both are forgiven as the rest of the stay was flawless, the staff (as every time I have been here) is outstanding, so nice , so accommodating. CAN NOT WAIT FOR THE MICHAEL JORDONS STEAKHOUSE TO OPEN!! Should be great.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith65
Reviews.Content: This hotel really couldnâ€™t be in a better location. Itâ€™s right on the Magnificent Mile and right next to the river. I stayed in the â€œhistoric towerâ€� on the 33rd floor. I recommend asking for a high floor because the views are amazing. Room was clean, comfortable and large with a beautiful bathroom that featured a jetted tub and separate shower. Lots of hotel choices in Chicago and the InterCon should be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel3031
Reviews.Content: Just what you expect when you book at the InterContinental. Beautiful lobby, clean, efficient staff, quality linens. Parking is $55/night but you are on Michigan Ave. The rooms are small so I wouldn't recommend bringing your entire bedroom closet with you. Close to great shopping and across from the Purple Pig which I would recommend for a close bite and glass of wine if you want to get out of the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel is a great choice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avondaletraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here for business so I saw every inch of the place. There were so many old nooks and crannies, it's unlike a lot of other hotels I've stayed in and the pool is very elegant and old school. Service was very good, although their business center left a lot to be desired. I ended up getting to know several of the area kinkos very well. Banquet food was good, and the room had the most amazing views, with floor to celing windows that overlook the city. I loved our tapas and a wine flight at the bar, which was hoping. You cannot beat the location, walking distance to many of the sites, which is good because I wouldn't want to deal with a car here. No service issues to speak of, which after a week is quite rare. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great pool!”
Reviews.Author: OpenSky
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the InterContinental several times through out the years. We go for two reasons: the great location on Michigan Avenue and to swim in their enormous pool. If you are shopping on Michigan Avenue the location can't be beat. We also have walked from the hotel down to NBC Studios to watch the live news(fun for kids). The other reason we stay here is to swim in the enormous pool. This pool is DEEP, so it may not be suitable for young kids and those that are not good swimmers. They do allow noodles and kickboards in the pool however, the pool is divided by lap lane ropes. We swim and then enjoy the sauna. We also enjoy the Starbucks in the lobby. The rooms are on the smaller side, but the beds are comfortable. If you are going for one or two nights into the cty, want to be close to Michigan Ave. and swim in a huge pool, this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Less than Impressive”
Reviews.Author: bsmny
Reviews.Content: It is billed as a luxury hotel, but the rooms were small and the decor surprisingly outdated. Although the location on the Magnificent Mile is ideal for tourists visiting Chicago, the hotel did very little to notify guests of its own amenities. (I never did find the workout room and still not sure if the pool really existed). The hotel did have a concierge, who was wonderful, but not always available. For the money spent on the room, we might have done better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel; yet, employees try their best.”
Reviews.Author: ArmoVacationer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the middle of Chicago and is close to many down town attractions and restaurants, which makes it very convenient. The hotel staff are very courteous and helpful to the extent of their ability. Like allot of hotels in big downtown cities, the rooms are somewhat small and some of the fixtures are somewhat dated and need some renovation. For example: There was some cracked and pealing paint in the bathrooms (we had rented two rooms), and in the air vents there were some white colored things (maybe dust or something else). The hotel has a pretty well equipped gym and a very nice indoor swimming pool; there is a charge of $16 per stay per person for the use of the Gym and the pool. Parking is $55 per night, which like allot of places in big downtowns is a bit pricy. Although we had a car during our stay, due to the convenient location of the hotel, we hardly used it. While I was in the hotel, I heard a complaint about erroneous charges on a guest's credit card. With my luck, after returning home, we noticed that the hotel had Made and erroneous charge of over $900 on our credit card. I called the hotel and they promised that they would reverse the charge - I guess I need to check the credit card statement to make sure that they did. By the way, the hotel concierge made some great recommendations for restaurants - they were really good!

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends Shopping Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nsvetor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was above average. The location was fantastic and the price was unbeatable through www.hotwire.com. There is a pool but it is set up for laps (exercising) not really just available for soaking and relaxing in the water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- Great location”
Reviews.Author: donebyme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental Chicago from Thursday, July 28 to Sunday, July 31. Overall, the hotel is very nice and the location is great. There are bus stops out front and just down the street from the Grand subway station. We were with a group (9 couples) that came to Chicago to see Red Sox/White Sox games. Unfortunately, our rooms were scattered all over the hotel (both towers) and it was very difficult to meet. It would have been nearly impossible if not for cell phones. I must say that my first impression was not the greatest. I was already apprehensive due to some of the not so great reviews on Tripadvisor. We had already been told that this InterContinental was not quite up to level of other InterContinentals in other places. The lobby is very small for the size hotel. Half the lobby is blocked off from the contruction of the Michael Jordan restaurant. Check in was uneventful until we went up to our room. We were given a room on floor 6 in the "new" building. When we got off the elevator, our room was literally right there next to the elevators. No way! I did not want to hear people and/or elevator noises while in my room. We didn't even go in the room. I went right back down to the woman who checked us in and told her that we must have another room. She was very nice about it and started looking for a better room. I also told her that it was our wedding anniversary and we wanted the best room she could give us. She changed us to a corner room on the 27th floor of the "historic" building and said it was an upgrade due to our anniversary. I know it is a must asked question but why did she give us a "bad" room in the first place if a "better" was obviously available? The new room was VERY quiet and we never heard a thing. Our new room was down a hallway in the corner. Actually, there were large windows on 3 sides because the room jutted out just enough for a good size window. Our first impression was the room was clean & not outdated. It was quiet and comfortable. There was a desk & chair, king size bed, sitting chair & ottoman, 1 bed side chest and some sort of armoire. The armoire had the TV on top and inside was the refrigerator, coffee maker and a tray of items to purchase, such as candy & nuts (intimicy kit??). There was a tab on the refrigerator that said "pull tab" and we didn't dare open it because we were afraid it was one of those minibars that have sensors and you pay if you move anything. It was an inconvenience not having a usable refrigerator, but we dealt with it. Personally, I think ALL hotel rooms should come with at least a cube refrigerator at NO EXTRA CHARGE. But that is just my opinion. There was no bureau or chest in the room for our clothes. The armoire thing was not for clothing. We hung up as much as we could and then lived out of our suitcases. There was a computer screen on the desk that supposedly would let you access information about the hotel & area. We could not get it to work properly. It would go to the screensaver itself but it suddenly went on in the middle of our first night and was so bright it woke us both up. It again went off and did not work the rest of our stay. The windows and roll down blinds plus curtains and kept the room dark when closed. The closet was medium sized and okay for us. It had 2 doors that opened out and was a pain to keep open because only 1 door would stay open and the other one would SNAP closed when you let go of it. There were 2 robes in the closet. The bathroom was HUGE. You could fit a twin size bed in there and there still would be plenty of room. There was a stand up, glass shower, pedestal sink, toilet and soaking tub. There was another big window but that was okay because it just looked out over a roof and no one could possibly see in. There was a nice long shelf above the sink & toilet which was nice. There was plenty of room to put your "stuff" on it. But, there was only one small towel rack in the whole room and it was too small for a bath size towel. The shower head was very nice and the water was hot enough. I did not try the bath tub but it looked okay. The sink drain did not work well and you had to pull it up manually to drain the sink. That was a pain but oh well..... The toiletries were very nice- citrus mint. There lots of towels so you did not have to worry about using them up. The room was VERY clean and the bed was comfortable. There were 5 king size pillows on the bed plus a decorative one. I usually do not like down pillows but these were fine. We both kept on banging our legs on the corner of the platform the bed was on. It was vinyl covered wood with a sharp corner and it stuck out. We both have bruises on our legs from that corner. We finally leaned the decorative pillow up against so it would force us to stay clear of that corner. We were up and out early on our first day- before 8AM- and did not return to our room again until 4PM. It had not been made up yet. We were exhausted and wanted to rest before the nightime baseball game but knew we had to leave the room. In fact, shortly after we had come back, a housekeeping employee called us on the phone and told us our room would not be made up because we were in it! No way! I said give us 5 minutes and we would be out. SInce the lobby is not suitable to sitting and there is no other place in the hotel to do that, we ended up in the attached Starbucks for 30 minutes or so. Annoying. Luckly this did not happen again during our stay. There is some sort of restaurant/lounge on the second floor overlooking the lobby but we never ate there. It was not very inviting and they don't advertise it well. There is an attached Starbucks that is always very busy. The new Michael Jordan restaurant is scheduled to open August 2011 according to the sing. We had a wonderful time during our first visit to Chicago. Along with the Red Sox game, we went on the Chicago Architectural Foundation river cruise and we also visited the Museum of Science & Industry. We highly recommend both. Make sure you do the 90 minute CAF cruise. We visited Navy Pier, Millennium Park, Grant Park and generally just walked everywhere. We bought bus & train passes and the bus/train system was not hard to figure out. To celebrate our anniversary, we ate dinner on Saturday night at Il Mulino. We have eaten at the Las Vegas restaurant and like it so we gave the Chicago sight a try. Wonderful! It is in this beautiful mansion and we were treated so special! We took a cab to and from the restaurant and it was not expensive. About $6 each way. Overall, we had a nice stay at the InterContinental and a nice visit to Chicago. It is a wonderful city with so much to do. We could sense that the people we met in Chicago had a great sense of pride in their city. There were flower boxes & planters everywhere we went. It is a pretty city. It was easy using public transportation to get around the city. We found the people to be VERY friendly and helpful. Whenever we looked hesitant on a bus or train, someone always asked us if they could help us. Nice! We live near Boston and take the MBTA all the time and the T employees sure could use some advice on excellent customer service from their Chicago counterparts. We were absolutely stunned by the difference. Not to say Boston's MBTA is bad, as it is not. It's just that the transit employees in Chicago seemed to actually care about their job & passengers and you could feel that vibe. We highly recommend using the public transportation as much as possible. In fact, when we come to Chicago again, we will take the train from the airport into the city instead of arranging for van transport because the traffic was awful to and from the airport. Much easier to take the train. We plan on returning to Chicago but will do it when it is a bit cooler out. We had 90 degree days and it sure was hot doing all that walking. Luckily, we missed the rain they had the week before. I think September or October would be better. There are still many things we would like to see & do in Chicago. I would have no issue staying at the Intercontinental Chicago again if the price was right and do recommend it. All the employees were friendly & helpful , our room was spotless and the convenient location is a plus. Those are the things that matter. Boston will always be my favorite city but Chicago sure did impress! Good job Chicago!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: ajklink
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the InterContinental New York Barclay, and I was expecting similar service and accommodations at the InterContinental Chicago. Check-in was quick, but the front desk agent did not follow proper AAA guidelines for this level hotel (e.g., failed to use my name during check-in, failed to provide appropriate information about the hotel, failed to offer assistance with my luggage, etc.). Once I got to my room, I found a poorly aged chair that was flaking a part. When I called to have the computer screen in the room turned off, they told me to put a pillow cover over it. The hotel is ideally located on Michigan Avenue and was easy to get to and from. The service and accommodations leave much to be desired, particularly for this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location for shopping the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: cjgrecco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was located right on Michigan Ave, we were able to walk out of the Hotel and start our day right in the middle of where we wanted to be with all the shopping and dining in walking distance. We had a nice size room with a very good view of the city. The pool was huge and we enjoyed swimming after walking around the city all day. The parking is costly if you bring a car, $55 a night in the hotel underground parking garage. Also WIFI connection was not free and I did not get it for us. Parking all over the city is costly so if you need to park a car be prepared to add that cost into the trip. From the Intercontinental you are short drive or cab ride from the Chicago Mosi, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium and Soldier Field. I would stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: scoobydigby
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous room on the 15th floor. Airconditioning was great and sunblinds kept the room at a good temperature. The hotel staff were friendly and professional and the lady who looked after our room did a great job. The hotel is in a great position for the Magnificent Mile and you could easily stroll to the shops, the river, Milennium Park etc. The only disappointing thing was that the bar was being renovated so there were a few tables in the area above the main lobby and it lacked any atmosphere but I'm sure this will be resolved when the building works (which didn't interrupt our stay in any way) are complete. Good to have Starbucks in the main reception, especially as we had teabags in th room but no way of boiling water and creamer just doesn't do it for us English people!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the other complaints were about. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: ZandGmama
Reviews.Content: My family of four, with girls, 4 and 7, stayed at this hotel July 27th -29th. I had some trepidation when I received this room through Hotwire because of some mixed reviews I had read. There was no need to worry--it was great! The temps were in the low 90s, but our airconditioner kept up just fine; we were actually a little too chilly in the room at times and had to adjust the thermostat. As everyone else seems to agree on, this was a great location. We easily walked to all kinds of shopping, the Navy Pier and Millenium Park. The room was very clean and HUGE. Honestly, we could have probably fit 4 pack-n-plays and a couple of strollers in that room. The view was blocked somewhat by columns, but they warned us about that prior to checking in and they gave us the option of a better view if we didn't want the early check in. We heard ambulance sirens several times, but I would expect that being smack dab in the middle of the city. Concierge was always helpful. There was no charge for the pool as some reviewers had indicated. I even asked about it and the attendant looked at me like I was a bit nuts. Maybe that was an old policy? The fitness center looked like it had a lot of machines too. The treadmills and such each had their own t.v. screen on them. The parking was $55 a night, which, with the discounted price for the hotel, did not bother me. Had I paid the online listed price, I would have been a little peeved about that. There was a fee for internet, but if you just go to the Starbucks attached to the lobby, you can get free Wi-fi. I would definetly recommend this hotel if I did not have to pay the full published rates and only when in Chicago in "walkable" weather. If you would have to pay to park everywhere you go, you might as stay out of the city and save some $. Oh, the only complaint would be the location of the toilet paper. It was off to the side and my kids could not easily reach it while seated on the toilet. This actually amused us for some reason. We stayed in room 903.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the corporate dime......”
Reviews.Author: ShaysWay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and it was comfy and centrally located to dining/shopping. Who doesn't want to be in the center of the action? The bed was comfy and I enjoyed the decor of the room. On this trip I didn't have to do much work but it was nice to have compliment WiFi connectivity in my room. From what I recall this has a fee/dly associated with it. I didn't care for having to pay for using the fitness facility which is standard at several other hotels. Also, I must say that I wasn't disturbed by the noise on the street in the evenings. If the price was right I would venture here on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago about every other year and recently we have consistently stayed at the Intercontinental. We usually stay for 3 nights and have done this about 4 times. We have stayed in both the old and new towers. The old tower rooms are smaller, but have the elegance of an older hotel. Be sure to wander around the lower floors of the old tower where the meeting rooms are to take in the neat architectural details and be sure to see the indoor pool at the fitness center. The new tower rooms are more spacious and as well decorated. The location is great right on Michigan Ave; a short walk North takes you past Water Tower (an indoor mall) and up to the Oak St beach. While a longer walk South takes you to the Art Institute and a few blocks over to the old Marshal Filed that is now a Macys. Be sure to look at the architecture in the old building especially the ceilings on the upper floors. Head West away from the lake for an area that has all sorts of restaurants. We have stayed at about 5 or 6 different hotels in Chicago, but chose this one for the location and the price. I do also accumulate Holiday Inn points so thatâ€™s a plus. The only negative this trip was the awful water pressure for the shower. Maybe being on the 33rd floor was a factor, but it was one of the worst, if not the worst water pressure we have ever had in a shower (& we stay in hotels 40-50 nights each year). Although the line was short when we checked in we noticed quite long lines most of the time in the lobby so checking in may take a while on a weekend. The poor water pressure is the only reason I do not give the hotel 5 stars. That said we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location for walking”
Reviews.Author: loveeatingineurope
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and the rooms are good as well. We had a great view of the city and lake on a high floor. We walked all over town from this location. Be sure to make reservations at Volare. It's not really high end, just super busy all the time and really great italian food. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: myzygy
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel is a nice hotel, clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The location is quite convenient. The trolley stops on the lower level to pick up people for Navy Pier (about 6 blocks away), there is a WalGreens across the street, the L is about 3 blocks away, and the shopping (of course) can't be beat. It's also convenient to some wonderful restaurants, all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: brobeman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night after bidding on Priceline the previous day. Location is outstanding - close enough to walk to Navy Pier, shopping, lots of restaurants and bars. Convenient access to CTA stops, too, if what you're interested in is farther than you're willing to walk. Our room wasn't huge, but it was big enough for our family of 4. We checked in at about 11am and our room was available, which was great. Beds were comfy, and although our room faced Michigan Ave., we didn't have any issues with street/traffic noise (we were on 14th floor). Based on the price we paid, we were pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, OLD Building”
Reviews.Author: RPH3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week while attending Executive Ed. at U of Chicago Booth. First room was OK, but TV/Internet set up was a retrofit and lots of cords/plugs etc looked bad and performed poorly. Had to call maintainence to get the TV to work. (One of the connections on this tagle had come loose). It was 90 degrees plus outside and this old building could not cope. A/C is set up with complicated motion detector system that must have sounded like a great cost savings when they bought it, but in practice it means coming back to a very warm room all of the time. Got moved to a supposed upgrade in the "Historic Tower". Larger room but with poor view and same issues. Do not go with the "upgrade". Had I paid an additional $50 per night for this I would have felt taken. AGAIN had to get the engineer to fix the TV. He rebooted the system. Walls were thin. One of my colleagues said in the morning he could hear wake up calls to other rooms coming at him from all directions. All this said every call or contact with people was VERY positive. Again, the people could not have been better. Unfortunately they are working with a facility where the A/C is poor and the technology upgrade came off poorly. The people were so good that I feel badly for saying I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Average 4* - You might be better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sd_in_switzerland
Reviews.Content: Reviewing this hotel is tricky. I have stayed at other InterContinentals, and this one was at the bottom of the pile. The pros of this hotel were: it was fairly decent value for money. The hotel's own website had a deal for late Thanksgiving (priceline had similar deals), which meant that we got the hotel for about $110/night. Given it's central location to shopping and Michigan Avenue, I think that was a fair price. There also seemed to be a pretty good spread for the Thanksgiving buffet but it was (as most hotels like this) overpriced. The cons of this hotel were: it was a bit ragged and more run down, particularly in the older part of the building. Our bathroom was not terribly nice and seemed straight out of the 1980s. We also had trouble finding just a basic drink (think orange juice or ginger ale) as the lobby and bar was incredibly crowded on a fairly regular basis -- but that may also have been a function of the time of year. The fee to use the gym was also fairly hefty. That having been said (but you can do this without staying at the hotel), we had a lovely stop at oenology -- a wine, cheese and chocolate bar in the corner of the hotel. Overall, I was satisfied with this hotel given the reasonably cheap price we paid; but if we had paid more, I think that we would have been better off at the Chicago Westin (not that far away) or one of the W hotels -- which were only slightly more expensive than what we paid at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: setter1vb
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I was staying on a free night certificate along with a second room for my parents, however I was always of the mindset that as you gain status within Priority Club, that the hotels took your stays a little more seriously in an effort to keep you coming back to their brand. The valet that took our car was great - things went downhill after that. We tried to check in around noon, and were told we would be called as soon as our rooms were available. We were slated to go to a show at 5:30, so we figured getting a room after the 3pm check-in time would be no problem, so we would explore the city and come back to get ready. At 3:30, we had heard nothing and went back to check and to get ready. Still no rooms available. The staff seemed to be put off that I would bother them about getting my room after the prescribed check in time. We finally got our first of two rooms at 4:15, giving us time to have a shared experience with my parents in getting ready and made our show. The rooms themselves were clean, and we did end up with our second room after the show. We did not apparently warrant a mini-bar in our room (the second one), though my parents at least had one. Location was obviously good, but also was a likely reason for the service concerns - being in a high demand location means you will have at least some level of clientele regardless of how some are treated. The long term concern for us was the lack of concern shown by the staff. Then again, how often can you say the highlight of your stay was the valet!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family hotel and incredible value”
Reviews.Author: Blair4
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two children, ages 4 and 3) visited Chicago for a quick weekend trip. We were excited about the Intercontinental due to its reputation, location and the great rate we received which included a breakfast buffet for our family. Check in was a breeze and we were in our room by 11AM (fabulous!). The room size is small, although we don't spend much time in the room so that didn't bother us much. I gave a rating of four stars instead of five because I think more people than not would be bothered by the tight quarters, especially if they do lots of shopping, have lots of luggage or, as in our case, have a double stroller (that barely fit in the hallway). The room was very clean, the bathroom was very nice and good sized, the view was fantastic, nothing was broken or in need of repair or updating, and we were never disturbed by noise. I can't say enough positive things about the breakfast buffet, and urge everyone to take advantage of that great value. All of us found more than enough of what we like - they have a huge variety ranging from made-to-order omelettes with great ingredients, waffles/pancakes/french toast, eggs benedict, oatmeal, pastries, lox and cream cheese, bagels and other breads, other great meats and cheeses (very high quality proscuitto, for example), a fantastic array of fresh fruit and fresh fruit juices, unlimited coffee, etc. The staff throughout the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The pool is huge and beautiful - reminded me of the pool in the movie Annie. The kids loved it and so did we; it was clean, big and had great old-fashioned charm. The location can't be beat. I can't think of a reason not to stay here, unless of course you are worried about the room sizes. We had two full beds, and I would guess that rooms with king beds are bigger, same possibly for the rooms in the historical tower.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: louabill
Reviews.Content: Plusses: Comfortable bed, good shampoo, cool swimming pool. Minuses: The air conditioning didn't work very well. Granted, Chicago had just had a hot spell, so the building itself might have warmed up. Even so, it seems incomprehensible that it could take all night to try and cool the room to the setting of 75, and never succeed. The air conditioning (central) fan was tremendously loud. Kinda like sitting on a runway. The sound-proofing was poor. When my neighbor flushed his/her toilet, it sounded like a pipe burst in the wall. When my neighbor's alarm clock went off, I heard it. When my neighbor's wake-up calls came in, I thought my phone was ringing. The light-proofing was poor. When the sun came up, my room got bright. There was no architectural reason for this, just a cheap version of the heavy shades that most somewhat fancy hotels can afford. The $15/night internet connection was painfully slow. I could have paid $18/night for a supposedly-faster version, but I would be willing to bet that the slowness was due to too many people using the same router at once. If I were in a cut-rate hotel (which is where I often stay), none of these but the internet would have bothered me. This hotel is pretending to be high-end, but is nothing of the kind. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Less than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Nikita50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early July. The a/c was extremely loud and could not keep up with the heat generated by the sun (our room faced east). Also, there was a weird smell in the lobby, reminiscent of my busia's kitchen when she cooked kapusta. The one nice thing about the hotel is that it's well located, within walking distance of many Chicago sights. But I'm sure there are better properties in that part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: apa1978
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent, right in the heart of Chicago and the main reason why you should pick this hotel. The building itself is impressive if slightly ageing. The rooms are very pleasant although the air conditioning units are a little noisy for the standard of hotel. Bathroom is good with quality toiletries, although I personally prefer the Elemis range found at other Intercontinentals. Friendly staff add to the service experience and this is a good bet for a quality Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great room!”
Reviews.Author: krstn425
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute through priceline, so we did not know where we were going to be staying. It was the best location you can ask for...right on michigan ave! The room was beautiful and it had a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Love Chicago...NOT this hotel”
Reviews.Author: drose12
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel before our arrival to explain the billing. Half was to be charged to the association and other half to me. On the last three days to American Airlines. It was a ten day stay. On check in, we were given an end of hallway room on top room. I was told not to worry about the other half of room charge and would be called about my half of room. I gave the hotel my American Express. I was shocked went a few days after my card had been charged $1550. No phone call. And then after many days of trying to straighten out was charged for the last three days..finally the hotel called to reverse the charges. The managers were beyond rude. We travel often and really this hotel has huge costumer service problems. I would not stay here again. If I had know we would have checked out and stayed at a Starwoods property our last few days. I do want to thank Robert, our server in the lounge and Ursella at the front desk. Nice and professional. We enjoyed very much attending the Million Dollar Quartet, shopping at Nordstorms and two of our favorite places were the Bridgehouse and C House for eating. Very disappointed in our ten day stay at the Intercontinental on Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Discomfort Prevailed”
Reviews.Author: ramonabare
Reviews.Content: I do wish hotels would notify customers if there is construction in process. Main dinng room in hotel is being rebuilt.. only restaurant other than wine bar is temporarily in a conference room and second floor lobby ..which is overwhelmed by noise from construction... We were given a nice room for our 7 day stay..21st floor we could view a bit of Lake Michigan. Room felt more like being on a cruise , for the size and storage. We had a desk and a computer (Navigator System) we could not get computer to work, and tech desk seeemed a bit surprised..so every nite I climbed under desk to turn off surge control - or the screen would not darken. We dealt with House keeping a minimum of 3 times a day. No coffee left for coffeemaker, no cups, no wash clothes, no liner for ice bucket,Only decaf coffee, a bath robe missing...And than on the 4th of July late we were awaken with knocking and it was room service delivering a tooth brush we did not order. Problem with housekeeping is that there is a language problem. Person answering phone did not know what I meant when asking for cup and saucer...Did not know what saucer meant, did not understand request - so we might have two deliveries of the wrong item. This must be a burden to staff as well. Simple problems with easy solutions. Concierges and bellman wrere great and so was staff on check in. Granted there is a remodel here,(although years ago) but plumbing fixtures were loose and a bit primitive. I loved the location, and for 7 days this was home, I really Like Chicago. My hope is that as an Intercontintal Hotel - fine tuning should be in order here and management should make the comfort of its guests a priority,

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: OceanSeeker81
Reviews.Content: We loved the Intercontinental. Our room was a bit small and without a view, but our king size bed and fridge and flat screen made our downtown during a busy Chicago weekend great. The concierge was quick to catch us a cab for the Cubs game and the Starbucks in the lobby was a welcome morning treat. I'd book this again for high quality hotel in the middle of downtown, with accessibility to a beautiful indoor pool to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your swimming gear”
Reviews.Author: dermotm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels around central Chicago over the years. I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Inter Continental on Magnificent Mile. There are two things it has that the others didn't; a great location and swimming pool. From my 12th floor corner bedroom I had a great view of Wacker Street Bridge. The room was worth it just for the view. The highlight is the 1930's swimming pool. Much frequented by Johnny 'Tarzan' Weissmuller; don't miss it for a little old school Chicago glamour. The hotel location is a big plus, centrally located and great for the business or tourist traveler. I'd stay at the hotel again, don't forget your swimming gear.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic wheelchair accessable room-other problems”
Reviews.Author: Bubber8
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the hotel we were not impressed. The lobby is dated and the restaurant was unavailable (construction). The staff at check in was effecient but no smile and not particularly friendly. How things changed dramatically as we entered our wheelchair accessable room! It was FANTASTIC. In over forty years of travel I have never stayed in a bigger room literally 22 ft from the end to the be to the other side of the room. You could put four additional couches in this area. The bathroom was also as good as any wheelchair accessable bathrooms we have ever stayed in, in the U.S. or Europe. The room was clean, quiet and compfortable. The price of the hotel, considering its location right in the middle of Chicago's Miracle Mile, was very acceptable. The parking is $54 a day, so you havve to consider that fact when considering the Intercontinental. One disturbing situation was the pricimg policy in the little store in the lobby selling snacks, tee shirts, newspapers etc. One bottle of Coke was $4.50, If I would buy two, the second was only $2. I have never seen this kind of pricing before and found it to be a disgusting money grab!. I am in a quandry staying here as the room was great but other things were truly substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: nrstycz
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue in Chicago is adequate. That is not a compliment for what should be a luxury hotel. Check-in was cold and fairly efficient. They were busy but none of the agents appeared friendly. If unemployment weren't so high, I could see unmotivated, unsmiling staff. But if I had to guess, the problem is that Intercontinental should be paying more because as their guests I am expecting more. The hotel is old and I recognize that there are limitations to what can be done in an older facility. I am 6-6 and my son is 6-7. We barely cleared the hallway ceilings and had to duck at the doorway to our rooms. The bathrooms were so small, that you barely had room to turn around. With many newer hotels in the immediate vicinity, I'm almost surprised that Intercontinental allowed its name to be put on this hotel. On the plus side the location is among the best in Chicago. It is smack in the middle of everything on Michigan Avenue where, e.g., much of the action of the current Transformer movie takes place. It is easy walking distance from Navy Pier, Millenium and Grant Parks, the Art Institute, and North Michigan Ave. shopping. The furnishings in the room were a little dated but quite comfortable. The hotel was nice and quiet on the 10th floor where we were and the room was nice and clean. And there is a Starbucks by the lobby that gets very busy by mid-morning.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February when we were in Chicago for a wedding. We got to the hotel and asked about upgrading. We were told we could upgrade to a room for $50 a night that would be about 50% bigger and have a nicer view. I decided we would upgrade, and remembered to give them my Priority Club number. With this the man at the front desk informed my the upgrade would be no cost to me. Already we were impressed and excited about the free upgrade. We went to the elevator and headed up to our floor. When we got out of the elevator our room was literally arms length away from the elevator door. This wasn't a huge deal though because it is always nice to not have to walk as much when you spend all day waking in the city, but we were worried that it would be noisy. We walked in the room and right away our jaws dropped. This upgraded room was about the size of a jacket closet. You walk in the door, immediately to your left is the bathroom, straight ahead is the closet and to your right is the bed. It was literally like a train compartment. I know you are in the city, but still for an upgraded room this was tiny. Other then the size the room was nice and the bed was comfortable so we got over it. We had a nice view of the city, and being that it was my first time in Chicago that was appreciated. We didn't rent a car, which is good because they charge around $50 a day for parking, so consider that when you are deciding if you are going to rent a car or not. And, if you are taking the train from the airport it is close to a mile walk from the train station. So it is semi-inconvenient to get to unless you are taking a taxi. Maybe it just seemed bad because it was close to sub-zero temperatures when we were there. The location is nice, on Michigan Ave, close to a lot of shops and restaurants and things. When it comes down to it, I wasn't too impressed with the size of the room and would probably choose another hotel if I were to return to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else.....”
Reviews.Author: liz77006
Reviews.Content: .....this is not a first class property. the hallways are tiled so the noise of the elevator, slamming doors, guest conversation, etc. is really loud. the food from room service was terrible--even breakfast. there was not an ice machine on our floor, and everytime we took the elevator to the "ice" machine floors, the machines were broken. when we arrived there was no bellman to help with our bags, the front desk had lost our reservations (the reservation was under my first name!) and the concierge was not friendly. on the positive side, the location is great

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, great staff, a little worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: SuTengKai
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is wonderfully positioned on the Magnificent Mile and that alone makes staying there a positive trip. Everything one wants and needs is nearby. I like the staff. The room costs are acceptable. I think charging $17 for internet connection is rather money-grubbing. The hotel building is attractive. I love that it has a Starbucks. The lobby is nice. The rooms show their age a bit, but not badly. Room service, parking, door men, concierge, etc. are all helpful and kind. They made the details of staying in the hotel very nice with the caveat that parking is rather expensive, 49 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable pricing!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell1116
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed over Memorial Day weekend so the hotel was busy and crowded! We still received excellent service and found the location to be excellent for shopping, transportation and access to Navy Pier. Our room was a bit small but typical of most hotel rooms in a city this size. Valet parking was expensive but we took advantage of self-parking in near-by lots.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: mytravels234
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the very large room we had. I'm not sure why they gave us such a large room, maybe we just got lucky. It was very spacious with a large bathroom. I've seen photos of their other rooms which look small compared to the room we had. We booked through hotwire and got a super good rate, I would never have paid the regular full price for this hotel. The location is probably the best in the Chicago loop. Walking distance to Navy Pier and centered on Michigan Ave so you can go either way to see everything. If we could get the same large room for the same price I'd stay here again. Parking was undergound at the hotel for $50 a day. Everything at this hotel was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: mokanj
Reviews.Content: location is excellent. The pool is the best i have seen in a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok. For One Night.”
Reviews.Author: jdog99
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. It is just average, but the location is great. If you are just staying a short time and get a great rate then you will be satisfied. The $55 for parking is crazy. My one complaint is the Air Conditioning on the floor was not up to par. The hallways were stuffy and humid and the room was just as bad. We had the temp set to 65 with the fan on high all night and we were sweating through out the night which is not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: i had a lovely room in the old tower. good internet connection and eveything was very nice. great 24 hour gym and a fabulous lap pool. too bad i did not bring my swim suit. great location. walk everywhere. nice staff. room was nice sized and bed very comforable. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great experience”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay! We were in room 2000 in the Historic Tower and found the furnishings to be comfortable and well appointed. Surprisingly spacious room for a city hotel-and historic at that! The lobby was nothing special but nice to have computers to print boarding passes and monitors with updated flight information. Starbucks is located in the lobby and Michael Jordans Steak House is opening soon. Something to brag about is the workout and swimming area! Make a point to check it out on your visit. Also, we enjoyed champagne/wine flights and cheese/chocolate flights at Enology on site. Lovely! We thought the staff was friendly and very helpful. The beds were very comfortable. I've read some previous complaints and didn't find the same experience. Looking forward to another stay-

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: duysguys
Reviews.Content: We picked up our reservation from Hot Wire and were eager to see the place. It was a major disappointment. The lobby was practically empty and the room was low in the building with no view. They are building a new restaurant in the lobby and closed their famous bar, so basically no amenities. Our cousins were across the street at the Marriott which was where we hung out. They had a computer in the room but internet access was a separate charge (unstated amount) so we avoided it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: First time at the Intercontinental Chicago, Service was good, location was excellent. Room was spacious. Only complaint would be a strange odor on elevator lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet 16 in the City”
Reviews.Author: Thegypsies
Reviews.Content: We took my daughter and her friends to the Intercontinental Chicago for her 16th birthday. We requested a suite and an attached room. They upgraded us to 2 suites. The rooms were different from each other, but both spacious and comfortable. The Intercon is in a very convenient location on Michigan Ave, halfway between shopping and restaurants and Millenium Park and the Art Institute. Our favorite part of this hotel is the pool area. The beautiful tile and terraces are a step back in time.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD NOT BAD JUST BLAH”
Reviews.Author: parkmusic42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at three hotels during my business trip to Chicago. This hotel fell right in the middle between the OMNI (loved it) and the Palmer House (hated it). The service was very slow at check in and the rooms were just ok. I would only stay here again in an upgraded room. Great location btw!! NO FREE WIFI

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sweetiebeak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental for one night in June and also for a few nights last September. We enjoyed both stays very much. The location is excellent. We were here for a concert in Millennium Park and could walk to the concert and all the shopping we wanted to do. The train station is at the Park also so we walked and stored our bags with the bellman. Parking is ridiculously expensive. A previous reviewer mentioned they thought the hotel was noisy. So, we were worried when we got off the elevator and realized our room was RIGHT THERE! I thought for sure I wouldn't be able to sleep. However, I didn't hear a thing at all. We kept our air on so maybe that helped. The hotel is clean. The pool is large but not for kids. The staff was extremely friendly. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Small room with a good view”
Reviews.Author: baddawgbob
Reviews.Content: We had a good view, bed was comfortable. the room was small and pricey, I guess that is what you pay for location!

Reviews.Title: “could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: TCishome
Reviews.Content: First off I am an InterContinental Platinum Ambassador. I was disappointed in this property, I have stayed at other InterContinentals and they were as expected. I expected it to be like the Conrad by Hilton which is right across the street. I did get an upgrade, but they lowered my floor and gave me a view of the roof. The room was clean but cramped, it was noisy. The first night the noise was from the hall and the second night it was the neighboring room enjoying adult activities shaking the wall and the items on the wall in my room. Very Disturbing! The hotel lobby and restaurant are beautiful but you don't sleep there. The breakfast is good. they did not make me feel like they really cared that my stay was uncomfortable. I stayed at a Crowne Plaza same hotel group and they went out of their way to help when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawthomas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago, staying two nights at the Intercontinental in the historic building. The room was large (two queen beds) with two windows overlooking Michigan Avenue. The batroom was spacious with both tub and seperate shower. The check-in was courteous and efficient. Two days later i was greeted by name from both the front desk clerk and the (very efficient and helpful) concierge. The room was exceptionaly wel maintained and tastefuly furnished. The ball room floor lobbies are a trip through history, as is the pool where both Johny Weismuller and Ester Wiliams swam when (and after) the building was a Shriner's mens athletic club. The only draw backs are the expensive valet parking and the full (limited is free) internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: GinkyH
Reviews.Content: I know Chicago is expensive , but for the money- our room was too tiny, tired, and with cheap amenties . For a few more bucks we should've stayed up the street and had a great room. Our group was extremely disappointed the bar was being remodeled.. We had to go elsewhere which was the hotel's loss.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace to the Intercontinetal Brand: motel-level service for a 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: petey2428
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice indoor pool, good location Cons: AWFULLY unprofessional staff, VERY small room, horrible value, $18 for Wifi Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else! The room is TINY (for comparison, a 1 bedroom suite in this hotel is the same size or even smaller than a 2 queen bed room at Hotel 71!) Sure, the location is good, but there are also MANY hotels in this price-range on the Magnificent Mile! ___________________________________________________ I got a free night from Priority Club and decided to stay there. We booked a 2 double-bed room in the Main Tower and got upgraded to a bigger 2 double-bed room in the Historic Tower when I called IHG since I'm a Platinum member. Then, we got a new updated confirmation email for the 2 double bed room in the Historic Tower. When we arrived there, a lady (who is also the manager) checked us in. I gave her my confirmation number and made sure that we're in the nicer Historic Tower per our new confirmation email. She said that the system put us in the smaller Main Tower, and that everything else is booked, so she gave us the keys to the smaller Main Tower. I told her that I have a new reservation for the bigger Historic Tower, but then she kept referring to my OLD reservation in the Main Tower. I tried to explain the situation to her, but then she kept referring to my old reservation. Since wifi costs $18 at the hotel, I had to walk to the nearest Starbucks to pull up an email with a new confirmation to show it to her. When I got back, the manager (who checked us in) wasn't there anymore, so I talked to one of the front desk staffs and showed her my new confirmation email which explicative states our confirmation number, the date we're arriving, and the type of room we're staying in (in the Historic Tower). The lady I talked to didn't seem to care about helping me at all, so she went back to get the manager. I waited for a VERY LONG time for her to come back and was given no explanation why it took so long, and when she did come back, she told me that my email isn't valid and kept referring to my old confirmation email. I told her it makes no sense at all because an UPDATED confirmation email should always rule out an OLD confirmation email. Then, she proceeded to tell me "I don't know, I didn't check you in" in an I-don't-care-about-you attitude. I was pretty mad at this time. I asked her to speak to the manager. Then, I had to wait again for about 10 mins.
