While waiting (I've had already waited about 20 mins by then), NOONE in the front desk even looked at me and asked if I've been helped or offered to give me any explanation why it took so long. By the time the manager finally showed up (she was on the phone, but noone told me that till she got here), she, ONCE AGAIN, referred to my old reservation and completely ignored the fact that I had a NEW reservation. I was furious at that point because a new reservation should ALWAYS rule over an old reservation. She said that there is probably a discrepancy in the system and gave me a that's-too-bad-because-the-room-you're-supposed-to-be-in-is-all-booked kind of answer. After going back and forth and me being extremely angry, she decided to update me to a 1 bedroom suite with 1 King Bed. Since I was traveling with my parents, I had to sleep on the pull out couch. The room wasn't ready, so they told me I could wait in my old room and that they'll call me when the new room is ready (FYI, they NEVER called me). Here are the things that they screwed up: 1.) They didn't acknowledge my presence. I felt like they didn't care about me at all. That's the most unfriendly customer service I've dealt with in a long time. The 2nd front-desk lady who talked to me said "I don't know, I didn't check you in" in a very I-don't-care-about-you attitude. Poor customer service is UNACCEPTABLE in a 4-star hotel. 2.) They made me wait a very long time without any explanation. A hotel shouldn't make you wait for half an hour without any explanation. A proper way to handle this would be "The manager is on the phone right now, and the wait could be long." I stood there not knowing where those people went and felt like they just left me standing there because they didn't want to talk to me. 3.) People make mistakes, and that's totally fine as long as they try to make it right. In this case, there's a discrepancy in the system. The minute I show my new confirmation email is the minute you acknowledge that there is a discrepancy in the system, apologized, and tried to fix it. They didn't do that. They kept referring back to my old reservation as if I was a liar. 4.) This is minor, but after they screwed up this badly, you would think they would try to go the extra mile to make my stay amazing. They forgot to call me when my room was ready. This hotel is a disgrace to the InterContinental Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: Great miracle mile location. Everything was within walking distance including Navy Pier. Worth staying if you can get a good rate on hotwire!

Reviews.Title: “Room too small and a bit beat up, common areas very nice”
Reviews.Author: jmk5
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference. The hotel had beautiful meeting facilites and rooms. The older common areas were quite lovely--but the room. This room was way too small for a four star hotel. It was approaching the size of a Japanese business hotel. It was just too small. To make matters worse, space was taken up by two connecting doors to each of the rooms on either side of me. Having two connecting doors also made the room noisy. Also the room did not deaden outside noises well. There seemed to be a fire station close by. I could hear the sirens quite well. There needs to be some more sound control. The furniture was a bit beaten up, and there were stains on the build in sitting area by the window. And most of the desk was taken up with a monitor that constantly showed ads to you for local resturants, activities, and other things that the hotel charged you extra for.. You could turn off the screen, but sometimes it would wake up on its own. Sometimes it would wake up at 2:00am and wake you. I wish they just would remove that thing. I talked to others at the conference. They all agreed that the rooms were not good. The food was good, and the service was good. I just wish the room was good. There shouldn't be a room this bad in a hotel as nice as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Misplacedbrit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental over the Easter weekend and had a thoroughly great time. We had read some bad reviews of the hotel mainly due to the size of the bedroom - have any of these reviewers ever staying in New York - you get a room not much bigger than a closet. Yes the bedroom is not huge but the furnishings are luxurious to say the least. We stayed in the tower on the 32nd floor with views of Lake Michigan from one side and the Magnificent Mile (directly opposite Nordstrums) on the other. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful - we chose the full buffer with eggs made to order., prepared eggs benedict, all the usual hot fixings including oatmeal. The cold buffer had the most wonderful smoked salmon served with cream cheese also plenty of fresh fruit to choose from. My mouth waters at the thought - it is possible to fill up and not need to eat much until later in the day or to eat healthily whatever your choice. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel - the welcome was also very nice from the doorman to the receptionist to the concierge top marks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, stay in the Historic Tower. It has recently been redone with new carpet, furniture, wallpaper, etc. It is luxurious and filled with amenities. The views are incredible if you are lucky enough to get a high room on the south or east side of the building. It is an old building located on Michigan Avenue. Consequently, there is outside noise and sometimes if people allow their doors to slam, it can be noisy. Be a good neighbor and don't let the door slam! The pool & fitness center are AMAZING! This is the part I enjoy the most when I stay here. The FC is two levels, with cardio equipment on one level and strength equip on the upper level. The pool is a lap pool, however, so if you have a bunch of kids that want to lounge around in the pool, there may be better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Droynick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'Historic Tower" in a room facing the Magnificent Mile. The room and bathroom were spacious and well equipped with the exception of a bureau to unpack into. The hotel lobby is undergoing renovation so the restaurant, which serves great meals, is in a nondescript temporary room. The only down side is that the hotel charges $14.95 a DAY, not stay, for internet access and the adjacent Starbucks does not have wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money On This Dump!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Content: We stayed on April 22 for one night for my daughters birthday and had a great experience until it we had to spend the night in the hotel. The heat/air ventilation system in our room was so loud it was like sleeping with a semi engine in the room!! None of us got any sleep and to top it off when we turned the heat off the walls were so thin that we could hear EVERY WORD of conversations in the next room and it went on all night long! The room was also small and the bathroom had peeling wall paper and paint!!!! When I brought this to the attention to the front desk the man was apologetic but did nothing to make it right and had the attitude that he or anyone else were going to do anything to make it right. Don't waste your $200-$300 here for a room or even $99 a night it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great ..... Expensive added fee- small room...”
Reviews.Author: Yvesg
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for a few days, the room are very average and not very big. The staff can be rude. Parking is expensive $55 per days. Also we requested to have some 2 plates to our room since we brought some left over from a restaurant and they requested us to pay $7.00 Pool is only a lap pool. Good location, but could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, Convenient, and a Real Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dsm22203
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become my choice for travel to Chicago. The location on Michigan Avenue can't be beat. I've stayed in both the new and historic towers and as other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are small. However, I think these claims are based on expectations that many have based on non-city center properties. On my most recent visit, we were treated to an amazing corner room on the 18th floor with wonderful views. The pool area is architecturally stunning and it is a true lap pool...a rarity for any hotel. Staff are exceedingly gracious, and I have to recognize the excellent service provided by Olivia and Jason at the front desk. My only small gripe is the $14.95 charge for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TheFlyingMommy
Reviews.Content: Being right on the Miracle Mile, the location is prime. But, geez, the rooms are tired. Now, I will also quickly say that the rooms are very clean, the beds comfortable, and the showers hot. It's not that the hotel is "bad". . .it's just. . .tired. The rooms could really stand to be redone. Especially considering the price that is charged for the rooms. When you stay at the Intercontinental, take a moment to explore a little around the historic tower. Ask the staff to direct you to the original lobby. Take a moment to up the stairs and explore a little. The architecture in that tower is just amazing. Very King Arthur. And, be sure and check out the pool - it is absolutely stunning. You'll never see another hotel pool like it.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small tired rooms, no extras (water in room ), but good location”
Reviews.Author: JimBuntJim
Reviews.Content: The rooms are awful. Very old, dated and small. They do nothing to improve the experience of these rooms. No water left in the rooms. No chocaltes on the pillow. No paper delivered to the door. We understood the hotel wad a four and a half star. It should not be. It is a great location and lovely building, but you expect a certain amount of pampering at a four plus star hotel and this place provides none of that. All in all very disappointed. Would not stay here again. Definitely worth the extra 100a night to stay at the trump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, small bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: SAP75
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel because the location is excellent and it's just historically beautiful. The service (front desk, concierge, housekeeping, reservation people, doormen, valets) were ALL VERY friendly and VERY helpful. They even loan out umbrellas at the concierge when it's raining! Starbucks in the lobby was great for breakfast. It was my daughters birthday & I mentioned it during the reservation process and the first night each of our two rooms had a slice of cheesecake & birthday card in it! Value would have gotten 5 stars for the room price, but tacking on another $53/night for valet did NOT make it such a great deal. The only complaint about the room is that the bathroom was small. We had 3 women getting ready and couldn't squeeze past one another in the bathroom to get to the mirror. Also, another $15/night for internet is silly in this day & age.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a 10 in general, but the room is a 6”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, very well located in N Michigan Ave, great food, restaurant, breakfast (very expensive) fitness center, service and etc, but the room needs to be better. It's small, tied, the shower is old and not good, and the worst is the lack of space (a good table) to work with your computer. There is only a small table and believe me or not, but without any power plug around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: johnsonevv
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11:30 on Sunday night and was greeted by a friendly staff member and she inquired if I wanted room service and told me it was still open. Room was smallish, but met all my needs. The bathroom was small and if my husband had been with me, it would not have been convenient. But for one person this room was PERFECT. The hotel is lovely and was so close to the Gleacher Center which is where I needed to go each day. Great view of Michigan Avenue. Check out the swimming pool for a bit of old world charm. You don't need to swim, just go look at it. I got a good rate view their website using AAA. My original plan was to stay at the Marriott across the street, but they were $60 more per night. When I go back to downtown Chicago (and it is a great place), I will consider the Intercontinental again. Friendly staff, helpful staff, lovely facility. What I would expect from a downtown Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental's Location Key to Our Fun Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: furfinfeather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental the weekend of April 1-3, 2011. The location of the InterContinental was key to our great weekend getaway. We did the Chicago Architectural Boat Tour (Wendella's)on Friday evening. The boat dock was a block away from the InterContinental Hotel. We ate dinner at Portillo's before Supernatural Chicago. Both spots are a 15 min. walk down Michigan Ave and up Ontario. Saturday, we hopped on the Red Line (3 Blocks from InterContinental) and went to the Cubs/Pirates game at Wrigley. Went to Holy Name Cathedral on Sunday. InterContinental were courteous and helpful with directions. Our clean room on the 22nd floor looked over Michigan Ave - Great Weekend, except we missed the parachutist jump off the skyscraper on Sunday! Thanks InterContinental!

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars all the way ... EXCEPT for the housekeeper's morning noise”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Chicago Intercontinental Hotel a number of time already. As aways, the room, bed, room service, F&B, and hotel staff were excellent, clean, and consistent with the 5-star Intercontinental brand and other IHG hotels worldwide. Of special note, was the service extended by "Ursula" - front desk clerk who was extremely professional and helpful. I do unfortunately have one problem to report, which housekeeping can easily rectify (I hope they are reading this review). I had a late night with business the night before and intended upon sleeping in (had arranged a late check-out). My bed (in guest room #2804 - in the historic tower) was quite a distance from the door, so I was certain that I would not hear any noise. However, early in the morning, I heard an overzealous housekeeper banging doors, knocking on doors, and yelling "Housekeeping". Mind you, this was not directed at my door, but neighboring doors of rooms on my floor. This jolted me out of bed ... and every time I'd dose off again, bang, knock-knock, and the word "housekeeping" yelled at the top of her lungs. I wish I could say that this property was the only outlier for this problem, but many hotels suffer from the blindspot. Kindly fix this problem, and you will have my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: Martinski22
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend inChicago with friends and loved hotel. Located right on mag mile and walking distance to many locations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Extremely Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mdl1014
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel last week and when I first checked in I was very pleased. Everything was very nice. I would plan on hitting up a local Walgreen's if you don't like paying for anything out of the in room re fridge. When a bottle of water costs $7.50 cents you know you are at a hotel that charges a premium. The pool was absolutely gorgeous and free to use. The hotel room was small, but still comfortable and clean and had a nice view. I felt like the hotel was very understaffed though. There was constantly a line at the front desk and even after several conversations with the staff, they still managed to double charge my credit card. Good thing I checked my credit card statement. This hotel is in a perfect area, there is no doubt about that. But it also has its downsides, they charge for everything under the sun. To use the fitness center for 24 hours, $12.00 per day. To use the internet in your room, $14.95 per day and it is incredibly incredibly slow. I felt like I was using a dial up modem. The On Demand Movie I ordered kept loosing signal and so I wasn't able to enjoy that without the reseting the guide every time and then resuming the movie. I am surprised this hotel doesn't charge to use the elevators. It was quite ridiculous. Maybe if they were a little bit more reasonably priced for their amenities, they would get more business. Overall I could give it a C+. There are several other hotels right down the street and next time I would try one of those vs. coming back to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “On the Mag Mile, historic and beautiful, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rosielovestravel
Reviews.Content: We took a room here for a quick getaway. We spent a bit of our time just wandering around the hotel enjoying the historic architectural features, the incredibly beautiful indoor pool and elegant decor. The room was small, but the bed was comfortable, inspite of our request for a king size. We ended up cramming into a double bed even though we had confirmed the day before. Apparently, it was booked solid and room assignments are first-come, first-serve. The amenities are higher-end and the atmosphere is very classy. You can't beat the location if you're looking for the tourist's delight of walking the Mag Mile, quick access to cabs, and being in the heart of the higher end of Chicago's shops and restaurant scene. We dined at Le Colonial on Rush. It was an indulgent night away from the kids.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT AT THE INTERCONTI!!!”
Reviews.Author: GEOII
Reviews.Content: This is my 10th stay here. 3 with family / 7 on business. I love this hotel / profesional well trained staff / warm and friendy / clean fresh rooms / fanastic bed linens / over the top baths with seperate bath and shower. The staff is always there to help with any need / one of my al time favorite hotels.!!!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: deneen730
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for one night through Groupon. My son and I were very excited. I planned to check in and take a walk. The room was beautiful! We rested for a while and then walked to a local restaurant for dinner. Afterwards, we rented a movie in the room. The amenities were very nice. In the morning, I tried to used the remote and it didn't work. Last night it did. Now, back to the old manual days. Around 8:00 a.m. the drilling and hammering began. It was so loud my son and I had to shout to be heard. I manually pushed the TV volume to more than 40 and still couldn't hear it very well. With all of the noise going on I wanted to order breakfast and leave as soon as possible. I felt like the hotel wanted me to leave too. When room service came to the door, I couldn't tell whether there was a knock at the door or the hammering. The breakfast was delicious! I went to take my shower leaving my five year-old son to watch TV. As I was prepared to shower, I hear my son talking to someone. I open bathroom door and I scold my son for opening the door and he said it was opened by the man. I believe I would've been able to hear him at the door if there wasn't the loud hammering, dropping of tools, the sound of crumbling debris and drilling. ----So, I finished dressing and was about to checkout. I mentioned the noise and the person at the front desk made a phone call I guess to ask someone about the noise. He told me that the noise was outside. I said do you mean outside of the building and he said there was no noise in my area of the hotel. Now, I'm a little upset, because he was telling me that I'm hearing things. Although, there were many apologies, I was still unsatisfied. I was told the previous day I could checkout by 2:00 p.m., but it's now shortly after 11:00 because I couldn't stand the noise anymore. No noise should be that loud from the street on the 23rd floor! So, I asked could I at least get my breakfast as compensation and the answer was no. All they could do was take off the movie. I was sorely disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DianeEB
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend in Chicago at the InterContinental on Michigan and again they never cease to amaze me with the staff courtesy, cleanliness and service. The pool is one of the most striking pools I have ever seen, absolutely beautiful. The Doormen and Bell staff are wonderful. I will be returning in two weeks for a girls weekend and can't wait to be pampered again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for family trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bollintj
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was excellent. We never waited once for any service - from check-in to valet to ordering a drink at the bar. The rooms were well appointed - a bit noisy though. Mind you our room had a magnificent views of Michigan Ave. Everything we wanted to do on the mile was within a few minutes walking from the front door of the hotel. We parked our car at the hotel ($53/day) and used it to drive to Lincoln Park and to the Field Museum. The kids loved the pool. I wished that there was a hot tub - but saunas were in each locker room (didn't use them). Overall we were VERY happy with our stay and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: richboys
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year for the same conference. I have never had much of a view from my room, but it has been good sized with plenty of space although perhaps too much furniture. Check-in was quick, the valet was good with my car, and the bag service was efficient. I cannot recommend eating in the hotel due to the costs. I was in a rush and grabbed the buffet. Everything was great except the cold pancakes and slow waiter in bringing my bill. Since I was in a hurry I had not looked at the price so it was a bit of a shock, but I guess that is what it costs in Chicago. When I asked about local places to eat the staff were quick to point out all the wonderful options and not just the in hotel service that some hotels push. Good points for knowledge and even pointing out some of the over priced and long waits at the tourist traps. It has been a pleasure to stay here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Use Your Debit Card To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cogle1726
Reviews.Content: Got a big shocker when I checked in. This hotel adds $350 for incidentals on an automatic draft to your account in addition to your entire stay amount, with the promise of returning it to your account within 72 hours if you do not use it. This was especially tough as I had received an 80 percent advance from work to fund the trip. Thank goodness I had saved extra money to spend in Chicago or I would have been in trouble. I think the hotel should prepare you for this when they send you the reservation confirmation. This forced me to eat in the hotels expensive restaurant to be able to afford to stay. I'm sure they know this will happen to some guest and that is why they do it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: QuipQue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 days and was very pleased. Very friendly doorman and staff. Very good food. I ate at the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. I recommend the breakfast buffet, which is plenty and just yumm! Great view from the restaurant The hotel does not look like a chain hotel but kept authentic features: wonderful. Beautiful 1920's style rooms, lobby, pool. Location couldn't be better: straight on Michigan avenue, which is nice for mag mile shopping, and everything is nearby, there are a lot of buses. HDtv in room. Fee for wifi. I would go back to this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A fine business hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ketchtwenty2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for three days in early February. I got a corner room in the tower. The service at check was great. The room was smallish and crowded with furniture, but it is a renovated hotel so that was expected. The service in the lobby was excellent. The doormen did a great job flagging cabs despite the bitter cold. The one small gripe I have is that everything is extra $$. If you compare the Intercontinental vs other lines from the same hotel chain, you actually get less for the money. I was very disappointed that the gym cost $$. The pool is spectacular and worth the trip. Even if you stay there and have no intention of swimming, I highly recommend you check it out. They have maintained the vintage decor and it feels like you are stepping into the 1920's. Very cool. I was very happy with my stay despite my small criticisms. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “At the Mag Mile. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Caximba
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great, the staff treat us like royalty. They honored my PC Gold and gave us a free late checkout. The restaurant is good, kinda pricey but good. There is better option nearby with better prices. The Starbucks at lobby is great, cause the hotel breakfast is not included and its not cheap. The pool is beautiful, even if you dont wanna swim stop by.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelers082330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in perfect location for anything you would like to do downtown. The hotel itself is amazing. I was in the historical tower and the rooms are beyond nice and the views are breathtaking. Everyone was very helpful there especially Victor at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wevorys
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with 3 sisters for a girls get-away. We used points for a free nights stay. The lobby was still decorated for the holidays and was very lovely. We LOVED the Starbucks connected to the lobby. The rest of the hotel was very pretty. The location was excellent &the rooms very nice-sufficient for the short time that we were in them. We could walk to the Art Institute, Millenium Park, and any high-end store you could wish for. We really enjoyed the staff, all were friendly, particularly our doorman who greeted us like old friends each time we departed or arrived. We would definately stay there again, even if we didn't use points.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay On Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: KandBTravels
Reviews.Content: We got a great winter rate at the hotel website, $119, and planned a weekend getaway to Chicago. The location is great, right on the Magnificent Mile, and our room in the Historic Tower was very nice. Large enough for the two of us (no reason to upgrade), and the bed was extremely comfortable. Check-in and bell-hop staff were very nice and accomodating. Our only complaint is that the room was not ready at 3pm when we checked-in. We had a 3:30pm play at the Shakespere Theatre (15 minute walk), so we checked our bags and headed out. But if we had taken a long flight or drive to get to the hotel, it would have been frustrating that we would not have been able to check-in on time to freshen up quickly before going to the theatre. Other than that, we definitely enjoyed our stay and would select this hotel again without hesitation. We also went to Eno Wine bar that evening and definitely enjoyed the wine and truffles!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Bears2344
Reviews.Content: We booked a king room in the Historic Tower and were placed in a room with no windows, which I thought was weird. Room was on the 9th floor and at around 7pm there was a party in one of the ballrooms below are room and it sounded like the band was in our room. We could here every word of every song and this went on until 11:30pm. Called front desk and said there was nothing they could do. Did give us 25% off stay. Wouldn't expect a noise problem in a 5 start hotel. Not worth the money. Have had much better stays at cheaper downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: rayyanyel
Reviews.Content: One of the best location if you want to be in the city center ... you can walk like 10 min to any where (Shopping, john hancock, many resturants nearby, navy pier)!! The Cleanliness & Service is Inter Continental standard : ) ONE BAD THING ... INTERNET CONNECTION IS ALSO Inter Continental STANDARD TOO EXPENSIVE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Mag Mile, but not five-star service”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental over New Year holiday. Arrived at 2.20pm. Room not ready , staff checked us in, but had to leave bags, and head out for some lunch. Not a major issue, and staff said they'd call when room was ready - no call received. Arrived back at hotel at 5pm, room was ready, and it was nice and large, in historic tower. Comfortable, but not a five-star accomodation. Everything was OK, but not the wow factor. Coffee maker in room, which was well used. One morning, there was a problem with hot water to the historic tower, and the staff offered a room in other part of the hotel for shower etc. (not great for the price of accomodation - but staff tried to assist). The hotel is right on Magnificent Mile. Ideal for all the sights. Overall, a decent stay, but nothing special for new year. If you can bag a good deal then it's a good choice. But I probably wouldnt return again - unless the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Historic tower is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MeganH06
Reviews.Content: I bought two nights in this hotel on hotwire and got a great deal! This was my Christmas gift to my fiance. After reading reviews on Trip advisor I decided to see if I could upgrade to the historic tower (since the reviews are so much better than the main tower). We got there a couple hours early for check-in and the staff was very friendly. The man at the front desk gladly upgraded me to the historic tower for $50 a day, which I think was definitely worth it (especially since I got such a steal in the first place) and found us a room that was available immediately. The room was very nice. The king size bed was super comfortable and there was a flat screen tv. The view was breathtaking from the 34th floor. The bathroom was clean and modern. The room was small, but I had no complaints. We don't need very much space. AND of course the location is perfect! Upgrade to the historic tower if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale any pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: PacerJim
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location right on Michigan Ave. It is the upscale brand in the ICH line and the room was quite a nice suite. I'm a platinum level traveler and yet there was no comp breakfast and a very expensive $15 internet. The lower end brands provide all that for free. The staff was polite and efficient. The room was very nice and very clean. I walked around the block and found a great little Armenian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location but Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: JJD82
Reviews.Content: Okay, good things first. The location of this hotel is unbeatable. You are right on Michigan Avenue, within minutes of walking to endless rows of shops and restaurants. Nordstrom (ladies, this Nordstrom has the biggest shoe department out of all US Nordstroms) is directly across the street. Walgreen is just kitty corner from the hotel for all your essential needs. There's a Starbucks right downstairs. Two blocks away sits at least 10 fantastic restaurants. Hancock Observatory is just a short ten-minute walk away. Again, the location is as good as it gets. Now the bad (wish I didn't have anything to say here); Even with 6 banks the elevator area is always crowded, so going up to your room could be a good 10 minute wait especially during lunch/dinner time. We booked a standard room, it's very cozy (translation: small); the room service cart could barely make it through the narrow hallway! The room is clean, the beds are pretty comfortable, bathroom is well equipped. The service was awful. The front desk lady was friendly but that was the extend of good service. We waited nearly an hour for our luggage (did not travel on a holiday weekend); another hour for room service, even though we were promised our food within 30 minutes. When I rang up the front desk for a few items, the answer I got was : "Well, what you have in your room is what we can provide". I find it hard to believe a big hotel like the InterContinental can not spare two extra notepads for their guests. As nice as the location is, I will not stay here again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: btusmccoyh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Chicago for a quick trip. I found an excellent price for the Intercontinental for $79.20 so we jumped on it. The hotel is in an excellent location, they also have a wine, cheese and choclate bar in the hotel. We stayed in the Historic Tower and had a great view of Lake Michigan. The hotel is located on Michigan Ave and close to everything. I would recommend it to anyone. I will be returning, even if I have to pay more!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: swimbikerunhike
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on Michigan Avenue. Must see the historic pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbuss5
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in town for New Years Eve, and this location on Michigan Ave couldn't be beat! The accomodations were outstanding. We ended up getting upgraded to a Jr. Suite which provided us with a great sitting room and two bathrooms. Bars and nightlife were an easy walk from the hotel. I would most definitely return to the InterContinental Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: pennybell08
Reviews.Content: The cahrged 800.00 on my debit card for a hold at check in. They didn't just have it on fil, they CHARGED IT!. The room was the smallest I have ever seen. The prices were outrageous. The location was excellent but a very pricey spot. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Buxton Derbyshire in the High Peak Forest
Reviews.Title: “ecellant location”
Reviews.Author: Buxtonworld
Reviews.Content: On the main Michigan ave road close, to the river,navy pier and eating areas

Reviews.Title: “Great value unbeatable location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Triple A rate 102/night nicely furnished rooms with friendly staff and a huge star bucks in lobby You will not get a better value on mchigan avenue. The walls were a little thin and some women were fighting @230 am but no other problems. We would go back and stay a couple of nights for a Chicago getaway. Cannot beat this hotel's location!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special...”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun08
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Chicago and I wanted to write this while everything was still fresh in my mind. We stayed two nights, with extended family. My husband, sister, and brother-in-law, and I stayed in one room, while my mother, stepfather, and brother stayed in another. We made reservations over a month ago, for the historic tower, only to find when we arrived they did not have rooms avaliable so we were moved to the other tower, we did receive a much cheaper rate, so we were ok with that. The girl who checked us in was very slow and it took forever, we probably stood in the lobby for over 20 minutes. We went up to our rooms, and they were ok, but nothing special. To me they actually seemed a bit small. The beds were hard as a rock, not comfy at all. The bathroom was ok as well, but again nothing special. My husband had a drink at the bar which cost $9 (which is a bit much, for me) and then he said it was so strong he couldn't even drink it. We went to check out the pool and fitness center, and both were very nice, then as we were leaving we found out that you have to pay to use the fitness center! I would think as much as you pay for a room in this hotel the fitness center should be free. The location was very good, close to many good restaurants, and tons of shopping, but if I ever come to Chicago again I probably would not stay at this hotel again. We saw several other hotels in the area that would probably be a much better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful,Friendly,Calming,Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: soxfun
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Beautiful from the time you drive/walk up to it until the time you leave (Sadly!) My wife and I live in Chicago but have traveled all over. Besides Chicago itself being second to none, this Hotel, all things considered, is also second to none. Great Food ,BETTER people, Clean beautiful rooms in a perfect setting and location. Will stay here every year. In Fact, we have traveled alot over the years and we are only in our mid 50`s. Since Chicago and this Hotel are so Great we figured this would be our only vacation from now on. It really is that nice and NO we do not work here :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice property but check the bedding”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl404
Reviews.Content: Everyone was nice and it is a great location. Very nicely decorated for the holidays. Rooms were satisfactory for the price. Service could be better, especially for this property. I woke up with a bunch of bites on my legs which appear to be bed bites, so check all the bedding and the wood around the bed carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: writesabit
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Intercontinental in Chicago and both visits were excellent. The Michigan Avenue location is convenient to shopping and dinning. The hotel restaurant is much above average and, in fact, we enjoyed one of the best meals we've ever eaten there. The staff is always helpful and friendly and while the rooms are on the small side, they are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: trip12345
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right on the magnificent mile. Took the subway in from O'Hare. No complaints except I wish they'd offer free internet. Clean rooms, nice beds, nice pool and workout room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: 1) Location......best spot for shopping on Michigan ave. 2) Staff....we did not have one complaint about any staff member. Top 10 staff. 3) Rooms.......very clean and well kept. Average bathrooms. 4) Parking.......$53 Really? Way too expensive. IHG can do better! 5) Room service....Did not use. 6) Architecture....top notch. incredible. 7) Priority club....They did not acknowledge my platinum status and did not offer an upgrade. They did let us check in at 10 a.m. and check out at 2 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good for Small - Medium Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: BrizBot
Reviews.Content: Our group had a meeting at the location in November and I have to say all things most things went off without a hitch. Food and breaks were yummy and we were able to centrally locate our smaller meeting rooms for attendees. The hotel room itself was very spacious and comfortable and I had a great view of michigan ave and the Wrigley Building. Each floor has a different theme and the venue itself is very historic, so if you are looking for something more modern or boutique-style this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelhg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental while in town for business. It offers a great location right on the Magnificient Mile. Room: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was clean and welcoming with a nice view. It had a desk and sitting area in addition to a quiet comfortable bed. Water and a few free snacks were provided free of charge (fruit, which is a nice healthy change of pace). A daily paper and robe was also provided. There is gym within the hotel complex that requires an extra fee. It offers a few elipticals as well as treadmills and has towel service. A Starbucks is located right next door and a Walgreens across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Thing in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Bywalec
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in my time at few high end hotels and have learned that they often end up being either the Real Thing or a Pretender. One can dress up any modern building with faux wainscoting, faux marble, stone statues, and arches but when you touch these ornaments they are hollow (both literally and figuratively) lightweight and somehow out of place. Some hotel chains adopt this "continental / historic look to justify extortive rates: take the Ritz Carlton in Berlin. I have stayed in this hotel near Potsdamer Platz literally in the first week of its existence. I was struck by its futile attempt to look like a Ritz Carlton should look, say in Montreal. Don't get me wrong, I am weary of some true classics, read: pathetic maintenance failures in bad need of renovation. And then is the Intercontinental in Chicago. This hotel is the Real Thing of hotels. Everything feels genuine from the lobby up. The decor, though neutral is not sterile. A historic building in its own right abound in Moorish accents which feel authentic and real. A former athletic club, it boasts one of the largest and most beautiful hotel pools I have ever seen. Magnificent stair case and private reception rooms, attract weddings and special occasions. Self guided audio tours are available if you like to dig deeper into its history and architecture of this magnificent hotel. At the entrance, the same doorman as last year will greet you at the entrance and make a credible attempt at remembering you from your previous visit. The reception and the check in process are friendly and without a hassle. The rooms are clean and bedbug free (courtesy of a bug sniffing pooch on duty patrolling each room at least once a week. The Westin may have their "heavenly bed" but the sleep essentials are every bit as good at this hotel. Clean, high count cotton sheets may not be Frette, but are pressed to perfection, nearly like at the Park Lane Interconti in London. Stay at the Historic Tower to experience the boutique feeling with only 10-12 rooms per floor, at the top. Excellent housekeeping by friendly and helpful staff, add to the classy experience this has been for us. We liked this hotel a lot and will stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: This hotel clearly has its "hotwire" rooms, but even those are quite nice - small, maybe in need of a little updating, but still elegant, well appointed and tasteful. A welcome oasis for a tired business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “High end hotel right in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: NoQuit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. My wife and I spent our anniversary night here, t is right in downtown Chicago and there are lots of places to go nearby during day and night. The staff is very knowledgeable and the concierge desk knows just the right places for you to go. It is a high end hotel so nothing is free which is a change from the usual hotels I stay at but the prices weren't bad. The rooms are older looking but it is an old hotel and the decor and comfort make up for it. Great place to stay when shopping or enjoying the nightlife in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Chicago in December, 2009, and loved it! The employees were very helpful and courteous. The location is ideal. We were able to walk around Michigan Avenue and shop, walk to Navy Pier and also to Watertower Place. The lobby was very busy with people, which made it all the more festive for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rucrazy222
Reviews.Content: Booked online at last minute and got a good rate on airfare/hotel package. Girls trip to Chicago to do a little shopping. Stayed in historic part of hotel, since other "trip advisors" recommended this part, since it was newly renovated. Loved hotel. Very nice. Asked for refrigerator, and delivered promptly. Walked to grocery down street (Dominick's) and bought cheese, crackers, and wine to snack on. Grocery is delightful. Hotel w/in walking distance of Navy Pier, the Mile, Wacker Street, etc. Couldn't be better location. Starbucks attached to hotel. Can't wait to go back! Pool area absolutely gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special otherwise”
Reviews.Author: sydneyinevanston
Reviews.Content: This is a standard hotel, maybe a little nicer than a Hilton or a Westin. The location is great but because this is an upscale hotel, they charge you for everything extra. There are hotels nearby that are cheaper that include amenities such as wireless internet, coffee in room, etc. for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but charged for packaged coffee”
Reviews.Author: LeePlace
Reviews.Content: We booked via hot-wire and got a great rate but had some issues with our stay. The TV cables were not all connected so I fiddled with them before it worked. We had a silver fish in the bathroom that we had to kill. The tub faucet wouldn't turn far enough to make the water hot just lukewarm so had a shower in the evening instead. Lastly we were shocked to be charged $9.10 per day for a beverage charge that turned out to be the packaged coffee next to the drip coffee maker that we had to put on the floor to plug in. If we knew there was a charge (which is a first for me in a 4.5 star hotel according to hot wire's website) I would have skipped the paper cups with no creamer and bought Starbucks in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay- Much Better than First”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental a few years ago and had were disappointed with our room. Last weekend we stayed again and had a wonderful room. We realized that there are 2 towers to this hotel- the rooms in one tower are updated and very comfortable, the rooms in the other are small and in need of updating. Both times we booked through Priceline, I don't think whether or not your book on a discount website determines your tower. Our last room- the bed was very comfortable, great bathroom and very comfortable room. We did not have any kind of view, but being right on MI Ave, who needs one? The hotel itself is GORGEOUS. The hotel bar was nice with great service. Our favorite part of our experience was the wine, cheese, and chocolate bar attached to the hotel. Very fun place with great wine. They sell discounted bottles/glasses when you take up to room.. Will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location right on Mag Mile!”
Reviews.Author: NOLATiger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated out 8th anniversary in the second city, and we chose the InterContinental Hotel as our home base. Wow! What a space. We had a lovely junior suite in a corner room overlooking the Mag Mile. It was very quiet. I would ask for it if you can get it! It came with an unexpected setee where we could relax, and the huge mirror on the opposing wall came in quite handy when getting dressed. Everything you could want was within a few blocks. Staff was very accommodating. There is a Starbucks in the lobby if you need a morning cup of joe and a few options for on-site dinner and drinks. My only dissappointment was the pool. We had hoped to take a nice relaxing swim, but it was sanctioned off for lap swimming only. I suppose it's meant to be used for exercise and not leisure. Wish I would have known in advance. Shame too. The area is breathtaking! Overall, a wonderful stay in a modern yet historic property.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: I have read the hot and cold reviews posted here and unfortunately my experience was disappointing. I travel to Chicago often on business and made my reservations through a discount hotel site, this seems to be where your experience will take its course. It appears if you book directly through the hotel your room will be located in the Historic Tower (Nice) and if you book through a discount hotel site your room will be located in the North Tower (Old). When checking in I was given a room in the North Tower with two double beds and was told if I wanted to upgrade at an additional cost I could have a room with a King bed like I requested. I find it very hard to believe a hotel of this size has sold out all its King bed rooms in the middle of the week. Since I was staying only 3 nights I declined the offer and headed to my room on the 23rd floor. The view over Michigan Avenue was beautiful but the room was below average. The room was so small you could not set up the luggage rack and walk around it. The drapes were frayed and were difficult to open or close. There were stains and cigarette burns on the carpets even though it was a non-smoking room. The bath was a disgrace and looked like a two year old caulked the shower. There was a small fridge in the room stuffed with drinks and a basket on top filled with snacks. The prices for these items were outrageous. Please note, there is a full service Dominick's Grocery store two blocks East of the hotel on Grand. Wireless internet service suitable for business is $17.95 for 24 hours, parking is $52.00 a night. The location is awesome. The Red Line (Subway) stops at Grand and the hotel is a three block walk East on Grand, take the stairs up to Michigan Avenue and you are there. The staff was pleasant but Will the doorman Rocks! It appears your stay here will depend greatly on which Tower your room is located in.

Reviews.Title: “A++ FOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: markroy53
Reviews.Content: i made my reservations for the intercontinental using expedia. when i got there to checkin there was reservation. after calling expedia the reservation was confirmed, and for having to wait for almost an hour the hotel upgraded my room and gave me fee breakfast vouchers for the three days that i was there. the front desk staff and manager were courteous and attentive. the hotel itself is wonderful, beautiful and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average on Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: kpowell05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental with some friends for a long weekend in Chicago. For a hotel with such a nice reputation my stay was only average. We had to call room service to bring us bath necessities twice, our power went out with the hairdryer running, and while it was pouring rain outside the hotel had no umbrellas for guests. While the staff was helpful they were not overly friendly or hospitable. I would recommend this hotel to a friend because the location is fantastic, but when visiting next time will most likely look to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor reviewers got it right again”
Reviews.Author: carrotsarered
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by lots of the reviewers on this site and we wanted a place to stay for one night in downtown Chicago after flying in from Manchester UK. The bedroom in the historic tower ( as recommended) was lovely - very quiet and the bed was wonderful. Maybe we UK people are easily impressed but I didn't find the room too small at all. A real bonus was the lovely pool and the amazing history to the whole place - I have never swum in a pool with stained glass windwos before. Not to be missed!! Dinner in the hotel was very good - breakfast was great with lots of fresh fruit which we love. One of the best hotels we have stayed in and we have been in quite a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay here”
Reviews.Author: blktulsa
Reviews.Content: Growing up in Chicago I would ride north on Michigan Avenue and think....someday just someday ....maybe I will get to stay at the Intercontinental. Imagine my delight when I booked a stay for a business trip in August 2010. Room was nice; expectedly small, but seriously who cares? Couple of nicks here and there on chair, but nothing that ruined my stay. Physical plant was old, but in good shape. Great atmosphere in lobby at bar etc. My one gripe was that the cups in the bathroom were PLASTIC.....as in Motel 6 plastic wrapped drinking glasses. Um hello....this is the FREAKING INTERCONTINENTAL. When I asked the bellman about it, he shrugged as if he'd had to answer the question a million times and didn't have a pat answer. Here's a thought......if I were in charge of guest relations/pr at the hotel my quick stock answer would be....."plastic cups are the cleanest we can provide our guests in light of the upcoming flu season etc".....don't leave your bell staff hanging without a good answer.....I would have thought...."hmmmm......pretty good answer" and not " ewww...plastic at the hotel of my childhood dreams?" Staff is topnotch and personable; esp the outdoor bellman....I am sorry I have forgotten his name; he was stellar...remembered my name after first day etc..... Great stay; no complaints ( just observation ; ) would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic in every say!”
Reviews.Author: spankyup
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Intercontinental of Chicago to any and all who want an extraordinary stay in Chicago. The staff is very courteous and attentive, history and architecture of the building fascinating, and the views unparalleled. J. Blanchard

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: JoAnne763
Reviews.Content: Room was great. Loved the bedding and the robes. We were well acommodated with lots of service. 1st time visitors to Chicago, the Concierge was very helpful with pointing out best place for breakfast and how to get about town on the rail and supplied us with umbellas for the one rainy day. One downside is we being smokers opted for the smokers floor. Just getting off the elevator was like walking into a bar. There was a air purifier right as you stepped out of the elevator which ran 24 hrs a day but in no way could it hold up to the smoke odor. Couldnt' really smell smoke in our room but the common area in the hall was awful. That alone will make me never to get a smokers room again. I'll go outside. The pool closes very early compared to most hotels I have stayed at so if you are sight seeing all day and want to take a quick dip at the end of the day to relax, you don't have alot of time to do so. I do have to say though, the pool area is gorgeous! Looking forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel in Downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: L&M_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Intercontinental is a beautiful old historic hotel with a newer annex. Very comfortable rooms, tastefully decorated and great bedding. Good choice of pillows. For anyone requiring a central location, right on North Michigan Avenue, close by to higher level shops and restaurants, this is a great choice. Now, we'll let you in on a little secret! We only paid $370 US for 3 nights thanks to Hotwire! Peanuts for the quality and location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Secret_Traveler101
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is located right on Michigan Avenue. Perfect for shopping. It is sooo close to everything! 3 miles from the aqurium, 5 miles from the Art Institute. We did a lot of walking that weekend. By the time we got home all our legs were so tired. I havn't exercised like that in a long time. The service was great. Any time you would call the front desk for anything they would be so acomidating, and get it to you in 15 min. from when you called. The sevice was spectacular, especially for the size of this hotel. The pool was amazing. Olympic size, and it looked like the room was decerated in a 1920's theme. Loved it. The room was perfect. Just the right size for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not that great”
Reviews.Author: jt1120
Reviews.Content: I first have to commend the staff of the HI. Very professional, very cordial, always very attentive. That and the location, it's a hard place to beat. That's all the good I have to say. Let's start with the $53/night valent charge. What? You've GOT to be kidding. Nope. I could have parked my car one block down in the public lot for $12. Sorry, I know it's a big city and all, but $53? That's way too much. Especially since I was a guest staying there. Then there was the mangled computer USB port built into the desk in the room. It literally was hanging out by the wires You mean that housekeeping didn't see it the last time they cleaned the room and contacted maintenance to fix it? That's bad. Fortunately, I didn't use it so I didn't care. Finally, the next morning, I turned the TV on to find that the audio worked but there was no picture. I wasn't going to be there for much more than an hour, so I didn't bother calling the front desk. All in all, for the money, I could have stayed at the Embassy, the Double Tree or the Marriott for about the same price in the same location. Sorry, HI, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: e26
Reviews.Content: Literally just got back home after spending Labor Day wknd in Chicago. I went with my mother and wanted to stay somewhere central so I Pricelined a 4-star hotel within the Magnificent Mile area and lucked out with Intercontinental for $90/nite! The location is extremely perfect. We took a cab from the airport ($42, incl. tip) and we got into the city pretty quick (30 minutes, slight traffic). There is a bus right in front as well and the train is close by too. It's about a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier and the same to Millenium Park. Very easy to get around the bus as well (we bought a CTA 3 day unlimited bus pass for $14). As for service, it was wonderful! The staff couldn't be more nice, unpretentious, or helpful. Check in was smooth. The room we got was on the 18th floor and was very nice. We had two double beds, and a flat screen TV. There is a safe hidden away in the clothing drawers (didn't know til we left, I thought it would be in the closet). The room was very clean, spacious for just the two of us, and yes the drainage was a bit slow but not a big deal. They had the usual bath amenities, but also body wash! I was ecstatic, b/c I prefer body wash over soap. Yes, the little things make me happy. The pool is FANTASTIC. It is the most beautiful hotel pool I've seen. It's very long (maybe 75 ft?) and wide and at the deep end is 10 ft. I was able to squeeze in a swim for two mornings and on one day had the pool all to myself! I didn't really check out the gym but it looked pretty standard. All in all, great service, great location (with a Starbucks next door), and great clean rooms and pool. Would totally stay here again and would definitely check out other Intercontinentals in the future. I think of all the hotels on the Michigan Ave strip this is the best central one (most were just off the avenue).

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mimi0329
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to take advantage of all Chicago has to offer. The amenities of the hotel are also a bonus - Starbucks right off the lobby, gorgeous swimming pool, bar, and decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: BRYANo75
Reviews.Content: Our very comfortable room was perfect for a two-night, three-day stay, and we had a nice view from our 22nd floor window. Bell staff were friendly and informative without being over-eager. The pool area is a charming look at old-time athletic club splendor. Wish the workout rooms had been open past 10:00 p.m., and the bar is sort of ho-hum, but overall, we would be glad to return. Great access to the city venues we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with room”
Reviews.Author: Gavitar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but what a letdown after the Intercontinental O'Hare. Hotel was at full summer occupancy with tourists, weddings and conventions. Very nice concierge greeter, front desk was mediocre. The lines aren't well defined (not sure if you line up by associate or single line) and I ended up waiting doubly long just to checkout. Liked the lobby buzz, but long waits for the elevator in the morning and evening. The room needed upgrading - bed wasn't firm, drains were slow, shower pressure was almost nil in the morning, and carpets were vacuumed but didn't feel clean. Worst: thin walls, could hear crying baby and conversation next door. Better to stay at the Historic Tower, which only has less rooms per floor and less noise, if you can get it. Unlikely to return, but I would like to try Eno the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “For the money....”
Reviews.Author: INtraveler2010
Reviews.Content: stay somewhere else. I'm not sure if it's a function of location, but when I splurge for a hotel, I expect more.... Small room, with 2 double beds- no kings available unless we want to upgrade for another 50 bucks a night.... WHAT???? No free internet service???? Again, WHAT??? Not even at the connected Starbucks, because of the hotel policy.... Deliriously happy with the location, but exceedingly disappointed in the hotel itself. I won't go back. We walked to and from Navy Pier and took the free trolly some. It was a bit of a hike, but a great walk. The staff was friendly enough, and the daytime concierge was wonderful for directions and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in chicago. Rude. Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: famdoc703
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 days and it was the worst experience of our lives with regards to hotel accommodation. The initial rooms had an old musky odor, not to mention leaking commodes and broken A/C's (both rooms!). One of the rooms had a wet floor where our 1 yr old son's crib was placed. The hotel couldn't change rooms for the first night b/c they were 'sold out', so they placed us in suites the 2nd night - or what they call suites. These rooms were arguably worse than the first. Again, A/c in one suite wasnt working, not to mention that one couple in each room had to suffice for sofa-beds (better off sleeping on the floor). The hotel states they would comp us the valet charges for both nights and gave us breakfast for 6 for one day (a fraction of what the cost of the stay was). In the end, they flat out lied, because they charged for both nights valet parking despite my placing a hold on my c/c. Needless to say, we'll dispute those charges. Additionally, they broke our new samsonite bag, for which we filled out forms, but they made no actions. I doubt the hotel will pursue this any further. The 2nd night they placed a fridge in our room for our child formula and milk, the next morning we open the fridge and its not working!!. We called about this and no one ever came to attend, and when we explained this to the manager, she simply looked dumbfounded and kept saying 'sorry' like an incompetent fool. I truly believe the ICH hotels which includes holiday inn, ITC, Crowne and other suboptimal hotels is the worst bunch of accommodations. I would not waste money on these places. ONe is better of paying double, even triple rate for a peaceful experience and one worthy of money hard earned. In major cities, one is more likely to get ripped off, especially because that is the modus operandi of the demographic that own and manage the business in metro areas. Be careful where you allocate your funds and fight for your right to get what you pay for. We usually stay are 'proper' establishments like the Four Season and Ritz Carlton; however, because of the size of our group we opted to more economical. For those who cant afford, places like 4 season and Ritz, here are suggestions of awesome hotels that are good deals : Hyatt, Swissotel, Omni, The James. These are FANTASTIC!! You will pay same or less that intercontinental which in my opinion isnt worth a dime. Its absolutely a sh*thole.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to swim”
Reviews.Author: cc1231
Reviews.Content: Great location and this hotel has the best indoor swimming pool in Chicago....big and does not smell of chemicals.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haley1canadaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of August. We had a mixture of teenagers and a four year old. The hotel is in a perfect location on Michigan Avenue. Lots of shops for the teens and Disney store for the four year old. The staff were awesome. This was our first trip to Chicago and our stay was limited to two days. The Concierge was very helpful in planning our itinerary and coordinating transportation. We will definitely return and stay at the Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “incredible from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: You're in for a special treat at the intercontinental chicago from the moment you arrive in their three story lobby, enjoy the ornate public spaces and your choice of contemporary or historic tower. The pool is magnificent and indoors (year around fun) and the breakfasts were to die for...especially the eggs benedict. We had a blast on our floor and didn't even annoy the neighbors (we had the entire floor). it's located right at the tribune tower, so easy walking north to shops (although nordstrom is just opposite the hotel) and south to the park and art museum. i continue to come back to this hotel because of the incredible service.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2011Bruins
Reviews.Content: I Hotwired this hotel and got a very good rate... I love IH beds, they're always a highlight. Within walking distance to great restaurants and most of the major sites in the city... the room was a bit dusty when I arrived, as if they reserved it for occasional travelers... otherwise it was a small but comfy king-size bed set-up. There was nice little sofa seater against the window-side wall that worked well with the tightness of the room. Pros: the bed, had a fun lobby/bar scene with a great wine/cheese place attached to the hotel lobby too, A/C was good, HD flat screen TVs, and a Starbucks in the lobby too. Cons: bathroom was dated and seemed out of place compared to the rest of the room. No complaints though... for the price, it was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay hotel, expected more.”
Reviews.Author: jballtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December, a few weeks shy of Christmas. The location was so-so, it is in the middle of lots of shopping, but farther away from Macy's, eateries, and some of the main shopping. The hotel is an older hotel, with not much updates. The wine bar looked fabulous, but being pregnant on our trip I was not able to enjoy! The Starbucks was a nice touch though. I think the feel was just that it was an older hotel that could use some upgrades. Ther service was so-so, and everything just felt okay. I will do more research and stay at a newer, more updated hotel, a little closer to the train station and the main "down town" area next time. Overall not a terrible place to stay by any means though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service and room, amazing location and historic spaces”
Reviews.Author: etherealpr
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was small and dark with limited view. The counter clerk talked us into $50 upgrade - this provided a minimally larger room with a single window (but great view), and little in the way of further amenities. For a 4 1/2 star hotel, we were surprised to find only disposable plastic cups, an information binder with no pages, and only one chair for a 2-person room. Retrieving our car from valet parking took a long time, despite a 15-minute advance call and small number of waiting car owners. With that said, the ballrooms, pool, and public spaces are spectacular. The hotel management really needs to improve their overall service level and in-room amenities to match their incredible location and remaining historic elements.

Reviews.Title: “Oh...That will be extra”
Reviews.Author: zwischen
Reviews.Content: Would you like to have eating utensils sent up to your room? That's $4.21 Like to access the internet? $16.95/day Want to use the fitness center after hours?$12.50 And if $53/night for parking isn't annoying...maybe the 20 minute wait to check in will be or maybe the fact that your room won't be ready until 4. Hmmm One would hope annoyance would end there but no... when we realized we had left something in the room after checking out; we were told after waiting for 30 minutes that the room had been checked and it wasn't there. Called the next day and voila! they had it and would be happy to bill me UPS charges to send it to me. Grrrr.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LaChicaCanadiense
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental couldn't be better situated if it tried. With its front door right on the Magnificent Mile, you're steps from shopping, restaurants and major attractions. The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated and the staff are attentive and polite. The only drawbacks were the lack of fridge in the hotel room and the noisy air conditioning (which we had to have on otherwise it would have been too hot). We had a very pleasant stay and I would definitely stay here next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bedub247
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "historic" part, which got us a rather large and comfortable room. Hotel was reasonably quiet, very convienent, and the room was large, comfortable and clean. No complaints, would stay here again. We did not eat at the restaurant or use any of the other services.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with comfy beds, but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: deeman777
Reviews.Content: First off, we were very happy to get a good deal on this property via priceline(PL). It was around 120 per night. The better news is that the buzz on betterbidding was that were were targets to be upsold on their travel club which would upgrade us from the old part of the hotel to the newer part where the rooms would be bigger. Well, we just got into the new part without an upsell attempt. This was good. The location was fantastic for shopping. Check-in was pretty quick and efficient. Our room was small! When booking thru PL the hotel only has to provide one queen or king bed. Getting 2 beds is not guaranteed, but we ALWAYS luck out and this time was no exception. But the rooms were crowded and small. The bathroom was small and needed some upkeep in certain areas. We did not use the restaurant or bar but did use the concierge several times with good, helpful results. If I had paid $250-$350 for the room I would be upset, but I didn't. So, unless you get a deal via PL don't waste your dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: pkeafer
Reviews.Content: For those booking on Hotwire, this property is an excellent value and a wonderful location on the magnificent mile. For those paying full retail there may be better bets. My wife and I went to Chicago for 5 days for vacation and we could not have been more pleased for the money. The rooms were clean and the facilities were excellent. Starbucks is attached to the lobby of the hotel and the Michigan Ave bridge (which leads into the loop) is only a block or two south. On the down side, Wi-fi and access to the fitness center are extra and expensive (we didn't use them).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: BucketAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental July 20-21, 2010. This was our best hotel stay ever! I had originally reserved a standard room for our first stay at this hotel, hoping for an upgrade to the historic tower, because of reviews that said the rooms were small. We arrived early, 1030, and were told our room wasn't available, but to wait, since we had been upgraded. Later, we learned we had been upgraded to a Suite on the 31st floor! We were on the SW corner, with a view of the Tribune Bldg, the Wrigley Bldg, the river, the Michigan Ave bridge, etc. The location could not have been any better, right on Michigan Ave near Grand. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The room - this is the best room I have ever had at any hotel anywhere. Great view, especially at night. There is a Starbucks on the lobby level. We didn't eat at the restaurants or use the bar/pool/exercise room, but everything else was perfect. We will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Melkol
Reviews.Content: In a word this hotel is 'disappointing'. The rooms are overpriced, everything is nickel and dimed and pricing is inconsistent. I got the impression the hotel overbooks quite often and moves guests to another property - a couple of groups in the lobby were discussing this. They tried to do this with me and after a few phone calls, a colossal waste of time after a long flight and calling in the duty manager the hotel managed to accommodate me. Surprisingly when advised they had placed me at another property I was also told that I would be responsible for the cab fares there!! The front desk was staffed by mostly 'trainee' people. While one can understand their lack of knowledge of hotel procedures and systems due to inexperience, the disdain for customer service can not and should not be tolerated. I hope management are addressing this issue. The room I finally received was small and tired looking. The desks and tables were dusty. There was no fridge nor microwave and the furniture looked worn. Internet was an additional $18 per day. Needless to say, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a View”
Reviews.Author: travelbug5285
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the InterContinental and although we loved the location -- right on the "Magnificent Mile" -- we were terribly disappointed with this hotel. Our biggest complaint was the size and height of the windows (see photo) in our room. You had to stand on a chair to look out! Who would ever think to ask a hotel, "Are there "regular" windows in the room" when booking? Also the air conditioning didn't work to our satisfaction despite 2 repair attempts, and the bathroom sink was clogged. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: dmoryan
Reviews.Content: The room was great, the staff was so accomodating and the breakfast was fresh and ample. Chicago is expensive to me but at least I think you get a decent value here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: daddi0
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights. Check in is slow. In fact, after reading reviews here and then standing in line for 5 minutes with only 1 front desk person on my second day, I raised hell with a bellman who went back and summoned 3 additional staff to take care of guests. Why these staff members dont summon help when they notice a line forming, I dont know! I watched this happen 3 or 4 times.The hotel really needs to fix this. I waited about 10 minutes to check in after a cross country flight. Once I quoted the reviews on this site to staff I did get good service and zero attitude about being assertive. The front desk is quite slow at this property, and I do not think guests should put up with it.We originally booked a budget rooom for a longer stay, and the room was smaill but OK. The carpet seemed worn, and the desk chair surprisingly had a couple of small rips in the vinyl covering. The room was clean, bed was nice, lots of pillows, etc. Then I read a review here that said it was worth upgrading by joining the ambassadors club, which gives you some perks, costs $200.00, and gets you an upgrade to a suite. Thank you, to that reviewer! What a marked change! The service became exceptional, and the suite was small but a good value for the total cost, which was about $30.00 more per night if you include the fee to join Ambassador club. Staff answers your phone calls very quickly.That being said, the ventilation was noisy, and we all found ourselves waking at night perspiring. We didnt want to open the windows because the hotel had posted a sign on the window advising not to open the window due to "abnormally high numbers of insects." We did see a spider spinning its web on the 20th story...after that my kids would not open the window. Was the noisy AC worse than other hotels? Maybe. This is an old property. The best part of this hotel is the location, and the pool, which is a gorgeous vintage 1930s indoor pool with all the victorian decor restored. It is really not set up for kids, though, being used as a lap pool by the management. There is even a sign posted that says "lap swimming only." The fitness center is very good, and a vaue at $17.00 for use during your stay-if you are staying more than 1 night since it costs about the same on a per day basis. The food is very good, but expensive for room service and the bar. Room service is excellent, BTW. The Zest restaurant is reasonable ande very good. Housekeeping was very good. Leave a couple of moderate tips and your maid will Take Care of your room. No scrimping, ask for extra coffee, she leaves 2 or 3 packets.Overall, I would stay here again. This is not the Ritz, but it is the next step down, and less expensive. The hotel has some panache, but I dont recommend the budget rooms due to the difference in service. Oh, and they do gouge for Internet, at 17-18 bucks per day. This small thing, in retrospect, is irritating, and not exclusive to this hotel. Why charge so much more than a motel 6? It doesnt cost the nice chains more for internent, why use this necessity to gouge guests? Listen up, management!

Reviews.Title: “explore this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: wow! How fun to explore this place - the pool was amazing, I expected to see Ester williams! Old, but Classy style...large ballroom smelled moldy, and almost spooky. The room was comfy, location perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jonescrew4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, clean, high end. Designed for the business traveler but was great for our family. We upgraded for $50 to the bigger room in the historic tower (smart move with two young kids). We got a rate of $96 a night via hotwire.com, i have heard anytime hotwire has a 5 star in downtown/Michigan ave area it will be the Inter Chicago or the Conrad, so you cant go wrong with that rate. Hotel location is great, service was outstanding. The only issue was the street noise, you can hear cars, sirens, people talking all throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: QSentry
Reviews.Content: While I was a bit concerned about recent reviews from fellow travelers when I made my reservation, I am so glad that I took a chance. The overall experience was nothing short of wonderful - from the time we checked in to the time we left. The front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful and offered us some great ideas for our stay in Chicago. The room was spacious, very clean, and extremely comfortable. Loved the robe and bathroom amenities. The swimming pool is incredible - they clearly do not make them this way anymore. While the use of the pool is included in your room rate, they charge extra for the use of other fitness equipment. The only other drawback is valet parking - $53.00 per night! I would recommend this hotel to anyone - and we will certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, but staff not”
Reviews.Author: InaF
