Reviews.Content: Chicago Intercontinental is an excellent hotel with the best location. However, the hotel would do much better in the hands of a different management and a better qualified staff. We tried both a suite and a standard room and they all offered the same quality. However, the staff treatment differed from how they treat you when staying in a suite and in a standard room. I was baffled by this and quite disappointed. They take more care to accommodate your needs when you are in a suite. The business centre was a mess. You have to swipe your payment card and if you donâ€™t have the right card, you are stuck. The centre was also very noisy and the lady at the desk only had time to speak to her friends on the phone and paid no attention when she was called upon. She did not seem to know what she was doing either. The funny thing was that I was denied entry to my own room, just because the reservation had been made by someone else. It was not until I reminded them that only a day ago my own credit card had paid the bill, that I was allowed in. The concierge desk is another disappointment. Apart from one person, whom I think is the head concierge, the others were just ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but....”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: Love the location, but i won't choose it again for the following reasons. Parking is $54/day there is cheaper parking on St. Claire St. at $36/day (no in and out priivaleges) when I arrived I asked for a room in the historic tower, mainly because the rooms are larger and with 2 kids, I needed it. I was told that it was fully booked with a group. Then another person told me that if I paid $50/night I could have it. I became annoyed by this and spoke with the manager. Either the room is available or it isn't. I know they are not obligated to give me the room, but clearly I was not given the truth. so management agreed that the front desk staff did not handle it properly and then agreed to move me two days later. Much better/larger room. However, when I called daily for bowls and spoons for the kids cereal, some days I was told there would be a fee and other days no fee. clearly they were making it up, perhaps annoyed that I was calling. I complained and was never charged. Housekeeping was inconsistant at best and the water coming from the tub came out brown at first. ( I think I was given an older room) the most annoying thing was the bellhop personel. I had to carry my own luggage and when I departed they stood there only offering to help after I got the larger one in my car. I'm a good tipper, so I;m not sure what that was about. I tip all staff including a daily tip to househeeping,(which they seem to really appreciate) this is really not good for a so called 4.5 star hotel. maybe minor in the grand sceme, but I expect more. the only delight was the concierge, always freindly and helpful. Internet is $15-19/day. my breakfast for 3 came to a whopping $65. small fridge provided but no microwave. I think this all happened because I booked the room on hotwire and got a great deal at $99/night. I think after seeing that, they decided not to upgrade my room, but didn't handle it right. Be warned if you book third party. You might be treated like a second class guest.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but I wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travel50S
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, and the age shows. Rooms are small, and a bit drab. Bathroom in my room was in urgent need of upgrade. Bed was comfortable, though, and the room was quiet, Hotel staff was polite, but not really interested in the guest. Even the concierge was disinterested. Check-in was irritatingly slow for the few number of people in line. Really, a hotel tjhat promises so much in its promotional material should deliver better. The hotel really didnt seem to be trying.

Reviews.Title: “You call that service..Really?”
Reviews.Author: AJPJPJM
Reviews.Content: Context: Weekend stay in a Suite with Wife and Toddler. Father's Day weekend and wife's birthday... I called the concierge a week in advance about events and settled on a VIP pass at the Shedd Aquarium. Concierge never returned my calls. Called the hotel manager who said they would set them aside. We check in on Friday. No passes. Their advice: Go to the ticket office at 9:00 am Saturday; stand in line; order tickets for Sunday to avoid the Sunday lines.... So, I should stand in line today to avoid a line tomorrow...?! Really? No turn down service. No acknowledgement of birthday. They forgot the storytime for our toddler. The pool is not at all child friendly. Room service never removed the dishes from the previous day. Dated decor. Had to pay for wireless... At $450 per night, we expected more; received less and left really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best one yet”
Reviews.Author: JMA-JHM
Reviews.Content: After many wonderful stays at the Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue, this one was the bestâ€¦ so, I decided to write a review. I paid $300/night in the Historic Tower with breakfast included for two. I checked on a travel site and found this was a very average rate for a downtown four-star hotel that weekend. In all our times at this hotel, I had never got the breakfast package, but it was only an extra $25 over the flexible rate (which entitled the two of us to the $30/pp breakfast buffet, including juices and coffeeâ€¦ quite a deal.) The Historic Tower King room was beautiful, as was the marble bath with separate tub and glass shower. Extremely comfortable bed. As I began to unpack I realized I forgot my travel fan (which I need sleep)â€¦ so I called down and a fan was brought to my door within 10 minutes. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant was excellent: all the standard fare along with an omelet chef, eggs benedict, piles of lox, and thinly sliced manchego. Fresh squeeze OJ and coffee included. Lnen tablecloths and beautiful service make it a very enjoyable experience. I will say the CD they were playing sounded like 50â€™s soap opera organ music, which just made us laugh. The thing I love about the Intercontinental is the service. The car valets are quick and friendly. A bellman was there to grab our six bags from the car immediately. Iâ€™ve read reviews the occasionally say the front desk staff was rude or â€œsnobbishâ€�â€¦ Having stayed at this hotel many times, I can only blame the guest. When I walk up to the front desk it is with a smile. I am always greeted warmly. Of course some staff members are more friendly than others. At the busiest times of day, the service is definitely more efficient, but if there is a line, I wanted a quick and efficient interactions. On this stay, we had just experienced a five hour drive because of a huge storm in the city. We were beat when we arrived at 5:30pm. There was no line at the front desk and the woman who checked us in could not have been more sweet and kind. One word of advice, when you approach the front desk of ANY hotel, be bright and friendlyâ€¦ youâ€™ll be surprised how well you are treated. In other reviews Iâ€™ve read complaints about the price of the valet parking. At $52 a night, it is not cheap. But when you arrive in the rain and there is a doorman standing there with an umbrella to walk you to the front door, it is pretty nice. When you need your car, you call down and it is brought to the lower level garage exit within minutes. That being said, if you are not going to use your car throughout your stay and you donâ€™t have a ton of baggage, go ahead and park at a nearby ramp, but be warned you will still pay $35/day with no in/out privileges. For me, itâ€™s worth it to valet. They also charge for internetâ€¦ I think it was $17 a day or so. That does seem a little steep, but again, it seems a lot of 4-star hotels are doing that. I have a feeling with more iPhones, people are using the service less and less. I really love the hotel. The pool is great. The fitness club has good equipment. The local is amazing. And the service has always been top-notch for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental for 4 days with my teen-aged son, and had a wonderful stay. Despite some negative reviews about the newer tower, our room as spacious, well appointed, with a great view. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and we especially enjoyed the comfortable beds. The location was perfect and we were able to geet around easily from the hotel. Victor was especially accommodating, and arranged to have a refrigerator delivered to the room at no charge. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room and service with superb location”
Reviews.Author: Kazoodog
Reviews.Content: We had a gorgeous room and view of the city in the historic tower. Staff were very kind to our children, 4 and 6. The pool is one of a kind. A real athletic swimming pool from a bygone era that is as beautiful as ever. We paid for the breakfast package and the buffet was exceptional and included made to order eggs, fresh fruit and more offerings than you can try. The location is unbeatable right on the Mag Mile. All the shopping and restaurants you could ever want are right outside the door. Our favorite reasonably priced Italian restaurant Volare, is directly behind the hotel on Grand. A straight shot up Illinois gets you to Navy Pier walking in about 15 minutes. Art Institute is also about 15 minutes down Michigan Ave. If you are adventuresome could probably walk all the way to Shedd Aquarium in about 30 minutes going through Millenium Park and Grant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good Historic Property on Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: iowaguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercontinental twice for weekend stays in the last 6 months, so I clearly like the hotel. In each case, though, I got a pretty good rate that made it attractive to me. Nice location on Michigan Avenue near the river, Wrigley Building, across from Nordstrom. Very interesting historical property with cool lobby---always buzzing with activity. Good bar. Had brunch at hotel once and thought it was just OK. Amazing indoor pool. Rooms are good, not great. I have only stayed in the newer wing. They are mostly updated, but still have a few 60's era remnants, like metal doors in bathrooms. All in all, its a very solid choice in Chicago, and should provide a very pleasant stay, but its probably not my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and the most comfy beds ever”
Reviews.Author: abarriosLarose_La
Reviews.Content: The locatiom was great, central to everything. We stayed in the historic tower which was newly redone. The rooms were nice, clean and the view was beautiful. We were on 11th floor though and heard sirens all night!! I have never heard so many sirens in my life than in Chicago. We also had our own thermostat in our room so it was nice and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Historic Rooms are large but the views are only fair...”
Reviews.Author: Tahoskibum
Reviews.Content: I stay in Chicago on business all the time. I just stayed at the Intercontinental in the Historic Wing. The room was very large, especially for a hotel room in the middle of a large city like Chicago. I went to several rooms because I was hoping to get a nice view. None of the available rooms had any views worth mentioning. All the rooms that they showed me looked at the builidngs directly across the street on Michagan Ave. They did show me one room that had a slight side view of the river but the windows were very low. I'm guessing that when they remodeled the hotel that they weren't allowed to change the exterior. Therefore to put in a room where they did, they were forced to keep the low windows. You actually had to bend over to look out at the river. Very strange! In any event, I ended up taking one of the large rooms without a view on Michagan Ave. The rooms (although they said that they were newly remodeled) were horribly and sparsely decorated. The furniture did not look new and was not at all attractive. It was almost a motel quality room. I also looked at rooms in the newer tower and their decoration was even worse, if possible!!! They did have a flat screen TV that was probably about 32" and was way out of proportion for the room. Considering the size of the room they should have had at least a 55" TV. It was hard to see because it was so far from the bed and I have great eyesight. The pro's were that the room was very quiet and the beds were comfortable. I did not hear neighbors which is a pet peeve! It has a great location. If you want a great room, great service and views then I would highly recommend the Sofitel over this hotel. It was just a very generic type of room, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the service”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here before and always been pleased with the location and the condition of the hotel. On this partiular trip I left my cell phone charger in the room. While it was a bit of a confusing situation to clarify its whereabouts I was impressed that after the manager told me they had located it and then lost it, they purchased me a new one and sent it to me overnight shipping. Few hotels would have bothered to do this. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: rxhappiness
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for my needs. While I attended a convention across the street, my wife was enjoying the shopping mecca along the Magnificent Mile. The array of restaurants nearby was enormous, and were fun to explore. Check it and check out were painless and swift. The room service was friendly and the amenities adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, GREAT location, but NOT a five-star hotel due to snooty check-in staff and pretty standard room”
Reviews.Author: Others_on_Lost
Reviews.Content: What we LOVED: central location if you're hanging out in downtown or Loop area. Walk to Millenium park, Chicago River architectural tours, deep dish pizza. SO convenient. I also liked our room on the 21st floor, with lake views. We DIDN'T appreciate: our snooty check-in clerk.

Reviews.Title: “What Started Horribly, Ended Better...”
Reviews.Author: Ot21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were quite excited to stay at the Intercontinental Hotel on Michigan Ave. because of the great location and generally good reviews. Our trip started with a glitch, as Delta lost our luggage (their ASA sub carrier is probably the worst airline in the US). Upon arriving at the front desk, the young girl behind the counter stammered a bit and then called for the manager, Urszula Khan. Ms Khan proceeded to tell us that a group had decided to stay another day and our PREPAID room was given to them. I was livid. She offered to place us in another hotel for one night and then return to the Intercontinental for the remaining two nights. Begrudgingly, I accepted. She provided taxi fare to the Hyatt. I understand the economics of her decision (1 vs. 40 room nights), but I was not a happy camper. Upon returning for the remaining two night at the Intercontinental, she could not have been nicer. She provided us a suite, comped some refreshments, sent fruit and an apology note, and refunded our prepayment. Although I was not happy, she was very accommodating and very professional. As to the hotel, room was OK (some very tired and patchwork wallpaper (Room 2668), but all in all good. I would have to say Ms. Khan salvaged what started horribly. Robert Large Florida

Reviews.Title: “upgrade scam, otherwise you end up in a small room”
Reviews.Author: Armeniancafe
Reviews.Content: we booked thru hotwire $119/night plus tax for 5 nights,, misleading 4.5 star hotel rating. i would rate it a 3. rooms in new building tiny, so had to accept an upgrade of $ 150 fee to join their club for a better room in old building, room size ok but still small.. maid said room was newly carpeted . maid service was excellent, elevators are spooky at times, we got stuck in one of the elevators in the new building, almost had a heart attack, reported it to front desk, nothing was done to ease the pain. everyone spoke english but with an accent, too many polish russian employes. had dinner in their restaurant 2nd floor, al hispanic employees, restaurant empty on a saturday night. excellent hotel location. Room Service prices outrages, cost us $ 15 for a bowl of soup, we had 2 bowls. overall experience ok but i would shop around for better rooms. definitely take the $29 double decker or trolley tour if never been to chicago before. also if you like soupons, eat at the SOUP BOX on chicago ave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the best location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's Michigan Ave location. It's perfectly situated for NM shopping, dining and Navy Pier. Upon arrival, we valeted the car. Check-in was good. I am a Priority Club platinum member and called a few days before to inquire what kind of upgrade I could get. The manager upgraded me to a larger Historic tower room. At the check-in desk, I asked for a further upgrade and was told about the Intercontinental Ambassador club. For the cost of $150, you get upgrades to next level room for one year, fruit plate and water, 4 PM checkout, applies to worldwide properties. I decided to go for it. They upgraded me to a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, separate large sitting area and a Michigan Avenue and chicago River view. 27th floor in the Historic tower. It was wonderful. Did not hear any noise from street or from other rooms. We used the entire space. My 4 year old was able to lounge around wherever. If one person wanted to sleep, the other could watch tv in the sitting area. We each had our own bathroom. One night, after dinner, I entertained 4 friends in the sitting area. Nicely decorated in more traditional tones. I heard the new tower is more modern but rooms are much smaller. Service was spectacular. There is a "need it now" button on your phone. Every time I pressed it for a quick question or request, someone would answer the call within the first ring with a personalized greeting. Breakfast buffet in the Zest restaurant is fabulous. Everything you could imagine for breakfast and they are very accommodating to kids. there is a Walgreens across the street if you need to get anything, snacks, etc. Full service Starbucks in the lobby. Obviously for a 4.5 star hotel on Michigan Ave, things are going to be very pricey ($7ish including tax for can of Sprite from mini bar and $14.95/day for internet, $53 valet/night), but the service is top notch. You really will feel you are on a vacation if you stay here. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “no room to turn around”
Reviews.Author: blueberryhilldecor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental the weekend of April 23, celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. The hotel had a good location and we found the staff to be courteous. The room itself was dated, extremely small and looked like it was furnished with garage sale finds. The bathroom was very dated and only one person could get ready, it was the smallest hotel bathroom I have ever seen. The carpet was torn and dirty, it was like going back 50 years in time minus the oppulence. I would never recommend this hotel. The hallway always smelled like a horse stable, not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but we are disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: HHTn
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in room 2547 in the newer tower and wish we would have known to request a room in the historic tower. This room is very small; it is a tight fit for me and my husband and would be nearly unbearable if we had any other travelers with us. The bathroom is also very small and is awkwardly arranged. Our view is not at all appealing; we look out over several other Intercontintental hotel rooms (we are on a U-shaped section of the building) and do not see much at all of anything other than these other rooms (despite asking for a room with a nice view). We were really looking forward to our stay in Chicago and feel disappointed with our choice of hotels. The best aspect of this hotel is the location; however, I would rather walk a bit further to have a larger sized room and decent view.

Reviews.Title: “NIckel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: agdwsu
Reviews.Content: Let's start out with the $53 per day valet fee--this should have been our clue as to the rest of the trip. We waited in line to check in, with only one person to help a long line of travelers. Three other employees stood behind the desk but told us they were not available. While waiting, we were inundated with ads about the various upgrades we could purchase for $50-100 per night. There was only one ice machine for the hotel, and the maids came into my room while I was still in bed in the morning, despite the "Do Not Disturb" sign! As a business traveler, free internet would have been appreciated, but there was a fee for that as well (whether in the room or the business center). Business center fees for computer use were $7.50 per 15 minutes...and you better not need to print! To work out, you are also charged a fee of $8 per day. The hotel itself is nice and in a great location, but the service left a lot to be desired. If this trip had not been covered by my company, I would have checked out after the first night. Save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a great hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveller74
Reviews.Content: I travel worldwide non-stop and this has really turned out to be one of my favorite hotels. * Great Location - Right on Michigan Avenue * Great Property - Historic building, yet modern rooms, great gym and pool * Great Food - Breakfast buffet is one of the best I have had Most of all: * Great Service - I have stayed here at least five times and never had an issue. Also they do one thing other hotels don't seem to do well - they treat frequent travelers well. While I seem to be continually disappointed with other hotels I stay at, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very lavish and historic feel. Exercise room is worth the $.”
Reviews.Author: matt987321
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel for business, and originally disappointed that the exercise room was not included in the price of a room. Managed to get a deal at $17 for the stay (5 days) and used it every morning. It fills up quick after it officially opens at 6 - although you can get your room key coded to open up outside official hours if you go to the front desk. The pool looks world class - even though I didn't actually swim in it. I don't drink, but there is a nice bar in the lobby, and a unique wine, cheese and chocolate spot adjacent to that. They have a large variety of cheeses (and wines and chocolates) - I would definitely recommend hitting that up while there. The room was typical, nothing fancy, but I did find it very difficult to sleep - not sure whether it was the bed, or the dry air or something else. Definitely take a walk around some of the conference rooms and levels in the tower with the exercise room - they have a great historic feel to them and almost seem museum-like.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy my stay every year, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: susala627
Reviews.Content: It's really a great place to stay. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. Also the accommodations are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: silwest
Reviews.Content: Been going to the Intercontinental on Michigan ave for years. The hotel is in such a great location and they just seem to make it better every year. The service and hospitality are always perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in a Prime Location.......what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: KCBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: At the front desk, I was greeted with a smile and that was the beginning of a perfect stay. I have stayed at this hotel many times but I never fail to be impressed with the level of service and luxury of the rooms. The bedding is fabulous and the amenities are perfect. We were there for a convention in June and the meeting spaces are also incredible. The ceilings had murals and ........well.........it is just one of my favorite hotels in the U.S. Incredibly distinctive! I can walk to many of my favorite shops (including the Nordstrom which is just across the street) and many restaurants so that doesn't hurt the experience either. Must I go home?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and stay”
Reviews.Author: ChasingSparkles
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the InterContinental Chicago on March 19, 2010. 17th floor in the Historic Tower. Great view of the lake, river and skyline. Very comfortable bed. Huge bathroom... separate shower, bathtub. Beautiful pool. Nice bar. Loved discovering the "historic" parts of the hotel. Great location on Michigan Ave., close to everything. Staff was very helpful. Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay, And I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: nursecarmen
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be back to the InterContinental again for work, and the amazing front desk staff made my stay worth while. Do to a mix up, I've never been able to figure out if it was by an employee by my company or from InterContinental, I suspect it was my company, our reservations were made for two days later. They made everything wonderful, and we even got a nicer room than I was expecting. Love love love this hotel. Best beds and pillows on the planet, which were invaluable after 15 hour work days.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: lkb55
Reviews.Content: Great facility - excellent restaurant; clean, comfortable guest rooms; courteous & helpful staff; great location - convenient to the metro and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “excellent break for new year”
Reviews.Author: mike-cheshire-uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the IC chicago for 6 nights from 26th Dec after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We werent disappointed. We had 2 rooms opposite each other in the Historic tower. The rooms were spacious and very clean with good views towards the river and tribune building. We got a good rate on the rooms but did not have breakfast in the hotel as it was very expensive as was the Wifi at $17 per day. As the hotel is on the Magnificent mile there are plenty of place to eat including for breakfast. The starbucks in the lobby was a hit with the kids - very handy. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for an incredible experience.”
Reviews.Author: CKEggen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an evening in Chicago for Broadway theater and a night on the town. When we arrived, we were greeted cheerfully by the valet. You really can't say enough about that first impression ... Got us feeling great about our evening away. Thankfully this was just the beginning! When we checked in were were told, "Sir, we have taken the liberty of upgrading you to a suite with a seating area." I thought, hey this is nice! Attached are photos of our "suite". This would have better been described as an average sized condo. It was huge. It was plush and decorated beautifully. It had it's own hallway and two bathrooms that were as large as bedrooms. The room was very clean and felt like an amazing value for the price we paid. I felt like a million bucks for having scored such plush accommodations! Thank you for an incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: soxfun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at over 100 Hotels . 20 In the Beautifu city of chicago and the rest all over the US. I can Honestly say, I have NEVER stayed at a Hotel that has combined Beauty,Great rooms and WONDERFUL Guest service all at the same place! I have written 2 reviews in my life but felt i had to write this one. IF you are staying in Chicago, this is the place to stay. You will not regret one second of it.The people were ALL Great and very helpful. The Hotel is Historical yet classy and extremely CLEAN! You can do and get everything you wanty and it is close to almost everything Chicago has to offer. If you take the advice of anyone on this site, take this. Kevin and Jeanne Brown

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay on Michigan Ave - Stunning Hotel - a Standout”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: Valet Guys - experts, checkin- flawless - Room - rooms are wonderful, beds are perfect. You can get all this at other hotels. What puts the IC over the top is the pool. The pool is amazing. Photo's don't do it justice. And - for those who do more than swim - these guys have serious weight machines, Cardio stuff and a great locker room complete with a sauna and suit dyers. Staff is wonderful - location is great - - I stay for the pool. I love the pool

Reviews.Title: “Good but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Chefexpert
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be a special weekend in the city for my girlfriend and I. We don't always get to spend "romantic" time together, so I thought we would go to the city for the weekend. When we arrived we checked in with the Day Manager (yet it was like 11pm CST). He couldn't get us checked in right away because his computer kept freezing. Then he told me my card was declined. I gave him another and he said this is declined too. I said to him I know the limit on this card, and there are thousands on it, so try again. Sure enough it went through (good thing I wasn't trying to impress my girlfriend, or that would have been embarassing). Anyways he couldn't get the keys made, and didn't know what time there bar closed. Said he didn't have a king like we requested because they were doing preventative maintenance. We got a double instead, and to be honest for our size not the most comfortable. Anyways as we entered our room we found the security latch broken, and paint missing from where he the latch kept hitting the wall. In the bathroom you could see where they placed in the lights but cut too big of holes. Some furniture worn, and the tv remote didn't work. Overall we had a blast of a time on the city and the location you can't beat. It is right on Michigan ave. There is a Starbuck's inside, which was a nice addition. Overall it was a good stay. I just expected more for being at an InterContinental and paying those prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: This is a large, luxury hotel in one of the best locations in Chicago. The location, directly on MI Ave. just north of the river, is great. Shopping is so close. On a cold winter day, it isn't a hassle to walk to many MI Ave. stores. The staff is very accommodating and was gracious enough to upgrade me (complimentary) to a junior suite because my room was not ready at check-in time. The public areas are truly elegant. They have been restored very well and at times, I felt as though I was back in the 1920's! The suite was great! It was in the main building versus the historic tower. I had a nice view to the east and could see a small portion of Lake Michigan. The room was very clean and updated. Bathroom is small, but well appointed & clean. Bed was very comfortable & was had great linens. The fitness center & pool is outstanding. There is no hot tub or whirlpool, though. The only reason the value isn't 5/5 is that it is extra for internet and extra to use the business center. Very minor complaints, though.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: FarawayFamilyReunion
Reviews.Content: Nice space, right on the mag mile, around the corner from famous Joe's, short walk to attractions. Definitely worth the extra few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: MissAssertive
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a "girls weekend" arriving on Saturday for one night. I had booked two rooms with two beds each using my Priority Club points. There was a convention occurring when we checked in so they were unable to give me the room type I had booked but upgraded us to connecting corner rooms in the Historic Tower. Beautiful! The furniture, bedding, and linens were top notch and the views were amazing from both rooms. My two favorite magazines - Town & Country and Wine Spectator - were provided. The bathrooms had separate tubs and shower stalls. My only complaint is that the bathroom had very little counter space with the pedastal sink. With two girls in each bathroom, it gets a little crowded. We had a wine and cheese flight at Eno which was amazing. I'm not one for Spanish wine but the flight recommended by our server paired very well with the cheese course we chose. We had drinks later that night in The Bar which were delicious. You cannot beat the location of the Intercontinental for shopping! Coach, Nordstrom, and even the fabulous Oak Street is close by. Garrett's Popcorn is right around the corner too! All the staff, from the valets to the housekeepers, were polite and very professional. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby if the in-room coffee doesn't meet your tastes (it was quite good although Starbucks was a better second cup). I will definitely stay at the Intercontinental again, whether it is for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced extras”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler49
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and understand the pinches hotels feel in the economy, but I feel this hotel is over the top in fleecing its guests. $17.95 for internet access in 2010? $15 to use the exercise room? Aren't we already paying for these things by paying the premium of a "better" hotel? Forget a free newspaper. Aside from that, the hotel is nice if a little dowdy. Efforts at sprucing it up might be better if the painting they were doing on my floor did not leave spackle tracked everywhere on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs better maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Iseult23
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel at a great rate on Priceline for New Year's Eve. The location is perfect - smack dab in the middle of Michigan Avenue and a 6 block walk from Navy Pier. That couldn't be better. The room was well-appointed until you entered the bathroom. The sink cold water faucet would not turn off and leaked all over the vanity and floor. Front desk wanted to send someone up at midnight (on NYE? Are they kidding me?) By the time we left next day, the water was running like crazy. If housekeeping presumably cleans that room everyday then haven't they noticed this problem before. Also, the shower curtain was way too long for the tub and pooled inside the tub at lest 4 inches....not very sanitary, although it appeared clean! As always, the Intercont. beds are comfortable and there was a coffee maker in the bathroom and a mini-bar in the room (although our key didn't work). As for NYE, they only had 2 people working room service - quite chaotic and not prompt. I would stay there again but this place needs better management.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay; Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingattorney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in room 2056 in the new wing. We were staying to celebrate New Year's Eve. Our trip had been booked through a discount "name your own price" website. We arrived 4 hours before check in and were immediately checked in despite being so early. Our room, 2056 in the new tower was fantastic. A corner room with windows on the north and west sides of the room offered a great view of Lake Michigan as well as part of Navy Pier. The in rooom thermostat worked flawlessly. The bed was superb, very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size. There was a nice sized desk with plenty of outlets/jacks for business travelers. The location was amazing. Just steps from some of the best shopping/attractions of Michigan Avenue and a short walk to the Art Institute. We didn't use the pool but we did go see it and it was as impressive as shown in pictures. We were told that use of the pool was free. The gym was impressive but at $12.50 a day, that seemed a steep price. The lobby area of the hotel is small but very pleasant. The bellmen were extremely attentive and helpful. This was our first stay in downtown Chicago. We will likely try other hotels because we enjoy trying new places. However, we were delighted with our stay and had a wonderful New Year's Eve thanks in large part to the wonderful stay we had at the Hotel Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you care about service”
Reviews.Author: Lux88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental from 12/31-1/3. I booked this hotel on an online discount site and paid $96 dollars per night. This is a good rate, but this hotel was listed as a 4.5 star hotel. IT IS NOT! have stayed at beautiful 4 and 5 star hotels that don't nickel and dime you and have a real committment to service. At best this is a 3 star hotel with a good location. You have to pay for tooth paste, there are no q-tips, the robes are disgusting, there is wallpaper peeling off the walls, and don't get me started on the valet. For $53 a night, I had to go get my car in the garage and check in with the cashier. Also, they broke my driver side car door. Pay a liitle extra and stay somewhere better. You won't regret it. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: natbro
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Chicago for a couple of days during Christmas week, investigating potential neighborhoods for her this summer. We used Hotwire for our room. I emailed the hotel and requested two queen beds which they were kind enough to guarantee. It was an easy train trip from Midway to the Grand stop; then a short walk to the Intercontinental. It's located on Mich. Ave in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. We arrived at 10am and our room was ready for us. They upgraded us to an historic tower room on the 23rd floor. Very nice, big room with two large windows and two queen beds. The beds were quite far apart with a big night table between them that held two large lamps. There were upscale amenities as well as bathrobes. The bathroom was standard fare with a tub/shower combo. and plenty of good quality towels, as well as a 4 cup coffee maker and a hair dryer. Internet was for a fee. It is tricky when signing on --the higher priced option shows first at 17.95. Hit the down arrow next to it and the 14.95 option is visible. We paid because we needed internet access, but felt seriously ripped-off. If all you need is to visit airline websites for seat ressies and/or printing boarding passes there is free access in the lobby for that. There is a Starbucks just off the lobby. We did not try any of the hotel restaurants since there are so many outstanding choices in the area, but we did order room service breakfast our last morning. It arrived within the promised time frame and the table fit very easily in our large room. We ordered simply- fresh fruit, muesli, coffee, etc. Presentation and quality were good. We had a great time in a very nice hotel in a world-class city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MsZie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, came at same time as Michigan Ave Festival of Lights. There were gobs of people and access to hotel by foot through crowds only. Had intentions been to attend said festival it would have been a perfect location. But we were just looking for a quiet getaway to do some shopping, get some good eats and visit with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel! Lucky husband got to enjoy it while I was at a conference. A+++”
Reviews.Author: jmc_in_gap
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location, terrific staff, and clean, elegant rooms. We always stay here when we have to come to Chicago and it never disappoints. The swimming pool is gorgeous and the whole building is beautiful. The food at the restaurant was a mixed bag. They have a terrific breakfast buffet - many thanks for that. Unfortunately, the restaurant is very disappointing at lunch and dinner if you are seeking either vegetarian or healthy options. I can't figure out how professional CHEFS, who are supposed to be both creative and understand nutrition, don't get that vegetarians are gifts to them! Vegetarians are very cheap for you to feed but you can charge as much for us as you do for the more expensive meat eaters! Vegetarians and people who are concerned with their health want to eat protein, for instance, but there were no non-meat sources of protein on your menu. Why don't you get a few recipes with beans, for instance? Beans are CHEAP, plus theyPROVIDE PROTEIN as well as fiber and can be made into many delicious dishes that appeal to meat eaters, as well! You really miss the boat when it comes to offering at least ONE wholesome vegetarian meal that would also appeal to healthy eaters; lots of travelers are looking for healthy food that isn't soaked in grease - salads don't cut it, especially in winter. That said, the Intercontinental Chicago is a great hotel. Because I was on business travel and had very long days, I really wanted to eat in the hotel but since there was nothing healthy for me, we went to other restaurants near the hotel. WIth its central location, the hotel is near many restaurants that offer vegetarian/healthy options. One other quibble: the charges for Internet use were exorbitant. I work for the government and felt terrible about having to use this expensive service (they're my tax dollars, too), but I really needed internet access for work. I would suggest the hotel re-think its wireless policy. This must be a cash cow for them but at other Intercontinentals, there is no charge for wireless. (The AMAZING Intercontinental Montelucia Resort in Arizona, for instance, has free wireless.) Overall, a terrific hotel. Highly recommend. We paid for an additional night just so I could enjoy it, too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, with a few flaws . . .”
Reviews.Author: califanglophile
Reviews.Content: Because I received a very good rate from Travelzoo, I decided to upgrade to a room in the hotel's Historic Tower and--for the most part--was very pleased with my stay. I can't speak for the newer section of the hotel, but the historic portion is near-perfect. (If you stay at the Intercontinental, be sure to take the guided audio tour of the 1920s architecture; it is available from the concierge.) I found the staff exceptional; the room spacious, well-decorated and clean; and the location just about perfect. My friend and I came to Chicago to see an exhibit at the Art Institute; we were able to walk nearly everywhere that we wanted to go--despite temperatures reaching as low as 11 degrees. Whenever we needed a cab, the attentive doormen had one for us in an instant. The plusses: Location, location, location. My room must have had one of the finest views in Chicago--albeit through a rather small window. Located on the 12th floor, it was just opposite the Tribune Tower and offered nearby views of the Wrigley Building, the Michigan Avenue Bridge and the river. It doesn't get much better. Courteous, helpful staff Pleasant bar Good-quality toiletries Minusses (I hope the management will take note): The room's entry was poorly lighted; I had to walk quite a distance in very dim light to turn on adequate illumination. As another recent guest mentioned, the robes were awfully thin. My greatest complaint: no free wireless. I have stayed in both greater and lesser hotels where wireless connections are complimentary--in public areas, if not in the rooms themselves. To go to the trouble of carrying a laptop across the country, and then be expected to spend an additional $17.95/day to use it, is enough to give me second thoughts about a return stay. (I travel quite a bit and was suprised to find that even the business center charges $6.95 to use their computers.) Another small thing for hotels everywhere: please don't ask me to pay $6.95 for the bottle of water that you have so prominently displayed in my room. I highly doubt that there are many people willing to accept such an inflated price for such a negligible pleasure, so it can't be much of a money-maker for you. I suspect that looking at that over-priced bottle for the length of one's stay merely annoys the typical guest. Either offer it as a sign of hospitality or eliminate it altogether. That said, I did enjoy my stay and would probably stay at the Intercontinental again--reluctantly carrying my laptop across the street to the thoughtful bakery with the free hot spot. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: meicurn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I flew into Chicago for the weekend and stayed at the Intercontinental. The rooms were very clean and the beds were great. The decorations in the lobby for Christmas were beautiful. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city. Disappointing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in December, 2009 on an annual holiday trip to Chicago. On previous trips we have stayed at other properties, but we decided to give the InterContinental a try. We won't be going back. The hotel's location is great; very central. However, that's not a major advantage for this hotel, given that it is surrounded by several other hotels up and down Michigan Ave. and Wacker that offer an equally good location. The hotel's advantages stop there. While the historic tower looks beautiful, the vast majority of the hotel's rooms are in the "new" tower. Our room was in this tower, and it was very disappointing. It is simply not the type of room you expect to find at a "luxury" chain like InterContinental. I have stayed in nicer hotel rooms in many other hotels in Chicago that are in a lower price and star category. Let's start with the hallways: the hallways on our floor were lined with air purifiers from the Sharper Image. That is weird -- what luxury hotel has such musty floors that it has to plug in air purifiers up and down the hallway? The ugly pattern on the carpet in the hallways did nothing to cover up the many stains. The decor was also odd -- some classic elements of an old hotel, like gold accents, mixed with Southwestern elements and a few modern touches. Much of the decor was run-down: letters were peeling off of signs, wallpaper was peeling in corners, there were visible dings in the walls at every corner, etc. Our room was tiny, and while that's not entirely a surprise in urban hotels, it was furnished horribly for its small size. Huge, run down furnishings that ate up space in an already cramped room. The desk had plugs on the side; these had been pulled out of the desk and were hanging from it. The lighting was dark. To see the view of Chicago from the room, you had to first make your way through heavy draping on the windows, much of which was stained. The brown carpet was fitting of a college dorm room and was also stained. The walls were also thin -- we could hear the screaming baby in the room next to us for most of our stay. You can't blame a family for having a cranky baby; you can be annoyed that the walls of a hotel aren't thick enough to mute the sound. The bathroom was perhaps the worst. Thin robes. Threadbare towels. In the shower, the rub kept running when you turned on the shower head; this let the water build up in the tub so by the end of the shower you were sloshing around in a half-full tub. The bathroom was un-ventilated and also poorly lit. The only good thing to say about the bathroom is that the soap, shampoo, and lotion smelled nice. The service at the hotel did nothing to make up for the poor condition of the rooms and hallways. Check-in was slow; my Platinum status with Priority Club was not recognized at check-in and none of the benefits typically associated with that status were offered. The bell staff was awful. Upon our departure, we asked the bell staff to hold our bags. When we returned to pick the up, the gruff bellman took our tags, said "it will be 10 minutes," and resumed reading his newspaper. When the bags finally did come, the other bellman carelessly threw them into the trunk of the cab. The hotel also has the typical charges of a luxury property: the glass-and-a-half bottle of red wine in the mini bar was $24; internet access was $15/daily (for a VERY SLOW connection; the higher speed connection was even more expensive); parking a car overnight is over $50; the bottle of water in the bathroom was $7, etc. etc. While you can expect those things in a large urban hotel, they are annoying when the basics that are supposed to come with your room aren't done well. A charge that is unnecessary at this hotel, and not typically incurred at other properties, was the $12/day charge to use the gym. Overall, this place is just not very nice. There are so many better options in Chicago -- places with nicer rooms, better service, and an equally great location. Another down point: it's not an "oasis:" the lobby was always over-crowded with crabby families; the Starbucks off the lobby always had a huge line, etc. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Rooms, and Service!”
Reviews.Author: jjcoello
Reviews.Content: The staff and management were so helpful and pleasant during our stay. The rooms are smaller, but the decor, furniture, and bedding make up for the lack of space. They do charge for everything so if you are looking for any complementary extras this isn't the place. Who can beat the Michigain Avenue Location!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little defects and expenses”
Reviews.Author: skateref
Reviews.Content: After many years I returned. Obviously modernized rooms. Pool still like a movie set. But, over $20 dollars for one day of internet access? No daily paper? Plumbing is strange. Water flow surges and temperature surges. Valves turn in non-standard directions. Only ice machine in new building is on the 7th floor. Decor was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Serious warning - Massive credit card theft continues at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: jp1234044
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you want your credit card information sold across the country. 12 members of our business group who stayed at the Chicago Intercontinental had our credit card information stolen either by and Interncontinental Hotel Employee or through their computer system. The hotel will not even discuss the situation with our Executive Offices. There is no doubt the theft occured here - our group has proof. This is a recurring problem with this hotel - information provided by local police. Cards were reproduced down to the card specific pictures on the front of the cards and codes on the back. One employee was out $2200 from their bank account. Fraudulant activity began within 2 weeks of our group's stay at the hotel and have continued as recent as last Friday. The only time these cards were used were at the hotel upon check in. If we had not started to talk to each other after I discovered my fraudulant charges we would not have been able to determine without a doubt Intercontinental Chicago is responsible for this theft. It is a shame they refuse to even discuss the situation much less offer to provide us with some sort of reassureance that they are working to protect to help us recitify the problem. There is no doubt Intercontinental is at fault and they are not even working with our credit card companies. The cost to our group of 100 managers keeps mounting in fraudulant charges and time we have to spend to canceling our cards and dealing with the credit card companies. Three of our employees were on vacation when this was discovered. My credit card company is launching a complaint and investigation into Intercontinental. I did not talk to them directly but those that have said the staff is totally disrecptful, unprofessional, and rude. There were several problems with the hotel when our group checked in. The hotel itself has interesting history but the view is not worth the price of the room and the cost of having your credit card stolen. We were all looking forward to staying at a hotel that was suppose to be one of the top in Chicago. WRONG. The Marriott and Hilton are much nicer, professional and we have never had any problems with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: Farohway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for a short (week) winter holiday to ring in the new year.We enjoyed all aspects of our stay.The room was comfortable, well appointed and welcoming after a hard days shopping/sightseeing! If you happen to go to this hotel it can be hard to go beyond the hotels main street which is choc- a -block full of a shopping divas every whim! (Inc.Macys)If you go for new year-nothing beats the midnight fireworks extravaganza at Navy Pier-(its walking distance from the hotel)- come prepared for the winter chill though- when it gets cold in Chicago it gets REALLY cold.- blocks of ice puncuate the pavements like carerra marble teeth- at first its hard to ascertain exactly what they are- the masses of compact ice refuse to melt, and periodically you come accross signs warning you against the dangers of falling ice!(TRY DODGING THAT!) .We made a trip out to Aurora( remember Waynes World???)- well also a great retail shopping outlet- the train alone was a treat(do it its an eye opener) - the sales also happened to be on when we got there( double joy!).Needless to say we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel-I thought the location was super,rooms good,but really theres so much to see and do you will be enjoying yourself too much to give too much thought to room details!!The only thing which they could review for next New Years Eve is their early closure of the bar- we came back from Navy Pier on New Years Eve Night only to be told the bar was closed- yes - even to residents??(There is actually a-v.handy Starbucks in the lobby-I think it was even open!)There are p-l-e-n-t-y of excellent eatieries- check out the rooftop(you will see a conservatory type feature protrusion)-accross and to the rightfrom te hotel(can't recollect the name- excellent- we went there for an evening meal- it snowed- it was like hovering in a cloud(-oh if you are fond of a g n t their tonic water in bombay sapphire gin is toxic/explosive but ..flat- be warned). All good- hard to get everything done- went again at Easter with family(gd for children)- must sees- Shedd Acquarium(A1),Planetarium,Museum Natural History,Chicago Institute of Modern Art (full of pointillist studies), Sears Tower-excellent,Chicago Bulls(A+++++++++++==F-A-N-T-A-S-T-I-C), Chicago White Sox- bring blankets for same if you go in winter- I kid thee not- although you can avail of hot chocolate.River Tour- later in season- if th e notion takes you you can also prebook /view an Oprah show.Went to Musical- A1 2-so many things..so little time.. its a city to FEAST ON! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Another bright spot in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TeriLynn069
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the InterContinental during the May 2009 Society of Hospitalist Medicine Conference- the venue hotel was booked. I enjoyed my stay immensely. The staff was very attentive-- especially during the rainstorm which greeted me upon my arrival. They were there with umbrellas to keep me dry as the cab driver unloaded my luggage. My room had a problem with the thermostat, but the front desk was very receptive when I brought it to their attention. Despite the busy downtown activity, the staff gave excellent individual attention. I will return to the InterContinental whenever my travel plans lead me to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: eggburt
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but, the service was excellent, location was better than we imagined, and they were very flexible! We arrived in Chicago three and a half hours early and they were nice enough to let us check in early! Concierge was more than helpful with directions and food recommendations. I would love to go back! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Chicago Intercontinental is starting to feel like a luxurious second home”
Reviews.Author: WyomingGoGetter
Reviews.Content: Superb service and luxury but without any snobbish attitude. I stay here frequently and always feel well cared for. I am fortunate enough to travel all over the world and this place is my favorite for the understated luxury and comfort...and that POOL! It is simply fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Girl's Weekend with American Girl”
Reviews.Author: grammaone
Reviews.Content: We take a yearly "Girl's Weekend. There were eight of us ranging in ages from eight to eighty. I called the Intercontinental Hotel ahead to request ajoining rooms, two beds in each room and non-smoking. I mentioned that we were going to visit the American Girl Store as we have two girls with dolls. We arrived around noon and to our amazement, there were two hot pink star cookies with milk in each room! Waiting on the bed was a personal invitation to the girls to visit the store and a fold up bed for each one of the dolls as a complimentary gift to the girls. You can only imagine how excited the girls were. The hotel staff was great. The girls had a fun time in the pool then took their showers in the Athletic Club-they supplied everything from shampoo and conditioner to a blow dryer. One of the girls did not pack a toothbrush so we called the front desk and they sent up toothbrush and paste. We received "Red Carpet" treatment! We "Pricelined" this hotel and sometimes because of that you get inferior service. We did NOT! The staff was awesome and we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: palladium35
Reviews.Content: Well. I had thought that the InterContinental was an upscale chain, having stayed at the one in Hong Kong (formerly the Regent). I was mistaken. I stayed at this one for 2 days while attending a meeting and was very disappointed. The positives first: location, staff, lobby, food/drink. A Starbucks in the lobby. These were all fine if not better than fine. I suppose the $276/night was for these features. And then the negatives.... The room was just deplorable. The Crowne Plaza in Minneapolis I stayed at last month was far better. I was in the "nonhistoric" side of the hotel--the room was tiny and in need of serious renovation. The bathroom was small, dingy, with peeling wallpaper, cheap or worn fixtures, scratchy towels, and sink faucets that went in the wrong direction. The bed was fine, however, comfortable with good linens. The fee to use the hotel gym was another unpleasant little surprise. I don't even know where to begin with that one, as I have not encountered that problem before. At what is basically $300/night, it seems insulting to ask hotel guests to pay extra for that. I guess I was shocked at the discrepancy between the attention to the nice lobby area, public spaces/services, customer service (excellent at the front desk and at the curb), and the very poor conditions of the room. I understand that this is a big city and that the hotel is in a great location, but I felt like I had been deceived. There are plenty of hotels to choose from in Chicago. Next time, even if I have to spend a little more, I will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd58
Reviews.Content: Great location - Lots of ammenities Zest - Great restaurant - Staff (Frank & Louis) were great. Lisa at front desk was very accommodating Wish we had of known more about the historical tower. Would have booked a room there. Had a look at one room and was very impressed (More roomy) The room we had in the new section was small and requires refurbishing

Reviews.Title: “This hotel did not measure up to 4 star quality. Lacking in several areas.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPianolady
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, staff was polite but offered no information about the hotel. I was suppose to have a Magnificent Mile Suite and paid for this; however, I could only see a side street. Bathroom was very small. I stayed Wed.-Sun. and each day something was missing from my room. No shampoo, no washclothes, no glasses. Restaurant was great with good service. Customer service was lacking with many areas. The hotel is over priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Michgan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: gypsy33117
Reviews.Content: A great place to take a mini-vacation in downtown Chicago. Our corner room. an upgrade to the tower, was comfortable with windows overlooking the lake in one direction and the river in another....the large bathroom had a tub and separate shower. The best part was being able to step out the door onto Michgan Avenue and start our day of exploring. There were so many sights, restaurants, stores, etc. within walking distance that we felt we had an apartment in the city. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I plan on staying here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: angelalyns
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, kid friendly. The pool was hard to get to, but it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and excellent service...right in the center of the Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: NightWoman
Reviews.Content: A friend and I flew into Chicago for a "girls weekend away" and stayed at the InterContinental. We chose this hotel because it is right on North Michigan St. with all its shops (Nordstroms, Filene's Basement, The North Face, Nike, etc. etc. etc.) The hotel is very beautiful with an elegant lobby. You probably already know about the famous swimming pool. Our room had two comfortable queen beds, a desk, a recliner, very nice sized flat-screen television, in-room coffee maker (small) with coffee and tea, and terry bathrobes. No fridge or microwave. The window actually opened! Elevators were fast and never a long wait. The wonderful concierge provided exceptional service, directing us to a great Italian restaurant only blocks away (and getting us a reservation so we didn't have to wait for a table ... and there were LOTS of people waiting for tables) one night and a great Thai restaruant and Blues bar another night. He also helped us get reservations to the House of Blues Gospel Brunch on Sunday. Couldn't believe that the food was so affordable! We took the El from the airport to within 3 blocks of our hotel - for $2.25! Sure beats the cost of a taxi! We walked everywhere...including to the Chicago river for a boat tour highlighting the skyline's architecture, out to Navy Pier to the Stained Glass Museum, to the Chicago Institute of Art, and, of course, to the park to see the "bean" - Cloud Gate - sculpture and eat a real Chicago hot dog. Every evening we returned to a clean room with fresh complimentary toiletries for a rest before heading out to hear live music. We didn't have time to check out the hotel's own Wine and Chocolate bar (what a great combination!). The only "negative" I can think of regarding this hotel was that although we tried to "be green" by hanging up our towels to be used a 2nd day, as the placard in the marble-tiled bathroom suggested, the maids put fresh towels in every day.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a pool with old time charm, stay HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_angela
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, it was centerally located. The pool is what really sealed the deal for me. IT was really neat.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and underapologetic”
Reviews.Author: Bcereus
Reviews.Content: I went for a conference, and was booked, paid for and confirmed for late arrival. When I arrived exhausted after midnight, the hotel was overbooked. I was shipped off to a lesser hotel (20 minutes away but evidently owned by Intercontinental) for the night. Ultimately I got my room, an apology from the manager, and 1 free night (to be used in the future), but I was exhausted and never recovered from that first poor night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant stay”
Reviews.Author: fern23
Reviews.Content: I returned to Chicago for my anniversary with my wife. She wanted to have a night downtown and since I had stayed here for over a week early in April, 2009, I thought this would be the best since it is on Michigan Ave. She loved the hotel and the shopping and the food around the hotel. Go to Rush Street!! Amazing places to eat there. While this is an expensive hotel, it is worth doing this once a year. I would recommend this to anyone for a nice night on the town with endless possibilities around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: pizzaandpi
Reviews.Content: i would rate the hotel a five star.the room was great.it had the best bathroom i have ever seen.the location downtown was perfect.the only bad thing was the parking the car was $53. per day?they should hide that in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindmar
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Inter Continental with my spouse on a 3 day business trip. The valet parking was quick & efficient and check in was a breeze.The rooms were very quiet and comfortable , the HD tv was really spectacular,and the room service meals were quick,plentiful,and very well prepared. The location was wonderful for my wife who was able to shop to her hearts content on the magnificent mile. This was my first time at this hotel and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff were rude, unhelpful and lied”
Reviews.Author: ColleenFortWorth
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation for a conference there 9/21/09. Flight had an emergency landing in Memphis so I called the hotel to ask them to hold my reservation and that I would arrive the next morning. They pleasantly agreed and said, "We willl see you in the morning." When I arrived the next morning I was told they had given my reservation away. I was referred to a manager who told me in "good faith" (in a tone connotating I did not call) that they would waive the "no show" fee ($300 in this case). Having had very little sleep, I lost my patience, and raised my voice, asking them why a phone call to their hotel was not good enough. They allowed me to stay 1 night then I had to find my own reservation to another hotel (they claimed they were working on doing that all day). When I checked out the next morning they then tried to claim I did not call the hotel directly (though I have the cell phone records to prove it) and got home to discover on my credit card bill that they did not waive the no show fee like they had offered. I would have gladly paid for the night I missed... I did not ask them to waive the no show fee---they offered. They were trying to blame me and were not sorry, helpful or understanding that I had experienced a horrific flight in getting there. Rooms and service were better at the Marriott across the street for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: wrunyon
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Intercontinental Chicago last week. On checking in I was upgraded to a room in the original tower. The room was perfect, comfortable and quiet; internet connection fast and reliable; and concierge services top notch. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CheleMiami
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in June 6th, 2009 for the Honduras - US World Cup match. The hotel room was incredible and the bathrooms were great. Had a blast and I am looking forward to staying here again in October. Can't say enough about the location. Look forward to staying at the Historic Tower.

Reviews.Title: “like cockroaches?”
Reviews.Author: sg390
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but after killing cockroaches in my room 2308 yesterday morning I am obliged to make this information public..... Truly unforgivable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katelynsandon
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this property and it was wonderful. Next time I shop downtown Chicago, I will try to stay at this hotel. Great location, beautiful rooms, and the lounge was a lot of fun. The only thing I would change is the amount of staff on at the front desk for a Sunday check-out. There were only two individuals checking people out and the line was almost to the enterance of the property. I would have used the in-room check out screen via the television, but it was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get it...”
Reviews.Author: ben1233
Reviews.Content: Looks like there's a lot of positive reviews on this property, and I couldn't disagree more. Just to keep this short, upon checkin I had to wait while the person at the front desk answered a phone call before she would help me. This is such a huge no-no. My request to be put in the "historic" section of the hotel was not granted (and given this was winter in Chicago, I can't imagine that there wasn't at least some availibility). The room itself was decent but small, and the bathroom was a joke. The door was abnormally narrow, the sink was devoid of any surface to put simple toiletries on, and best yet - the flushing handle on the toilet reminded me of the kind that you kick with your foot in dirty public restrooms. Really, couldn't they have something a bit more civilized? To get ice I was required to make a trek several floors away as there was no machine on my floor. To make matters worse, the elevators were painfully slow and I believe one of the 4 elevators was out of service...the trip for ice literally took me 25 minutes. Would never stay here again no matter what the price. In fact when I book rooms via Hotwire, I actually try to stay *away* from the region and star rating that the InterContinental resides in....which is a shame because the Conrad across the street is in the same category and is light years better than this old, tired lady.

Reviews.Title: “Small room for high price.”
Reviews.Author: Gunterfri
Reviews.Content: A very small room in a nice bulding a good location. old fashion furniture. The only impressive thing is the lobby and the builduing. They charge for everything, U$ 18 for 1mb internet conection 24hs. For the same price go the the Conrad acrros the street or the wonderful Hard Rock Hotel. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: kamitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place for 2 nights and really loved it. we got a good deal on hotwire for it ( 350$ for 2 nights ) The location is great, in magnificent mile, walking distance to Navy Pier and lots of other cool places. When we arrived, the hotel lobby was crazy crowded and we had to wait in a long line to check in. But the staff were really friendly and they gave us a room on the 32 nd floor. It had a fantastic view to the lake . The room was really nice and well decorated. It was a bit small though. We didn't try any of the restaurants on site, so I cannot comment on them. But there was a starbucks in lobby level which was convenient. The only negative point of this hotel is the parking issue ( which is a natural problem in magnificent mile ) They charge 53 $ per night for the valet service. I found a close by parking with a lower rate and parked there. The whole crazy traffic and the stress of finding a parking was a bit of negative point for us in the begining. Otherwise this place is great and if you are looking for a pleasant stay , go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rchs20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It is an excellent location. There was a few minor issues. The hotel is clearly geared toward the convention and business crowd. There were charges for almost everything, although I did not incur any of these. Our room was a little small for the class of hotel, but not overwhelmingly small. Not a true complaint, but the elevators were very slow. My comparison was that we stayed in an equally aged hotel in a different city during our trip, and the Intercontinental's were significantly slower. That's it, no more little nit picks. The staff was excellent, the doormen being the highlight. The hotel bar was also very nice. The hotel was immaculately clean. I would definitely travel to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: skydiver1985
Reviews.Content: Did some wonderful shopping below hotel. It is located above the miracle mile river and is in a gorgeous location. Beware they do charge a lot of add on's for spa, working out, etc. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: crittenden
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 couples stayed at this hotel Labor Day weekend. It is beautiful and we couldn't have asked for a better location! We stayed in the Historic Tower and the rooms were a nice size and had a great view of the Mag Mile. The staff was great as well. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: AntonioAlphonse
Reviews.Content: The location is right above the river on the Magnificent Mile, but this hotel is for business travelers. They charge for internet, gym use, pool, everything, expecting guests to expense the charges. It is an immaculate, lovely hotel, with a comfortable bar and attentive staff. Just be forewarned about the nickel and diming, when there are great deals for nearby boutique hotels that better cater to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: BandonDunesMan
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Intercontinental Chicago has obviously been trained in the in and outs of customer service. The were very service oriented and eager to provide information to make our stay in Chicago the best it could be. The location of the hotel is unsurpassed. It is on the the Miracle Mile and within walking distance of great museums, parks, shopping and excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The historic tower at the Intercontinental Hotel Chicago was great!”
Reviews.Author: JaneenArkansas
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and beautifully decorated. We loved the view of Lake Michigan and of the Chicago Tribune tower. All the staff were very helpful, and the room was spotless. I complimented the housekeeper's service at the desk on our check out. The travertine in the large bathroom was exquisite. It was a business trip, but the hotel made us feel like we were on vacation. Thank you. Janeen

Reviews.Title: “Extra Charges is only thing keeping this from a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: HOSKI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and I love this hotel. It is so beautiful and in a great location. I visit Chicago yearly for a Leadership Summit and I stay here or the Embassy Suites depending on which is offered. First the bad, everything is extra here. Internet, fitness center and just about everything else. I never leave home without the laptop and work while I'm away but I did not purchase internet at the hotel. The headquarters hotel that the conference was at had free internet hot spots so I took my netbook there and worked between sessions and at the end of the day. I just can't see paying $12.95 a day when I'm only using it an hour or two. I did not get to tour the hotel this time even though I swore I would but I did check out the pool and it was beautiful. The security guard recommended that you go to the old section and start on the 8th floor and walk all the way down checking out each floor. Hopefully next year. This trip I did get to see rooms in both the old and new sections. My traveling partner was in the new section in room 1062. The room was small but beautiful and very clean. If they took the couch out it would feel like you had a lot more room. She was very happy with her room. I stayed in the historic section in room 2415. My room wasn't ready when we got there but we were early and they were very busy. It was ready about 1/2 hour after the promised time, about 4 pm. My room was large and had a very big bathroom with a separate shower. Again this hotel is very clean. Water was $6.95 a bottle and the mini bar was way overpriced even for a hotel. A stop at Walgreens fixed that. The bed was comfy and once I got to sleep I never woke up at night or heard any of the neighbors. The room was just plain wonderful. I had a king bed and there were 4 big fluffy pillows on the bed. My husband would have loved it. I need a firm pillow and always travel with my contour pillow. I had a semi-river view and it was pretty. There was a great old building across from my room that I had a view of and it was nice. Finally a hotel with good TV channels. I was so tired at the end of the day I couldn't even read so I enjoyed falling asleep to the TV. The person I traveled with this year kept me pretty busy and I got to see a little more of Chicago then I usually do. One item noted by myself and my friend was that even though we hung the towels up to reuse they replaced them. If you are not going to conserve water by letting the guests reuse towels then don't put the little cards in that say you will. Good selection of soap and shampoo and stuff. They offered both bar soap and bath gel. I hate when hotels cheap out and only offer bar soap. There is a blow drier there for those who like to know. I didn't use it so don't know how strong it is. There is also a coffee maker in the bathroom that makes the little pots of coffee. I did use this every morning before hitting Starbucks. All the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Starbucks was not crowded in the morning this trip as in the past so we had a nice coffee on our walk to the conference. All in all if you want to stay in a beautiful hotel in Chicago whose prices are pretty much par with the rest, stay here. My first choice is the Embassy Suites because of the free internet and breakfast which saves my travel budget but for beauty you can not compare to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: eibbore
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel. Fantastic location. Helpful and friendly staff. Beautiful swimming pool. Very nice room. I really liked this hotel, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great hotel, great view, great location, great exercise club!”
Reviews.Author: PsychDocRichmond
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in all ways. Extremely well-managed and maintained hotel. Superb room with view of Lake Michigan on two sides. Service was very strong, especially room service, housekeeping, and the concierge desk. All three were very responsive, flexible and pleasant. The hotel had everything you could want, a concierge desk that knows all of the good restaurants, a great bar and restaurant, a Starbucks, and exceptional location in an exceptional city. The recent renovation of the hotel has it in tip-top shape. And bring your sneakers and swimsuit when you visit. They have a great health club and beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence114
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed the stay at the hotel. The room had a clean decor, the hotel staff truely helpful. The hotel is very well located I could just walk to all attractions. Five star service in my experience. I will return...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: FergusMum
Reviews.Content: What can I say - great location and an amazing historic hotel and a bargain at $99 per night for a deluxe room. But a few negatives - concierge pretty unhelpful, staff in ENO - wine, cheese and chocolate tasting room completely stuck up!!
