Our room had no view at all just building opposite and when we enquired about a move told nothing available - can't quite believe that in a hotel with 792 rooms! Good points - lovely bathroom with great toiletries, pool is amazing, fast wi fi connection, charming helpful bellboys, location is awsome - just a step away from all the shops and restaurants in North Michigan Avenue area, and a short walk to the lake. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodations I've experienced in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaConnie
Reviews.Content: I had flown in that morning from San Diego, CA, and had an overnight stay booked at InterContinental on Michigan Ave. in ChiTown. I wanted to share a couple of days of fun with my Michigan friends and was very pleased at the willingness of the employees to accommodate our needs. Although our room was not readily available (even after 3:00 p.m.), the check-in staff offered to provide us with a few coupons for complimentary drinks at the hotel bar while we waited. I was especially pleased when offered free breakfast coupons when the staff didn't produce our held luggage in a timely fashion. Our room was spacious and the view of the City was superb. What was a very long tiring day could have been spoiled by the delays, but the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “the heart of the magnificent mile”
Reviews.Author: travellinmanfrommo
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location, friendly and attentive service, classy clientele, and great value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. booked via hotwire, upgraded to historic tower. Got a big room, with a nice view.Service was great. Valet parking was efficient, but you expect it for 53 doller/night. But the location was the best

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: jvanmalderen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful however, I booked a room for 3 and it was quite small. Not alot of customer service. Went to bar area and found the staff there very unfriendly. I would recommend this hotel if you just want to stay and not be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Worn, weak service, great location”
Reviews.Author: rpcvx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights under the American Girl Package and enjoyed the excellent location. The furniture was worn however, the veneer stripped off some of the pieces in the room, giving it a less-than-luxurious appeal. The promised doll bed never showed up - had to request it, and the milk and cookies delivered at 2pm and thus warm (milk) and stale (cookies), but they promptly replaced them at night when we returned to the room and noticed the issue. However during the two days there they never took away the old milk (2 carafes), glasses nor plates. Outside our room the floor was messy with remnants of someone else's room service for at least 24 hours. The beds were OK, nothing to get excited about as far as comfort is concerned. The duvet had some tears on it....not 4 star for sure. As for the hotel, it's really beautiful (we stayed in the historic wing which is lovely, the deluxe room truly large). We looked forward to the pool, as with the AG package it states to bring your swimsuit to enjoy the pool....but when we got there it was set up for lap swimming, there is a sign stating that it is for "lap swimming only" and a bit too deep for young children, and mine know how to swim. And it got crowded easily so young children who are in the pool tend to get overwhelmed by others there. Not child-friendly in the least and I wish the promo materials for the hotel would state that. And lastly, the street noise can be overwhelming if you're not used to it. The walls/windows are very thin - you can hear not only traffic, but bathroom and hallway noises very well. In short, for the money I'd try elsewhere - there are so many hotels in the same area. Next time we'll try elsewhere... And $27 buffet breakfast with stale bacon and tater tots?! I think not....(granted they had other things, but the stale bacon and tater tots put us over the edge).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandtravel2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend four amazing days at the InterContinental in Chicago. We booked it through a third party provider and expected to get the smaller room or one beside the ice machine. Before leaving home, I contacted the hotel directly and requested a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. I got an immediate response to my request and was also informed, to my delight, that we were booked into a room in the Historic Tower. When we arrived, we were provided with efficient, friendly service. The room was larger than I had expected and very clean. We read about the history of the hotel and later during our stay went on a tour of this historic building. It is absolutely amazing, if you are interested in older buildings staying in this hotel is an absolute MUST. It was like taking a step into the past. In addition, it was right on Michican Avenue, so we were in the heart of Chicago. We certainly reommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience Chicago in style!!! Sandra, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service made our Anniversary celebration memorable”
Reviews.Author: NewMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they provided us a memorable weekend. Everyone was very kind, helpful and went that extra mile to make our stay wonderful. Their little extra touches spoke volumes as to their care for their clients. Our room in the historic tower was very comfortable and the view was spectacular. We also ate at their restaurant, which was fabulous! We would highly recommend this hotel and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highwaydriver
Reviews.Content: Firstly there is a comment regarding this hotel from a guest that paid $100 through hotwire and thought they paid too much...If you think a $100 is too much to pay to stay on Michigan Avenue at the InterContinental then you are better off staying at a Best Western out at the airport, maybe that would suit your lifestyle. When you travel a lot you realize that what look for in hotel isnt when it was renovated, or how beautiful the hotel lobby is, it is the little things that make the difference: The bad: the Concierge (Clefs d'Or member) seamed indifferent when I asked for a map to the city simply putting it on the counter and then looking the other way. Dark skin gentleman - both keys. The first night I was there two concierge seamed occupied on the same guest and didnt have a moment to acknowledge that I was standing in line... finally I walked away. This was the only ill experience about my stay and really not a big deal. The Good:) the hotel is beautiful, clean and located minutes away from everything. The room was cleaned and the maid made the biggest impression on me by noting where i had left a drinking glass two nights in a row; instead of putting it back in the washroom she replaced the glass and left it where it was underneath a coster. All the housekeeping staff I ran into were freindly, made eye contact and greeted me with a smile. The restaurant, located on the second floor had great atmosphere and even though they seamed to have been short staffed, did an excellent job maintaning their service with one host, one server and two porters - always smiling and asking how everything is. The gym is great! the machines are new and well maintained. There was a $16 for the 5 dyas that I was there which is understandable if you want to maintain and replace the equipment as it wears out. The Front Desk was prompt and responsive - again always smiling. Great Hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Staff and Excellent Massage”
Reviews.Author: ohiobandit
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Pennisula and was worried about moving Hotels and was pleasantly surprised by how nice and clean the hotel was. In fact, has a starbucks attached and a very nice bar with comfy sitting areas to hang out in. We gathered at the bar several times and had great servers and gave great recommendations for dinner. We were there with 3 other couples who also had a great time! I would strongly recommmend this hotel to others. We stayed in the historic tower and it was convenient to the spa/fitness facility. Our room was a little small, due to the historic tower but our friends had bigger rooms! If you like historic - you will LOVE the historic tower and if not - they have bigger rooms too!

Reviews.Title: “Snobby rip-off. Chicago has much better options.”
Reviews.Author: ElViento
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? --> Problems getting the room you actually reserved: I had to call this hotel three times and email four times in order to insure that we actually got the room we had reserved. --> Overcharging. They charge for everything here. Wireless. The Fitness Center. The Business Center. I've only run into one other hotel that ever charged for use of the fitness center. Note to the Intercontinental: If you're going to charge for something that is commonly included, you should advertise that fact. What's next? Charging for sheets on the bed? --> Very poor customer service. The staff does not communicate in full sentences, or wait to hear your answer. This is Chicago, not New York. How about a little Midwestern patience?

Reviews.Title: “Other than location, don't expect a lot.”
Reviews.Author: PShermanATL
Reviews.Content: Was there for 3 nights the last weekend in July 2009. Booked through Hotwire for $100 a night. Would have been VERY upset if we had paid more than $100 a night. First, the location is right on Michagan Avenue, right in the middle of shopping and dining and near the major touristy spots (literally a 4 minute walk to the Chicago Architecture Boat Tour which should NEVER be missed when in Chicago). Just could not get over the location - it was perfect. The rest of the hotel, eh. Some sites were giving it 4 1/2 stars, some 5, but it is AT MOST a 4 Star Hotel. When we checked in we were told the hotel was completely booked. We were assigned 2 double beds. I asked if we could get a king and the front desk said no, not unless we wanted to pay $75 a night for an upgrade. But if the hotel was full, how was I going to pay for an upgrade? Day 2, with a completely different staff, was much more accomodating and they moved us to a different room. They only misplaced our luggage for about an hour, but it was found so no worries. The rooms are smallish, gym nice, the pool is very historic looking and neat. We never could get the internet to work in our room (and yes, we're decently technology savy people) - when we talked to the front desk about issues, they simply gave us a briefcase size box of cords and modems and connectors. Even after all that, never could get the internet to work. Not a bad hotel, but not a great hotel either. If you're looking for luxury, stay someplace else. But if you're looking for location, stay here. But don't pay over $100 a night to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ninapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is somewhat the half way point on Michigan Ave - its walking distance (10-20 mins) to all major sites. We loved the location and would stay there again in a heart beat. There is a cool Wine/Chocolate Bar restaurant in the hotel. Metro: On the way there we took the metro from the airport - from the airport we switched at jackson and got on the red line and got off at Grand (red). It was a few blocks from the hotel. On the way back to the airport we walked 15 minutes from the hotel to Clark and Lake and get on the blue a direct line to the airpot. The room was clean, decorated nicely - but not every big. If you are more than 2 sharing the room it may be a bit crammed. The pool was nice but indoors - we check it out and lots of families were using it. There was an amazing coffee shop Lavazza Coffee Cafe, one block away at 162 E Ohio St. Every morning we started our routine with a nice coffee / espresso from there. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jme02067
Reviews.Content: The concierge at this hotel was the best part. We were able to get CAF tour tickets in advance without a Ticketmaster surcharge and they booked all of our dinner reservations and give travel tips on buses and CTA in a heartbeat :) I got four free reward nights so I can't vouch for value, but I can say I would stay here again for the published rates of about $230-$250 no question. The location is amazing and the view from our room was beautiful. The room service as well as the maid service was also quick and fantastic. 5 stars all around! I know I'm not the only one to think this place was great because there were 3 weddings while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but expected to be rich”
Reviews.Author: VolcanoBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, it was not a 4.5 star, then there was a 54 dollar a night charge for car parking,plus although the hotel was prepaid in full, they wanted 125 dollars per night, i had to cancel my reservation for my car because they demanded this deposit, 800 deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Intercontinental Chicago”
Reviews.Author: alwaysevol000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental recently and really liked it. We obtained our reservation via priceline and upon checkin we were upgraded to a really nice room looking east to the lake and north down Michigan Ave. The service was pretty good. The pool was interesting and we did go swimming for a little bit to burn some time. We ate out every day and didn't use their food service. There is a Corner Bakery across the street which has better prices. We would probably not book for the rack rate, but we would take a deal through Priceline in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, small room”
Reviews.Author: PassportGirl75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire for a great rate of $113/night. When we got there, she upgraded us to the historic tower. The room was on the 32nd floor and had a great view. It was, however, very small. I had to climb over the armchair to get in and out of my side of the bed. The bathroom was gigantic, though, which was nice. I am allergic to feather pillows, so I called down for foam pillows at 11:15 pm. It took about 45 minutes to get them, which I thought was excessive. Other than that, I liked this hotel. It's in a great location for exploring Chicago, the conceirge was very helpful and friendly, you could check in for your flight in the lobby, and the pool is really nice. I think this hotel is worth the good hotwire rates everyone seems to be getting. I think I would have been disappointed if I had paid more for it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Snob-appeal -- overpriced for value”
Reviews.Author: Stevens08
Reviews.Content: Too expensive from the get-go. If you want snob-appeal, this is the hotel for you. If you are interested in seeing the fabulous city of Chicago, go budget and spend you money on a river tour.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Moments on Magnicant Mile Chicago Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: avriln
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Chicago a few times for work and always try and stay a few extra days but when a friend of mine suggested we go for a girls four day vacation I immediately thought of this great city. We booked the hotel online through hotwire and received a great rate. We took a limo from the airport and from the moment we stepped out of the car we were greeted with such warmth and service. We were early for check in but wanted to walk to Pane Caldo (my favourite) and the bellman directed us to the check in desk where we mentioned that we would like to stay in the historic tower. I had joined online the priority club (idid not have any points at this point) and the very friendly representative upgraded our room and put us in the historic tower at no extra charge. This was accomodating considering we were already paying about 60% below the room rates. Our room would be ready for us after lunch and they stored all of our bags promptly. Our room was beautfiul on the 12th floor overlooking Michigan avenue-two nice double beds -the most comfortable ever, comfy robes,beatiful entrance way , desk for working (i managed to bring my laptop to do some work as well) and they called up to ask if were happy with our room. We had purchased some champagne at a store and asked for some glasses to be sent-not only were they at our door withing minutes they called to make sure we received them. I logged on immediately to the wireless and they only charge me for one day and we stayed three. When we made a few errors with ordering a movie separately at different times to watch-they simply took it off our bill. We ordered room service once for late nite munchies and the service was fast and the food good especially after a lot of champagne and music at the Drake-i do not have a problem with paying more for somehting at 3:00am-they are a hotel and are in the business of making money! The hotel staff were always courteous and friendly and made an effort to make our stay the best we have ever had anywhere. Both my friend and I have done a lot of travelling (I have also lived in the islands) and we must honestly say that the Intercontinental Chicago is the best we have ever stayed anywhere in the world. This is the only place i will stay when i go to Chicago! Keep up the great service and staff ICC.

Reviews.Title: “Location, luxury and service.... The Intercontinental nailed it!”
Reviews.Author: jdiddy430
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and brother and his fiance (he proposed while we were out there) at the Intercontinental in July 2009. I've read some somewhat critical reviews of this place, but we had a wonderful time. I'll give you my thoughts below: PROS: - Location - The location is really perfect for a downtown Chicago experience. The hotel is located on Michigan Ave., a about 100 yards north of the Chicago River. So it's smack dab right in the middle of the Magnificient Mile. You could walk most every place you wanted to go, or you could hop on a train to get to further flung locations. - Hotel - The Intercontinental was very well-appointed, and high-end, yet comfortable. The rooms had flat-screen HDTVs (but only had 2 HD channels), down comforter and pillows, the bathroom was modern and had quality toiletries. The design of the room was also modern, yet comfortable. There was obligitory $8 bottle of water and basket of $6 candy bars. Who actually buys this? - Service - The serviece at the hotel was great. We checked in a little early, and they had us in a room with 2 double beds. We asked for a king, and they told us that unfortunatley that they didn't have one ready, but took my number and would call me when it was ready. We went and had lunch, and then within an hour they gave me a call and told me it was ready. Throughout the rest of the stay, everyone from the front desk staff to the bell staff to the consierge was nothing but friendly and professional, without any of that big-city snobbery. - Ammenities - There was a very nice looking wine, cheese and chocolate specialty restaurant in the hotel that we didn't use, and the in-hotel bar was very nice. In addition, there is a Starbucks in the hotel, a nice way to get a light, cheap breakfast, thereby avoiding a high-cost breakfast. CONS: - Fitness Center - The only complaint I have is that the fitness center was like $25 a day to use for hotel guests, and the fitness center was only an OK hotel gym, not even on par for that much a day. The pool was free to hotel guests, and while I recommend that everyone take a look at it (it looks like a pool frozen in time during the 1920's), it is only for swimming laps, so unless you are a pretty hardcore swimmer, no pool for you. All in all, we had an absolutely wonderful time at the Intercontinental, and we will go back again if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: phillytrippin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well appointed and plenty of room. Located in the heart of downtown Chicago, the Intercontinental makes getting around easy. Excellent restaurant in the hotel and close to nightlife. Staff is courteous and if you're into a healthy lifestyle, the fitness center and pool is incredible for a hotel. There are gyms I've been to with less equipment. And the pool is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: claw7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental hotel. The rooms were very spacious, super clean and the beds were super comfortable. The location is excellent, very close to shops and close enough to the Navy Pier that you can walk there. There is a Starbucks attached to the lobby area which is great to grab coffee and a quick breakfast. We hope to stay here again for our next trip to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerplus77
Reviews.Content: Absolutely huge hotel, big comfortable rooms and great location. The pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Waaaay out of it's league”
Reviews.Author: rm9k
Reviews.Content: Fiancee and I stayed here recently (Jun/09) to check out apartments in South loop area and for a bit of romantic R-and-R. (Didn't quite do it for us for latter purpose). Booked through Hotwire (maybe that was the mistake), which rated this at 4.5 stars (wish I had a BS detector). Upon arrival, discovered only one parking option exists... valet, which runs $53 per day. Ok, fine. Then, at check-in, lady told us room we were getting was great with spectacular views... lie. Come to find out, room was musty smelling, worn-looking (and I don't mean the decor) and very dark. Serious need for a remodeling/redecorating, at least for our room. As for the "spectacular view", one small window in the corner with a partial view of Chicago River and Michigan Ave; what a joke. Then discovered hot water fixture in sink was broken. Called to report it; all they could offer was that they'd send someone to take a look at it... no offer for room change, voucher, nada, not even a thank you for having reported it. Noise from hallway other room doors opening/closing was very apparent and annoying. Felt a bit like we were in a cruise ship, as the nickel-and-dime approach to a few of the amenities seems to be the other modus operandi at this hotel (following the trend of the big-chain hotel industry it would seem); $12.95/day for wireless, for example. Even though we booked through Hotwire (somewhat of a deal, relatively speaking), based on what we observed and experienced, this hotel does not deserve to be rated higher than 3.5 (4 maybe, but that's stretching it) EVEN at the price we paid (just under $200). Other than that, service was just "okay", nothing special. Hotels in this tier really need to take that extra step make you want to return or at least attempt to provide a memorable stay. In this regard, the Intercontinental just falls flat and is way out of its league... it simply offers nothing that to make it, or your stay, stand out. Take this together with the above-mentioned demerits, and I would have to recommend that you seriously consider staying elsewhere. Prospective travelers (and hotels, for that matter) can (and do) much better than this, especially in this area and price range. I'm somewhat disappointed with Hotwire as well... I've had good luck with them in the past, but they have never been quite this far off-the-mark in terms of rating and overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location. This is the way to experience Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tracy818
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 10-15 hotels in the North Michigan Ave. area, and the Intercontinental is our favorite. The location is ideal and the hotel is the perfect size: large enough but not overwhelming. The staff is polite, friendly and helpful. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charge for Everything!!! Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: powerTravler
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! I was surprised with this hotel. First time stay and last time!!! They Nickle and Dime you on every occasion. First when you check in the girl was nice but missed all the basic. She managed to tell me more about her self then to find out my preference and then to offer and sell me a package!! No i want a room i booked and paid for in advance. I get to the room and its old and half view of nothing!!! The next day i go for breakfast and again extra for this and that!!! Never staying there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not wonderful. Internet not included.”
Reviews.Author: shazajshow
Reviews.Content: We have reached a point in our society where internet is expected. This hotel charges $6.95 an hour to use the internet. When I pay $260 a night to stay in a hotel, I expect internet to be included. What a dated, price-gouging policy. This is not 1995 and the Intercontinental is not AOL! The hotel is comfortable, the rooms are clean. The pool is pretty, but old, so there is a lot of rust and dirt on the tiles. The fitness center is very nice. Service is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: atownthat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sisters last year. The rooms are beautiful and the location is great if you are going to stay on Michigan Avenue. Parking is a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location with spotty service”
Reviews.Author: smushie
Reviews.Content: First off, the Intercontinental Chicago couldn't be in a better location and the hotel itself is an absolute gem; especially the pool. We stayed in the tower and the room was beautifully appointed and relatively large for a city hotel room. After reading about the history of the hotel, I would highly recommend exploring the hotel if you have any interest in early 20th century architecture and design. That said, we had two experiences that were stunningly awful and totally unacceptable for a 4-5 star hotel. The first incident occurred at check in. It took over 1.5 hours to get our bags to the room. Worse still, we called down to the front desk 30 minutes after we were told our bags would be right up. After being placed on hold, presumably to find our what the delay was, we were told by the front desk that our bags were, "on their way up." After an hour of waiting we called again and were told the exact same thing (i.e. "on their way"). Finally, after an hour and a half of waiting I went down to the lobby to demand my bags. The front desk person that checked me in literally went, "I remember you. You checked in a while ago." I understand that sometimes the bellmen get backed up but don't lie to me about it and leave me sitting in a room for an hour and a half twiddling my fingers. The second incident occurred on the final night of our stay. A friend dropped us off after dinner and we wanted to invite them up to give them a gift we had brought for them. There were no valets out front and the front desk insisted that our friend would need to pay a $53 parking fee to leave their car out front for 15 minutes. Finally someone offered to watch our friends car for a few minutes but I found the entire situation totally embarrassing and absolutely absurd!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: UWECSARAH
Reviews.Content: My friend & I got a great rate at the Intercontinental Chicago off of Hotwire ($107) for our Thursday night stay. Hotwire doesn't guarantee bedding preferences, so I called the hotel directly a few days ahead of time to confirm my reservation & request a room with 2 beds. I was told that was no problem & they had my request in. Oops! When I checked in I was told that a King room had been reserved. I explained to the front desk women that I had put a request in for 2 beds a few days prior - she one again informed me that there was no note on my reservation with that request. :( She then went on to tell me there were no double rooms available in the whole hotel (really?) - would the King Room be ok? Um ... I guess it has to be, right? I wasn't being mean about it, but she didn't even apologize for the mixup. After I told her we'd take the King Room because we had no choice, she let me know that "they gave us an upgrade" and that she'd make arrangements for a roll-away to be brought up at no charge. That was nice of her I guess, I just wish she wouldn't been a bit more friendly about it. The room itself (room 2703) was big enough for us, but I found it a bit odd that the bathroom didn't have a fan. It also seems to only have heat lamps in the bathroom - which caused the room to get awful hot. We had the air conditioning on the whole time we were there (set as low as it would go - 65 degrees), but it never got below 72. Not horrible, but it was quite humid out and that 72 felt warmer because of it. All-in-all I think we got a great deal for what we paid for. The location was wonderful and the hotel is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal_2
Reviews.Content: What I loved: Stayed in the historic building (the hotel is two buildings conjoined - one old, one new) and our room was large and lovely. Bathroom had both a tub AND a shower. Beds were lovely with that "sheet on the outside of the blanket and inside of the blanket" thing going on, which is so nice. Pillows very comfortable. We LOVED LOVED LOVED the "Eno" wine bar downstairs - they do cheese, chocolate and wine only - how neat is that? We tasted a different flight each night we were there. Hotel is close to almost everything - just a couple blocks away from the river to catch the architecture tour; ON the millenium mile for great shopping, easy walking distance from the red line, easy walking distance from fantastic restaurants (we went to Frontera Grill and Cafe Grand Lux). Annoyances: Couldn't properly open the curtains to let light in the hotel room. Gym and computer usage were extra and pricey (altho I sprang for the gym and it was very well stocked with equipment). Pool area was beautiful - tho not quite as lovely as Swisshotel - where the pool has the best view in the city. Overall, would give Swisshotel the nod for their more beautiful view of the lake, but this hotel was still quite ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Wedding Anniversary Experience”
Reviews.Author: denbosch7
Reviews.Content: We live in a Chicago suburb and wanted to have a special experience for our 43rd wedding anniversary, so we booked the Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue in Chicago. We planned visits to the art museum and the "Jersey Boys." We arrived Friday evening. They gave us a really bad room initially, but after complaining, they upgraded us to the 20th floor with a view overlooking the Tribune Tower and Chicago River. When they learned it was our anniversary celebration, they provided Champaign and Chocolate. We had dinner at the hotel. It was a wonderful gourmet meal at a very reasonable price. The hotel staff was first class from the front desk to the parking garage. (My only negative is that parking here is $53 per night.) This is a wonderful property with a really world class group of people.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great room if historic tower,service non-existing”
Reviews.Author: tucano
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one week end of may. Location is unbeatable, as it is max. 10 minutes walking distance in each direction to all highlights on Michigan Ave. On arrival we had to specially request for luggage delivery to the room after 40 minutes waiting time. The booked room in historic tower was spacious, well-kept and nice for those liking old-world charme. Comfy beds. A bit on the dark side because of small window only because of historic building (1929), but in a city like Chicago you don't spend much time in-room. The marble bathroom was nice, practical and pleasant. We had a look into a room in the new part of the hotel: ok only if single- rooms are very small. On the negative side: staff is very indifferent toward guests and it is obvious that management, organisation, training is on the weak side. At the moment of check-out ask for a trial print: it is obvious that they try to put unjustified charges. We gave tips directly to breakfast site staff in cash. On the invoice there were unknown charges of 5 to 10 dollars for every day. The cashier: our machine puts those charges automatically....! After asking for charge documents signed by us the extra charges were taken off. Watch out for all extras like phone etc.- everything is extremely costly and sometimes doubtful. Breakfast offer was very good, especially the fresh fruits and berries and the croissants were of top quality and taste and so was the corner "wine, cheese & chocalates. .

Reviews.Title: “A perfect American Girl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: steg1ses
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two granddaughters stayed at the Intercontinental in Chicago while visiting American Girl Place for a special birthday week-end for our granddaughter. The hotel was marvelous. We had a specious room and our granddaughters did not want to leave it. They played with their dolls and the special bed provided by the hotel for their doll and did not want to leave to go get supper. So we had room service which was just wonderful. The girls thought this was the best hotel ever. When the cookies and milk arrived, they thought they were in a "very special place". The staff was just wonderful. They even provided a high chair for our American Girl dolls at breakfast. It was truly a week-end to remember. The Stegemollers from Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: bobbi3220
Reviews.Content: Lovely room .Well furnished and very comfortable bed. Great view and location to all the down town activities. Fine staff. Take your swim suit; a must to be in the historic swimming pool. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Clean, friendly, and right in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: stationsweetheart
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through hotwire and paid $104 a night (what a steal!). My friends and I were impressed with the lobby and our room. Everything was clean and neat. We liked the pool and we did pay the extra fee to use the fitness center. I enjoyed a rest in the sauna as well. One hint: park at the 24 hour lot behind the hotel. It will be cheaper for you than the valet service. Also, the transit system (trains, buses) were easy to get to. Overall, I would definitely return to this hotel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely my new favorite place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Hunamoon
Reviews.Content: I am 51 years old and I have stayed in many quality hotels, but none compare to the Intercontinental Chicago on Michigan Ave.. I can not say enough about the staff, they were just a pleasure. From the young lady at the check in counter, Stan the door man (what a treasure), Jose in the lounge was just wonderful (we stayed longer because he was such a joy), the concierge (which there was not one question that he could not answer right off the top of his head....I tested him often), and absolutely everyone there surely made you feel like you were home, but much better. The room was beautiful with an amazing view. I can not wait to get back there again....I am already planning to go back to Chicago.....just to experience another stay at this magnificent hotel. Hats off to all of you!!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience for the right price”
Reviews.Author: SparksMN
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel through Hotwire.com for 115 after tax... parking is 50 bucks a day which is insane and the rooms need some more touches. other than that the rooms were spacious. and have decent views. the pool is historic and the location of the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: wingnut34
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was recently updated, nice bathroom and T.V. It is a central location for sight seeing, shopping and dining. The overnight parking is a bit pricey 53.00 dollars unlimited in/out priv. If you have never been to Chicago like me, this is a great place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Intercontinental was all you could ask and more!”
Reviews.Author: mamak6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It is clean. The employees are friendly and the service was great. All our needs were met and met with a smile. Thanks for a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Excellent Lodging”
Reviews.Author: WBL_9
Reviews.Content: Girls' Weekend with family members was made even better by our stay at the InterContinental. Perfect location for shopping, lake views, museums, restaurants, theater, and parks. Hotel staff was friendly, professional, and responsive. Rooms were attractive, clean, and had all the amenities we needed. (Additional fee for internet use and fitness center). Hotel pool is rather Grecian; interesting change of pace. Although we didn't use the fitness center due to limited time, we toured and it appeared to have everything one would need to maintain a daily workout routine. We enjoyed a classy weekend in the windy city, appreciated the opportunity for discounted rate, and will definitely return to the InterContinental!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Michigan Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisVisitor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic experience at the InterContinental Hotel in downtown Chicago. We stayed for two nights. The location was perfect, on Michigan Avenue, close to the Chicago River. When we checked in, we asked if we could stay in the Historic Tower. They said that would cost extra. But while we were discussing whether we wanted to pay the $50 extra to upgrade, they just went ahead and comped the upgrade -- no charge! We got a corner room on the 17th floor. We could see a little bit of Lake Michigan, and a little bit of the river. I hear the views are even better on the 25th floor and higher, but we weren't going to complain. It was still a great view. The bed... was... heavenly! I can't remember when I've slept so well. The mattress was exceptionally comfortable, as were the pillows. We had a very large bathroom (very nice). And we used the robes and slippers that were provided. The staff was extraordinarily nice. One of the nights we made use of the very cozy bar located adjacent to the lobby. We will definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: neurodoc01
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay at the Intercontinental in the past month. Both times the staff has been friendly and helpful. I found the location to be excellent on Michigan ave. The gym and pool are incredible for a hotel. The first time I have a better room. I believe I was in a business suite and the second time in a regular room. The regular room appeared to be less kept. The carpet was not cleaned by my standards. Also the first night I had to kill a few bugs in the bathroom. They were not present the first time I stayed here. In general it is a good hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vaux
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated directly on the Magnificent Mile and yards away from the river, just walk out straight into the centre of Chicago. I managed to get a good rate through Hotwire, but the IC still honored my Ambassador status and upgraded me to a larger corner room in the Historic Tower with all other benefits. I was pleased with the large room and the two-way view to Downtown and Lake Michigan. Historic decor in this part of the hotel: I liked it but perhaps not to everyone's taste. Very comfortable bed, great power shower but a rather shallow bathtub and only average quality toiletries. The towels were not especially thick. Staff were very helpful, especially when my keycard stopped working 30 minutes before a late 4pm check-out: an immediate offer was made to extend the check-out to 5pm. The swimming pool is a must for its historic associations, but note that it is set up for lane swimming and may not be a suitable diversion for families with young children. The wireless internet is charged extra and was not particularly quick. I chose the $49 1-week option but was pleasantly surprised that the charge was automatically reduced to about $37 at the end of my 5-day stay. The Starbucks in the lobby offers a cheaper option for breakfast coffee and a bun. If you can get a good rate at this porperty, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel For Chicago Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Zena1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in the Intercontinental & found it an excellent hotel in one of the best locations especially for first time visitors to Chicago.We got an great rate through Hotwire & were delighted with our corner room on the 8th floor with views towards the river down Michigan Ave.Some previous reviews mentioned the rooms were small but we were quite happy & everything was to a high standard and very clean.We were spoiled for choice with the selection of shops & restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel ,did some serious retail therapy in Eddie Bowers directly across the road ,great bargains.Five minute walk to the boarding area for Wendella lake & river tours -great trip,10min walk to the fab Millenium park,5 minutes to the House Of Blues for a great Sunday brunch -little touristy but had great fun, 3 blocks to the Red line metro which will get you to the theatre district in 5 minutes & Wrigley Field or Celluar Field in 15 minutes,directly beside the stops for the free trolley to Navy Pier so we really couldnt have asked to be in a better location. Starbucks on the ground floor very handy for an early coffee & a nice local bar Blackies directly behind the hotel.Because there are so many choices close to the hotel we never tried the hotel bars or restaurants .The only slight negative is the excessive hotel charge for wifi & its not free in Starbucks either because it is owned by the hotel but just pop down to the apple store on Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Says it's luxury, but doesn't follow through.”
Reviews.Author: etitan
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, almost to a fault. The superior room was nice with good space, but small details undercut the luxury atmosphere; the curtain was severely worn in a couple places, the iron sputtered rusty steam when turned on, and you could easily here the conversation of your neighbor. For a steep discount, it was worth it, but if I was looking for a luxury hotel, I'd book elsewhere. Oh, and it's the only hotel in Chicago where the internet isn't complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruToronto
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! From its location directly on the Magnificant Mile and surrounded by the finest shopping, to the curtious staff and excellent restaurants and bars, this hotel is one of the best in Chicago. Our room was very clean and fresh, the public areas comfortable and the staff at the concierge and front desk very extremely helpful. This is the only place to stay to be in the cnetre of the action in Chicago. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and convenience”
Reviews.Author: wwcaterson
Reviews.Content: I was attending a training conference in Chicago and opted to book my own room thru one of the online discount programs rather than stay at the rather sterile and pedestrian hotel where the conference was being held. I booked 4 nights at the Intercontinental and was pleased with the elegance and convenient location (an easy walk to the conference). From the lobby to the rooms, this hotel lives up to it's storied reputation. (The indoor pool seems to be imported from the set of a Busby Berkeley movie!) And even tho' I was there for a conference, the hotel's location on the Mag Mile and a quick jaunt to restaurants and theaters, made for a very pleasant stay at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: NiteOwlHouston
Reviews.Content: We had a block of rooms and everyone in the group had an excellent experience. Service was friendly and attentive. Handy Starbucks in lobby and great wine bar in hotel. Nice big rooms with great views in historic building but with all the modern amenities like internet, hair dryers, irons, coffee makers, etc. Very nice pillows and linens. Incredible indoor pool. Location is superb; 1 block from river to pick up boat tours; 1 block from city tours; 1 block from water taxis to Navy Pier, aquarium, museums, etc. Can walk to Millenium Park, Art Institute, sightseeing, tons of shopping, restaurants, nightlife. Taxis out front any time. Easy walk to train. There were plenty of affordable and family friendly places to eat nearby. We loved having a suite to hang out and have snacks and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “We Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimerCleveland
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago. The service we experienced at the InterContinental was first rate. From the location to the early check-in to the Concierge, it was all top notch. We spoke to the Concierge daily and he never led us down the wrong path. We counted on him for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and travel routes. Not one time did he let us down. As far as location, I don't know how you can do much better. Right on the Mile and a couple of blocks from the River. Thank you from my wife and I for making this trip one that we will never forget!! See you soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SYV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental on a "girls" weekend, after attending a wedding in Wisconsin. The hotel is old, ornate, and very beautiful. The best thing for us was that it was in such a fantastic location! We could walk everywhere, and shopping very close to the hotel was great. We relied on the concierge several times for restaurant recommendations and reservations, and she was helpful and friendly. We were fortunate to be assigned to a corner room, which offered beautiful views of Michagan Avenue at night, and on the 24th floor it was pretty quiet. Beds were comfortable and the room was tastefully decorated. We booked on Hotwire and got a great rate, and others in my family used Priceline and we all got the same hotel - we were thrilled with our luck and couldn't have been happier with our visit. Be sure to see the fireworks on the Navy Pier if you can, and we took Shoreline Cruise out to the water and the view of Chicago and the fireworks is something I will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “view to die for”
Reviews.Author: paloftess
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in Chicago with a flight delay, we learned our booked hotel room was a smoking room, and there were no other rooms available that evening. Around the corner from our "budget" smoking accomodations, the InterContinental Chicago had a room in its historic tower. Our luck changed: while clearly not designed for a king bed, the room was extremely well appointed, with a highest end bathroom and a view of the Chicago skyline to die for. The concierge suggested late dining and breakfast restaurants within easy walking distance and w hich were just what we asked for. When we return to Chicago, this is where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury living along the mile”
Reviews.Author: Allenman63
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the hotel I was impressed. The reception was absolutely as pleasant as one can imagine. In and out in a couple of minutes and up to my room. I did go "budget" on the room but the room was great. Not a super view but I was there to sleep. The bed was fantastic. The room is incredibly quiet -- the only sounds being sirens that can occur at any hour. Road noise and hall noise was not an issue but we were in a corner away from the elevator. The room is not huge for two persons but we managed. The TV service was a bit clunky although the TV was a beautiful flat screen in HD. The bathroom is well appointed. We did not use room service. At the hotel we used the Starbucks, the bar, and the wine bar attached. The bar is pricy but so is all of Chicago! Watch out. $15 mixed drinks is the norm in the city. The wine bar was cute but not exceptional. The location is probably one of the best in Chicago. You can walk to just about any popular destination in minutes and you're along the mile...everything is found off the mile!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades Not Worth the Bucks”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: I got a room at InterContinental in Chicago a few years ago. I was excited because my prom was there decades ago and I always remembered it being luxurious. Well I got to my "four-star" room and it looked like a Holiday Inn. I asked about upgrades and they showed me several rooms. I wasn't happy with any of them but had to pick one due to Hotwire. The room was NEVER cleaned for three days. The GM finally listened to me when I explained this is not a "four star" property. He put in my profile for a free suite upgrade. I saw the suites....not worth another round. Stayed at the Conrad across the street and should have never left.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alangou06
Reviews.Content: I was thouroughly impressed with the service and quality of the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago. The building itself is gorgeous and the ammenities they provide are comparable to the best 5 star hotels in the area. Its in the little things that Intercontinental Hotel really sets itself apart from other hotels. The bed and linens, the soaps and shampoos, and the towels, all are luxurious and of the finest quality. All rooms are equiped with large flat screen TVs! The hotel itself is gorgeous. There is a beautiful indoor swimming pool, a full gym, and multiple fine restaurants (i especially loved the Chocolate, Cheese, and Wine bar!) inside the facility. The service also is top rate. Everyone proved very helpful. The concierge service is especially helpful in recommending Chicago destinations and providing valuable information to all their guests, especially guests who are not familiar with Chicago. The best feature of the hotel is the locatation. It is ON the magnificiant mile, the heart of the shopping district of Chicago and only a few blocks away from the finest restaurants, museums, and other destinations. Overall I was more the satisfied with my stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago and would highly recommend it to anyone who travels to Chicago. I will definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A Totally Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobbiMonterey
Reviews.Content: From the time that their car picked us at Ohare to our delivery back to the airport, the stay was a delight. We were upgraded to a suite that had had previously been two rooms. It was a real treat to have two bathrooms in a hotel. Also it was a comfortable livingroom and a terrific bed. We were late for breakfast one morning, so they kindly served us in the bar and applied our credit. I found this a step beyond what they had to do. Finally, the service was warm, friendly and and available when we needed it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and downtown!”
Reviews.Author: IowaElle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went and stayed here for a mother/daughter weekend of shopping. The hotel was nice. The pool was very beautiful and water temp was great. We didn't try any of the restaurants but they looked busy and great atmospher. Room was small and nicely decorated. I had read the reviews of the rude staff and the mistakes in the mini bar but we didn't have any of that. The front desk staff was very kind and we were never charged anything but our room. We will be back in June for another stay but for a week this time. The best part of this hotel is definetly the location. Its is smack in the middle of everything downtown. Buses and trolley stop at the hotel. Subway is 2 or 3 blocks west.

Reviews.Title: “Dark room?”
Reviews.Author: thordandk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We bought the tickets via Hotwire. Maybe because of the low rate we were given a room with both windows completely blocked by a brick wall on the outside. With a 7 hour time difference from Europe it is very hard to adjust when you can't see if it is night or day. After 2 days we complained (should have done it sooner), and we got a better room at a higher floor. But I'm still surprised that a 4,5 start hotel even has rooms with no daylight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ShebaDaisyKittyBaby
Reviews.Content: Location: Smack dab on the Michigan Mile. Halfway between Millenium Park and Water Tower mall. Hotel: Nice linens, pillows, clean rooms, nicely decorated, flat screen TV. Full-service Starbucks in the lobby. We paid $99/night via Hotwire. I'd pay up to $150/night and still think I'd gotten a good deal. Cons: Had to pay extra for internet access per day. Pay-per-view movies were $15. Parking is $53/day which I think is outrageous even for Chicago. There were several self-park lots a block away that were more reasonable ($36/24 hrs). Hotel food was pricey. For a 4+ star hotel, I would have thought they would have had more than single ply toilet paper!! The Grand Luxe restaurant a block down and across the street (above Ann Taylor) was outstanding in terms of views and food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, incredibly slow check-in”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: This is about the fifth time I've stayed at this hotel to attend a conference. It's in a terrific location, and the rooms are very nice, but the check-in process was interminable. Between the time I first stood in line (about 2:30 p.m.) until I got the key to my room, almost 30 minutes had passed. I then had to wait another 20 minutes to get my luggage. If I had known that would take so long, I would have retrieved my luggage from the bell service where I stored it earlier that day before checking in.

Reviews.Title: “you can find better for less money”
Reviews.Author: 715traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small compared to other American hotels. The room we stayed in had this very loud noise. We think it may have been the heating and cooling system. The noise "boomed" every few minutes. We stayed in room 2506. The location was good but not worth the money considering the size/noisy room. This hotel was reviewed to be 4 1/2 stars I've stayed in better 3 1/2-4 stars. I don't think is should be consider a 4 1/2 star in America maybe in another country. The fitness center has a cost of $16 and you have to swap a credit card for the use of the computers in the business center. I've never had to do that before so I was very disappointed and decided not to use the computer. The staff wasn't impressive but they were ok. The concierge service wasn't very helpful I've received better service in lower rated hotels. Overall, I think the hotel is overrated and a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: kmgrossepointe
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The staff is very helpful and responsive. It is centrally located and it is easy to get anywhere from the hotel. I was in Chicago for a convention and the shuttle service was convenient. The room would not cool down (I like my hotel rooms to be very cool) and the staff brought a floor fan which worked fine. Spent a lot of time in the bar and even though it was very busy, staff again, was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - service, room & location all outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BVerde
Reviews.Content: Service, room and laocation all outstanding. Hotel staff were very helpful without being overbearing. Room was very nice, yet amenities were pricey ($6.95 for half liter of water). Location was great, within walkiing distance to the Loop, Hancock center and Navy Pier. Bus station across street will take you to museums, aquarium and planitarium. West Egg Restuarant a few blocks down serves breakfast, lunch and dinner; great food and very reasonable. Hotel restaurant was too pricey for us but very nice. Starbucks in lobby was very handy. Only complaint was that they charged for use of the gym and internet service was outrageous ($9.95 for 15 minutes and $1.00 per sheet printed)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Bruegger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with wife and two nine-year-old boys. Very nice hotel. Clean room and friendly staff. Old fashioned lap-pool but nice enough if you're not expecting a water park (we weren't). Good enough for the kids to practice their cannonballs! Awesome location. Walking distance from Hancock Tower, Ghirardelli, Giordano's Pizza, ESPN Zone and of course, the Billy Goat Tavern (cheezboogya, cheezboogya!!) We got an incredible deal via Priceline using the tips on Bet69terBidding.com. Parking can be a killer (as others have mentioned) but if you do your homework and are willing to walk a few blocks, you can find some alternative parking (I paid $69 total at a self-park garage for Sat, Sun and Mon nights). Would have been nice if high-speed wireless were free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trivster
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location, friendly and efficient staff. Starbucks on site, rooms are smallish but adequate. Beautiful pool and the building has great history, staff are passionate about the hotel and the history. Very efficient valet parking but expensive ($53 per 24 hours) - local parking is still $40 so you may as well stump up the extra $13. I would definitely stay here again, we got it on Hotwire for around $100!

Reviews.Title: “For a 5-star Intercontinental just ok”
Reviews.Author: Puedder
Reviews.Content: Location perfect - right on North Michigan Av. We had a Standard room in the main building - room size pretty small but all in all ok. Swimmingpool is just a great disapointment. WeÂ´d pick the Hotel only if weÂ´d get the same rate for $99 per night, otherwise weÂ´d try antoher hotel (Sofitel, Sissotel, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in center of things”
Reviews.Author: AZGuys
Reviews.Content: Would rate as a 4* +, with beautiful public areas . The location is outstanding, excellent restaurants of all price ranges and shopping in easy walking distance.Excellent large grocery store and liquor store, both within block of hotel. Bus service just outside door gets you to sights without expence of taxi. .Had very nice room in old section (the more expensive part of hotel), large room, very nicely furnished in a traditional style. We did bed and breakfast rate, which was a good deal, only slightly more than room without breakfast, but probably deal if only two persons. Good bath with both tub and shower, with high quality ameniteis and a good selection. Nice large towels. Hotels staff helpful in all areas. Good bed and pillows, although pillow menu promised never realized. The internet was very slow, probably because of full house with Information Teck personnel, but after we discussed it with front desk they removed charges (very nice). Excellent large HDTV, best TV have ever had in any hotel of any price range. Desk was large with plenty of electric plugs, but desk chair looked good was not too comfortable. Only negative part of stay was room was too warm even though outside tempature was in 30s. We kept window open and heat off entire 6 days and still almost too warm. They offered to move us, but maintance said it would be same temp in all rooms. The food was okay, bit on high side, but normal for this class of hotel, but with all the restaurants in area, not of concern. Did not have car but parking is $50 per day, valet only, but car not needed. Some public garages in area seemed to be in $30 day range, but no in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Great Location -- Great Price”
Reviews.Author: maa-maa
Reviews.Content: Our family -- mom, dad, two girls 10 and 5 -- stayed here for three nights. The hotel is in a great location, right on Michigan avenue. Lots of stores and restaurants within easy walking distance. Beyond that, the El -- subway actually -- is only three blocks away on Grand Ave. Everything was exceptionally clean. Decor is attractive. We had great service, but only dealt with the staff at check-in, check-out, and at the fitness center. The pool was phenomenal. It's huge. A holdover from the hotel's days as an athletic club. The room has multiple tiers of seats and tables for parents watching their kids. Not much of a shallow end for the very little kids. No whirlpool. Price was great: Under $130/night for Wed-Thurs-Fri stay. Don't know how long downtown Chicago rates will stay that cheap. Probably until the economy improves. Only two slight negatives. (1) The room (two double beds) was very small. With two kids, it was sometimes a juggling act to get us moved around. We were in the "new" tower of the hotel. (2) The in-house restaurant was very expensive: $25 for breakfast buffet. But given the number of other restaurants around, that wasn't such a big deal. For a great breakfast, check out West Egg Cafe at Ontario & Fairbanks, two blocks north and two blocks east. There was also a Starbucks in the lobby for coffee/snacks. Overall, I'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Goldilocks412
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting in November. The stay was fine until I actually needed some help when I returned home in recovering a couple of blouses I accidentally left hanging in my bathroom when I left. These weren't run of the mill t-shirts or I'd have blown it off to my own stupidity, but rather expensive blouses. So I invested hours in calling around the hotel talking to Security, Housekeeping, and the Front Desk and got absolutely nowhere. Want to speak with a manager there? Hah - good luck. The operator is 6-Sigma trained on directing calls to anywhere but the managers who don't want to be bothered with mundane issues like customer service. Where could those shirts possibly have gone? Clearly they didn't walk out of the hotel and were set aside by someone. It's a decent place, but if you need special assistance with anything, you aren't likely to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jhollingsworth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and short cab to McCormick. Staff was extremely nice and service was prompt. Clean and comfortable for a decent price. I believe one of the nicer stays in Chicago. Great restaurants in walking distance! Breakfast buffet a little pricey but most are. Bar comes alive in the evenings. Very pleasant stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable beautiful and centrally located chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: purduegirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Stayed at the hotel for a Girls Weekend. Very clean, beautiful and spacious rooms. The hotel is in the heart of downtown Chicago and was in walking distance from everything we wanted to do (shop, eat, see a play).The hotel restaurant was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer074
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The decor was beautiful, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the restaurant was outstanding. The room I stayed in was beautifully decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. Make sure you check out the pool, it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel illustrates the best of Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: maxiemom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on Michigan Ave that allows vistors to go anywhere in the city with ease. Cabs, buses and the river allow you to see museums, theater and architechture in minutes. The rooms are on the smaller size, but this is due to the historic nature of the buliding. And I recommend walking around the building to see some of the wonderful 1920's-30's features in the ball rooms. The Pool area is not to be missed for such architechture. In fact many peolpe came by the pool deck to just take pictures the room is so fantastic. The Tower rooms offer a great deal of privacy as there are only a handfull of rooms on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: luv2campMo
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding. Room was large (king bedded historic tower). They even had a birthday surprise waiting for me! Location was perfect. ENO was fun. Bar was cozy. Check-in and check-out a breeze. Starbucks on premise. Concierge helped with transportation and dinner reservations. The Bell man stored our luggage for us the last day so we could shop before our 5pm flight. Very nice and romantic. The only complaint, was we weren't prepared for all of the tipping and had to keep making sure we had some small bills in our pockets.

Reviews.Title: “The Intercontinental will be OUR Hotel in Chicago....”
Reviews.Author: bidder2th
Reviews.Content: Our two-night stay was exceptional. The room was perfectly clean, and when I asked for extra towels, they were in the room when I returned from shopping. Drinks and snacks at the bar were very good, but expensive (but, I have come to expect this in Chicago). Location was perfect for shopping and dining. Some walking was required (1 mile or less) but was welcomed. I look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Bad Customer Service & They Overcharge You”
Reviews.Author: udream86
Reviews.Content: They were horriblly rude! They added items to my bill and during checkout they treated us like we were lying about it. When they reviewed the cameras and saw that they made the mistake we werent even offered an apology. I almost missed my plane and I missed the shuttle dealing with it and they were so rude and obnoxious about it. Plus dont even think about room service as they overcharge you like no other hotel I've ever been. A regular omelette with only cheese was $37.50-yes, $37.50. Plus, the amenities aren't even free. You have to pay for the internet. you have to pay for the gym and the pool. I would never go back there ever!

Reviews.Title: “We will defintely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: OldBull
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable rooms located in the center of the Michigan Mile shopping area close to most attractions Restaurant,Bar and a Wine and Chesse bar on premise Up to date fitness room, lap pool and sauna. On a bad weather day you don't need to leave the hotel. Have stayed at other hotels in the area would recommend the Interconcontinental Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for getting your Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jaydarl
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely perfect, arguably the best location on Michigan Avenue. The staff was professional and friendly. We stayed in the historic tower. Very nice room though our floorplan was kinda odd and a tad small. Very nice and large bathroom though. We went to both the hotel bar and the seperate wine bar. Both are great for hanging out and each has a cool vibe. Expensive, but I guess that is to be expected. The food at the bar is typical bar grub and was decent except for the battered fish which was undercooked. That has to be my only complaint. Overall, we had a great time in Chicago and this hotel had a lot to do with that.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic gem on Michigan Avenue but be prepared to walk for better dining & drinking options.”
Reviews.Author: mmr1979
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a nicer room, better service, or a better location for $125 a night. It was only a $8.00 cab ride from Union Station, too, which by the way I would highly recommend taking a train to Chicago. Parking prices seemed ridiculous & the driving was very crazy! We stayed in the Historic Tower King Room with a view of Michigan Avenue. The room was luxurious & romantic. It would have been nice to have a CD player in the room. And P.S. ladies- do not use the complimentary lotion, it smells very bad, like old playdough or something! But those are my only two very minor complaints. We didn't use the pool area but we checked it out- a very nice large pool but for lap swimming only. We didn't see a sauna or whirlpool, either. Every single staff member we encountered was extremely professional & courteous. They had 2 employees who worked right outside the door loading & unloading luggage, hailing cabs, & they even escorted me to the door under an umbrella the night we returned & it was raining! Now that's service! You must try the Passiontini at the bar by the entrance- $13 but the best drink of the weekend! Drinking is VERY expensive in Chicago- don't think you will find cheap drinks- we didn't & we went to lots of different style bars. The dining options are very limited for this being such a large hotel. We previewed the breakfast menu & they were charging $14 for 2 pancakes! Nothing with it, just 2 pancakes! We found a great diner right around the corner with unbelievable breakfast at a much better value (Mary's Cafe), pretty much every breakfast was $10.95, we had 4 different things & they were all super delicious! If you go right out of the hotel there is a set of stairs that takes you down under Michigan Avenue- keep walking straight from the bottom of the steps about 2 blocks, on the right is Mary's. You will pass the Reagle Beagle which has to be one of your nighttime stops- it ended up being our favorite bar. Very low keyed, great food, great atmosphere, great 80's decor & music. Not the songs that make you roll your eyes- the ones that make you say "I've got to put this on my ipod!!" You must try the Brady Brunch Punch, $10 each but soooo good! We had the boneless buffulo tenders one night with fries & they were great. Other than those 2 places near the hotel, nothing really stood out- you've got to walk further for more options. Couldn't ever find the popcorn shop that everyone raves about, but while we were looking we discovered that Hubbard Street would be a great afternoon bar hopping street. Someone else told me Rush Street has lots of bars, too. Unfortunately we found out about these on our last morning :( We needed a late check out & it was absolutely no problem getting it, even free of charge. So all in all this was an amazing hotel, but be prepared to walk for nightlife & dining.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: burnonthego
Reviews.Content: There was slight confusion about my room, and the hotel upgraded my room. I had a truly remarkable stay and the upgraded room exceeded my expectations. They made every effort to meet my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: We were excited to see a 4.5-star hotel on Hotwire for just $95, but disappointed with the hotel itself. This is barely a 4-star in facilities or service. There was a long line for check-in, with the clerks loudly announcing people's room numbers as they checked them in (so much for discretion). The rooms themselves (we asked to see more than one) reminded me of the Times Square Sheraton: probably nice at one point but now past their prime and poorly maintained, I've added some photos but unfortunately the cell phone camera isn't very clear. The carpet was worn and stained in places, the baseboards were banged up, and all the furniture was dinged and scuffed,, In the bathroom the wallpaper was peeling and the counter had permanent stains. In the second room we saw there was also a bizarre brown stain in the middle of the wall -- and this was the room that was supposed to be an "improvement." Since we were stuck here with a nonrefundable rate, we decided to make the best of it by getting a minibar drink and getting into the hotel bathrooms -- eeeeew, stained! Granted it was just a small lipstick stain but pretty icky to think the robes may not have been laundered between guests. Judging by the crown at check-in the hotel gets heavy tourist traffic, and the wear and tear is really showing. As other posters have also noted, there are just a lot of other, better choices in Chicago, Why a vendor would rate this a 4.5-star is beyond me, but even for a 4-star I'd look elsewhere,

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 star quality. I would not advise staying there”
Reviews.Author: Prettipetite
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights after booking with hotwire. I have been to just about all of the 4 star hotels in the area and I have to say there are many which are better than the Intercontinental and cost a little less. If you are not concerned with the quality regarding your room, this review might not be important. First of all, valet has gone up to 53 bucks a day. Apparently, they have to run all the way to the Navy Pier to get your car so you will be waiting a little longer than usual. I waited about a half hour. Now lets get tot he real disappointment: The rooms. I was incredibly peeved when I walked into my room. It was so tiny I kept bumping my knees on the furniture when I was moving my suitcases around. Both my suitcases would not even fit in the closet so I have to cramp them in which made it a hassle to get my clothes out. I have been in 2 star hotel rooms that looked nicer than this. There was a little cat hair on a red velore like love seat, with cheap, really stiff cushions. I am not saying the room was dirty but it certainly was not spotless either. There were quite a few holes in the sheets as well. Sleeping was impossible due to the loud heating system. I called the front desk and they immediately sent someone to look at it. He sort of giggled and said that there was nothing he could do because it was supposed to be that loud. I couldn not believe it. I'm sure they get many complaints about the heating systems. All in all the staff is friendly, the food is pretty good, However, there are many other hotels with comparable prices and much better quality rooms, service, and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: sawyetr
Reviews.Content: I booked package deal with airfare and hotel. I was pleased to find this hotel was right in the heart of Michigan Avenue. I thought the decor was updated in the room I was in and liked that there was a Starbucks attached in lobby. Also, check out the pool area (even if you don't swim) it is very cool architecture. I had a great trip, enjoyed the staff, the bar, the room, etc. Room service was pretty good TOO! I would recommend this for several reasons but best of all is the location. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Hotel Experience @ Hotel Inter-Continental”
Reviews.Author: kimmy1971
Reviews.Content: I work alot and i'm not able to get away on vacation with my children to much. so i work in the chicago area and wanted alittle getaway just for the weekend , so i chose the intrercontental for just that. and its just what we needed for that little break. We had a great time there .went swimming ,the pool was beautiful.And everyone at the hotel was so accommodating.I will be returning for another stay .

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miaheaston29
Reviews.Content: To avoid saying what others have already said, just don't stay at this hotel unless you're looking for a super cheap hotel in the city. My fiance and I booked a room here for Valentine's Day to get away from the daily grind but little did we know how disappointed we would be. The hotel staff was mediocre, decor was old and the hotel smelled stale! The ceilings are so short, so if you're even close to being 6 feet or taller, you're going to bump your head....seriously! The gym was smaller than most peoples bathrooms and if you think you're going to do anything other than run on the treadmill, you can forget it! They charge you $12 to workout and there wasn't ONE weight to lift, a resistance ball or room to stretch....simply horrbile! On top of that, we had to wait 10 minutes every time we wanted to use the elevator because they were so slow. The ice machine was on the 7th floor, so needless to say, we wasted a lot of time just getting ice. Overall, this hotel was pitiful! My fiance and I both agreed that our time would've been better spent at home. We live downtown already and just wanted to spend the night at a really nice hotel in the city and do some shopping on Michigan Ave. If it weren't for the location, this hotel wouldn't be in business! It wasn't even worth the $112 we spent to book it on Priceline. In the end, I guess you get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Spiegs2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental based on a recommendation from a co-worker. It was an excellent choice! It's in a great location right on Michigan Avenue, the room was very nice, and the staff was extremely accomodating! On my next trip to Chicago, I'll definitely be staying at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unique wine bar, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Dibby_Dain
Reviews.Content: Shame the pool was closed, but offered use of pool in another hotel across the road. Can't fault the location, central to everything. Especially enjoyed the wine&cheese bar downstairs, which we visited for a drink before heading out - excellent staff there. We were offered a free tour of the old building but never got around to it, will save it for next time!

Reviews.Title: “Whoever designed and installed the plumbing should be shot”
Reviews.Author: Bob_the_Editor
Reviews.Content: Whoever designed and/or installed the plumbing should be shot. I was on the 37th floor and the shower was unusable. There was so little water pressure that the shower stream couldn't hit the opposite wall of the shower. Moreover, the temperature couldn't be adjusted. After 30 seconds, I gave up and took a bath. I wasn't happy with the slowness of the flow from the bathroom sink faucet, plus the sink didn't drain properly. If I had managed to use the shower, the light in the shower was burned out. The bathroom scale didn't work at all. The Internet service was slow for $12.95 a day. The maid failed to refill my supply of coffee and cream/sugar so I had to call downstairs for them. The decor of the room was nice and the bed was comfortable. Front desk personnel were friendly and the bellmen helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: liveforluxury
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to use Hotwire to book our one night stay in downtown Chicago to celebrate our anniversary. We choose a $110/nightly 4.5 star rating from Hotwire and they then told us that we would be staying at the InterContinenal and I must admit I was a little bummed as I was hoping for a smaller, boutique style hotel. When we arrived Saturday afternoon the lobby was bustling with energy and there were many people floating in and out of the bar. We made our way to the front desk and were nicely greeted by a front desk attendant who was extremely friendly. I was carrying a bottle of wine that we had brought with us and she noticed it, jokingly commenting, "Oh that was so nice of you to bring that for us!" She then asked if we were there for a special occasion and I told her that we were celebrating our anniversary. A few clicks on the keyboard later she told us that she had applied several upgrades to our reservation. This is very uncommon given that we used a 3rd party source to book our stay. Our room, suite really, was in the Historic Tower on the 34th floor. There was a large bathroom with a tub set underneath a large window with an awesome view of the city and a separate glass enclosed shower.
