The bedroom was spacious with a king bed, desk, couch, and entertainment center. There were also two large windows in the bedroom. Overall we were very impressed with the room, given that we had only paid $110. My husband really liked the bed (very firm) but I found it to be a bit lumpy and uncomfortable. The tub beneath the window was nice but it was just a regular size and not large enough to really lay down and relax in. The maid service was very quick to bring extra towels when we needed them and there was a button system on the door to let them know when not to disturb. The decorative style in the room was a bit dated, but not too cheesy or old looking. Sunday when we checked out we were assisted by the front desk manager who was, again, extremely friendly and courteous. We grabbed a Starbucks (nicely located within the lobby area) and took our bags to the bell stand. The bell staff (working the desk) were by far the least helpful/most rude staff at the hotel. They didn't smile and seemed pretty annoyed that we wanted to store our bags for a few hours while we walked around downtown. The only real problem we had was retrieving our car from the valet (that was ridiculously priced at $50). We waited about 30 minutes and finally went back to the valet desk where we had paid to get our car out. The woman had forgotten to give one of the runners our keys and our car had never been sent for. Fortunately we weren't in a hurry and so they went to get our car and she immediately apologized, took responsibility, and took my husband with her to refund the $50 fee. We were thrilled with her response and professionalism. Overall the InterContinental is a nice place to stay in the city. Would we pay more than we did to stay there again, nah, too many other great places for the same great price.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Chicago--* World Class!”
Reviews.Author: SherpaDave
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is World Class--at amazingly low rates! From the beginning (checking in with Agnieszka Szumal--who was polite, professional, & personal) to walking into a fabulous room (with my wife & son) to enjoying the incredible pool & gym (not to mention the restaurant/bars) to shopping on the Magnificent Mile (& taking advantage of huge sales), our time at this hotel was simply fabulous (& we travel around the world, so we have a lot to compare it to!). The next time you are in the windy city, do yourself a big favour...& check into the Intercontinental Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “you'll love the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: 120Barton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day business meeting at Chicago's Intercontinental and it couldn't have been nicer. Staff goes overboard to accomodate guests. Rooms are clean, well furnished, spacious and well appointed. Room service was quick and the food was great. Located in the heart of Chicago's Magnificent Mile...shopping and dining possibilities galore. Ms. J.B. Hancock

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cippie75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel one night. The hotel is excellent, comparable quality than Marriott and Sheraton, perhaps superior, but the location is definitely much better. Whatever your trip purpose is, business or leisure, you can drop your bags and take a walk on the Magnificent mile. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “New Years trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: craigpainter
Reviews.Content: Every year for the past 25 years, my wife and her sister, along w/ her husband, have shared New Years w/ a trip to the city. We use the trip to get away from everybody and everything to review the year just past and make plans for the year to come. Out of those 25 years, we have spent six of those years at the Hotel Intercontinental, Chicago. We have tried other places but the best has been the big "I." It is centrally located, great rooms, outstanding staff, and wonderful food. My brother-in-law love the "art deco" pool and work-out rooms. A great place to go after lunch when the sisters are shopping. Even better is the Lounge downstairs! We have tried other places in Chicago and the "I" always seem to come up best. For the last two years we have been spending the first few days of the new year at the Hotel Intercontinental Chicago and this most recent stay was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChiT0wnGirl
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Chicago is FABULOUS! Small but lovely room in the Historic Tower. Entire experience, from check-in to check-out was perfect. Employees are friendly and attractive. Hotel was clean and attractive. Amenities are great, especially the indoor swimming pool! Food service was prompt, well presented and tasty. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: HT1
Reviews.Content: Spend five days here over New Year. Got a great deal on the Intercontinental website so I guess that was the main motivation for choosing this hotel. Plus the reviews on tripadvisor were overall good. Could not fault the hotel. Stayed in the "new" tower. Room was very comfortable - occasional noise from neighbouring rooms but it did not last long. Took breakfast on two occasions in the restaurant and found it good. Location is excellent - at the upper end of the Mag Mile it allows easy access to all the shopping plus the loop area for museums etc. At the price - would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is back!!”
Reviews.Author: dkja03
Reviews.Content: After many stays at comparable hotels, I can say that this one was by far the best experience we had in a long time! EVERYONE was just so darn pleasant, they renewed my faith in quality customer service. From the doorman, to the front desk check-in, to the housekeeping service, to the security guard, to the fitness center staff...they were all as friendly and polite as you could ever ask for. The best example of hospitality? My son became ill during the night, and they arranged for us to do a 4pm checkout (when we needed to leave to catch our train) in order for him to stay in bed and recover. No extra charge; no hesitation on their part. They've earned my business from here on out!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: w00f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for shopping and dining. The accomodations were just what we needed for a quick get-away. The staff was friendly and helpful. Water Tower is only a few blocks away, and there are plenty of great restaurants just steps from the hotel. The pool was packed with kids, so I wouldn't recommend it for lap swimming or relaxing. Still, overall this was a super choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sciguymrd
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in the city, especially for shopping up and down Michigan Avenue. For the money, however, I thought the hotel was decent but nothing to rave about. The rooms in the main building are fine but quite small. The pool is amazing (and included) but the exercise room is an additional $12 a day. A nice lobby and lobby bar but the hotel service was nothing special. My wife, with the kids, tried to check in as I was parking the car ($50/night) but the front desk attendant wouldn't let her since the room was in my name. My wife offered ID and a checkbook with both names on the checks but needed to ask for a manager to allow her to check in. Just not real customer-oriented and I think you could find better for the money. Try the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Chicago!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jerome0404
Reviews.Content: What a great place!! Recently had the opportunity for a quick overnight in COLD Chicago with my family (wife and 2 young daughters) to soak-up some big city Christmas cheer and let the girls do some swimming. This hotel was perfect. The property is just beautiful. We had a large King in the Historic tower with a great view, large bath (w/ separate shower), plenty of floor space (the girls love to bring the aerobed), and overall very nicely appointed. The Historic tower is worth a visit even if not staying in the hotel. Very beautiful well-mainted structure with an interesting history. The pool is awesome (but could be a few degrees warmer-honestly my only very minor complaint). Breakfast at the charming 2nd floor "Zest" was terrific and more than worth the $18.95 EarlyBird special ($7.50 for the girls). As great as the property is-the real treat at this place is the staff! To a person-EVERYONE we came into contact with was top-notch. Friendly, professional and eager to enhance your stay in any way they could. Big-time kudos to the management staff for hiring, and properly training, such a great bunch of genuinely nice people. We've stayed at many of the nicer properties in Chicago and I can't think of a better place to get the most "bang for your buck"! Can't wait to go back. Hopefully, it will be warm enough to actually enjoy a stroll along Michigan Ave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidCrescentCity_CA
Reviews.Content: If you need a place right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, this is the hotel for you. It took a couple tries to find it driving in from the east, even using my Garmin. However, once we pulled up to the front, our bags were handled efficiently, and our room was ready as promised. Of course, for a better view and a larger room, we were offered to upgrade to a more elite status in our travel club. I did so, but am not sure our view really changed much. The check in process was smooth and our room quiet and comfortable. I never appreciate Internet fees and didnâ€™t like that their Internet service was not free. Also, parking is very expensive in most downtown Chicago hotels, so avoid bringing a car unless you really need one. The hotel location is right across the street from Nordstromâ€™s, making shopping easy. There is a Starbucks in the downstairs lobby, which is nice for a quick breakfast. The restaurant/lounge was frequently busy, but our service was good. If you can get a rate for around $160/night I would take it and avoid the upgrade to something more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: maintexn
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. I chose it as part of a package made available through Hotwire.com. When I saw it as one of the options, I seized the opportunity to stay there again. This time I was able to take my wife and we had all of our expectations exceeded by the staff of this superb hotel. We arrived early and were able to check in, even though it was prior to noon. For a small fee, we were able to upgrade our accomidations and enjoy a spacious room with a great view of the city. I have to speak again about the staff at this hotel. It was probably the most friendly I have ever encountered in my travels. They were quick to help with any questions we had about the city, how to best get around, attractions and places to dine. I certainly will stay there on my next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Mike Cohen Appreciation”
Reviews.Author: c-notehoops
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great and even greater by the entire staff and the attention they gave during our stay We look forward to our next stay at the InterContinental and the staff in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pinkbird_creates
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suit, which was lovely! The property itself was amazing, our entire stay was very enjoyable. I recommend just wandering around the hotel, as there is lots to look at! It's also in an excellent location for walking or public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: greypilgrim
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel does not offer many amenities. Internet costs $16 for 24 hours. If you forget toiletries, you are better off walking down Michigan Ave. to the Walgreens because the hotel charges you four bucks per item for shaving cream, razors, toothbrush, and toothpaste. Other, less expensive hotels I've stayed in, give these items free at the front desk. The central benefit to staying in this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of the Miracle Mile, and most of the things you want to see are within walking distance. Overall, the rooms were fine, although I don't think the bathroom was well-cleaned. There was hair on the edge of the bathtub. However, there really wasn't anything special about this hotel or its rooms, and for the price, I'd rather have stayed in a Best Western or Holiday Inn for the free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: JSTraveler08
Reviews.Content: I travel quite extensively for business and travel to Chicago on a frequent basis. Before this most recent year I was a regular guest at a different hotel chain. I began to search other locations based on location of client meetings. I decided to give the InterContinental a try. My first stay was very good so I decided to stay at the hotel again for this most recent trip. I was pleased to have ANOTHER great experience. When the cab pulled up to the hotel I was greeted by a friendly bellman who helped me into the hotel. It happened to be the coldest day since last February so I was doubly appreciative of the smile on his face. The hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays (which makes the business travel aspect of my life a bit more special). The front desk staff was very attentive and welcoming as I checked in. The room was very clean and well appointed. The hotel continues to implement GREEN initiatives and does a good job of communicating their mission and the many ways they are trying to help our envirornment. Both the room service delivery time and food was very good. In addition, if you have an opportunity to visit the bar and are hungry, be sure to order the mini-sliders on pretzel bun. They were very delicious but also found the chef's presentation to be very creative. I am planning to make the Hotel Intercontinental my new home-away-from home when I am in Chicago. I am very pleased with the consistency and quality of service and the genuine good nature and professionalism of the staff. In addition, if I ever have an occasion to travel with my family to Chicago, the hotel would be a great location first because of the service but also the pool is great and would be another activity for the kids. There is also great shopping but in particular the hotel is located across the street from an indoor Mall with lots of great stores (including Nordstroms)! Give this hotel a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dmats22
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the middle of everything Chicago has to offer. Large hotel with great architecture, you can choose to stay in the new more modern tower othe the charming historic tower. Friendly staff with great service! I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Chicago!! Oh yeah, and a full service "real" Starbucks in the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The InterContinental Doesn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: arenabiatch
Reviews.Content: I'd had very satisfying stays at InterContinental Hotels in Europe before, but never had stayed in any of their stateside properties. As soon as you drive up to the hotel you notice the architecture of the building. Housed in a former Shriner's Athletic Club, the structure is a refreshing change from the cookie-cutter layout of many large hotels. It has character. My room was larger than I expected and nicely furnished. The bed was comfortable and the bedding not too smothering like some other hotels. The closet was large and the flatscreen TV was a nice surprise. I had a very good buffet breakfast in the restaurant. The bar was a little on the small side, but the selection of beers was good. Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay at the InterContinental. My only criticism would be the cost to valet park a car is a hefty $50 per day, with no option for self parking. But I guess that's the price you pay for staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouWhoOhio
Reviews.Content: From the muinute we got there to the time we checked out, the staff was very friendly. The hotel is clean, with great decor. The location is a perfect, you are so close to many attractions. Even if you did not want to leave the hotel, you have everything you need right there. We will always stay at the Intercontinental Hotel Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: borntoexplore
Reviews.Content: We booked short notice this hotel before Thanksgiving looking forward to enjoying the pool. We have been staying many times in CHIC but never got to stay at the Interconti. Unfortunately the pool was closed for repair and we did have some issues with the non-working a/c system and the noisy elevator right behind our wall. The hotel did wave generously part of the fees for parking / internet to compensate us for our experience which we did highly appreciate. We decided to upgrade to a Junior Suite which gave us 2 baths/ and a separate bedrom. The King Bed was big and very comfortable in a rather small room, the pull-out sofa in the connecting room would need desperately to be replaced since it was absolutely worn out ( our son had to sleep on it feeling each single spring) . The hotel is in an older building and probably does require lots of maintancance. The lobby is beautiful but small, the adjacent STARBUCKS very convenient for a quick breakfast, the service of the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Probably would stay again in the hope to experience the pool next time but would make sure to ask for a room NOT ADJACENT to the elevator and with an updated/ newer sleeper sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: csakumanyc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels through business travel. The InterContinental in Chicago was definitely a very nice hotel. Service was friendly and helpful. Even the valet guy was really nice. Rooms were clean and the bed was VERY comfortable. Wish I had stayed a few days longer...cause I never got to try the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tbrowley
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Hotel chicago was a great romantic getaway for my husband and I. When we first arrive the door man greeted us with his knowledgement on the hotel and the city. We was very impress with his willingness to make us feel comforable and relax. I am not sure if the InterContinental Hotel trained all their employees to overwhelm the customers with kindness or if it was just this young man personality. My husband and I was so impressed by Keenan Caldwell, that we left this hotel feeling as if we were on our second honeymoon. We will absolutely recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family, mostly because of the hospitality of this young man.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: tomest05
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two nights over the Thanksgiving holiday at the Intercontinental. This hotel was very beautiful throughout most of the interior and exterior the adjoined restaurant/bar and Starbucks was enjoyable and convenient for day and night time city walkers like ourselves. The best aspect of the hotel is its location in my opinion. It's literally right on Michigan Avenue, head just one block North and you're dead in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, famous for fabulous shopping and boutiques. The lobby was ornate and gorgeous with some crowd issues during the night time, since it was not a very large lobby. Check in was rather easy. We had booked the room weeks in advance via Hotwire and recommend that method if possible, of course it's not feasible to know with 100% accuracy that you'll get the Intercontinental when booking through them, but if it's a 4 Star in the Loop you may be in luck. I believe we paid $130 a night. The history behind the hotel is rather extensive and unfortunately we did not have the time to check out all of what the hotel has to offer in terms of historical significance. Although I did wander lost in the the historic tower a bit after getting ice! The building and towers are a bit confusing in the L-shape turn hallways that lead into different sections of the hotel entirely without you noticing when you head up or down stairs. But the pool must be seen. It's one of the most beautiful indoor pools that I have seen. As for the room, it was extremely cozy and reminded me of the Palace Hotel in San Francisco a few weeks ago, so much so in fact that the Screen Saver on the plasma tv was exactly the same and playing the same hypnotic tune, on the neutral Hotel channel. The refrigerator was packed with overly priced alcohol and soft drinks. I'd rather have the space to store leftovers or my own alcohol from stores down the street to be honest. The room itself was much less spacious than the Palace, and in general was very tight. It had a Queen Size bed and a 3 cushion couch tucked near the window. Not much room to put any large luggage without it obstructing your walkway to and from the door and bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the TV was a pleasantly large HD flat screen. My particular view being on the 12th floor overlooked the backside of the neighboring buildings and street. So not a very awe-inspiring view, but then again it wasn't a special room in the historic tower nor a suite. The concierge were well informed and found information with extreme ease and speed. I recommend walking to Trump tower and if it isn't the winter time definitely check out the architecture tours down the Chicago River. Check out was very easy through Instant Service on your phone, simply leave the card keys in the room after they verify any additional charges and at 12:00PM. Overall, the Intercontinental is one of the prettier hotels in Chicago, but it's most attractive feature is its centralized location to the downtown shopping area. Some negatives are the unusually small lobby for such a nice hotel and small rooms with the small refrigerator stuffed with high-priced booze instead of leaving space for personal boissants. If you are into shopping and want to see the architecture and cultural center of the city this should be a definite place to stay for under $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelers045
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for the Thanksgiving Holiday with other family members. Service was wonderful, room and all the amenities very comfortable. We had the holiday dinner and wine pairing in Zest and also found it to be excellent quality and quantity, as were the morning buffet breakfasts. The package we booked also included the valet parking which worked very very well.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: RDisney
Reviews.Content: I work for Radio Disney and we were huge sponsors of Mag Mile Lights Festival so I stayed at the Intercontinental Chicago for 2 nights. My family joined me on the 2nd night. My room had the most amazingly comfortable king bed that I truly appreciated as I wa onmy feet about 15 hrs each day. My daughter is a competitive swimmer and just loved the chance to swim in a pool with such rich history. On Sunday afternoon her and I had Tea at Zest where we overlooked Michigan Ave. and recounted all the fun things we had done over the weekend. Kingson Kok, the Restaurant and Bar manager was so lovely and answered all our questions about the history of the Intercontinental Chicago and suggested that we come back for the self guided tours that they offer for free. We fully intend to spend more time here. The next time we are going to make sure we have more time to shop especially since Nordstroms is directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, room so-so....”
Reviews.Author: Laineylop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my partner for 3 nights at the beginning of November when Chicago was basking in glorious sunshine and the election reached its conclusion (and the city went in to celebration mode). I chose the hotel purely on location and was not disappointed. In fact, the location exceeded my expectations. For a first time visitor to the city it was immense. Some impressive architechture and excellent shopping on your doorstep. It's also very close to the departure point of the Chicago Architechture Foundation river cruise which I would highly recommend. For a first timer, it was perfect. The hotel lobby is impressive and the much talked about pool is stunning and was not very busy when we went for a swim, so we were very happy with the hotel itself and the amenities, albeit if I was a gym user I would have been less pleased as the fitness facilities weren't great for a hotel of this class. The room rate, which I booked through a UK hotel website, was also reasonable compared to other hotels in the city, particularly considering the location. However, our room, which was in the modern part of the hotel, was just OK. We requested a king bed and received 2 doubles which wasn't an ideal start to our vacation but we were too tired to request a move. The cleanliness of the room could have been better and we had some issues with the electrics which we persevered with but should have reported. Overall, I was more than satisfied with my stay at the IC Chicago but that was primarily due to location and not the quality of the room itself. If I hadn't received such a cheap rate for the room then I would have definitely complained about the room we were allocated and requested to change. All in all, it was an excellent choice and one I would recommend, mainly to first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BethanyMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Great location. Concierge very helpful... Room was clean, but not spotless... Found some dust. Very good quality for the price you pay. $50 to park the car is honest price... note that you can leave car there from noon to 5pm of following day. Phone, snacks, water are not included and very very expensive... you can though go to Starbucks right near the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: No_1_Derbyshire_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the IC Chicago on November 7 for 5 nights. We had booked a standard room but were upgraded to a huge suite which was amazing. The service in the hotel is superb and on the one occasion that we ate at the hotel it was very good. The pool is free to residents and open very early til very late. The concierge service is the best of anywhere I've stayed and they have an encyclopaedic knowledge of restaurants in the area without consulting any books or maps. Within a couple of blocks of the hotel are several outlets of the Corner Bakery which is a great place to go for breakfast if you're on a budget but also want fresh food. It does everything from eggs to bagels to porridge for breakfast plus all kinds of things for lunch etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and energy in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: vastrauss
Reviews.Content: We spent the night in the historic tower on a Saturday night. We had a gift certificate and used it to celebrate a birthday. The lobby was lively and inviting. Several weddings were going and there was a lot of traffic, but the lobby did not seem overly crowded. Our check in was swift, our request to change to a king room was accommodated without incident. The room was very spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel location is right in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. Loads of restaurants, shopping, parking nearby. We enjoyed our stay so much that we are looking into holding a 50th anniversary party at this location. The pool is also beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: ksp93
Reviews.Content: We took the Amtrak from Lincoln, IL to Chicago on 11/2/08. Arrived at hotel by 10:30 a.m. and were able to have early check in. Room was very nice, but small. Built in couch located directly below the window. We could see Navy Pier, otherwise view was tops of other buildings. Bathroom was adequate - also on the small side. We were attending the noon Bears game, so took cab to Soldier Field. First time at SF - seats were 2 rows from the top! Took cab back to hotel and freshened up, headed to hotel lobby bar. Very lively, nice bar. Good size drinks, friendly bartender. Decided on Gibson's Steakhouse for dinner. We didn't have reservations, but were told a table would be available in 15-20 minutes. Went to bar and ordered drink and table was ready. Both husband and myself ordered steak. Very good meal, but felt a bit rushed. The next day we decided to do some shopping and looking around. Stopped at Ditka's for a Bloody Mary - one of the best I've had! More shopping and then on to the Billy Goat Tavern for a cheeseburger. More walking and back to the hotel to pick up luggage and took cab to Amtrak. Had heard how great Garrett's Popcorn was, but no one had been able to tell us where it was. Cab driver to Amtrak found it and stopped for me to run in and get carmel/cheese corn combo. I have to agree with Cab driver - a bit buttery for my taste! The staff at the InterContinental was great. Very friendly and helpful. We booked this room through Hotwire, and for the money, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on all counts”
Reviews.Author: lawm0m
Reviews.Content: I took my daughters on an American Girl Weekend to Chicago. The Intercontinental had a package giving us a discount, doll beds (one free to take home), and cookies and milk at night. The room was impeccably clean. The staff was very helpful. Room service was excellent, fast and hot. The hotel dining room had good food and warm service. The pool is amazing! You feel transported to another time in the pool area and is very magical. The location is good and although other hotels may be closer to American Girl Place at its new site in Water Tower Place, this one is across from Nordstrom and is just a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: uscfan1325
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from a four level mall, the Shops at North Bridge, anchored by Nordstrom's. There is a Starbucks in the hotel and a Panera Bread close by. We stayed in the historic tower in room 1404 and our room was huge. My daughter and hubby upgraded to a corner room for the better view, but their room was much smaller, although still very spacious. The room service is expensive. I had a twenty eight dollar club sandwich, fruit, and about 1/4 cup of coleslaw. 18 percent tip and a service charge is added. From the 14th floor foyer you can see the beautiful historic pool, nicknamed the Johnny Weismuller pool. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: metroman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed four nights at the Chicago Intercontinental Hotel on a trip combining business and pleasure and enjoyed our visit enormously. From the reservationist, who was the most polite, professional and helpful that I've ever encountered, to the room itself, which was small, but clean, well maintained and very comfortable, we had a very nice stay. The concierge made a winning recommendation for a restaurant on our first night, the only night for which we didn't have a preexisting reservation for dinner, and he also gave spot-on advice about navigating the train and bus system on the one day that we wanted to travel across town. The room was ready on time, very nicely maintained and the bed was quite comfortable. A digital signal on the LCD TV would have been nice, but for location, cleanliness and professional treatment the Intercontinental is high recommended. We will definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mwalsh8
Reviews.Content: Our company regularly stays with the InterContinental in Chicago's beautiful downtown shopping district. They have a wonderful way of making us feel comfortable and cared for, even on our repeated extended stays. We come back year after year, and the cost is usually not much more than the generic hotel chains. Lovely accommodations, caring staff, and a wonderfully unique facility make it a pleasurable stay again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: KO_Boston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Chicago for three nights last week. I'm a frequent business traveler and my experience at this property defininately far exceeded my expecations. The hotel staff was welcoming, the rooms were large, recently decorated and quite stylish, and the hotel gym and pool were tremendous with flexible hours and new equipment (unfortunately, this is not always the case with hotel gyms). The location of this property is amazing. There is a lively hotel bar, a starbucks and a chocolate/wine bar, all in the lobby. Surrounding the hotel are numberous restaurants and up-scale shopping. This is a terrific location for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: katie8471
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is grand. It has an interesting history. The rooms are a bit on the small side and no microwave, but the comfort was great and the room was very clean. The pool is like a step back in time. I took pictures but didn't swim in it. The location of this hotel can/t be beat! It is right in the heart of shopping and eating. It is walking distance to Navy pier. It is a short trolley ride to the museums. The view was outstanding and can't be beat. I watched the sunrise over Lake Michigan every morning. Incredible. Mostly I am easy to please, but the inability to reheat leftovers was annoying. We had to eat out EVERY MEAL. The fridge was stocked and overpriced(like 4 dollars for a bag of M n Ms and 6,95 for bottled water). So we couldnt use the fridge either. My bedroom at home might be bigger than the room was. The tv was large and flat screen and awesome for watching tv but we didnt watch a lot of it. Too busy seeing the sights. Overall it was neat but I have stayed at other places that were even better and DIDN'T cost an arm and a leg per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Experience the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: Cross0149
Reviews.Content: While my stay was associated with business travel, when I return for a personal vacation I will consider staying at this hotel. It is in a great location for shopping and dining and the staff is very courteous. An enjoyable experience overall on alll 3 visits.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joan08029
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable, safe, and perfectly located for visiting the Navy Pier, Art Museum, the shops on MIchigan Avenue...etc. The pool is large, there is a sauna and a work -out room, and the staff offers great service. We have stayed at the InterContinential before and always try to book it when spending time in Chicago. The rooms are well equipped, beds are comfortable, and we find it the place where we have been the most comfortable when staying in this busy city!

Reviews.Title: “Who's been staying in my hotel room? Room cleaning breakdown”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: This doesn't happen often: you unpack, get settled in and then notice in the bathroom that there is debris in the trash can. And then, as you study the situation, you see debris from a shower -- the hotel shampoo bottle, the wrapper from the soap bar, etc. And then, still taking the bathroom in like a first time trip to a crime scene, you notice a used bar of soap in the bathtub. YUCKK. If it hadn't been the middle of the night, I would have rejected the room, but I was too exhausted to think and simply went to bed. I had a second breakdown in the one meal I sought: dessert. I ordered two items. Only one came, and after a wait, I prodded the staff into action. The workout room was a B- at best: About 12 pieces of equipment. I was able to get a treadmill. But the ICH charges $12 for the privilege of a workout. Memo to ICH: this is a problem at 530am when I don't have cash -- now I have to choose between exercise and the additional charge on my bill which I will have to break down when I get home as a personal charge. Thanks a lot -- I don't generally take cash to a nice hotel workout joint. The hotel room I was given was not for a second honeymoon. I opened the prison-like window drapes only to find a sticker that read something like: "Do not open window swarms of bugs outside" Nice. I do not believe, based on my stay that this is a five star hotel. I am at 3.5 stars at best. This great chain is really coasting on it in Chicago. Michigan Ave address isn't worth this. I will keep looking in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BraddyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. My 29th floor room was really spacious and well equipped, with great views over the city. Breakfast was very complete and with a good selection of everything. Service was up to the expected standard of the Intercontinental. Only the afternoon/evening barman was rather unfriendly. However, all in all a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The everything you could ask for hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Verle
Reviews.Content: The place to stay in Chicago is with out a doubt the InterContinental on Michigan Ave. From the moment you pull up, till the time you are ready to leave, you are greeted with a smile, a "Hello, how are you", and all of the help you could ever use! They strive to make sure that you have the most relaxing stay in a hotel that you have ever had. Cleanliness is a very big issue with my wife and I, and they hotel passed with flying colors. The hotel is also in a perfect location. You can walk out the front door to Michigan Ave and the "Magnificent Mile", the numerous restaurants, Navy Pier, The Theater District, and many other great points of interest. This all adds up to a fantastic time in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JOANN65
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were on a shopping weekend and stayed at the InterContinental in Chicago. It was the best location for exactly that. We also were in a location that provided many wonderful choices for dining. We walked everywhere because of this great location. The staff was warm and friendly. We were taken on a mini tour of the original section of the hotel. There were robes in the room, which believe me at the end of the day they were so welcome. The hotel has a magnificient swimming pool, which is a must see. When we travel to Chicago again, we will definitely stay at the InterContinental it was a pleasure for us to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ICH in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Rico_Sauve
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago therefore we had to rely on Tripadvisor comments to help determine where we were going to stay. Once again, tripadvisor proved to be a valuable resource and we were not disappointed when we arrived at this hotel. We stayed in a room on the 35th floor in the Historic Tower (upgarde required) but found our room a bit on the small size - the view was spectacular! Don't get me wrong, the room was more than adequate and very well appointed, we just wanted more space to stretch out. The front desk staff were very accommodating and moved us down to the 23rd floor (again in the Historic Tower). The room was much larger but the view not as spectacular - we gave up one thing for another so just be aware of this. Now that I have that housekeeping (no pun intended) out of the way, this hotel, although showing her age a bit, is a classy old dame that is filled with historic design and architecture. The service we received from the staff was excellent. They were friendly, very professional in their duties, and most important to us they were knowledgeable. We had many questions and they had the answers we needed - especially the Concierge' on duty. This hotel is right smack dab in the middle of it all and most everything that you need to do or see is within walking distance - shopping, theatre, night life, and more. There are some very modern and upscale hotels in this area but there is a warmth and charm that welcome you and make you feel comfortable at the Intercontinental. When we come back to Chicago, and we will be back, the Intercontinental Hotel is where we will stay..

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: sdoyle2000
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. The InterContinental is the place to stay if you want an excellent experience exploring downtown. From its great location to its great accommodations, the place has it all. Walking through the front door you know you are at a place that values your time. They quickly get you checked into your room. Once in your room, you will notice most have great views of the Chicago skyline/shoreline. The rooms are modern and do not "feel" old. The bathrooms are large and bright and the showers are hot! The Olympic size swimming pool is definitely something that you should at least view. It is even better if you take a swim as you can sense the history of the marble surfaced pool. The work out facilities are also top notch. Once you are done working out, the bar is definitely a happening place for happy hour as it always has many people sitting and talking. The restaurant is very good, but there are other places to explore in Chicago. Now getting to the location of the place. You are on the magnificent mile and can easily walk up and down Michigan Avenue or can head down to Navy Pier. During the summer there are fireworks and if you are lucky enough to get a room that faces Lake Michigan, you will see a spectacular show. The "L" is only a few blocks away which can take you down to Wrigley Ville or back to Midway Airport. Great experience all around and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Great Service”
Reviews.Author: davidnap
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service. Great location. Nice bar. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadridMadrid
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous opinions mostly good about this hotel. Excellent location both for tourism and shopping around. Very fine rooms though smaller bathroom than expected. Friendly staff but no exception for a later check out without paying extra 30 $ (even if you only needed 30 minutes after expected check out at 12:00). Excellent beds. Great indoor pool and sauna at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Wineflight
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is a consistently reliable hotel with a great location. We have stayed at the hotel several times while in Chicago and have been pleased with the service, cleanliness, and location. The hotel has a nice bar, however, the wine bar adjacent to the hotel (accessible from inside the hotel), is a great place for relaxing and enjoying an extensive wine list, cheese, and olives. We bypassed breakfast at the hotel in favor of the Corner Bakery across the street, which has a decent breakfast selection, good quality food, and great coffee. Previous stays have been without any complaints or issues. On this stay, the only complaint was when we called the guest service "hot line" and requested a bell hop to meet us in the room to help us with luggage for check out, we waited for a fairly lengthy time, and after retrieving our car, checked at the bell hop stand and the bell hop stand had not received the request, so we had to wait for a longer period of time, making us late leaving for an appointment. The staff members were courteous and apologized for the delay. The Intercontinental is a good choice for a business or pleasure stay in Chicago. Our experience with the hotel and staff overall has been very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Homely Base to Explore Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jacko002
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel, North Michigan Avenue, Chicago is such a fantastic hotel to use as a base to explore the vibrant city of Chicago! This is now my forth stay and no matter what the time of year is, I have always been greeted with a friendly smile (from the doorman to reception, chambermaids to bar/waiting staff) The Staff here are second to none. Bedrooms are excellent with just the right amount of luxury and to say my room overlooked North Michigan Avenue, there was very little traffic noise. And well what can I say about the Breakfast - it's to die for! Whether I had the fantastic buffet selection or the freshly made waffles. It was heaven ! ! Having business customers with me it is reasurring to know that both their needs and mine are being catered for. Additionally the Concierge was a great help assisting me with restaurant reservations and tourist information. Including a more unusual request for the local fire department. (As one of my customers had been in the UK fire service and had a dream to sit in a Chicago fire truck) - what a great experience! All in all, I can't praise this hotel more highly, a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Well-meaning but laughably poor service in this Intercontinental in name only”
Reviews.Author: boraborabob
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying in the Intercontinental Chicago and, having stayed at the Intercontinental Kowloon twice, and the Grand Intercontinental Seoul once this year, it is puzzling to me that this is part of the same chain. The Kowloon and Grand are spectacular with outstanding service (the Kowloon has what is probably the best view of any hotel in Hong Kong - even better than the Peninsula, another fantastic hotel in Kowloon). The Chicago Intercontinental is mediocre at best, with some well-meaning but laughably poor service and a management team that is in deep denial regarding what is required to be a true first-class hotel (or even a middle tier business class hotel). It started at check in: I always request a quiet, king, non-smoking room. They gave me a room with two twin beds facing Michigan Avenue. Okay, fine - sometimes that's how it works out. But I don't expect any Intercontinental to have paper-thin walls allowing me to hear normal conversations in adjoining rooms, as one has here in Chicago. Then I called to have some clothes pressed for my meetings the next day. Three calls later they had yet to pick up my clothes, and kept telling me that I needed to fill out the laundry request form, refusing to hear that there was no such form, nor the normal laundry bags, in the closet. I finally had to leave the clothes on the bed in order to make it to the restaurant on time. I discovered on my return that the clothes had been picked up, but instead of simply being pressed, as I had requested, they had sent them out to be dry cleaned. Perhaps they are looking for additional revenue? (more on that below) We'll see if I get them back in time for my meetings in the morning - but my confidence is not high. Then comes the business center. They have one, but it doesn't have a copier, the printers don't work, and there is no one available to help fix them. The best they can do is suggest you try printing from all the PC's in the business center, where one is charged a minimum fee just to log in and discover that one is unable to print from any of them. As a result, they get to charge you to log in to all their computers, but then go back to the front desk where they charge you again for the privilege of making black and white copies of the deck you needed in color. Must be a great marginal money-maker for them, along the same lines as the airlines charging $10 for those disgusting appetite suppressants they call food in what has become nothing short of peasant class. Oh yes, and now it is close to midnight, and, despite trying to get 15 simple decks printed at 9:30 PM, I still don't have them. Finally, my patience at an end, I provide some feedback to the hotel management and get whiney excuse after excuse about why none of these things are their responsibility, in a tone that suggests they are doing me a favor by providing any service at all. A true first-class hotel will at least step up and own the facts, but not the Intercontinental Chicago - they are just hapless victims of a cruel landscape over which they have no control whatsoever. Avoid this hotel if you can - Chicago is packed with other hotels that charge the same rate for fantastic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “LOved the pool and the professional reception”
Reviews.Author: OdysseusSanFelice
Reviews.Content: I have been enthusiastic about my recent stay at the Intercontinental Chicago, convenientely located on the "Magnificent Mile". I have really appreciated the warm and professional reception, with the staff always ready to assist you. Try the "old style" swimming pool next to the convenient gym facilities. And, after dinner, don't forget to drop by the new "Wine and cheese bar" , a pleasant and tasty experience in beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an old girl.”
Reviews.Author: Buellrider
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest hotel in Chicago I was expecting something grand, and found it, almost. Whilst all the service was there there were a few cracks in the paintwork which made me think that the old lady could use just a little more loving care. Overall the fabric and ambience were great and the amenities were very good but I resented paying for internet access when I was paying big buck for what was, at the end of the day, quite a small room. Ah yes, that room, it realy was quite pokey and the bathroom looked well used. The comfort factor was there though. Hotel services were fantastic, room service was excellent in both prices and the very quick time it took them to produce anything day or night. The restaurants were superb. Loaction is ideal but I didnt like having a Starbucks almost right in the lobby. Overall, if you are staying in Chicago and dont mind spending a few bucks this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A bunch of theives”
Reviews.Author: jcissweet
Reviews.Content: Recently the company I work for held a HUGE event at this hotel and I went. I made the mistake of letting the valet park my car and they STOLE money out of my vehicle. I discovered this fact as I pulled out of the garage. I called Yosef the garage manager of STANDARD PARKING who assured me he would investigate and he or his boss would call me in the am. NO ONE called. I called back the next day only to find that they were screening their calls and no longer accepting mine, I have called several times since and still NO ONE will talk to me. I have talked to the front desk manager who informed me that the valet "is not a part of the hotel" and though they would investigate they had no authority to punish the thief/thieves. I have since notified my company only to find out that I WAS NOT THE ONLY VICTIM. SO TRAVELERS/TOURIST BE WARE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: smvs_princess
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous and VERY accomodating. Check in was not until three so we tried to drop our bags off at the hotel because we had an early flight into Chicago. The staff was extremely friendly... they let us check in at 9:30 in the morning and upgrade our room. The room was comfortable, clean, and had a great view of the surrounding area. They did charge $12 a day for the fitness center (which I thought was outrageous). Good thing we did a lot of walking. I would highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pretty & Historic”
Reviews.Author: NYCDiane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year when accompanying Hubby on a trip he needed to make for work. I was on my own during the day while he attended a conference. Neither of us had been to Chicago before. We stayed four days. The InterContinental is in the perfect location. It's next to the beautiful Chicago Tribune tower, with all those fascinating little rocks embedded in its outside wall. A short walk down the street and you're at the Michigan Avenue Bridge, which you can stroll over to explore what lies across the river. Head in a different direction and you can walk to Navy Pier. Another direction, the historic Water Tower and other sightseeing. Of course, being right on the Mag Mile, shopping is close at hand -- with Nordstrom's directly across the street! I had gotten blisters from my sandals on my first day walking all over town and needed to buy more forgiving shoes for the rest of the trip, so having a mall so close was very convenient for me. Our room was small but very cozy. We didn't have much of a view, but that didn't really matter to me, as I spent most of my days out and about. The furnishings were rich and sumptuous, the bed extremely comfy and clean. A small sofa was situated against the window, and we had a fridge to use. We didn't get to use the pool in the hotel, but we checked it out and it's very nice. The hotel staff was very helpful whenever I stopped for recommendations or directions. We both became enamored with the city and will be back again, to explore some more -- four days is not enough! We'll probably see if we can get a room at the InterContinental again. In fact, Hubby did go back to Chicago alone on a subsequent trip and stayed at the InterContinental a second time and he liked it. When we stayed here together, we were both very happy with our room, the service, cleanliness, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most orderly hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Traci_S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip last week. I was originally given an adjoining room (which I thought was odd since I was travelling alone), but had no problem with changing the room once I went down to the front desk to request one. The room was fairly nice upon initial inspection. However, that afternoon I was unhappy to find that the shower had slow drainage (gross). Also, my bed linens were not changed during my (2 night )stay - I thought that was bad hosiptality to say the least. Finally, my hotel receipt had the wrong name on it (as well as charges) and I had to get that corrected upon checkout. Not sure how that happened. The reservations agent wasn't too friendly when I brought it to his attention. Overall, I will probably not stay here again if I have to go back to Chicago and I would probably not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Intercontinental Hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Swissdiver
Reviews.Content: My first contact with the Intercontinental was a shock: USD 50 per day of parking! Must be the fact the hotel is located on Michigan Avenue. I then checked in and got my usual upgrade (I am Intercontinental Ambassador for more than 10 years). They gave me the suite No 4000. To get there, a first lift took me to the 38th floor, then another small one to the 40th. It opens directly on the room's door as it is located in the penthouse. As a result, I had a 360 degrees view. Quite a treat! I then decided to have a swim in the 80 years old pool, where Johnny Weissmuller was preparing his Olympic Gold medals races. Then there is an historical tour within the hotel to be sure not to miss anything spectacular. And of course a Intercontinental level of services at all stages and a fully fledged rooms with the delicate amenities one can expect from a *****. In short, a great ***** hotel, extremely well located, carrying a lot of history where to stay for business or for pleasure. P.S.: Make sure you book a room in the historical building!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: Loved it! What a classic look. Beautiful rooms and gorgeous pool..Even if you're not planning on swimming, must take a look at it! Excellent location on Miracle Mile,,Walking distance to everything! Free Trolley right there. Very easy to get there from airports..If not using car service..Take the train to the bus and go 3 stops and it drops you off right in front of the hotel. Starbucks & wine, Chocolate & cheese lounge right in hotel. The building itself is historical.

Reviews.Title: “Not great... not even good”
Reviews.Author: fifi4me
Reviews.Content: Our room was dirty upon check in. Covered in dust, the trash had not been taken out, there were price tags and old papers on the tables andned, and were told that someone would be right up. Someone did come... eventually. But not after a decent amount of time during which we just sat around waiting. Even after the SECOND round of cleaning, the room was still unbelievably dusty. floor, dirty towels and robes in the bathroom, and used soap/shampoo in the shower. We called and asked to have the room clea The decor was cheesy at best, it wasn't quiet, and the hotel charged for everything they possibly could... don't expect to use the pool or WiFi without paying an exorbitant price for it. There were none of the extras that you would expect from a so-called "luxury" hotel. Staff did not go out of their way to provide good customer service. Bottom line... not that nice, too expensive for what you get, and not even clean! They also charged our credit card an extra $300 that they can't explain and seem disinterested in rectifying. I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Times at the Hotel Intercontinental!!”
Reviews.Author: coppertop12
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago for years to celebrate our Annual Girls' Weekend. This hotel has it all! The staff is wonderful, a great bar, coffee in the morning, fabulous in-room robes - all located on The Fabulous Miracle Mile! There is nowhere else in Chicago I would rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: ReconChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days while attending Lollopalooza music festival. One of the best locations in Chicago, on Michigan Ave near the Tribune and Sun-Times buildings. An easy walk or bus ride to many attractions. The King sized room was very nice, not large, but with a generous bathroom. Service was excellent throughout. Check out the awesome swimming pool, straight out of twenties.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again When I Return To Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: palmspr_flyer
Reviews.Content: Arrived earlier than check-in, and was able to get my room right away. That was a plus! Room was nicely appointed and had plenty of room, including a nice loveseat near the windows. Nice Flat screen TV worked great. Bathroom was large and very nice soaps etc. Also, Coffee maker in the bathroom was nice for an early morning cup of coffee. The location was ideal for going up Michigan Avenue to all the stores!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: RonT58
Reviews.Content: We happened to stay twice at the hotel within two weeks, first for 4 days in a suite and at the end of our holidays trip another day in a standard room, before we went home. The first stay was excellent: beautiful room, good service and we enjoyed a few great breakfasts, especially notable was the friendly mexican cook who baked us excellent omelettes and even brought his own, home-made sauce. We also really enjoyed Eno, a wine / cheese / chocolate lounge inside the hotel. The second stay was so so: our standard room was - of course- much smaller, but also quite noisy and there was no way to reach the lobby level by stairs (although we had asked for that). The restaurant was completely empty and the uninterested waitress / receptionist did no attempt whatsoever to get us on-board (maybe she wanted to go home early that evening, guess she succeeded, we went to Copperblue, just around the corner). The next afternoon, we found the bar staff equally uninterested, one of the waiters even downright blunt. On the other hand, all of the bell waiters we met were helpful and fun and the hotel lobby - and the entire building for that matter - has a great atmosphere. And you can't beat the location, right on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “For the Price, Should be Better”
Reviews.Author: wjschmonsees
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Intercon is a pretty hotel in a great location, but the rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are like something you would expect in a budget hotel. The front desk did allow us to check in early (just before noon), but they sent us to an incorrect room which required us to carry all our belongings to a new room and go back down for new keys. The TV didn't work, which required a disruptive call by a maintenance man. The valet parking charge was ridiculous -- $50 overnight. I was also upset to have to pay for internet access: it's 2008 folks, why are business hotels still treating internet access as if it's some exceptional service that their customers should have to pay extra for? Internet service should be assumed to be included in every hotel, just like hot water. At least the staff were fairly friendly, which was a bright spot. The Concierge was very helpful, taking a good deal of her time to steer us to a couple of excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrvlrs
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at the Intercontinental in Chicago. It did not live up to the reputation set by other Intercontinentals we had stayed in before (including one in the third world). When we arrived, our first set of room keys did not work. After returning to reception and getting a second set of keys, we were yet again unable to get into our room. We were told to wait outside our room and that security would let us in. So, at a four-star hotel we ended up sitting on the floor waiting (with all our luggage, because the bell hop was faster than security). After security let us in, we had to wait again for a mechanic to check our door lock (which was fine) and then fetch us a third set of working keys. Our room itself was mysteriously damp, with peeling wallpaper throughout. At 4 AM, our mini-bar fridge made a screeching noise that wouldn't stop and could be heard through closed doors. We called reception and had to wait for a mechanic to show up and fix the problem. The only compensation the Intercontinental management was willing to offer was free breakfast, which we could not take advantage of due to a long road trip ahead of us. We would not suggest the Intercontinental in Chicago for those truly expecting a four-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PRERIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in Chicago for a long weekend get away. It couldn't have been better! The location is perfect, the rooms are very nice and the service outstanding. The rooms are very clean and the beds are like sleeping on a cloud. The front desk took care of all of our needs including moving us to another room for a better view, with no hassles. We went to lunch and they moved everything to another room with an incredible view. The lounge is a great place to end the night out, nice atmosphere and great snacks. Everyone in the hotel aims to please, this was our second stay at the Intercontinental and we will definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: redbird1Peoria
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Intercontinental for a weekend birthday get-away. We stayed in the Historic Tower (31st floor, far east side) with an unbelievable view of the Chicago river and Lake Michigan/Navy Pier. Room was very clean and quiet. The front desk was extremely helpful in providing local maps, calling restaurants for reservations, and answering all questions. The treatment we received - by any and all staff, front desk, fitness center attendant, etc was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AggieGirl02
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a hotel with an entrance on the Magnificent Mile, I would recommend this hotel. My husband and I booked our room on hotwire.com and got a wonderful rate over the 4th of July holiday. We had probably the smallest room in the hotel, but it was clean and extremely quiet. The bathroom was a nice size that easily allowed two people to get ready at one time. The room had a large flat-screen television, a desk large enough to do work, and a decent sized closet. I was impressed with the bed -- soft, but not too soft. The staff was pleasant and not too in-your-face. If you are high-maintenance and want the staff to constantly greet you and ask you if you need anything, this might not be the place for you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago, especially if you want a location in the middle of it all. It is an easy walk to great shopping, the Hancock Tower, and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: dr-dom
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel (on the Magnificent Mile). Nice building -- at least the old part, which was built in 1929 as the luxury 'Medinah Athletic Club'. The hotel also has a 'new' wing (built in the early 1960s), which is much less of an architectural highlight. My room was in the new wing -- there seems to be a premium to stay in the old wing and I had booked one of the cheapest rooms in the hotel. Nevertheless, my room was quite spacious, well-equipped and reasonably stylish. The room was at the back of the building on the 16th floor and I had a bit of a view onto Lake Michigan. I enjoyed the use of the 'junior olympic swimming pool' (free for residents) on the 14th floor of the old wing -- I almost had it to myself on the two occasions that I went there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Nice location, right on the Magnificent Mile in the midst of all the stores and action. Walking distance to the Navy Pier (about 15 minute walk). Down the street from Millenium Park and the Art Institude. Right outside the door is the trolley and bus stops to get anywhere you desire. Couple blocks from Grant Park and river cruises. Lots of restaurants and shops all around. The room was very clean, beds were comfortable, great view from our room. Service was great, fast check in and easy checkout. They charge for a late checkout, but will also hold your bags if needed at no cost. I would stay again without any hesitation. We loved our stay and I recommend to all my friends and family. You won't be disappointed with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, dependable 4-star, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: mfhstid
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that, for the most part, provides the standard 4-star experience. Rooms, in the more modern tower where I stayed, are presentable and dependable, but unremarkable in most respects. There's little sense of luxury about the place, although that might not be the case for rooms in the historic tower. Some might find them a little on the small side, but that's the price you pay for such a central location, right on North Michigan Avenue. The one major downside, as other reviewers have commented, is the absurd range of additional charges the hotel levies. While these kinds of add-on are not uncommon in other hotels, it's irritating to be charged $12.95 per day for internet access (which really should be free nowadays) or $12 for the gym (a pretty dowdy affair), led alone the predictably ludicrous array of charges for the in-room extras ($5.95 for a bottle of water). All of that said, there's no reason to avoid this hotel, if you can secure it at a decent rate. Equally, though, there's certainly no reason to pay top-dollar to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “location and luxury”
Reviews.Author: snorkel-luvin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is truly in the best location, the Intercontinental is it--right on the Magnificent Mile, next to the Chicago River, across from the Wrigley Building. My daughter and I stayed here for a getaway, and quickly were able to get to Milennium Park, shopping, Navy Pier, great dining, exploring festivals and strolling through beautiful areas along the lakefront and Chicago River. Check-in was easy and we were treated with courtesy throughout our stay. Maria, one of the concierges, was especially helpful in finding us a unique place to eat. The room was lovely and comfortable, although our tub didn't drain well. Just a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: North-Yorkist
Reviews.Content: We had a superb suite in the Historic Tower, it was extremely spacious and comfortable. The staff, from the trainee check in clerk onwards, were very helpful. The buffet breakfast was extensive and of good quality and was easily the best we had on this visit to the U.S.. The location at the south end of the Magnificent Mile was convenient for most attractions. Reading some of the other reviews I almost wonder if I stayed in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: James41Jackson
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel is centrally located in dwontown Chicago. It was walking distance to Navy Pier, Grant Park, Rush Street, and of course is located right on Michigan Avenue. The staff was extremely friendly and the rooms were clean. The valet parking was also very convienvent. For our next trip to Chicago we plan on staying at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Financedude
Reviews.Content: Of the many hotels I have paid a reasonable amount of money to stay in, this is the worst. For this price range they nickle and dime you for everything (workout room, internet, etc.). Other hotels in the area include much more than this hotel that is very much in need of renovation and new management.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the right price...”
Reviews.Author: Ladan84
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an absoulute steal through hotels.com. The hotel is in a great location you can walk to the lakefront, water tower and el stop. The rooms are slightly bigger than average and well appointed. The real dissapointment at the InterContinental is the service. At check in I was told that the fee for incedentals was $100.00 per night, not the $75.00 I was told when I booked the hotel. The Front desk clerk did not apologize for confusion, she simply carried in the transaction, I was not offered the upgrade to the historic tower, nor the bundles of services (telephone, internet, fitness center). The parking service was even worse, there was never a valet after about 11:00 pm I had to walk my keys into the reception desk. For $49.00 a day I wanted there to physically be a valet waiting for me! Housekeeping was efficent but forgetful, as part of the "greening" of this hotel you are given the option of reusing linens/towels during your stay. As someone who tries to be "green" when she can I noftifed my housekeeper that I would keep the same linens/ towels for my 3 night stay. Even so each day she would replace the linens/towels. When I returned home from my stay I noticed a $300.00 charge to my credit card, beacuse I had used no other hotel services other than valet I called to question. After 6 attempts (the accounts receiveable clerk was on vacation, transfered to dead end extentions and being placed on hold to die) I was finally able to speak to the manager on duty, who told be that there was no charge on my account (even though I was looking at the statement) and it was a problem with my bank. After being placed on hold, I was told that I had in fact been charged twice for the room and the charge would be reversed. With no real apology the phone call was ended. The InterContinental is a good hotel if you get it on fire sale, if I was paying the peak season rates of well over $200.00 a night I would have been greatly disappointed. This hotel is a 3 star with 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Fun way to start or end an evening”
Reviews.Author: gointochile
Reviews.Content: Comfortable place to relax with a glass of wine and some truffles. Place features cheese flights ("sensations"), wine flights and truffle flights. There are also wines by the glass and bottle. I would suggest going early evening or late night when not too crowded. Flights come with explanatory cards of what you are eating or drinking. Service was ok. Most people in the place were dressed up, likely coming from another event. We were in more casual dress (pants and shirts). The waiter treated those folks more warmly than us but we didn't mind since we were having a new experience learning about our truffles and wine. Would go again and try the cheese. It is pricy though--$11 for 3 truffles. Next time I would likely just stick with one glass of wine v. a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a few of the things are a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: melasue72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Chicago for a 3 night stay over the 4th of July. The check in was quick but they said he had booked a smoking room with double beds. We had actually booked a non smoking deluxe king room. We had to pay extra to upgrade. Our room was nice and had a nice view. The bathroom was cute and the toiletries were decent. The first day we didn't have housekeeping come in but the 2nd day we did. They forgot to leave washcloths. The robes and slippers were a cute touch. As for the refrigerator in the room...we didn't open it at all. The prices for the snacks and water were pretty outrageous. I even took pictures. $5.95 for a bottle of water!! All in all it was a decent hotel and the stay was nice and convenient to all we wanted to do. The breakfast buffet is very pricey but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “We had some issues.”
Reviews.Author: terrypam
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Intercontinental did not start off well. Upon arrival at 4pm, we were told that our two rooms were not ready and that they would call my cell phone when it was finished. I received a call within 20 minutes stating that one of my rooms was done. For my inconvience, they did upgrade me to a nicer room (junior suite). The luggage did not arrive at the room and I had to call three times to get the luggage to the room. This took over three hours. When the luggage arrived, I was told that they had been to the other room to deliver the luggage but no one was there. Well we would have been there if we would have had the room but it was not cleaned. After all this mess, our first day was pretty much finished. Our room was nice with a great view of the lake. No complaints with the room. It was clean and met our needs. Had to ask for more towels daily as they would only bring 3 towels for a family of four. Parking is very expensive. $49/per night and is not included in the room stay. Take this in consideration when booking. Parking everywhere else that we saw was around $20-30/per night. The hotel is centrally located. Enjoyed the taste of Chicago along with shopping, navy pier and museums/ sears tower. Recommend getting a CTA bus pass to take you around the city. Can get a 7 day pass at the Dominiks grocery store in Chicago for $20 and can ride as much as you like.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wifieluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights during a business trip and would definitely recommend this hotel. The service from the moment we arrived was excellent. Our room wasn't ready upon our arrival and the front desk took my cell number and called me to let me know when I could come back and check in. We had no problem checking our bags with the bell captain while we went shopping. As we were leaving the hotel it started to rain, and the concierge loaned us an umbrella. Our room only had a partial view of the river, but that didn't really bother us as we were hardly in the room. The robe and the slippers were a nice touch as were the upscale shampoo and soaps. It was also nice to be able to print out our boarding passes at no charge in the lobby. Room service was a bit pricey for breakfast ($42.00 for granola, milk, coffee, fruit, and juice) for one person The hotel is in a great location directly across from Nordstrom's in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the miracle mile and a nice older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grinadam
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for an absolute steal on hotwire and then upgraded for $75 a night to a top floor lake-view suite. Great hotel in terms of location and service. Extremely convenient and comfortable hotel. Loved the bathrooms and the fixtures. Its only draw back it is a really physically old hotel. Book it on hotwire (using one of those websites that decode what hotel is what) and then enjoy the luxurious accomodations for what it would cost to stay at a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Michigan Avenus”
Reviews.Author: nflores07070
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this hotel which made it all the more worth it. Our room was very large with a view. The Staff was friendly and very helpful as far as holding our bags while we went shopping, helping us find a place to eat, etc.. The hotel's lobby is beautiful and they even have an airport check in for free so that I was able to print our boarding pass before we left. The pool is grand! I would highly recommend taking a swim while you are there. You will not regret it. We will be staying here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: ByTorSnowCat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the InterContinental for six nights. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to the historic tower with a great view for an additional $50 a night. My first thought was, didn't I pay for the historic tower when I booked with Orbitz? The Front Desk couldn't tell us what we paid for. Oh well... Sure, give us the upgrade since we're here for a week. The room was on the 32nd floor overlooking the Tribune tower and the river. The view was fantastic and the room spacious. There was a couch, chair, very large desk, espresso machine (that didn't work the first few days), nice bed and decent bathroom. Until you try and flush the toilet. You have to hold the handle down for several seconds and then flush again. When pointed out, engineering was sent, but nothing really changed. Why not a euro toilet with extra flush for that extra flush moment? (Note: You get a courtesy VM on your hotel phone asking if everything is okay after a call is made). Day 3 - No toilet paper after maid cleaned room. The stem was bare. Checked the main closet outside of the bathroom (this is where they keep your extra roll) - no toilet paper. Called the help desk and two rolls delivered. Courtesy VM left minutes afterward. Day 4 - Sink clogged. Call engineering. Sink fixed along with courtesy VM. Day 5 - Sink clogged again. I just pulled out the plug and it resolved the issue. Almost daily issue - The room we had on the 32nd floor was near to a conference room that serves both morning and evening events. What this means is that there is banging of tables and chairs (or something) in the hallway outside of the room starting at 6 am for set-up and sometimes until midnight for take down. We didn't complain about this, but keep note of this if you're tempted to stay on this floor for any reason. Another cleaning mistake: A hair from a previous guest was on the shower wall our whole visit. The lobby bar was very nice and the bartender was very personable. We didn't dine at the restaurant or the wine/chocolate/cheese bar. Workout rooms (although we didn't use) look very nice with an assortment of equipment, nice locker room, sauna and towels.
