The pool area is really cool, like you're stepping back in time about 50 years (with lighting a bit dim). Beware though - it is not a play/wade/splash around pool. It's a lap pool, so bring your goggles. I wasn't impressed with the Concierge desk as others have noted. Short, quick, stern answers after waiting in line. We won't stay again. I really appreciated the view that we had and the room itself was very nice for an extended stay. I just expected a lot more pampering at these prices and a lot less mistakes (and noise).

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregh88
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at some of the best hotels in Manhattan, when we visited for Chicago for our nephew's graduation, we had high expectations for this hotel. The rooms were nothing exceptional. They were not well-kept and showing a great deal of wear and tear. If you tried to reach the concierage for a question (because you can't dial housekeeping or maintence directly) you couldn't get through - rang off the hook. Only three small drawers in the room for clothes (if you removed the phone book and bible from the 3rd drawer) . TV was new digital but only had analog signals (ie., fuzzy). Elevators had lould knocking noises or shook on way down. Breakfast was OK, not exceptional. When it was busy on Sunday - very slow service and 1/2 the bins were empty on the brunch buffet. Overall the stafff was friendly and accomodating - although it took 30 minutes to get a bucket of ice delivered ( only ice machines are on the 7th floor of the hotel). Would try another hotel 1st (Ritz Carlton or Hyatt?)

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Chicago is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: mpsportscards
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at hotels in many parts of the world and our very favorite is the Hotel Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue in Chicago. The hotel staff is top-notch. They are very well informed, courteous, extremely polite and friendly. The Concierge group is outstanding and have never steered us in a wrong direction. Our room is always clean and we never have to ask for anything. Every time we go back to Chicago the Intercontinental employees make us feel it's our home away from home. We would reccomend this hotel to anyone (and often do).

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved the property and the service!”
Reviews.Author: sodontld
Reviews.Content: I held a one-day medical education conference at the property and the service that Santos, Banquet Captain, and other provided was excellent. The room was very beautifully decorated and room service was also outstanding. I will definitely return to this property! Also, the service rendered by the sales staff, Andrew Rottman and company was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night during my stay at Chicago. Booked it at Hotwire and gotten a good offer considering the location of the hotel. I am surprised that the hotel is ranked 40+, considering that the room was pretty good and the bed was comfortable. It is along the magnificent mile and is accessible to different places. The hotel had a rich history, do check out the indoor swimming pool, reminds me of the old pool in the 60s. Do consider this hotel if you plan to visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: dangerpre
Reviews.Content: From the start this was a good stay. The front desk staff were pleasant and very accommodating with my early check-in. The room was decent and well distributed. Overall, this was nothing less than I would expect at an Intercontinental property. The location was awesome with everything a few steps away, literally. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased”
Reviews.Author: rose4jc2
Reviews.Content: Check-in went smoothly but since we arrived so late (11 pm) there were no non-smoking rooms available with king size beds as we had requested so we took a non-smoking room with 2 doubles. A full size bed just isn't comfortable for the two of us so we each took a bed, not a big deal but I wish we would've arrived earlier to claim a king. We stayed in the new building on the 20th floor. We inquired at check-in about getting a room with a mini-fridge and the front desk clerk told us to request a fridge from housekeeping. They delivered one to our room the next day and it was free of charge. This saved us from having to go out to eat breakfast every morning since there is no complimentary breakfast at the Intercontinental. We bought cereal and milk and a few other items at the Dominicks around the corner. We were very satisfied with our stay at this hotel, all the employees were very helpful and nice. Just be aware that there aren't many free extras here. Food is expensive, both in their restaurant and by room service, and the goodie basket/mini-bar is of course overpriced. Wireless internet costs over $10 a day, so we left our laptops behind. Use of the fitness center/pool is also expensive so we didn't indulge. We paid $120 per night by booking through Priceline.com, we probably could have gotten an even cheaper rate if we'd waited longer to book but I was worried about getting a good hotel since we vacationed over Memorial Day weekend so I booked early. Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: GovTrips
Reviews.Content: I was on a government trip and this hotel was one of the few good ones with the government rate. Upon check-in I was surprised to be given a special room on the 41st floor which had a elevator entrance, two bathrooms, loads of room, and great views. The hotel staff were outstanding and very friendly and h helpful. The food was great. My only regret was that I hadn't brought someone to share it with.

Reviews.Title: “All of the good, none of the bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Had made reservations at another downtown hotel, based on price, but still read every Intercontinental review, wishing and hoping we could stay there. Shortly before the trip, I found an ad on Travelzoo for the IC for a price less expensive than we were paying for a hotel two blocks off Michigan, and booked it immediately. Got in after an early flight, and the doorman met our taxi. He gave us receipts for the bags, and told us they would bring them to our room when the room was ready, so we were pleasantly surprised when we were told they had a room on the 25th floor ready for us then. We were checked in, and on our way to the room before 11am! AND, our bags beat us to the room! No upsell attempts, no glares because we had booked through a third party website, just a pleasant, quick, and courteous process. The room was small, sure, but no surprise there. It was, however, clean, comfortable, and very well laid out. Not much drawer space, and a beautiful flat screen TV that we put on for a total of 5 minutes to check the weather report. The view was facing the other tower, so nothing great there, but, I wasn't there to sit and look out the window. The room was quiet, even though it backed up to the elevators (didn't hear them, even once). The room was made up perfectly by the housekeeping staff...everything immaculate, everything fully stocked. Beds were extremely comfortable. The location is the prime #1 reason to stay there. Walking distance to everything, and overall, I have to say, this was the best hotel stay I have had in a long time. Highly recommend the Corner Bakery (they are everywhere) and, before you go here, do your homework, read the reviews, and go in with an open mind. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, spendy and great location...”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: Well here we are on the last day of our four day stay over Memorial Day weekend and we have had an overall positive experience here. We paid the extra $50 on the advice of the earlier write-up and are glad we did. The view out the window on the 36th floor is spectacular, esp. room 3603. The folks here have been friendly, much like the city itself. There is one notable exception to this friendliness and that resides at the oENOology bar in the hotel. These people act like rejects from a bad fashion show in their snootiness and indeed the males there are just hostile at the outset. Prices in ENO are high, but the cheese and location is good. Try the Hook Cheddar if must patronize the place. It is great. Otherwise, there are many other places to have that preprandial libation. You cannot beat the location of this hotel for Chicago. The rooms are small. My parents room was like a shoe box. I understand that in the historic tower, it is a grab bag, but given the nick for the room rates, overall I would go another location down the street (Trump, Peninsula...if your wallet can stand the meltdown of your credit cards). If you do stay here, wander the meeting rooms on floors 3-5. They are amazing (the place was built by the Shriners and is quite historic.) Get a view room to be happy.

Reviews.Title: “How to have a great state at the Intercontinental Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJoey
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Intercontental Chicago about 9 times. Most of the items I was booked at the hotel through Priceline, however, I have booked it direct with the hotel on several occassions. Here's how to have a great stay at the Intercontental. BE POLITE TO THE STAFF. They process hundreds of people each day and you'd be surprised how wonderful they are when you walk up with a smile and a hearty hello. I stay at the ICH Chicago a few times a year and I had always paid to upgrade to the historic tower. Always. It's a $50 upgrade, but well worth it, especially if you paid only $100 or so on priceline. When you buy the upgrade, try to get to the hotel right at check-in time and ask to pay for the upgrade. Don't ask for it for free... they never do it. Be very polite and ask for a corner room with a view of the river. However, if you go to chicago more than a twice a year, ask about the Intercontinent Ambassador program. I never join hotel programs, but one of the phone clerks told me it seemed to be a good fit for me. It's $150, but you get the following: 1. Automatically get all your rooms upgraded to the historic tower. I used to pay $50 a night for this 2. Early check-in. Usually they get me in at noon. 3. Fruit, chocolate truffles, and Evian waiting in your room. 4. Late check-out 4pm. Automatically. I love this. 5. You get a FREE weekend night with the purchase of a FRI or SAT night stay. Let me explain how this worked on my first trip when i used it. I bought the program for $150. I booked Memorial Day weekend in Chicago. The city was booked solid, so my cheap room was $229 at the ICH Chicago. But I get upgraded to a $280 room and I got a second night free. Not to mention all the added perks, I saved $330 on my first trip for the $150 program. Plus I'll use it for upgrades throughout the year. Such a good deal if you visit even once or twice a year. Valet Parking is expensive ($50 per day) but the service is impeccable. Internet is also expensive ($15 per day if i remember right)... I wish it was free or maybe a one-time fee regardless of length of stay. Otherwise it's a great hotel with a great staff. Avoid eating at Zest. It's very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Expected so much more”
Reviews.Author: HIT_GUY
Reviews.Content: I am sad to report that the Intercontinental Chicago was a waste of money and my priority club points. I expected so much more from a high end property and received so little. As a priority club Platinum (40+ weeks/year in priority club properties) I had some basic expectations such as express check in, friendly staff, a bathroom bigger than 3' X 3', clean rooms. At check in I had the huffy clerk who complained that she had to merge my record because I was using points and paying for my stay. She never looked me in the eye and made no attempt to be friendly. It went downhill from there. I noticed on several posts that some reviewers recommend getting the ambassadors club membership, but I would not pay a dime for that! I have spent over $21,000 on hotel stays this year so far and should not have to pay a single cent more to get some decent treatment and a decent room. Please heed the warnings of your fellow travelers and DO NOT stay here. I am from Chicago and believe me there are better properties where you will get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_wright07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two days while in town just for fun. We booked through Hotwire and were very pleased with the hotel, especially considering we paid only about $120 USD per night. We arrived at the hotel at about 10:30 in the morning fully expected to have to wait a few hours to check in, but were able to check in promptly. The only problem was that they were going to put us in a room with two double beds. I explained to the man that we supposed to have a king bed, and we would be more than happy to wait. He got a little agitated and told me that I could upgrade, and that if I book online, I am not guaranteed any certain room. I quickly explained that I had called to check my reservation two days prior and a certain girl with reservations had confirmed that I was guaranteed a king bed under my name and that we wouldn't mind waiting until a regular king came available. As soon as I said that, a king "room" popped up and we were in our room in a flash. Other than that, we had no problems with the hotel. Our room was on the 20th floor in the regular tower. It was small as some other reviewers noted, but there was plenty of space for the two of us. I liked the room because it had the feel of a European boutique hotel. The location of this hotel is probably the best hotel for shopping because everything is just right there in front of the IC and you can just head down the mile. We did have one meal (breakfast) at Zest and it was fine. Overpriced like all hotel breakfasts, but it was fine. Nothing spectacular and nothing bad. We had to check about 4 hours before we were scheduled to the airport, so they were able to hold our bags at the bell desk while we shopped some more. This is a great hotel for business and tourists alike.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: atfLondon_England
Reviews.Content: First the good aspects - the rooms in the old tower are excellent - the swimming pool is fantastic ( and the staff in the gym area are great too). The situation of the hotel is tremendous and Chicago is a fabulous city. But, I wasn't able to check in until 9:30pm as the "room wasn't ready" , the dates that the check in people had were wrong and they took some persuasion that I had booked the room I was told that I would have to move room during my as the floors were being renovated - but that the room I was being moved to would be of the same standard - no problem. I was also asked to have my stuff ready for the morning of the move as the staff would move it. I came back later that day to get my new key only to be told that I had "checked out" - after a lengthy discussion I was told that I was still checked in and given a key to another room. The room was half the size of the previous room and next to the lift area - During the time that I was outthe airline rang the hotel to ask them to tell me that my flight had been cancelled - only to be told that I had "checked out" so I missed the revised flight time. - Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced; Bad service; Great location”
Reviews.Author: Noscreennames
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I are currently staying in this hotel on business. The stay has been characterized by bad service and total lack of attention to detail: - No maid service provided for more than 1 full day, despite room service garbage lying around (half eaten food, etc.) - No laundry bags in room - Package shipped to hotel temporarily lost; Hotel requested I pick up rather than delivering to room once found - Room service unable to accept food order temporarily - Front desk clerk insisted on giving 2 keys to 1 person despite repeated requests for 1 key only - Front desk clerk did not provide mini bar key - Doorman provided wrong directions to nearby destination One might say the above are minor (except maybe the maid service) but at the prices charged (> $400/ night) one would expect near perfection and in my experience one would get it elsewhere. The hotel has a great location on Michigan avenue and my room is nice enough, but there are many other hotels nearby including the Swisshotel, Sheraton, Fairmont, Hyatt, and many others.

Reviews.Title: “Had my ipod stolen”
Reviews.Author: guy1974
Reviews.Content: Had my ipod stolen while I was there. Management had me fill out paperwork for a claim. I was then directed to call a number to process the claim where the person would never pick up the phone and would never return a message. They said it wasn't their fault, you were warned not to leave anything valuable not locked up and you can't prove that anything was really stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3jstravel
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at this hotel on Hotwire, and was very disappointed at not only the facility, but the poor level of service. When we drove up, no one came to the car to offer assistance with bags, parking, etc. The 3 of us staggered through the lobby doors with all our bags, while the hotel staff stood and watched. No one tried to even assist with the doors. The lobby is not particularly impressive, low ceilings, nothing distinctive. There were 3 chairs, yes, 3 in the lobby. The front desk person first tried to sell us a more expensive room, when she saw there were 3 people on our reservation. For $50-150 more per night, we could indeed get a nicer room. I wanted to stay with the $130 I was already paying. She said she was giving us a "nice, larger, corner room, with a particial view of the lake." When we opened the door into the room we were shocked at how small it was. There was not even adaquate space to access both sides of the bed. Both beds had about 8 inches of wall clearance. One of us had to crawl in and out from the foot of the bed that night. There was no view of the lake, only the side of highrise condos, nothing but concrete in sight. There is room for ONE suitcase in the room, that is it. If you use the space available for the one, you also forfeit access to the window, as it blocks the narrow passage on that side of the room. The closet is approximately 40 inches wide by 14 inches deep, so very little storage there. We were climbing over our 3 suitcases and several smaller bags the entire time we were there. The bathroom is very small and poorly designed, complete with the type of industrial toilet found in a sports stadium. The toilet was dirty with brown grime around the base and lid. The shower was clean, except for the black mold in spots along the grout. I contacted the front desk to see if a mistake had been made, since this was not the "spacious corner room with a lake view" that I was told of. They would not acknowledge that a mistake had been made, and I was given the same speech on "upgrading" for a fee of $50-$150 if I desired a "nicer room." I tried a third time, a little later, to resolve this issue, but by then I was convinced I was talking to a robot. The same speech on handing over more money if I wanted a decent room for my family. The star rating of 4.5 or 5, depending on which website you are on, is inappropriate for this property. 75% of said "amenities" are not included in the price of your room, therefore they are not true amenities, and must be purchased at additional cost. The final insult were the condoms that are available for purchase in the basket of snacks on top of the mini fridge. My child discovered these along side the $4 Snickers bar and the $6 mini can of Pringles. The Intercontinental rivals Motel 6 for level of service, inadaquate facilities and overall tackiness. (My apologies to Motel 6, as that may be an unfair comparison.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: goreranger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a leisure trip. The hotel is a fantastic location, and bellman/staff at front dest - were all excellent. The room was a king in the historic tower on the 19th floor, quiet, clean - however - way overpriced. I did pay full price for the room, but did not find the "value" of it to be worth it. Amenities are average, not first class which is what they market to the public. The maid service, cleanliness of the room were all great, but beware - there are a lot of hidden costs staying at this hotel - one already pays enough to stay there, but then you have to pay nearly 50.00 to park, 12.00 to use internet, 20+ dollars to workout, plus, plus, plus. Beware of the hidden costs, and book your room though hotwire - they offer no special discounts if you call them directly. For the full price - I expected a lot more. no turn down service, (i'm sure that would have cost extra) - overall a good stay for sure, but if you can somehow get the cost down....you might feel better about your "value" for your dollar during these hard times.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chicago - who cares about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location on the Magnicent Mile, just walk outside and stroll down this street and immediately you notice the overwhelming array of shops and department stores. A shopping paradise for serious shoppers. The open top bus tour (hop on/ hop off) station is also just two minutes away. Check in â€“ We arrived at 5.30am and had booked a room for the previous evening, so check-in was easy and efficient especially at this time of the morning. We did notice later the hotel is extremely busy and queues were often seen. Room- Our room 556 faced Michigan Avenue â€œthe Magnificent Mileâ€� we had no real view as we were placed on the 5th floor. The room had a king size comfortable bed with lovely feather down pillows. A huge plasma TV sat on top of a cabinet and a good size- working desk was handy for catching up on work or e-mails. No broadband but Wireless High-Speed connection, which worked extremely well. A long red sofa bed was placed beside the large windows. Mini bar, safe and wardrobe were also neatly tucked into the comfortable spacious room. The room is not modern but had a 1930â€™s dÃ©cor, which created a soft and cozy atmosphere. The bathroom was standard size with a shower over the bath; good quality Damana toiletries were also generously supplied. Breakfast â€“ The breakfast is located on the second floor in the Zest Restaurant. One can order from a menu or have the hot buffet meal, which also includes a chef-cooking omeletâ€™s. We thoroughly enjoyed every meal. Bars â€“ There is a comfortable lobby bar offering cocktails, beer and wine located just near the reception. Eno is another bar, which is located in the Historical Tower lobby level and offers more than 300 varieties of wine and 35 different types of cheese and a selection of handmade gourmet chocolates. Next door to the hotel is Starbuckâ€™s coffee shop, which we found incredibly handy. Facilities â€“ There is a fabulous heated swimming pool located on the 12th floor in the Historical Tower. The pool is a junior Olympic size with beautiful blue Majolica tiles with a fountain of Neptune on the east wall of the pool. The gym is also located on this floor. An ATM machine is located just near the Business Centre in the Historical Tower on the lobby level. Overall â€“ I have given the Intercontinental Hotel 5 star rating for being a beautiful landmark building located in a prime position in Chicago offering comfortable quality rooms. Thereâ€™s nothing I can say I disliked and we thoroughly enjoyed our five day stay. We actually loved Chicago with its excellent shops/restaurants/cafes it's a fabulous city for any traveller to visit.- highly recommended by Ellemay !! Shops or food - its hard to decide which gets my 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rrayal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and had a vague but favorable recollection of the visit. We stayed in the older part and enjoyed the traditional but updated room. This time our suite was in the newer tower and was not charming or comfortable. The windows were too high for looking out and so dirty that our limited view was obscured. The sofa bed for our daughter was the worst we have encountered. All this for a price that seems much higher than in the past. In spite of the great location, I doubt if we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience -- get the hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: Call_Me_Mister_Fun
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a great hotel, with helpful and pleasant staff. It's in a very central location, just north of the river on Michigan Avenue. The facilities are high quality, and there's a very good wine bar connected to the hotel. But you will normally pay relatively high prices for it. We were fortunate in that we got our reservations through Hotwire and paid a very economic price. One negative: they charge for extras like Wi-Fi and the gym. Other than that, this is an excellent place to stay for a visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: New-England-wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights for a meeting, and I am much happier than most reviewers. My room was a corner room with a king bed. there wasn't a lot of walking area, but everything was here, including a robe and couch. I liked the furniture and decor, and the TV is a big flat screen. The bed and linens were excellent quality. I did not find the staff unhelpful. In fact, I found everyone nice. The wine, cheese, and chocolat bar was really good, and they serve their food in the regular bar area, which made for a pleasant evening. People are right who complain about the hotel charging for everything, but if I paid $100 on hotwire or priceline for this, I would be extremely happy. the workout center is very good, and the pool is absolutely gorgeous - a throw back in time with lots of chairss, tiles, a real deep end. Do not miss this if you are a swimmer. In short - great location, very nice hotel, and a bargain if you get this via a discount broker given everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel........Awesome price through Priceline!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara3672
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. Booked it through price line at $100/night (taxes included). Nice hotel and great location! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: calgary08Canada
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for a week. The hotel was in a wonderful location and the service was great. We found all of the staff very helpful and prompt. We highly recommend the Intercontinental for any travel needs whether it be for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: barbiflys
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with a really neat wine/chocolate/cheese bar adjacent. Our room was clean and quiet. We had a view of the lake which was nice. The pool was gorgeous!!! We didn't use it but we did go down to check it out and were impressed--the pool water was warm. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the hotel charges extra to use the workout room--I thought that was a little lame. The pool was free though. We'd stay there again but I would be disappointed if I paid a lot for the room and then couldn't workout.

Reviews.Title: “Service doesn't come close to 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: erink
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Nice flat screen TV, great view of Magnificent Mile, nice furnishings. We got the room for $79/night through Hotwire. To be honest, I wouldn't stay here again, even if it was $59/night. The service was terrible - the concierge was away from the desk, and no one else would help us find a good place to eat/drink/dance. Finally, someone told us about a great place to go on the other side of town - Sangria. We had a minor with us, and he said that they accepted 18 and older in the club. So, we took the $15 cab trip there, and Sangria told us that it was 21 and up only. So, we went all the way back and complained. We asked the front desk to refund us for the cab rides, but they said that they couldn't do that. They gave us a coupon for a free drink, but by the time we got back from our room, the bar was closed. Everyone behind the front desk except for one person treated us like we were just second rate. On top of all this, EVERYTHING costs extra - even the toothbrush/toothpaste, just in case you forgot yours, costs $2. If you have an endless pocketbook and love to tip generously, I'm sure your stay would be wonderful, but if you're like me, you'll grudgingly hand over $1 by $1 for tipping and extras, adding up to be just as much as you spent on the room originally!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: swtgrad
Reviews.Content: great location! walking distance to many of the chicago hotspots

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great and Priceline folks beware”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 11 a.m. on Friday, Feb 29. Asked for 2 double beds and was told they had absolutely none (at 11 a.m.?). I know this is a chance you take on Priceline, but felt we were *caught* in having to upgrade to a "historic tower room" just to fit a rollaway in the room (we had 3 adults). We had no option to call the front desk bluff except to accept a king bed for 3 women (which honestly we did consider) or pay $50/night to get a bigger room. We still got a great rate and ended up paying less than $100/person for 2 nights. The room itself was nice, but not great. We looked South at another tower (new?) and could see a silver of Michgan Avenue. The bathroom vanity area is TOO NARROW. It's ridiculous in fact unless you're a man or woman w/no hair products, make-up or hair appliances. The outlet situation is worse. There is ONE outlet accessible near a mirror outside of the bathroom (which does have an outlet, but no space to set a hair dryer or curling iron) and it has the nightstand light and clock already plugged in. You can use the mirror in the dark (unplugging the light) or without knowing the time (unplug the clock). Would it kill them to offer a power strip? Another outlet is available nearly behind the tv (no mirror nearby) or by the desk (with NO mirror again). Apparently women aren't supposed to get ready anywhere but the bathroom (with the tiny vanity). The sink drain was locked shut upon arriving and required a call to Housekeeping to open. The promised rollaway (which was to be delivered between 12-1 p.m. per the front desk) was not in the room at 6 and after 1 call by us and 4 callbacks from "Tiffany" (I will give them credit for checking back with us) it arrived near 8 p.m. The service was apathetic for the most part and although the location is perfect and the hotel itself is beautiful (tour the meeting areas on 2-4), I think this is just an average hotel, maybe 3 star, but certainly not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Will return!!”
Reviews.Author: Little_Doll
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was because we were coming from staying in the Embassy for a couple of nights, but I was totally impressed with the InterContinental Chicago. We were in the new tower and the room was small but decorated really cute. Beds were comfy and rooms were clean. You can't beat the location -- within walking distance of everything!! There is even a free trolley that goes to Navy Pier and drops you off literally within steps of the front door. The concierge were very helpful and polite. If you like wine and atmosphere, Eno is a must!! Very, very cool! I got this hotel for $90/night on Priceline so that may be another reason I liked it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: slynsobe
Reviews.Content: I want to be fair. The place is decently decorated, the rooms are clean. But it doesn't feel like a 4 star. The room service meal was cold and wasn't prepared to a culinary delight. Most of the staff was not very professional or courteous. I left feeling like I was at 3 star. The location is great for Michigan Avenue shopping and sites. For those who don't mind lackluster service, the hotel isn't that bad. The price was also reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: Boroko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IC Chicago several times. Keep returning for the location, pool and fitness center. Walk out the door right onto one of the most vibrant streets in the US. I am a bit of a pool buff and the IC boasts my favorite indoor pool in America. Fitness center includes some free weights, good range of machines, and a sauna. Service is pretty good, although check in lines can get a little too long during busy times, and although the staff are very professional, they are not as friendly as you expect at a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great introduction to one of the great cities of America”
Reviews.Author: lysurgis23
Reviews.Content: My wife & I drew this hotel via a conference at which my wife was presenting. It was a wee bit pricey (even by conference-rate standards) but we wanted to be sure of a good night's sleep after a punishing trip from Australia. We were not disappointed! The building is truly lovely - a mixture of renovated 1920s and more recent. We offered an upgrade via their travellers' club (I forget the exact title), where the membership more than paid for the upgrade (plus assorted discount / accommodation vouchers). We opted for this after an exhausting 31-hour journey from home, and were very glad to do so - 2 large bathrooms, a living room and a huge comfy king-size bed. Our area was very quiet, and the room was quite dark with the heavy curtains drawn - almost causing our downfall the next day, as we slept solidly until 11am (due to jetlag) and my wife's showtime was 1pm (my fault - I should have set alarm). Staff were very good and obliging. Door staff were friendly and efficient (and many of them were cricket fans, so we talked cricket a bit). Service problems were promptly fixed - the CD player in our room was not working but a replacement came within 10 minutes of a call. There were no tea-making facilities in our room (eg electric kettle), but house staff very obligingly brought a jug of boiling water each morning at the same time (we used to this to make our own breakfast). Location is mind-boggingly great - at the top of the Magnificent Mile and within cooee of the business district. The short walk to the subway station is a bit obscure - not signposted, and you have to cut through the Westfield Centre over the road - but we figured it out by studying the map plus asking concierge. We did not really use the restaurants in the hotel. Thanks to the great location we were happy to try different cuisines in the neighbourhood. We did visit the bar late at night (weeknights), and found it restful and quiet (which is just as we like it). Chicago had a unusual early-spring snowfall during our visit. The footpaths were generally lethal, but the door staff assiduously kept the footpath in front of the hotel de-iced. This was the true mark of their magnificent service - attention to small but potentially very uncomfortable) detail. The hotel has a business centre, including pay-as-you-go internet on in-house computers. As we did not have our own computer present i do not know if there is WiFi to rooms. I cannot comment on car-parking facilities because we used public transport. All in all - a truly memorable stay! Extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: stefanie1007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Chicago the week of Jan 28-31. We stayed at the Intercontinental. Before we went we signed up to be a priority member which was free to do. We got our room for $75 a night through hotwire. When we got there we expected to be in the new tower since we had booked at the cheaper rate but when we got there we were upgraded to the historic tower for free. Check in was not until 3 pm but when we got there at 9 am we got checked right in. The room was on the 24th floor. It was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the view was nice. The staff was very helpful especially the concierge. We didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants because there were so many options around. The location can not be beat. You can walk anywhere. There are tons of restaurants and shopping right outside the door. I will definately stay here again the next time I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: GBMember
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Fairmont, but they were unable to accommodate us, so recommended this instead, and we thought it was better than the Fairmont, and the location was excellent. We got a good rate for a junior suite, which was lovely, with good sized rooms. Room service was prompt, and all the staff were helpful. The breakfast was good, included in the room rate, with an excellent choice. However, at dinner, the restaurant seemed very cold - even though it was below freezing and snowing outside, we got the impression that they hadn't turned the heating on in there until we sat down. For such a large hotel, it seems strange that they only have one bar and one restaurant, plus a wine bar. The bar was overflowing with conference attendees, so impossible to get a drink there. And unlike other Intercontinentals we have stayed in, it doesn't have a club floor, which seemed a bit strange.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Service and Amenities with Great Eco-Practices”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is centrally located to the Magnificent Mile, has nice guest rooms with good amenities, a Starbucks inside the property, and solid service. On top of all of this, the hotel has a couple of very special features: -an aggressive greening campaign throughout all of its operations - including energy efficiency, waste management, water efficiency, and guest communication about eco-friendly activities. -a spectacular art deco swimming pool and several common spaces that are truly unique and grand in an historic, old-hotel glamour way. My stay was competently executed for the most part; the bellman was particularly accomodating. My only complaint was that my 5 am wake-up call came at 5:30 - but anybody who depends solely on the hotel wakeup call and doesn't set their own alarm deserves what they get. Beds were very comfortable with high quality linens; even small rooms and nice extra furniture and room to work.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price. You can run towards the lake down side roads. Close to shopping and tonnes of restaurants. Safe surrounding area. Few blocks from closest train station!

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental...Great location to enjoy Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Texas2trippers
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we visit Chicago. Located right on Magnificent Mile with lots of shops and restaurants right outside the door. Trolley is available to Navy Pier. We found it an easy walk to Millennium Park. During our visit in January we were thrilled to see they had added a full-service Starbucks right off the lobby...didn't have to leave the building to get our latte when it was snowing...even have a fireplace in the Starbucks. Don't miss the wine bar...they also feature chocolate and cheese...we tried the flight menu which was fun. I like the historic tower...it costs at little more but really appreciate the spacious rooms and views. Sometimes you can get a historic room at check-in for only $20-$30 if you ask...ask they don't always let you know. Oh...and the pool is spectacular...and really has been kept like it was when they opened in the 1920's.

Reviews.Title: “5* Service. Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Chicago is a world class hotel. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff truly tried to anticipated our every need and were so attentive. We were immediately greeted by the doorman/bellman who assisted us with our bags. Check in was perfect with no wait and everything in order.We were upgraded to the Historic Building and given a room with views of the lake and Michigan Ave. The room was elegantly appointed with beautiful linens and very clean. The bath was large with a separate shower and bath. Room service was prompt with delicious choices. The room was very quiet and private. Maid service was impeccable. The pool is a beautiful 1920's tiled olympic sized pool. The lobby bar was very comfortable to lounge in after a day of sightseeing with attentive service with tasty tapasstyle offerings. The wine bar Eno offers a warm sensuous place to taste fine wines matched with either local chocolates or cheeses from around the world. The Intercontinental is a fine hotel that truly cares about its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: Very solid service and nice rooms. Ask for an upgraded room as they usually will accomodate requests if possible. Beautiful 1920's archecture that is well worth exploring the hotel. The roof top pool is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Intercontinental on a Chicago stopover on our way back to Europe. The hotel is located on the Magnificent Mile itself and is excellent for easy access to great shops and a number of good restaurants. The hotel is housed in two buildings - a historic tower and a more modern annex. The decor in our room was somewhat unimaginative, but the room was clean and a decent size. Right next door is the Chicago Tribune, an interesting building with quirky stone insets on its facade from famous building across the globe (think Taj Mahal and St. Paul's). The hotel staff are very efficient and rooms seem to go at competitive rates. Being on the Mag Mile, the rooms looking onto Michigan Avenue have good views. Although this hotel is undoubtedly good, there is nothing about it that makes it stand out. Oh, for those of you who can't go without coffee - there's a Starbucks that can be accessed directly from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Much better option than it looks”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location in Michigan Avenue, just infront Nordstroom and Hugo Boss. Walking distance to any place in Magnificent Mile. Staff is friendly and eager to help people. I stayed in a suite, and even when the decoration is not my favorite style, you have all the confort you might require in a upscale visit to Chicago. Try the breakfast at this hotel, it's simple but the dishes are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno007
Reviews.Content: We booked Interconti through Hotwire, although the site doesn't reveal the name of the hotel until the payment confirmation, so you are buying a bit of "cat in a sack". Such approach, however, gives you a rock bottom price for otherwise pricey hotel. We paid $100 a night whilst the rack rate is $300+ a night. When we arrived at Interconti on the New Year's day, the hotel was very quiet and reception staff was very attentive. We got great room with a great view, although booking through Hotwire does not allow you to collect points on your loyalty cards, we managed to get late check out which was very handy. Unlike other Interconti hotels, Chicago property is not rated 5 stars and 4 stars farily reflect shortcomings. The hotel has a main part (rather typical chain hotel) and historic part (which has wonderful decor). Not sure how the rooms in two differents building compare but the halls in the histroic part are pretty spectacular. Location of the hotel could not be better. Walking distance to many attractions, although not in January when we visited. If we come to Chicago again and Hotwire gets us another great rate, we will definitely stay at Interconti again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mare54Mich_
Reviews.Content: ....................... Just stayed here thinking it would be nice, Not........................... Wallpaper falling off walls. NO fan in bathroom. What REALLy blew me away was that $500. /night they did not even have a bar of soap....Littlle mom/pop motels can supply that................... Don't Waste your money. Hotel Indigo will be the only one's for my family Beautiful . Bath supplies. well kept and friendly staff.....

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Great!!”
Reviews.Author: SLIKWILL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over New Year's and found the hotel to be nice, but nothing special. The service lived up to thier reputation as being short with us, they weren't rude, just short. The room was nice, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was a bit small. We had a flat panel TV that allowed Aux. inputs so we could hook up our DVD player and watch movies on the TV. If you are like us and don't care about the minibar or room service, stay somewhere else. There are a lot of hotels in the area that would offer the same experience for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice (not exceptional) business class hotel in a great location for shopping on North Michigan Avenue. The room was fresh-feeling and not very spacious, but not cramped, either, i.e. typical of a renovated hotel from another era. The bed in room 1842 was comfy; the heat was "responsive" on chilly nights; the bathroom is good but not luxurious, although there was a nice range of toiletries and counter space to spread out. Exellent housekeeping. There were all the other things you expect of a good business-class hotel, e.g. in-room safe, coffee maker, etc. Since we were at leisure on a short stay, we did not test the internet connections or the fitness center (lots of power shopping and museums instead.) There is a $48/night parking charge, which is very typical for this area of Chicago. There are in/out privileges. I don't understand the complaint of another Tripadvisor poster re: having to wait in a cold garage -- the car was quickly brought around to the front when we wanted it. There are various restaurants and a Starbuck's on-site. We only used the Starbuck's and the cafe for breakfast since we were in the mood for eggs, panakes, etc. The latter was fine, and service excellent, although they should improve the coffee (can I bring in a Starbuck's?) There is also a more lavish breakfast buffet, but we generally don't go that route. The Eno wine/cheese/chocolate bar looked nice, but we were busy with other things. My usual complaint about these places: the music was grating Euro-techno-loud something, not conducive to sipping wine. I would have asked them to turn it down (or off) had we stayed for a while. The other complaint is minor and happens: we had difficulty checking in when the desk could not find our reservation, and this was one of the few times when I had the confirmation number buried somewhere. 'Can't say whether it was their fault or the cedit card tgravel agency we booked with (we used bill-back miles, using a good room rate) but even after checking both my husband's and names, there was still a no-go. We booked a spare room, and then settled it with out CC company and the hotel afterwards. For some reason, we were booked using my husband's first name as the last name. Someone should have thought about this possibility. The room in general was quiet, but it faces North Michigan Avenue to the north. The holiday lights were ablaze, but we could also hear the occasional siren going by. Still, the room was ready, and we could check in early. Everyone was very nice and polite. While not in the same league as a Ritz or Four Seasons, we'd be happy to stay here again. But then again, we good a good rate, not the posted rack rate that would put it in league with those other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Jarno
Reviews.Content: Now this is a five star / four diamond hotel, so it's still pretty nice despite the low score. It's just that when I go to these types of establishments, I have high expectations. The building is very nice as are the public areas. Combine this with a top-notch location right on Michigan Avenue and a short walk to the theatre district and you can't go wrong, right? Wrong. First of all, there are many little issues with the way this place was remodeled. It looks like the construction guys were a little sloppy. The curtains in my room were coming off the roof, some lids on the floor were a little offset recovering dark nasty holes, door frames were obviously repainted by a non-professional handyman etc. These are little things, but aren't the little things what you fork the extra dollars for? I just hate that when you pay $200 plus for your room, they have the guts to rob $10 for a wireless internet. The worst part was, it didn't even work. I complained and didn't need to pay for that which is the least they can do. I think they should add some access points to strengthen the signal and make the access free like so many of the 3 star -type of places have (Hampton Inn, Garden Inn, Fairfield Inn, you name it). I wanted to go to the fitness center after a long drive to drain some sweat. Guess what, guests have to pay for it! Breakfast was nice, and it needs to be when it costs as much as a good dinner. To top it off, they made me wait 15 minutes in the cold garage to get my car. Is this why I paid a $100 for valet parking for two nights? There was nothing wrong with the attitude of the staff and the receptionist was courteous and nice when I said I didn't want to pay for the internet. I think the issues with this place are related to management. If you get a good deal here, go ahead and stay. It's not a bad place. It just should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathy/baits
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I stayed here for one night to do some shopping and relaxing before the crazy Christmas rush. I got a great price on Hotwire and I'm sure that's why we were so pleased, but at twice the price it would have been a bargain compared to other hotels in Chicago we've stayed. The location is great, with lots of stores and restaurants right there. We walked to the hotel from Union station. If the weather is ok, that's doable. The day we left tho, it was sleeting, so a cab was really necessary. The room was very comfortable, 5 star quality, but as others have mentioned, watch out for the extras( mini bar,tv,parking). Those prices are outragious. We knew that going in ,so we stopped at the 7-11 a couple blocks away before we checked in.They can't force you to open that bottle of water for $6.00,or listen to 30 minutes of music for $10. If you do, I don't understand the surprise at checkout. This is one of the few hotels downtown with a pool, and it's the nicest one we've seen. We didn't use it, but something to consider if you think you'll have time. A breakfast restaurant in the hotel would have been nice. Starbucks is the only option and we're not fans. All in all, we thought this was a wonderful hotel, very nice staff and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: For a weekend shopping trip around the holidays, we wanted something right on Michigan Avenue. This was the perfect location for a Magnificent Mile jaunt. Great service, nice people, elegant interiors, pleasant room. We went to the ENO wine, cheese and chocolate bar and were very satisfied with that as well. I would stay here again without hesitating.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Wedding Night! Please boycott!”
Reviews.Author: LikeLegos
Reviews.Content: We booked directly with the Intercontinental--a special room for our wedding night. After our wedding, we went to the Hotel excited and happy. When we got there, the night changed. We were treated rudely and with no respect. They told us there was "no room" even though we had a confirmation number. Instead of showing any empathy, they told us to go sit down while they figured out "what to do with us". My husband was in his tux and I was in my wedding gown! No apology! No concern! We were given $20 and told to go find a cab and take it to a hotel where they'd "found" a room. The Intercontinental RUINED our wedding night. We are telling anyone and everyone of our experience. This place was supposed to be elegant. We've never been treated so poorly. We will never stay in another Intercontinental Hotel and highly recommend you do not contribute to a place that would do this to a newly married couple!!! STEER clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Love Shopping? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: gingertoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental on Thanksgiving night. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas with a large tree and many poinsettas. We stayed in the non-historic wing, they offered to upgrade us for $50 to the historic wing but we declined. Our king bed room was an average size with a lovely view of the entrance to the hotel and Michigan Avenue. The room was smartly decorated in golds and burgandies and the highlight of the room was the red velvet window seat/sofa. The good: The rate- for under $210 we had a great room, parking, and full breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The not so great: The food- for this caliber of hotel, the food should have been ten times better than what it was. The valet parking- upon arrival we were immediately greeted and the car was whisked away. Upon departure, they sent us down to the garage to retrieve our own car. Isn't the point of valet parking that they deliver the car to you? Parking is also pricey if it is not included in your stay $48 per night. Overall, nice hotel with some issues to work through.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: velab
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and we have stayed at alot of hotels in Chicago( including Palmer House which was awesome). But the proximity of the Intercontinental to everything we did was the best. Shopping was steps away, a movie theatre right around the corner on Ohio, many resturants and the El only 2 blocks away on State. We also got our room on Priceline for 110 +tax and it was well worth the money. We were in the main tower and the room was a little small but beautifully decorated and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. Nice couch and ottoman.Also I have never stayed at a hotel that had a noon checkout so it was great not to have to rush to get out . We parked in a parking ramp on the north side and grabbed a cab into the city $18 for 24 hrs and we didn't have to deal with the traffic.That worked out great.By far this is the Best stay in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aato
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for three nights last weekend. It is a located in a fantastic spot on the Magnificent Mile, right near the Chicago River and the NBC building. We had a double room in the main tower. The room was very clean and updated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The negatives about this hotel is that you have to pay extra to use the fitness centre and internet access. Also, parking is high ($45 valet/day). Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel. We paid $90 on Priceline and felt that this was a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seb814
Reviews.Content: They caused stress b/c they couldn't find our reservation at check-in. We stayed for a weekend and the trip was immediately soured when we were checking in. I presented my driver's license and was told I had no reservation and the hotel was fully booked. We informed them we were a part of a wedding party and the response was still no reservation. The manager was there through this entire process and joined in the clerk's attitude that we were from Mars. Only after giving them the credit card number, which they reluctantly used, did they find the reservation-under my horribly MISSPELLED named in their computer! we had unfortunately left our confirmation email at home, but the name was correct on the email. some of the wedding party had to be contacted which stressed them out too. This was clearly their error! It took forwever to sort out, and never once did anyone take on an apologetic tone. We paid w/ parking over $700 for two nights so I don't think we should have received such horrible customer service. We never asked for any extra service, but saying sorry would have gone a long way. Thanks Intercontinetal-the stay was ruined by the service.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance in Chicago with prime location”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: PLUSES: * The hotel's location is fantastic - right across from the Nordstrom shopping area on Michigan. * I stayed in the Historic Tower -- huge corner room with views of Michigan Ave. * The room's decor was attractive -- classic and elegant. * Very comfortable bed and NO sounds from neighboring rooms. * Strong wireless internet signal in the room (but there is indeed a daily fee to use it) * Gym is very nice and clean, with lots of cardio equipment. However, there is also a one-time fee to use it ($12). If you want to go to the gym more than once in your stay, it's a $16 flat fee, per person, for unlimited use. NEGATIVES: * Only two elevators serviced the floor I was staying on in the Tower, and elevators were very slow at times. Once I waited about 5 minutes for the elevator to arrive to the floor where my room was. * Turndown service didn't happen one night -- not sure why. Be sure to ask for it, as it's a nice touch (chocolates on the bed, ice bucket filled, etc.). --- Overall, this is a place I woud definitely choose again for lodging in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3-day weekend. Great location. Lots of attractions in walking distance. Beds were wonderful and room in historic tower was very nice. Great views and the windows open which was great for some fresh air. Changed from 31st floor due to banging we kept hearing for 24 hours (sounded like someone jumping on the floor above us). Hotel was gracious in moving us to 37th floor, but had breakdown in communication as to why we were moving. In the morning, told us to leave our stuff and bellman would move it; just pick up key when returning at day's end. When we came back at 5pm to pick up our new key, they then asked all sorts of questions which should have been noted already. So it was annoying to reiterate the whole banging noise, engineer you sent up heard it, never got back to us, etc. Both rooms we had were very nice. Bathrooms have a lot of marble, nice tub and separate shower. Nice toiletries too that smelled great! Amazing lap pool--one that must've been shown in movies. Interesting how you must shower first--you have to walk past the attendant to get to the pool from the showers; this rule is apparently enforced. Pool does not smell like chlorine which was great. Didn't eat there so can't comment on food. Check on internet access--some get billed and some don't. There's a Starbuck's on the ground floor too. Took doubledecker bus tour first thing and saw the whole city. Next day went to Space & Invention museum (taxi cost $20) and then to Millennium Park. Walked around the City and shops, etc. Hancock Tower was cool at night. Fox & Obel store near hotel was great. Lobster club sandwich was so good I went back next day and got one to go for the plane ride back to NJ (United serves/sells NO food in flts < 3 hours). I'm sure the cupcake we ate on the plane was the envy of passengers around us. Nice upscale store with a great "to-go" selection too. Ditka's had good food for dinner. All within walking distance of the hotel. Hotel staff was very courteous. Used Continental Van service from/to airport. Paid r/t at airport but next time would taxi back as the p/u was late and driver had attitude toward everyone. A LOT of traffic to and from airport. Leave about an hour to get there. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only hotel I will stay in while visiting Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaGail
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the most recent reviews I'm really perplexed. I didn't know what to expect, but I was most pleasantly surprised. Just as all the past reviews, both negative and positive, have stated, you can't beat the location of this hotel. It's perfect. We had a big spacious room in the old tower. We avoided the expensive pitfalls of the hotel extras such as bottled water and items in the room fridge. The beds were great, the rooms were kept clean and the staff was very friendly. Great martinis in the hotel bar. I really can't understand the negative reviews. I know you can't please everyone, but in some cases I simply don't believe their claims. I've traveled a lot and have stayed in plenty of hotels. This is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: blondebomb13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the intercontinental during the last weekend in September for a "pleasure trip" -- the InterContinental was in a great location and the staff was excellent. The room was clean and comfortable -- and came equipped with a new LG flat panel tv. Had breakfast at Zest (hotel restaurant) -- a bit pricey but decent if you want a buffet. The hotel is in walking distance to millenium park, museums and the aquarium. There is also a lot of shopping - window shopping is best though, considering the sales tax is 9.5%! (and possibly raising to 11%) Great stay. I highly recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They Have Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrissybabee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a dozen of my friends, and more than half of us got eaten alive by bed bugs! We stayed there from September 28 - September 30th, but the symptoms (i.e. the crazy itchiness) didn't come until Sunday night when we all got home. I complained to the hotel and basically all they're gonna do is cover the cost of our dry cleaning bills. Honestly, they should reimburse us, because it was not worth it at all. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassHotelCritic
Reviews.Content: The service and overall feel of this hotel is First Class. I was treated like I was a King. The rooms were very clean and smelled clean. Did not care for the Zest restaurant downstairs but the wine bar was excellent. The food ordered via room service was very good, with the delivery faster than expected. The food ordered via room service was made fresh and the portions were much larger than expected. I ordered soup because I had a cold and received a portion that was about four cups of soup. Along with the very large Ceasar salad with freshly grilled chicken, I could not finish my dinner. At first glance the room service menu appears to be very expensive but that is deceiving. The service at the conferences I attended at the hotel was also top notch. The cleaning staff were impecable and genuinely friendly to the point I left a tip for them each morning. If you want to be treated like gold stay at the Intercontinental Chicago. They must treat their staff the same way as it shows in their excellent customer service. Hats off to the Intercontinental management and staff!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: millim1900
Reviews.Content: I've travelled a lot to Chicago, and after many, many trips my family and I have finally found the place we will always return to. From the moment we arrived to check-out we found some of the best customer service we've ever encountered: - Personally saying good morning to me, my wife and kids. - Despite our day late arrival (cancelled flight), finding our rooms ready and without delay. - Kind staff at the pool and health club. - Excellent wait staff at the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. - Extremely professional concierge services, dedicated to finding what we were looking for, and not just "answer their question and get them out of here" that seems more and more to be the standard. Struggling to find something negative to say, I really cannot find anything. We left our door ajar one evening while moving kids from one room to another, not 2 minutes passed before security came, made us aware we had left our door open, asked if everything was OK, smiled and gave us a "have a nice evening." For us, that's everything: the little things that just kept adding up. Good old fashioned customer service, great location and attention to detail; this reviewer highly recommends staying at the InterContinental Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Intercontinental Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: This InterContinental Hotel is absolutely wonderful in every aspect. First, you cannot beat its location right on Michigan Avenue. Close to great shopping and dining. If you happen to arrive late as we did, try the very good Grand Luxe restaurant just down the street (ask the very nice doorman for directions). The lobby of the hotel is small and not spectacular, but who cares, you only use it to come in and out. Since I am an Ambassor Club member of the Intercontinental hotels, we were upgraded to a suite in the historic tower. The room had a stunning view of downtown Chicago with a separate sitting area with a sofa and tv. The bedroom was spotless and beautifully appointed. I am very picky about the quality of hotel beds and pillows and at this hotel they are superb. The bathroom was large and spotless with a separate shower and bathtub. Loved the big plush towels and fine toiletries. This is a great hotel and when in Chicago I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: 49States
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental for one night, the Sunday during Labor Day weekend. We had booked the hotel using Priceline (less than $100) and were concerned after reading many of the previous reviews. However, our stay was excellent. We were given a king room in the historic tower section. The room was immaculate, recently redecorated and spacious. It had a 32" plasma TV, very comfortable bed, large marble bathroom with a large tub and separate, glass shower. The room temperature was well-controlled and our room had a view of the Tribune Tower next door and the under-construction Trump Tower on the Chicago River. We dealt with two different front-desk employees as well as the guest services manager. All were courteous and professional. Valet parking at the hotel is high...$48 per day. We drove so we parked our car instead at a parking garage two blocks away at the corner of Ontario and St. Clair (Marriott Courtyard) for $34...the going 24-hour rate for garages in this area is $29-$34 for 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: petelbury
Reviews.Content: I went onto priceline.com and selected a 4 star hotel in the river north area of Chicago. The price I entered was $90.00, I figured this was a long shot. My request came back immediately, and i was booked into the Intercontinental for just 90 bucks. I then emailed the hotel directly and requested a non-smoking room, (priceline can't guarantee you a non-smoking room, FYI) on a high floor with a nice view. We packed up the family and headed to Chicago with our fingers crossed. I couldn't have been happier with a hotel, even if we had paid full price, it still would have been great. What's good about it? The location. Right downtown on Michigan Ave. next to the tribune building, near the river, walking distance to Navy Pier (By walking distance, I mean our two kids, 7 & 8, walked without complaining). The hotel itself is very nice, there are two restaurants downstairs, Zest and Eno. One fancy, the other really fancy. and a bar. There's also a Starbucks attached to the lobby. There's probably two more across the street, but who's counting? I can only review the room we stayed in here, but it was awesome, lots of open space, large plasma TV, large marble tiled bathroom, comfortable beds, very clean. The room actually felt new. The view from the window as you're going to sleep was of the Tribune tower, the Wrigley building and the Sears tower, among the other building which I don't know the name of. Beautiful at night, the kids loved it (It was room 2317, if you're curious). The downside? The extras are expensive. Parking was $48.00 a day, which I think is outrageous even for downtown Chicago. I probably could've found a cheaper lot, but driving around Chicago is stressful if you don't know where you're going. So we just took it on the chin for parking. $9.95 a day for internet access. There are so many place offering free wifi, it just doesn't seem right to find a place that still charges. The restaurants and bar are pricey. OK, so I only went to the bar, but $6 for a bottle of Goose Island? And $10 for a gin & tonic? One last note on the pool, it seems to be part of a larger members only fitness club, and although it's amazing, it was a little awkward bringing little kids there to swim, something they had been looking forward to the whole trip. You enter through the fitness center doors where you're directed to a locker room and told to shower before entering the pool area, and as the host eyes the kids she tells us that there's a strict no jumping or diving or splashing rule. At the pool there are lane dividers and signs on the wall that say "lap swimming only." In the pool, there are a few old people with swimming caps and goggles on, doing laps. The pool is very nice, but not for families with kids, and for us that's a pretty big deal. because if the kids can't enjoy the pool, we can't enjoy the pool. All in all, great place to stay. Park, eat and swim somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in better Downtown Chicago Hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravelNF00l
Reviews.Content: Stayed in old tower. Room was nice and room service was very good. Room Wi-Fi was expensive as was the bottled water. For the price of the room, at least there should at least have been water. I would rate the value as sub-par. The restaurant menu was not great, food mediocre by comparison to other downtown Chicago restaurants and the service was below average especially since there were only three tables in use in the entire restaurant.. In summary, I will go to the M... or H... next time. Some of the above comments are based on a previous week resort stay on the outer banks of North Carolina and earlier this year in Northern California. P.S. If you are a fitness room user, the $16 per stay per person is a good deal at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Volume hotel without charm”
Reviews.Author: JakobBengt
Reviews.Content: A volume hotel with very little charm. Good location but it ends there. Staff is indifferent and you really feel it is all about selling additional services with bare minimum for free. For a corporate rate there is better choices for USD 199 in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for one night in August to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It was a last minute trip and we booked on priceline. We were a little worried at first because of some of the other reviews. However, we called and requested a room in the historic tower and mentioned it was our anniversary. It was the weekend of the air & water show so we weren't sure if such a request would be honored. On arrival, the front staff was very helpful. We were placed in a corner room in the historic tower and it was a gorgeous . There was a sitting area and a beautiful bathroom with marble tiles and a large shower. We were on the 30th floor and had a nice view of the city. We were also surprised by a nice note from maid service congratulating us on our anniversary with complimentary truffles, a bottle of evian, and fruit! This was a nice touch. I always wonder if hotels treat guests who book through priceline differently, and the intercontinental hotel clearly does not. Will stay again! No problems as mentioned by others re: noisy or dysfunctional A/C units.

Reviews.Title: “Not my 1st choice”
Reviews.Author: acetb
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to see that we got the intercontinental on priceline for $62.00. I've always thought the location was great and it is, we walked everywhere. We asked for an upgrade and agreed to a suite for an extra $100.00 which we felt wasn't that bad for Chicago. We had to check back several times because no suites were clean yet. (we arrived early) and we still didn't get in until 3:30pm. The front desk staff was wonderful as were the bellman upon arrival. We finally got into our suite and although we had requested a crib 5 days prior and again at 1pm when we first tried to check in and again at 3:30pm there was no crib in the room. I called and asked again, it finally arrived at 5pm, only because the room he was bringing it to had not checked in yet. Gee thanks!!! I noticed on the desk what appeared to be the schedule for a conference of the prior guest along with the 1/2 gone $5.95 bottle of water he must have had. This was not just a piece of paper, it was several pieces and a large binder left behind on the desk which was cleaned???? We pretty much let that go and decided to take the kids to the pool. It was beautiful. The ladders going in and out are kind of scary but the place is beautiful!! Our 1 & 5 yr old had fun but it is a huge pool and deep so you have to stay right with your kids, no kiddie area here. That's OK though it was really a neat pool. Our teenager loved it. Then I took the little ones back up to the suite to have a bath before dinner. That's when I noticed the black hairs that were all over the tub area. I thought at the time I would just put the kids in the shower(which is separate) until I saw there was a used soap left in there. I was disgusted, I couldn't even bathe my children and I paid extra for this!! It took several phone calls and 1 hr 10 minutes later we finally had a clean bathroom. The instant line they have for you to call had said they would were going to send the manager of housekeeping up, it was 45min before she showed up. I in the mean time had called back and said forget the housekeeping manager, I wanted to talk to the manager. After our bathroom was finally useable the housekeeping manager showed up while I was giving the girls a bath so I did not have time to speak to her. She told my son that the room must have been not quite ready yet but they let us check-in. Well the front desk clerk phoned housekeeping twice before letting us have the room so that doesn't fly with me. The fact that I had asked to speak to the manager seemed to have been forgotton until I walked down to the front desk myself and complained when we were leaving for dinner. We got an apology and 4 free breakfast coupons, yeah thanks. No manager to speak with I guess. Then when we went out the front door to get a taxi we had to get it ourselves, the bellman ignored us and went to the car that just pulled up to help with their luggage. Not that getting a cab was a big deal but I have never had to do so at any of the other 4 star and even 3 star hotels I have stayed in in Chicago. The front desk did say they were very busy. Oh well that is no excuse at a hotel that charges the amount they do and claims to be 4 star. We gotout to dinner at 8pm that evening with a very tired 1 & 5 yr old, thank you intercontinental. I love priceline but I won't be excited about this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: JCIL62210
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at the InterContinental. Checkin was fast and friendly. Room was small but clean. Bed was very comfortable. Didnt experience any of the problems written about in previous reviews; A/C worked great (90 degrees outside), shower temp was hot and consistent. Booked the room through Priceline at $100/night. Given that price and the InterContinental's unbeatable location, I was very happy with my stay. We walked to the beach and Navy Pier; just about everything is within walking distance. We did take a cab back and forth from the train station, $6.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: trishf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two teenage girls in August on a Sunday night. We all liked the room, it was large enough with two queen beds. Bathroom was quite nice and spacious. We were given a choice of king/rollaway in the older section or two queens in the new. Don't know how the old section compares but our room was just fine. Public spaces were nice and the Starbucks was a good touch for my girls (I'm not a fan!). I wish I'd known, though, that there were no vending machines b/c I would have picked up some water and soda. So, we used the minibar, which I hate to do, b/c it was late and we were thirsty after a big game out at Wrigley Field. We were given an early check-in, which was great. Hotel staff were very accomodating and gave us good advice re eating out, getting to the Blue Line to go to the airport, getting to Wrigley Field, etc. I would stay here again - I got it for $120 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: deenad
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel in June for a convention with a friend. This was my third time to Chicago and the first at this hotel. I am inclined to agree with the other comments. This was just an alright stay for me. The rooms were small. Our bathroom was really small. Not sure if it was where the room was located. However, the door would not open all the way because there was a wall behind it. The room never really seemed to cool down, especially at night while we were sleeping. We, too, woke up sweating. The location is good, you can't go wrong with a place on Mag Mile. I think I will opt out and stay at a different hotel for my next stay in September.

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: daslky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights and enjoyed our stay. It is an older hotel with much history. I actually enjoyed a short historical tour given every morning. The rooms were small but was spotlessly clean. I had some concerns about the HVAC as it was warm in our room and Chicago was experiencing unseasonably cool weather for the date. It finally cooled down but it took most of the night. The hotel is convenient to most areas and restuarants we visit. The pool was nice but the exercise room was $12 extra and I never gave it a try. No frills such as breakfast but the room did have a coffee pot. You get a three star hotel, however, for the money spent, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good...If the price is right”
Reviews.Author: drays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental over the 4th of July holiday and got a great rate for $139 a night for 3 nights. On the last night, the special was done and we decided to splurge on a suite for $289. We arrived and got upgraded to the suite for the whole 4 nights. This was great news!
