The room was okay, good size and comfortable, but I think I would have been disappointed if I paid upwards of $300 a night for it. It was great considering the deal, but it was not high end. The A/C is kinda random - it never really got cool in there. I suppose it was comfortable, but it was a bit warm at night. The bathroom is really nice, especially the toiletries, but I was hoping for a much nicer tub. It was standard and not all that comfortable. Oh well. We tried Zest twice for breakfast and it was pretty good. Expensive, but convenient and solid. It worked for us. I have one problem with this though, the last night we had breakfast included with our rate. We spoke to the front desk about it and they said that we had a $43 credit for Zest. The buffet was $35 for two, so with tax we figured that it was right on. We left our room number with the server and left a tip because it is never included in these types of deals. After checkout, they charged us for tax and tip anyway (and it was an 18% tip - for drink refills and clearing plates?!). This is ridiculous. We also had to wait over an hour to get our bags taken to our car and then they lost a piece and we waited in our car for about 20 minutes for that. These mishaps on the last day really made us wonder for next time. Of course, if I can get a suite on Michigan Ave. for $139 again, I would do it. On the plus side, most of the service was great, although they charge $75 for late checkout, which seemed ridiculous to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, average room”
Reviews.Author: hudgens08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Intercontinental. We had 2 rooms with 2 double beds. Rooms were on the small side (bed was up against walls);rooms needed a good cleaning. Dust was on the lamps and alarm clock;shower drained slowly. Beds were comfortable. Room temp varied. We had the thermostat set on 65, yet woke up sweating. Did not eat at hotel, but there is a Starbucks adjacent to the property, which was great for breakfast. Bottom line- there are plenty of hotels to choose from along the Magnificent Mile, and I would choose a different hotel the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jbsarts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our Midwestern vacation. While in Chicago, we stayed at the InterContinental for three nights. We were pleasantly surprised. Our first and second choice hotels were booked due to the NeoCon Conference, but we agreed that we would stay at the InterContinental next time instead of the Monaco or the Burnham because our room was very nice, the location perfect, and the view was great; even though the price is noticeably higher than the other two hotels ($230). We were on the 26th floor and had a corner room looking across to the Tribune and Wriggly Buildings and also to Lake Michigan from the other window. The king bed and pillows were very comfortable as was the room temperature. The room itself seemed to be recently updated, clean, and quiet. The front desk and housekeeping were very friendly and efficient. We liked the fact that we could choose to use our same sheets for two nights and save a bit of energy. We didnâ€™t use the pool or the gym or the restaurant because we had so much fun being out and about in the city. We would recommend the Inter Continental to other travelers not only for its amenities, but also for its location to shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A Faded Beauty in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: In its heyday, this is the kind of hotel that my grandparents would have been thrilled to stay at. But my grandparents have been dead for 20 years, and they lived well into their 80s. Suffice it to say that this hotel's best days ended during the Eisenhower administration -- which is not to say that they have not tried to update and upgrade things. The rooms are comfortable enough. The beds have 4-star bedding and the bathrooms have very nice toiletries. The staff is generally quite helpful. Nevertheless, on a good day, this is a 3.5 star hotel. Yet, it tries to pretend that it is up there with the Four Seasons. If you're paying priceline rates, you'll be happy with the value. If you're paying business rates, however, your money is better spent elsewhere. A final, positive note: It's hard to beat this hotel's location in terms of proximity to shopping and dining. It's just north of the loop in the heart of the main upscale shopping district on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected . . .”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelDC
Reviews.Content: Was slated for two nights in Chicago, June 12 - 14, 2007. I could onyl get the Intercon for both nights. I booked a handicapped room since that was they had left. After reading other reviews of the property, I decided to move it from two nights to one, and stay the second night at the Hotel Monaco. Of course, upon check-in, I was given a suite. Nice room, great linens, clean bathroom, and very quiet. Parking is really high ($48). I understand some peopel saying the rooms need to be updated, but everything was clean and worked well. At ,ost, the rooms were a bit dark. I had a late night drink at the bar, which was reasonably priced. i did not eat there, but the menu seemed pretty good, albeit with the typical hotel mark-ups to be expected. In all, I thought the place was everything I needed, and was very happy with the room, the staff, the linens, and the housekeeping. Much better than others have indicated.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the greatest out there...”
Reviews.Author: Miamiheat1
Reviews.Content: I had booked (in advance) a king non-smoking standard room directly through the hotel. Upon check in, they told us they had "none available". I couldn't believe this! To appease us, they offered us a suite in a smoking room, or a double in a non-smoking room. I'm sure you can imagine we chose the suite. So we theoretically, got a chance to see the best this hotel offered. I was not particularly impressed. The TVs weren't flat panel, the showers had no pressure (we had 2 bathrooms in the suite believe it or not), and the toilet looked like it was from the 70's with an institional flush handle like in schools. Paint was poorly applied in the hallways. To top it off, the hotel charged you an extra fee to use the gym (but not the pool). This infuriated me. I think it's a cheap move. Charge more for the room, and build it into the price then! Lastly, the elevators were terribly slow, and the restaurant was sub-par. Not to sound like a total complainer, there were a few important things on the upside: the location was great, and the pool was very unique... a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't justify the high price”
Reviews.Author: Expat93
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with other reviewers who find the Intercontinental in Chicago to be a bit below par. To be clear, I didn't have a bad stay; it just wasn't as nice as I would expect given the price I paid ($239 per night). I was there for five nights, so I was able to see a good cross-section of service standards. What is good: -The location. Fantastic. Can't be beat. You are right across the street from the Nordstrom's on Michigan Avenue. -The pool is a beautiful junior Olympic-size pool. Very nice and not too crowded when I was there. -Extremely pleasant and helpful bell staff. -Quiet room. There was a fairly long (albeit dark) hallway in my room between the bedroom and the front door. That meant that I couldn't hear any noise from the hallway at all. -Big desk area. I was in Chicago on business and had to do a lot of work in my room and the big desk was very useful for this. Why, though, do they have a fax machine on it? -The wine bar on the ground floor. Nice wine list, good cheese selection, very nice staff. -Comfy bed. Good linens, good pillows, good mattress. I would have slept like the dead if it wasn't for the problematic climate control (see below) What they need to work on: -The gym. It is cramped, poorly ventilated, and not very well equipped. Either improve the facilities or don't charge for them. -Pricey wifi. US$10 per day. -The rooms need to be redecorated. Mine was looking a bit tired. One of the hinges on the TV cabinet was broken, they still had a massive CRT TV in the room, not a nice, compact LCD TV. The bathroom was a bit tired (why is there no place to hang a hand towel near the sink?), though the lighting was o.k. The doorbell for my room was broken, so it was hard to hear a knock at the door. -Inconsistent housekeeping staff. Some days, it was great. Other days, they didn't replenish the toiletries, give me any fresh wash cloths, or restock the minibar. In fact, my minibar wasn't restocked at all during my 5-day stay! -Climate control in the room. It was extremely warm for much of my stay and I just couldn't get the air conditioning to cool down the room. -The breakfast buffet. Expensive, the food wasn't great, and the waitstaff were slow and not very responsive to guests' needs. I also have to agree with people who have commented that they felt like the Intercontinental wanted to find any excuse to get more money from you. It starts with the gym and wifi. The minibar prices are really extortionate. What finally pushed me over the edge was being asked to pay $35 for a late checkout--at 2pm! I completely understand if you want to check out at 4pm that some sort of charge is reasonable, but 2pm?!? When you've spent over $1500 in the hotel already?!? Very cheeky. I wasn't impressed. If you get a good deal on the room, you probably won't have a bad stay (I certainly didn't). Just don't arrive expecting to be pampered in the same way that you might in other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Memorial Day Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: nic_leb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental Chicago for five nights over the 2007 Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is well located within walking distance of all the Miracle Mile shopping and dining as well as Millennium and Grant Parks, the Art Institute, and Navy Pier. The room was small, befitting an urban hotel. We were in an end room in the newer tower and the room was extremely quiet. Air conditioning blew all the time, although it did provide white-noise. The king-size bed had very comfortable bedding and superb pillows! The built-in sofa unit was pretty uncomfortable. The shower's water pressure was a little low. There was some minor wear to the room (e.g., wallpaper peeling in bathroom, scratch on mirror), but room was neat and clean. Elevators were speedy and even at busy times came quickly. A newspaper was delivered outside the door every morning except Sunday. A new room service menu was delivered during our stay. The offerings were greatly expanded and upgraded, although pricey ($20 for a small pizza, plus delivery fees). The room had a stocked mini-bar and snack items. I didn't like the non-refrigerated snack items being so blatantly peddled, and looks like there hadn't been any takers in awhile since one of the cans of nuts had a small coating of dust on it. We had limited interactions with the staff, but they were always courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Super value & great stay at ICH Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/12-16/07. Booked direct through hotel at Travelzoo rate of $109 night for double-double room in main bldg. Joined the Ambassador Club prior to arrival & was then entitled to room upgrade at checkin; got a large 1 bedroom suite with 2 full bathrooms. Great! Other amenities with Ambassador status are free bottled water & 1 free move with each stay. (Note, you also get coupon for 1 free weekend night at any ICH hotel, so that pays for the admission fee.) Based on that alone would give the ICH a good to excellent rating but there was more: Room was spotless, bed was very comfortable, living room space was quite large & very nicely furnished. Loved historic part of hotel & location was spot on; central to everything. Lobby area is nice but not huge and has free 24/7 airline kiosk for printing boarding passes. The indoor pool was nice to look at but the area was very warm & stuffy; needs to be cleaned up a bit. Gym was sorta stuffed into 2 small rooms - not very impressive & if all the machines were occupied would seem very crowded. Other than those 2 minor issues, hotel stay was really special & definitely would recommend to others, especially if a good rate is available!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cellgirl99
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal through Priceline for a Friday - Sunday stay at $75 for each night. The hotel is very centrally located on Michigan Avenue "The Magnificent Mile". You can walk to a ton of shops & there are plenty of restaurants handy as well. The hotel staff was very friendly, and the room itself was gorgeous. Very modern decor. Not drab & typical like most other chain hotels. If staying in Chicago we definitely will be staying there again. Price for valet parking overnight was insane ($42/day), but what do you expect in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy charges for little things”
Reviews.Author: w123x
Reviews.Content: Crazy charges for little things. Inter-state phone call, more than $2.5 per minute. The rate is not given anywhere in the room although the manager claimed to be so. He seemed to be very happy when a customer made a mistake or was stupid enough to use their phones.

Reviews.Title: “Unpredictable expenses at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Lari_Ling
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Intercontinental, and I will never do it again. It wasn't terrible in a general sense, but it certainly did not fit my personality. The good aspects of it included that it was clean and appealing in its decor. And the people working there were not unpleasant. However, several things irritated me throughout my stay. The first was the lighting, which was much too dim for my taste. I don't mind romantic lighting sometimes, but it was grey and dreary outside when I arrived, and I didn't like having to be in a dim room too. I consoled myself with the hope that the dim lighting meant that they were conserving energy, and so, I hope, it was for a good cause. Then there was the issue of the lobby areas. I had a lot of work to get done on my trip and yet did not want to spend all my time in my room. I found it quite difficult to find comfortable lobby areas to just sit and relax. Most areas were just for the restaurant and bar customers, or too close to the incoming and outgoing traffic of people checking in and out. More attractive and quieter spaces were usually full. I usually ended up going back to my too dimly-lit room to work. The most irritating things, however, were the many small costs, many of which were not transparent to me at the outset. True, I don't travel a lot, so part of it is my lack of saavy. The water bottles lying about were clearly marked with $6 price tags, so at least I was clear on their costs. But I still found it very irritating, especially when I could get a bottle of socially conscious water right across the street at Starbucks for less that $1.50. It felt like the hotel was taking extreme advantage of weary travelers by charging so much for a lousy bottle of water. Then there was the issue of the exercise room. When I came in, I was informed that I had to pay $12 if I wanted to exercise that day--or $16 if I wanted to exercise multiple days. I was disgusted by this because if I'd had stayed at a cheaper hotel, it would have been free. I realize that they had a fancier exercise area than most hotels--though I wouldn't know anything about that because no one offered to let me go in and look around--and I was so flabbergasted by the charge to exercise that I didn't think to ask. Upon complaining about this to some of my traveling companions, they said that they had heard that parts of the exercise facilities (the pool perhaps??) could be used free of charge. "Why then didn't the person at the desk let me know this?" I wondered. Why did he/she allow me to leave stunned and annoyed that, on top of an expensive per night fee, I was going to have to pay an unreasonable price just to exercise. Then there was the phone issue. I guess I'd mostly stayed at lower hotels before now -- where internet, breakfast, and 1-800-number calls were all included in the price of the room. Still, I was saavy enough to understand upon arriving that internet would cost $10 a day (too high, but at least I could prepare myself by knowing ahead of time), and I knew that breakfast wasn't included. But I was unprepared for the charge to use my calling card. In my previous stays elsewhere I had been charged for local calls, but never for 1-800-number calls. Again, if it had been obvious (like the cost of the internet or the cost of the water in the room) I would have been very irritated, but not outright offended. But there was nothing in the room by the phone to let me know that they'd be charging for that. So I didn't find out about it until I called the desk to find out what it cost for a local call (because I knew that local calls would cost and so knew that I needed to call to find out the charge if I didn't want to be surprised). It was then that they informed me that I'd already been charged with $15 worth of calls. Furthermore, when I let them know (indignantly) that I had no idea that there would be a charge for 1-800-number calls, they did not politely offer to remove the calls. I had to get quite angry before they even offered to remove 1/2 the charges. I was most angry because if I'd known about the unreasonably high charges, of course I would have used a cell phone or even my internet connection (which I'd already paid for) to make my calls--I didnt even need their phone!! I was using it only because of lack of information, which they should have posted in the room somewhere. I could afford the Intercontinental--that wasn't the problem. My company was helping with the charges too. I didnt rate the hotel as terrible, because of course some of my dissatisfaction is due to my own characteristics. I was being lazy and time pressured (without much time to research hotels for my trip)--I had hoped that by paying more for a hotel I would get more. But in fact, by paying more I got less, and everything I wanted/needed was "extra" in a really unreasonably high-priced way. I suppose I'm the kind of person who would like to pay once and then enjoy my stay without worrying what sorts of charges I might accidentally and unexpectedly be racking up. I left feeling like the luxury of that hotel was extremely selfish, "charge-happy," and wasteful -- taking advantage of tired people who'd be willing to pay for every little thing simply because they had the money to do so and were too tired to look for other options -- NOT because it was worth the cost. Really, the hotel wasn't that much more beautiful than any other cheaper hotel that I could have stayed at -- and which I will stay at in the future. I should be grateful, I suppose. To have learned this lesson with most expenses paid by my company, rather than to have had to learn it when I was footing the bill. Still, I left very irritated. I don't care how rich I eventually get, I will avoid the Intercontinental and hotels that remind me of it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: C5LS1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four day stay at the Intercontinental. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. We stayed in the historic tower and I did not see or hear anyone else on the floor. Maybe it was because there were only 6-7 rooms on our floor. Never saw housekeeping, but when we returned to our room at various times each day, it was always cleaned up. We only had breakfast at the hotel one morning, but it was very good. No complaints at all with his hotel. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great food, awesome service”
Reviews.Author: cjindc
Reviews.Content: If you belong to their admiral club you will get an incredible upgraded room! The food at the main restaurant was wonderful, breakfast buffet was incredible (lots of fresh berries, lox, etc.), especially wonderful on Sunday, and dinner was fabulous. The new chocolate, cheese and wine bar was great fun and delicious - highly recommend it. I agree about the odd fragrance in the lobby, but I didn't have the problem in my room, and I love that you can open the windows for fresh air! Convenient location for shopping and other restaurants. Agree about the gym currently is a huge disappointment - but they do have what you need available, and once the remodeling is done I will enjoy checking it all out again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: kkrtraveler
Reviews.Content: Since I tend to get wordy, here is my bottom line: my husband and i liked the hotel but would not go back. The main downside to the hotel is an overwhelming fake fragrance smell that permeates the lobby and rooms that i just could not get over. Service: really great, helpful people, a highlight of the hotel. Rooms: We were in the historic tower. they were pretty and relatively spacious (coming from nyc at least) bed had luxurious feel to them. The only downside was again, the overwhelming potpourri/fake fragrance spray smell to the room. I opened the windows and they tried to help by sending up an "ozone machine" (?) but it was there throughout the stay. Some people may like the smell of air fresheners but strong fragrances make my eczema flare. Sensitive skin people beware! the other downside is the bathtubs are completely rectangular and have no slope to the back so lying in them is really uncomfortable. The showers are pretty but are smaller than most standard showers if you're claustrophobic. Another downside to the hotel is limited TV stations. not much to choose from. Facilities: they are currently remodeling their exercise area so they had a few treadmills and elliptical machines, few free weights next to the pool. the pool is beautiful but makes working out a sweaty time. Food: we didn't eat at the hotel since they haven't gotten great reviews. there are so many great restaurants in the immediate area, the proximity to so many is a bonus. There is also a Starbucks across the street which we loved. Transportation: we took a cab from the airport, it was about 45$ total one-way. the shuttle service is available but is i think 18$/person so for an extra 10$ we didn't have to make multipe stops and we thought it was worth it. last thought: if strong fragrances do not bother you, this is a beautiful hotel with great service. The proximity to things is a plus. let me know if anyone has questions!

Reviews.Title: “Great swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: BorisWestCountryUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location on Chicago's Golden Mile and is within reach of all the major sites, especially the main shopping area. I stayed in the historic tower on one of the upper floors in February 2007. The water pressure is not great so high up, and it took about 15min to fill the bath-if you like baths! Otherwise the room was comfortable and very clean. However, it was obviously partitioned off from a larger area with the usual problems of sound insulation from the room next door. The room was clean and reasonably well decorated, but in a rather 80-90s style with heavy drapes and large furniture needed e.g. to contain a large screen old style CRT TV. The hotel has a really serious swimming pool (at least 25 yds long) which is kept well and appears to be in the original 1920s (?) decor-it is really a great place. The pool is free to guests, although the fitness room if used costs extra. The standard of service in the hotel was excellent, staff were always polite and seemed to observe the rule that the guest was always right. I had a cheap deal on this hotel as a result of a large conference block booking-around $100 dollars a night and for this it was a good deal. I guess such rates would only apply to such large block bookings, but if you can get a good deal, I would recommend staying here-especially if you like swimming!. If not, and you are looking for more style, more modern decor etc you should consider other nearby places-the Sheraton looked swankier-but probably much more expensive?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kamikazetrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ICH Chicago for business in November of 2006 and loved it. As a Royal Ambassador member, they upgraded me to a beautiful junior suite with a separate living and working area and 2 bathrooms! My upgrade was in place upon arrival and a beautiful fruit basket was waiting for me on the coffee table. They even had a nice young lady escort me to my room. The suite was beautifully furnished and had an Art Deco feel to it. The only thing I regretted was that I only stayed one night. I will definitely stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great CHicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRChicago
Reviews.Content: Booked directly via the hotel and got a decent AAA rate for a one night stay. We live several blocks away in downtown Chicago and like to get out of the apartment for one night stays. We booked a room in the historic tower for a room with a king bed. **Make sure to ask if you can be on the upgrade list as they are redoing a few rooms still. We got our upgrade for no extra cost and got a great conrer suite for the same cost. Great room with two seperate showers. etc..Great views as well! Room service was good and on time for dinner and breakfast. Pool was nice as well but try and take a dip early as to miss the kid hour at the pool..If you have kids then there will be some kids to play with in the pool on a weekend. All in all a great stay! Chicago, IL resident

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at The InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Jule215
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a weekend in Chicago and the InterContinental, and have to say we had a great time...The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere about it...Our room was very clean...The staff more than accomodating...And the location can't be beat...We especially enjoyed their bar area which is very cozy and offers seating/views right along Michigan Ave., so perfect for people watching...This is our 3rd stay in the past 2 years at this hotel, and we much prefer it to others we've stayed in along Michigan Ave., ( although they were nice as well)...Overall I don't think you can go wrong with this hotel, and won't be disappointed if you chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls' Getaway Weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DC/VATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked our flight and the Intercontinental through www.lastminute.com and paid $69 a night for the hotel which was a terrific price for a terrific location right on the 500 block of the Magnificent Mile. The hotel staff were friendly and our room with 2 double beds was spotless and nicely decorated. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the linens were perfectly fluffed and pressed. The piped in air deodorizer was a bit much in the lobby but hardly detracted from our stay. The only reason I didn't rate the hotel as excellent is b/c, in my mind, a hotel has to be perfect for this rating and very few live up to my expectations of excellent. We were able to check in when we arrived at the hotel around 11am and headed out for a quick walk to Portillo's Hot Dogs on Ontario which we definitely recommend. Who knew pickles and tomato on a hot dog could be so good? After that we walked to the Art Institute which is a must see and very walkable from the hotel even though it was a bit nippy. Do yourself a favor and go to Flatwater on North Clark right on the Chicago River after the museum for the amazing $2 appetizers from 5-7pm. You could make a meal out of these alone but we saved some space for Giordano's pizza which was worth the wait. We did not eat at Zest in the Intercontinental as we heard it was overpriced and not that great. The doorman recommended the West Egg Cafe for breakfast on Sat morning which was a short walk from the hotel. What an amazing breakfast for a great price. Do yourself a favor though and get there early as the locals line up starting a little after 9am. A short cab ride away is the Museum of Science and Industry which is definitely worth the price of the cab fare. Check out Body Works 2 if it's there or in your city! After the museum definitely go have a cocktail at the Signature Room on the 95th/96th floor of the Hancock Building. The views are great even if the cocktails are all $11 each. Again, it's a quick walk back to the hotel from the Hancock. Another short walk from the hotel on Ontario is the Chicago Chop House where we had the most amazing and tender steaks (prime rib and filet) and lobster tails. Amy was a great waitress and did us right by recommending the warm chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream for dessert. On your way back to the hotel stop in at Redhead Piano Bar and get there a little early (about 7:30pm) for a seat around the piano. We had the best time singing along with Dave the piano man who sounds almost exactly like Randy Newman. Their cocktail list is long and imaginative and we can vouche for the Y-Spot and Queen's Kiss cocktails. Excalibur for dancing afterwards was a fun (if not somewhat late way) to end the evening. The taxi ride from the hotel to O'Hare is about $50 including gratuity but the cabs were lined up outside even at our early departure time of 5am. You can also get to the hotel from the airport by taking the Blue Line CTA train to the Clark/Lake stop (which is only $2) and then take a cab to the hotel for about $8 including tip. This is a cheap and convenient way to come into the city esp if you want to avoid the morning rush hour traffic. There are many hotel options around on and around the Mag Mile but this location just can't be beat. Besides, hopefully you're not spending too much time in your room when there is the fabulous city of Chicago outside to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired rooms and terrible food”
Reviews.Author: TomBro
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental in Chicago is located right on Michigan Av. (the magnificent mile) which is great. The rooms, however, are tired and gloomy (I stayed in room 456). Particularly the bathroom is a bit shabby and small. The room service is even worse. I ordered a Ruben sandwich - probably one of the least inspired sandwiches I have even seen despite a hefty price. Breakfast (at restaurant Zest) was much the same: Listless eggs and bacon, boring fruit juices and awful cappucino - totally overpriced. The final drop came, as I had ordered a limo service to pick me up. The hotel employees saw me lingering about in the lobby and asked if they coud help. I explained that I was waiting for the limo. Do you think any of them bothered to let me know that there's a seperate entrance for taxi and limosine pick-ups? (I'll let you work that one out for yourselves). Very disappointing stay - will definately try one of the other hotels in downtown Chicago next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chicag0bears
Reviews.Content: I received a really great rate on Priceline to stay at the Hotel Intercontinental Chicago. Upon checking in, I was told the reservation was in the main tower, with two double beds. I asked if there was a room available with a king bed, but was only offered an upgrade for $50 a night in the historic tower. I passed. The room was very nice and clean. My only complaint there, which may seem small.....The light switch for the bathroom is outside the door. So, I kept walking in the bathroom and had to walk back out to turn on the light. Like I said, it was small, kind of became a joke after awhile. Stay away from the restaurant Zest in the hotel, unless you like to overpay for breakfast. We went in there because we didn't have a lot of time before checking out. Discovered after we received the bill that the coffee was $4.25. In my opinion, that is a bit steep!!! Overall, I would suggest this hotel due to the location and the cleanliness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: jbbryan04
Reviews.Content: We just finished a great weekend in Chicago. We have been to this hotel on several occasions and often try others as well, but this continues to be our favorite because it is consistently well maintained, has beautiful amenities, and a great location. This time our family booked a room through Priceline and snagged this lovely property for for only $90. (I did lots of research at other hotels, including this one, to get an idea as to the lowest posted prices for 5 star hotels and then bid $60 under the best price I found.)

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: bjunior
Reviews.Content: Wow, stayed here during a bitter cold snap in December. The hotel was great. I stayed in the historic tower , same buildling as the pool which is amazing. The room was newly redone, beautiful and very comfy. I did not want to leave my room! location can not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MasterTravelerAtl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after receiving a great deal on Priceline which included hotel stay, flights, and rental car from Atlanta for two days for the bargain price of $484! We stayed Friday through Sunday, and we received impeccable service from arrival until departure. From the moment we arrived to the hotel, the valet promptly received our rental vehicle while taking our luggage in record time. Please note that parking is rather steep at $41 daily. The hotel allowed us to check-in early on Friday (approximately 10 am). Once in our room, the luggage handler took time to show us all of the features of our room, explain hotel amenities, and notify us of our restaurant options. Since I was looking for an economical breakfast selection, I called the concierge and he recommended the West Egg Cafe which was quite delicious (in 4 walking blocks of the hotel). After taking a nap, I went to work out in the fitness facilities which were alright (note: $16 for entire stay or $12 a day/ per person). They offer free access to their spectacular junior olympic lap pool and sauna. Overall, I was very pleased with the decor, service, and hotel amenities! This is definitely 4 star quality lodging. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: cecomp76
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the InterContinental having stayed at several other downtown Chicago hotels. We booked through Hotwire and got a fantastic rate of $100 per night. Upon arrival, we upgraded to a "suite" for $50 more per night. So, at a price still far less than what we would have paid for a small hotel room with two beds, we got a room with a living area with pull-out couch, king bed in a separate bedroom, and a view of the lake (albeit partial). Not to mention the fact that you walk out right onto Michigan Avenue - we'd do it again in a heartbeart. Upon arrival, valets were gracious and attentive with baggage. The front desk met our requests without skipping a beat. (The lobby was beautiful at Christmastime with a huge decorated tree.) We didn't use the lounge or the restaurant - too busy sightseeing and shopping - but our room was nice to come back to at night or for a rest during the day. Housekeeping exceeded our request for extra coffee in the room, and even had nice music and dim lighting waiting for us when we returned. I did notice that the armoir in the living area was beaten up a bit around the bottom, and that the sofa had at one point seen better days, but despite the nitpicking thought it was a great hotel room. And for 150 bucks a night in downtown Chicago, who could complain?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: chewettoo
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is positively delightful! Ambience and charm abound. Many thanks to the wonderful guest relations department and friendly, helpful staff! We made a long-awaited mom/daughter 3-day trip to Chicago after Christmas, and the first night, my 11-yr-old got the stomach flu. Thank goodness for our spacious, clean room and, again, the kind hotel staff. Housekeeping was amazing, bringing clean linens and deliveries of ice as soon as I contacted them. The concierge was very helpful, and the hotel's "Instant Service" personnel greet you by name and are happy to answer any questions. They even offered to run out and pick up medicines for us. Although room service is prompt, polite and professional, the food is pricey ($20 for pot of coffee and rolls -- you can pop down to Zest and pick up morning coffee, juice, etc. for a fraction of that). The pool is not to be missed, and rooms in the historic tower are the way to go. Suffice it to say, I was so thankful that we stayed here rather than the Marriott across the street. We will most definitely return -- hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Magnificent Mile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreeSandySprings
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the InterContinental Chicago this past week on business. It's a solid downtown hotel on the Magnificent Mile, but it didn't blow me away. It has what you would expect in a good hotel, but I didn't find it to be beyond a Sheraton or some place like that.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays ever”
Reviews.Author: bestfoot13
Reviews.Content: At $275 I paid well under the normal rates, but stayed better than any NYC hotel at similar pricing. View of Lake Michigan at sunrise, fabulously appointed room, marble bathroom with both a garden tub and separate shower stall. Incredible bed. Wine, fruit, and chocolates brought to my room 10 minutes after I arrived. Impeccable service all the way, even people to help you get to the right elevator. I was there on business and the computer hook ups and desk arrangements served well. Drink prices in the bar were excessive, and my usual complaint of all hotels--where to plug in the iron--was a problem even in this large room. Overall a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at the InterContinental Chicago again”
Reviews.Author: Janiekins53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 nights stay at the InterContinental Chicago. Great downtown location right on the Magnificent Mile. We had a room in the main part of the hotel. What a dump. The furniture was all scratched and worn out. The room was so tiny that my husand and I could barely walk around. I wold never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “hated it!”
Reviews.Author: cwhite1202
Reviews.Content: Be sure to call the hotel for the cheaper rate. I booked online thru hotwire, and thought I received the lowest rate possible. I paid $130 thru hotwire but the bill I received the morning of my checkout was $90.00 I stayed the weekend of the 4th of July. On my checkout date I received a bill for $90 although I had paid online thru hotwire. I checked with guest services and they assured me that the situation would be corrected. Unitl I called my credit card company the next day, and had a charge for $166.00 pending. Not only did the charges include the room rate, but incidental fees that the hotel charged up front, and did not inform me of at check-in. When I tried to correct the situation the day time manager was so non-chalant about it because it was holiday. The end result was that I wrote the executive offices and the hotel manager about my situation. They offered me a free "upgrade" to the VIP suite with full VIP treatment. The hotel didn't even offer to reimburse the difference between what I paid thru hotwire and the rate the hotel charged if I had called directly. I declined the offer, and refuse to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel if you get the right rate”
Reviews.Author: reisejunky
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two weekend nights at this hotel with a friend in June and found it perfectly acceptable. We had a room in the new tower (which may be slated for demolition if the hotel moves on with its expansion plans) which was small but with a view. The service was friendly and prompt. The location is excellent. I have to say, however, that had I not secured a lower rate from an on-line service, the hotel is probably overpriced. I guess in Chicago, with the conventions affecting the rates, its either feast or famine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; pool not the best for beginning swimmers”
Reviews.Author: CamperAtHeart
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a GREAT location -- we enjoyed our 1 night stay. We booked through Hotwire[--] for $182/night on a weekend when both the Tall Ships and LollaPalooza (sp?) were in town and rooms everywhere were expensive. We're more used to Holiday Inn/Comfort Inn type accomodations but even the downtown locations for those chains were more expensive, at least for the night we were staying. The valet staff courteously explained the parking/luggage process (something we are used to doing ourselves), and the front desk staff were efficient if not overly friendly. However, housekeeping ignored our Do Not Disturb sign and rang our doorbell promptly at 9 AM to see if they could make up our room. Also, the light bulb was burned out in the small entry hallway in our room, making it hard to see in the hallway closet. The bellhop that brought up our luggage said he would contact maintenance to get it fixed, but nothing ever happened. Another word of caution: parking is $41, not the $10 to $25 estimate listed on the Hotwire website. However, we were allowed to drop off the car 2 hours before check-in time (our room was ready that early also), and leave it in the garage 5 hours after check-out. We walked or took free trolleys everywhere (Navy Pier, Millenium Park, American Girl Store, Rainforest Cafe), saving us parking fees at other places. The pool area is gorgeous, if you like historical decor, which we do. The pool itself is huge (75 feet long). However the shallow end is 4 feet deep, so if you have young children be sure to bring their flotation devices. Our daughter ended up using the kickboards that are available at the fitness center desk (one of the few things that were free). We were a little surprised that there was a substantial daily fee ($17?) to use the fitness center. Our room was in the Historical Tower, and faced Michigan Ave. As another reviewer mentioned, we heard sirens all night, even though our windows were closed. We just figured that was part of the Chicago experience! Our room had 2 double beds, but one of them was about 6" from the wall. It was fine for the three of us, but a fourth person would have had a hard time getting out of bed. Obviously hard for the maid to vacuum also, as there was a row of dust bunnies along that baseboard. Otherwise the room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: manders318
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. Was impressed with the public areas but my room was small in a stange way... it was long but not wide. There was about 3 feet of room between the foot of my bed and the wall. The bathroom was unnecessarily large and if made smaller, the bedroom could have been larger. The pool, fitness room, and banquet rooms were well decorated but in a exaggerated, Las Vegas resort way. I probably wouldn't stay for leisure travel as I wouldn't spend that much money on a night at this hotel unless I was guaranteed a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: momfour4
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here for our 10th wedding anniv. Five night stay Aug 2-7th, 2006. Booked by phone from number on web site with a special rate--309.00 the first night, then 239.00 the rest of the stay. Well that turned out to be a misquote--the 239.00 was only to be for the one night on Thursday and then back to the 309.00 for the remainder of stay. When I found the mistake in rate I called and spoke with Josh Ellerman in Guest Relations. Apparently they had recorded the original booking conversation and the hotel did honor the 239.00 rate. He was very nice, polite, and helpful. The hotel is lovely, great location and very clean rooms. All the staff at the hotel was very nice, polite and more than helpful. We did encounter problems with finding out the hard way there is a fee for every little thing--ex: free local calls, but only up to 19 mins, after that there is a fee per minute--not informed of that when inquired concerning charges. So be careful when using internet. They will charge your credit card 75.00 a day for "incidentals" and they stated it is on their web site, but we never saw it--must be the tiny little print that no one reads! Just little things like that. We did not park, but they charge 41.00 a day for parking. Close to bus pick up and El trains, Walgreens and Starbucks about a block away--very handy!! Right in the heart of the city!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: AJ1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7/24-30/2006, after having stayed here last October, which was a pleasant experience. We weren't so fortunate this time. First, we arrived at 8:00pm only to be told our room wouldn't be available for at least an hour. Not acceptable when you're paying $350 a night, in my opinion. So we had to do the luggage storage thing while we went to dinner, which cost us a couple of extra tips. When we checked in after dinner at Ditka's, the drapery sheer was torn loose and hanging sideways from the curtain rod, the carpet in the entry way was soaking wet, and the bed was sunken in the middle like a hammock. It was late so we decided we'd deal with it the next day. The pillows on the bed were these awful feather pillows (are we the only people who don't like feather pillows??), so we requested foam pillows. The ones they sent up weren't much better. The next morning I was getting dressed for a business meeting, had my socks on, walked over to the closet, only to soak my socks on the still wet carpet - not happy! We asked to be switched to a different room that afternoon, and they accommodated us. We asked for foam pillows up front, and didn't get them, so we had to go thru the whole ask and wait scenario again. Pillows were a bit better this go-around. This room was better, but the problems of the first couple of days left a pretty bad memory for us. The location of the hotel is great - easy walking to many shops on Mich Ave. We had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant - Zest - and it was $57+ for the buffet for 2 people!! I have to admit it was very good, but it certainly should have been. If you like to have a cocktail at the hotel bar in the evening, forget it here. The bar was always full, with nowhere to sit, and incredibly noisy. So, they lost a lot of business from us over the course of the week. Overall, I think we'll have to try a different hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Intercontinental Hotel everywhere but in the pocketbook”
Reviews.Author: MsBach
Reviews.Content: Certainly the most luxurious hotel in which I have ever stayed, the Intercontinental was the second choice for our recent organists' convention. Alas, few organists can spend even the AARP rate of $161.00 plus tax per night Mon - Wed in early July. The Sunday night rate was even higher. Two clean double beds were provided along with a large screen TV. A Nintendo was available, but I did not use it. The restaurant is named ZEST, and I did enjoy the vegetable pizza with white cheese on top for $9.50. It was quite a shock Monday morning when I saw that a hot breakfast would cost $23.50 and a cold Continental breakfast would be $17.50 or perhaps $13.50. Express breakfast was available, according to a gold card in the corner, with coffee $2, juice $2, a bagel $2, cereal $4. I finally settled on a cold cereal for $3.75 and coffee (which must be served) and a small glass of juice of $4.25 plus tax and tip. The housekeeper did her job well, but I was called early one afternoon and heard a door knock on another, even though the Privacy Please sign was on the door.. The Chicago Trib was provided free on Monday, Wed and Thurs (Tues was a holiday). We were asked to leave the dark blue cover in the room to be used again. This hotel did not offer the option of not washing the sheets and/or towels to save on energy. Wireless internet access was available in the room; I visited the Business Center twice for internet access. During the day, I could enter without a key. Late at night, the receptionist had to rekey my room card so that I could enter the locked room. There is a minimum of $6.75 for 15 minutes; more than 15 becomes $.45 per minute, payable to another business via credit card, not the hotel. Elevators worked well. Ice was available on on the 7th floor. On a busy weekend, I had to wait an extra hour to check in to a non-smoking room. Smoking rooms were available. In the room, in addition to the typical "mini Bar," was an assortment of snacks. Individually they would cost $28.75; as a package deal they cost $16.00. I managed to restrain myself from using those. A travel toothbrush and toothpaste would have cost $2, which surprised me.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: LLori
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what everyone is expecting with the room size. My last trip to Chicago was in a Club Quarter's, Loop location and the room was much, much smaller, so I had no problems with our room (2362) facing the lake. The remodel of the hotel seems to have worked- as our bathroom was faultless and had an attractive sink. My only off-note was that the tub was small. Still, I have no complaints. I discovered that I have an allergic reaction to down feather pillows, asked for a hypoallergenic pillow, received it when our room was turned down. We got phone calls to confirm the pillow and other requests. The staff was courteous at check-in and throughout. When I used the pool, I was glad to be told to shower in the locker room. There was only one other person there in the pool, so none of the masses I was expecting. The work out room is small, but there's the Lake so I didn't use the work out facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the location can't be beat. We stayed three nights, June 23-26. Hotel has gone down a bit since I stayed last year (June 05). I am a priority club member but didn't really get anything from the Intercontinental to show for it, not even a newspaper outside the door. Had requested a room with a view and thought it would be fairly easy since it was the weekend. The room faced a construction site so most of our view was of the cranes outside. Don't know why they couldn't have done better since hotel was not that crowded. They did put us in a king-size, as requested, but the very small room made it seem quite cramped. Other minor annoyances included: a bathroom exhaust fan that didn' t work (steam took forever to dissipate making shaving etc. next to impossible) and toilet that wouldn't flush unless you held down handle for whole cycle. Another minor peeve was the very strict instructions from the pool/gym attendant to shower before using the pool. I have no problem with this, but the pool was FILLED with kids and during the times I was there I didn't see one of them ever leave to go use the bathroom, so you can only imagine! Hotel staff were polite but not particularly accommodating. At checkout, they noted it but weren't too concerned when I told them bathroom needed some maintenance. I will definitely look elsewhere next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A classic, old school hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Girloadventure
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location.... this hotel has it in spades. We walked to everything and anything from this hotel and enjoyed that very much. An older hotel so it has smallish rooms, we stayed at the intercontinental because we got a deal on Priceline ($100 on a summer weekend night). Comfy bed. Quiet and clean. The staff at the front desk is a tad big city disinterested but the straff at the restaurant was very attentive and patient. We noticed that they paid special attention to a family with children near us at breakfast, getting them crayons, talking to the children and making sure they could find something they liked to eat. Parking is a total rip off: parking on site is $41 a night!!! Yikes! Had we not arrived at Midnight, we would've parked elsewhere and walked. Gorgeous lobby. We had a nice view of the Magnificent Mile. Can walk to the Navu Pier, Millenium Park, shopping, museums, the lake, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BIZZTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location was great! It's on Michigan Ave., and smack dab in the middle of the magnificent mile. You can walk easily to everything. The hotel staff was 'ok', they weren't overly or under helpful, just OK. The hotel is beautiful though, having a renovated historic side and a more cosmopolitan side that are both beautiful, but the rooms are small, very nice, but small. The pool was nice, but there was no jacuzzi! If you're going for a visit or business, this is a nice hotel. The small room is more than compensated by the location. Location is king!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the famous Magnificent mile, next to Chicago Tribune Newspaper and across from Nordstrom. Marriott and Conrad hotels are across the street. Walgreen and Starbuck are across the street as well. Good to know that there's a convenient store nearby to buy bottled water, because the one in the room costs $6 and it's not even a big bottle but that is typical for a hotel like this. Walking distance to a Navy Pier. About 2 miles from the planetarium, Aquarium and field museum. Walking distance to Hancock Observatory center. Lots of designers shops right on the Magnificent mile (that is same as Michigan Avenue) like Coach, Salvatore Ferragamo, Burberry, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, etc. We stayed at the historic tower which is supposedly better than the main building. We were upgraded to a deluxe corner room because we're an Ambassador member. It is definitely worth it to be a member for a fee of $150 for the first year and $100 to renew. Check out the Intercontinental website to learn more about it. Anyway, the room is very nice because we have both the city view and the lake view. The elevator is slow because there are only 2 elevators that go without any stops to floor 23 thru 41. There is no other choice to take either one of these elevators because the others do not go to these floors. We were on the 29th floor. The window for some reason are not quite sound proof as we heard sirine everyday. Imagine we're already on the 29th floor. We dined once at Zest restaurant (a restaurant at this hotel). It's pleasantly good. Food in Chicago for us is not that good. We thought that it was gonna be as good as NewYork but it's not. Los Angeles is much better. Chicago pizza is not good at all. Thick and tasteless. The hotel service is just average. We were supposed to get complimentary fruit basket and bottled water when we checked in because of our Ambassador membership but we had to call twice before they finally sent someone to bring them to our room. They were also going to charge us for a movie which was supposed to be complimentary as well. The bathroom has no counter place to store your stuff and has one sink. One morning I had to wait for 10 minutes to have hot water in the shower. I thought I was gonna have to move to another room. The receptionists are not that friendly. That's really bad for a hotel like this. The housekeeper is very good though because she or he did not throw away things unless you place them in a trash can. I hate not being able to find my stuff when I return to the room. The best place to come to downtown Chicago is to take a train (CTA), the blue line and get off at Lake then catch a taxi to the hotel. It costs less than $2 for the train ride (about 45 minute ride) and about $7 taxi ride to the hotel. Of course! if you have many luggages, it's always best to take a taxi from the airport. Costs about $50 if there's no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Way Below expectations, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Virg777
Reviews.Content: After reading all the lukewarm reviews for this hotel, I went ahead and got an Ambassador membership just to hedge off any unpleasantness. I normally have a good experience with Intercontinental hotels, particularly the Mark Hopkins in SF. I called the hotel directly to confirm that my reservation was designated as Ambassador Club. When I arrived at the hotel, there was no separate check-in line (as advertised) and the manager on duty basically ignored me when I told him I was an ambassador club member and stuck me with a regular tiny room. I was nearly half an hour checking in the room and had to deal with the arrogant attitude of the manager on duty. They gave me a room in the "modern" tower, (built in the 60's) which was about 2/3 the size of a regular room at the Mark Hopkins (built in '29). I had to deal with torn sheets, cracked marble sinks, and the spare roll of toilet paper being located OUTSIDE the bathroom inside the closet - how convenient is that? The closet door, if you are not careful, may break the full length mirror attached to the bathroom door. I was not provided with a key to the minibar and I called for turndown service, which never happened. The next day, they finally got around to the fact that I was an Ambassador Club member and entitled to an upgraded room, but since I travel with a medical device which I already set up in the tiny room, I declined. To their credit, they did send some of the amenities I would otherwise be entitled to as an Ambassador Club member. I would not stay at this hotel next time I go to Chicago. There are other better places for the money including, the Omni, The James, The Fairmont, Hyatt, Sheraton, Monaco, Crowne Plaza, even the Holiday Inn and Marriotts located in the same general area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgrady3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend and it was great. The check-in staff changed our room to a single bed without question, and the bar served the best martini I have had in a while. The rooms were well decorated and spacious, although it did get a little tight through the bathroom door. The bell staff was very accomodating and walked my wife up to our room when she arrived late. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask for a room that is NOT facing Michigan Ave. I like to sleep with my windows open but the traffic, horns and noise forced me to close the windows. Once I switched, all was wonderful. Just a hint you might like to know about!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you swim for fitness”
Reviews.Author: msavaria
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my hosts when I was invited to speak at a conference. Everything about it looked fabulous on-line, but I was a little worried by some of the reviews. I actually had a wonderful stay. I was in room 1402 in the historic tower. I got to see a lot of the hotel, because we had events in various places. Overall, it is a wonderful hotel. My room was very large and beautifully furnished, but, because I like to review hotels I've stayed in and felt that I wasn't having the average experience, I started asking other conference attendees how their rooms were. The two people I asked separately were unenthusiastic and complained of small, "O.K." rooms. The lowest conference rate those paying guests got was $209. The conference rate for the room I stayed in was $249. Depending on where in the country you are from, you may have very high expectations when spending that kind of money. My own room was very large and beautifully furnished. It had a king-sized bed, a lovely armoir that housed the television and mini-bar items, a desk and upholstered chair, an easy chair and ottoman, a small sofa, and an upholstered bench at the end of the bed. Everything was in perfect condition, the art was nice, and the room afforded that fabulous view down Michigan Avenue that another reviewer mentioned. There was a massaging shower head in the glass-enclosed shower in the lovely bathroom that also contained a tub. There were plenty of towels, and they were very nice and thick (so I thought the towel complaint in another review was curious). A scale and a hairdryer were provided, and there was lotion, shower gel, and ample Yardley soap. Toiletries were replenished daily. A complimentary newspaper was also delivered daily, and the in-room coffee was actually very good (I've never said this before.) Now, even though I seem to have had an exceptional room and loved the hotel, I do agree with one of the reviews I read before my trip that said this is in no way a 5-star hotel. Here's why. First, the toiletries were not very nice. I usually bring my own shampoo, but decided that since I wouldn't be there too long and there was sure to be complimentary shampoo, I wouldn't bother -- big mistake. There was a combination shampoo/conditioner that was not good. Second, there was no make-up mirror, and I defy anyone to apply make-up with the available lighting. I also defy anyone to read using the lighting available in the main room. Third, the robes provided were those spa-type waffle robes (which I actually discovered I like, but most luxury hotels provide thick, terry robes). Now, please don't get the idea that the bathroom was dirty. It wasn't. However, I could see stains at the back of the toilet bowl that extra attention with a brush would have eliminated. Next, the hairdryer was that same basic Andis wall-attached model that they have in even the most basic hotels. (Any woman would have to bring her own.) Finally, there was no turn-down service. In a 5-star hotel, one expects to return home in the evening to a turned down bed, robes laid out, chocolate on the pillow, and soft music playing on the radio. Guests staying in even the worst available room in a 5-star hotel should not be saying, "It was O.K. but nothing special." Now, on to the pool. Although the pool is surrounded by patio-type furniture, this is neither the sort of pool that you'd relax around or a suitable playground for kids. There is nothing romantic about it. The pool and room have historical interest. The pool is long and divided into several lanes. This is a pool to swim laps in -- nothing more. If you are a swimmer, however, everything I just wrote will be hugely appealing. There was little competition for a lane in this pool at 6:30 a.m., and at other times, I never saw anyone in it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Southern_RN
Reviews.Content: We also stayed over Easter weekend, 2 adults and 1 teenager. We had booked several months in advance and found that by joining the Intercontinental Ambassador Club we were able to receive a free night, plus automatically upgraded. We stayed in a Junior Suite in the Historic Tower. WOW!! The view was phenominal !!!! I was worried about the service because of the recent bad reviews, but we sure didn't see any signs of the complaints listed. We did eat at the hotel, and it was great. Pricey, but no more so than other really nice restaurants in town. Try the crabcake appetizer, best I've ever tasted. We loved everything about the hotel, and hated leaving. We will definitely stay there next time. Thanks for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdblues
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Easter weekend. 2 Adults 1 child. I booked the room early for $129 a night on the hotels web page. I was a little anxious after reading reviews, when we arrived the front desk they were very friendly, we were upgraded to a suite in the main building, it was wonderful. Sometimes a smile and a tip, will go a long way! Everyone was very friendly, housekeaping even gave my son a chocolate bunny on Easter. I don't know why people complain about housekeaping they work very hard, we also leave a couple of dollars for housekeaping everyday we stay, I think they really appriciate it and it shows because our room is always very clean. As far as location goes, you are right on michigan ave. the Norstrom mall is across the street and for the kids there is a great lego store, that has amaizing full size lego structures. You have a wallgreens and starbucks across the street. We did not eat at the hotel prices were very high. There are so many resturants in Chicago all within walking distance, go to Giordano's for pizza,if you go at 4:00 there is not a wait, (you do have to wait 30 min. for the pizza so order a salad and enjoy your surroundings) for breakfast there is a great diner right around the corner called Mary's Cafe, nothing special just great food for under $10. it is on the north side of the building go down the stairs to the street below and walk straight ahead it is on the right. Thank-you again InterContinental! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service; Not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental while in town for a conference. I wont go back!!! The service was terrible! Our room was not ready by check-in time. A "computer glitch" casued the front desk to wake me up at 11:15 PM to verify who was staying in the room. The front desk staff service is poor. The pool is 4 feet deep in the shallow end -which is not all that family friendly. It did not seems as though the hotel appreciated having children as guests. After our first night the maid service did not replace many of the items in our room such as a tub mat, coffee supplies and the glassware. I attended several functions at the Palmer House Hilton as part of the conference. It appears to be a much better hotel and next time I am in town I will try to book there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have already been travelling for business so I was quite happy when I got to the Intercontinental. This part of my business trips was for a mini vacation in between, and the other places I stayed at prior to Chicago (in Boston) weren't as impressive. There is a new and old part of the hotel. There some little things that gave it away that it was an older hotel, but the hotel was able to restore it quite well. (Unlike the place in Boston I stayed at). The location was great, right on the Mag Mile. Across the street was the Nordstrom Mall with a Spa (that I def. recommend)! It was beautiful outside (which I heard is rare in March) so we walked to the Navy Pier. The Wrigley building was also walking distance and so was crossing the river over a bridge tainted green for St. Patty's Day! I was quite happy staying at this hotel. It's not the most elaborate hotel, but I would consider there staying again! It was def. up there.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, but I would not stay here again as a result of the rude and demeaning staff. The check-in agent was surly when we asked for a room away from the elevator (and it was a polite request). We called down twice with questions for staff members and both times were put on hold with nary a word of apology or concern for our time. Both times I was cut off in midsentance with one word, just 'hold'. When checking out, my husband discovered a billing error and brought it to the attention of the young man who spent five minutes arguing with my husband. He told us over and over that if it was on the bill it was correct. We finally asked for a manager, who was even less helpful. The manager insisted that we must have ordered $90 worth of room service if it was on the bill. We finally got the bill fixed, but the attitude of every staff member we encountered at this hotel seemed to be that the hotel is right and customers are wrong. Next time, we will take our business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: prospero1b
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the InterContinental on a business trip. This is a tremendous, towering hotel in one of the best locations in Chicago â€“ right on the Magnificent Mile and superbly convenient for shopping and well placed for the business area. My room was in the Historic Tower â€“ a 1920s Masonic Club which has been converted at enormous expense. The effort has been worthwhile. My room was very large and well furnished, with a beautiful bathroom which contained a separate shower cubicle. It had breathtaking views down Michigan Avenue. There is a superb recreation centre (with an impressive swimming pool) beautiful bars and a good restaurant, Zest, that serves a great breakfast. There is wifi in the rooms ($9.95 per day) and tea and coffee making facilities. No trouser press, but there is an ironing board and iron. The staff is friendly and anxious to please. I recommend this hotel in the strongest possible terms. Itâ€™s expensive, but it will be difficult to find a better one in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure how this is a LUXURY hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan577
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but I was surprised this is a luxury hotel. The rooms are very small, the sheets and towels are not high quality, and the room service took 2 min just to answer the phone. I would rather stay at the Lennox suites and pay half the price for twice the room.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but a little nickle & dimey”
Reviews.Author: JSRPhx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental for an entire week on business and for the most part a very elegant, convenient visit. Stayed in the historic tower. Very nice rooms, great view, attentive staff, convenient location just north of the Tribune Tower & the river, and nice fitness club at $16 for the entire stay. The only downside is I couldn't get over the feeling that I was being nickle & dimed: $10 a day for Wi-Fi, $6 bottles of water in the room, $26 mini-bottle of wine in the fridge, tipping multiple staff for carrying the same bags, etc. Their in-house restaurant Zest is Zagat rated though I'm not sure why. Within a 5 minute walk there are plenty of great restaurants with much better food than Zest. But, next time I need to be near the Loop I'd stay at the InterContinental again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, skip Zest”
Reviews.Author: StripesTTiger
Reviews.Content: OK, let me start by saying that the Intercontinental is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! It is beautiful, full of historic charm and peaceful. If you are looking for a place that really is in the middle of everything on the Mag Mile this is it. Our room was fantastic. We opted for the historic tower king bedroom with a city view. My wife and I loved the interior of the room. It was clean and tastefully decorated. Our bed was extremely comfortable, making it hard to escape from in the morning! Best of all the view was amazing. We had a great view of the Wrigely and Tribune buildings. We were also able to see the river and lake Michigan. Now, the reason I give this hotel an above average...Zest. The Intercontinental should start from scratch on this one. At first glance the decor is very cool. On closer inspection you realize the furnishings are sub-par. They could have done better buying everything at IKEA. The food is average and overpriced. We opted for a breakfast included package on our room. However I think I would have felt like I got ripped off if I paid full price for it. $50 for eggs and OJ! The second day we went there we opted for the buffet which was insane. During our stay there was a business conference and a couple of weddings at the hotel. This meant a full house and Zest was not prepared. We waited in line for about 20 minutes to get bacon and eggs only to get to the eggs and have them taken away for a refill that never came! I could go on and on but the best piece of advice would be to skip it. There are a lot of great places for breakfast and other meals in the area. Billy Goat offers breakfast for under $5 and it's worth the classic Chicago experience. To sum it up stay at the Intercontinental and skip Zest. Save the extra mony for Cole Haan, Neiman Marcus or Crate and Barrel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: We recently had our January sales meeting at the Intercontinental Hotel and our group was very happy with the stay. The hotel sales department was very accommodating for our needs, even extending several of the team's stays for 2-4 days at our negotiated price. The location was perfect, right on the Magnificent Mile. Definitely a great place for a meeting in Chicaog.

Reviews.Title: “I was shocked!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would have to say after reading the TripAdvisor reviews from Oct. 2005, I was very concerned about my upcoming scheduled hotel reservation. Much to my surprise the hotel was very nice. I stayed in the Historic Towers on the 18th floor. Checking in/out was a smooth transaction, friendly staff, large room, seperate marble bath and shower, great location, breathing taking view of the city and lake. I am so glad that I went ahead and kept my reservations for this hotel. I am looking forward to my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be my favorite hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the second time. Our first trip in August was wonderful-the room was huge and the staff fabulous. This time, however, we experienced all sorts of problems. We had booked our room (a king in the historic tower) over the internet-no deal ($349.00 per night)- but convenient. When we arrived, there was a large group of foreign tourists having all sorts of problems. After 15 minutes, the man behind me went to the assistant manager and demanded she help check people in. Naturally she was angry and after many heavy sighs, checked us in. The room was in the new tower and tiny with two small double beds. We immediately went downstairs to correct the room situation. My husband had written confirmation of our room, but this didn't matter-she insisted on arguing that this "wasn't in the computer." After advising her I was tired of her snotty attitude, we finally got the room we paid for. The luggage took forever to get to the room and the elevators were incredibly slow. The doormen were great though. The location is awesome and it's a shame that the management staff is so unresponsive. Our daughter is a student in the Chicago area and we will be visiting several times a year-we thought we had finally found "our" hotel. Prior to this trip, we had already booked a room for our anniversary in January-we'll see.

Reviews.Title: “A matter of taste...”
Reviews.Author: stephantravel
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Intercontinental on a trip combining business and leisure. I chose the hotel for its central location and for the good rate I could get. I would say that the hotel is really a matter of taste. My room was fairly nice although a bit oldfashioned and faded. However, everything was very clean - and the bathroom was nice and modern. I just had one single very small window though which made the room look quite dark. The swimming pool is beautiful and large (although the decoration there may also be a matter of taste). In general, I didn't find staff as friendly and welcoming as in other hotels. My room had not been cleaned at 2pm (although I left it around 9am) and I had to call housekeeping to remind them! In-room dining was a bit slow as well although the quality of the food was good. Staff at the fitness center were very polite. All in all, I would only recommend the hotel if you can get a good price - and some people may really love its style as well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Serenitybee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and we were extremely disappointed! While the hotel itself is fantastically beautiful, it did not make up for all of the problems we had with the staff. Check-out time is 11am, however the maid came by every day at 9am to clean the room and got upset if we weren't ready to leave! A couple of days she unlocked our door and walked right in, while we were still in bed! She even stole our bottle of champagne, which was still half full. When we complained, she marched up and pounded on our door, demanding we call her boss and say that it was all OUR fault, so she wouldn't get in trouble! She maintaned that the bottle was empty, of course. To the credit of the hotel, they did give us a new bottle for free, and we didn't see that particular maid for the rest of the week. Not that the other staff members were any better, because the people staying in the room next to us had similar problems. As we passed their room one morning, a man and a maid unlocked their door, walked right up to them in bed and demanded to know when they were leaving...and they were still booked for one more night! I would also strongly caution anyone who wants to book a room here over their internet website, because I did, and my credit card number was stolen! Believe me, the discounted rates that their internet site offers, will not make up for the horrible experience. I will never stay at one of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for his business meeting and the room was very comfortable. We stayed on the 21st floor so the street noise wasn't an issue. I liked how the room was decorated very modern very simple, but there was dust on the stands. I went to get an extra pillow in the closet and there was a questionable stain on it. I must say though that the bathroom was very clean and roomy for both my husband and I. The bed was pretty comfortable. We found that the concierge was very helpful when it came to dining recommendations. Of course we had to try a Chicago hot dog. I loved the fact that the hotel was close to everything. The lake was within walking distance. Shopping everywhere you turn. We had breakfast at Zest down in the lobby. Although the prices were a little steep. Both the food and the service were great. Aside from the dust and the pillow. Both problems easily fixed We would stay there again but mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Faded yet wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Occi0
Reviews.Content: August 15-17, 2005 my husband and I spent 3 nights at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago, whose locaiton is perfect for walking to the river, the lakeshore, Grant Park, Mich. Ave, and even restaurants in River North. We opted for the rooms in the old portion of the hotel where room and bath were large, beds comfy and we loved overlooking lively Mich. Ave. Decor was a bit worn but on two afternoons at 3 PM, tired from walking the city, we had their glorious old tiled pool to ourselves and felt like we were staying in the Hearst Castle. It was simply wonderful. Beware the hotel bar which couldn't make a drinkable Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Pricey”
