Reviews.Author: sobore
Reviews.Content: Great Location, decent staff. Be careful not to drink the $5.95 bottles of water and stay away from the high priced minibar. Zest restaurant on the property had a $22 breakfast buffet which was pretty good. If you like big soft towels this is not your place. The room was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. Overall a very good property with a few improvements needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Dont Expect 5 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this hotel is a very nice choice for anyone heading to the Windy City. The problem is that the 5 star hotel price does not yield 5 star hotel quality. If you can get this hotel for $200 per night or lower, you will be happy with what you get. Over $200 per night and you might feel a tad ripped off. The hotel, it should be noted, charges $12 per day for use of its fitness center. I found this to be absolutely ridiculous considering I paid top dollar for my room. In addition, the hotel charges $10 per day for use of its high speed internet in the rooms. It's not the price that annoys me (anyone staying here can afford $12) but the tackiness and cheapness of such a luxury hotel. These petty fees irritated me considerably. In terms of service, I had no qualms. Maid service as well as valet parking service were fine and all employees were always polite and helpful. One semi-major annoyance which has been continually stated in the forum is the loudness of the A/C units in the rooms. It really is noisy and one should call the front desk immediately if this problem occurs (perhaps to suggest a room change). All in all a nice hotel but dont pay rack rate. You might be angry at yourself after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are very spacious. Great service. Very good dining. Every thing you would expect from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 5-Star... 3-maybe”
Reviews.Author: KeithGP
Reviews.Content: Let me get the awful part of our 12-day vacation out of the way. The InterContinental Chicago is just average at best. Maybe it was just the room. Maybe it was our last stop on our 5-city tour. Whatever it was, InterContinental Chicago was our family's least favorite stop. My boys are 14, 13, and 6 and they all thought this hotel was the worst in comparison to the Westin NY, Embassy Suites Niagara Falls, Wyndham Cleveland and Hyatt Detroit Southfield. The room was smaller than average size (even the New York room was larger) but the A/C unit was not the right fit for it. It ran constantly and was very loud in spurts. It was loud enough to hamper a good night's rest. The water pressure in the hotel was faulty as well. The sink ran as if the water had been recently turned off in the hotel. The shower sputtered the same way with a serious variance in water temperature. I alerted the hotel staff and management on duty the following morning. She promised to hava an engineer look. We returned to find everything the same, except for the wonderful job from the room staff. I instantly went to tell the manager on duty who was so swamped that I could not wait to see him, so I left a note. Since nothing was done, the last manager we spoke with tried to make everything better. That helped the stay tremendously, but my boys still gave it the worst rating. The pool is magnificent on the 12th floor. The elevators are quick. The staff is friendly. Don't get me wrong. The hotel is clean for sure. It is definitely a nice hotel, but when you see 4 and 5-star, you expect a certain level of excellence. The valet is slow and awkward. Don't lose your valet tag with number or you might lose your vehicle. At one point when we returned, we had to leave our car doubled parked in the middle of Michigan Ave in the middle of Chicago. The awkward part is that you have to go to the hot basement to retrieve your vehicle and you have NO idea where you are and which way you are facing. It was a little unsettling. My wife asks if she is wrong in thinking that if we pay $41 for valet that they should bring the car back close to where you left it and not in some smelly basement? Or is that just in Texas? The view was atrocious. We were in the main building facing the other building. Needless to say, we kept the curtains drawn all day. The in-room safe was a tad bit small for my Dell 15" screen laptop. There are 2 phones in the room-one is in the bathroom (neat!!!) The beds were hard and uncomfortable. Nothing compares to the Heavenly Beds at the Westin. We will NOT go back to the InterContinental Chicago. It received the coveted "Ah BOO!" accreditation from our family. I had intended on posting pictures of the view but we neglected to take any because of how bad it was. I did take a cell phone shot of the pool and a night view of the front. Feel free to ask me any questions you might have.

Reviews.Title: “Really unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental over Memorial Day weekend 2005 and we were less than impressed. The location is good and our room was very nice, so no complaints there. However, the staff were dreadful. In fact, the hotel seemed to be understaffed to us and because it was a holiday weekend and there was an England/USA soccer match the place was packed. On three of the four mornings there was no hot water for a shower. We complained, but nothing was done to remedy the situation. A guy with a wrench turned up the final morning and told us that the water was fine. Great - I'd taken 3 cold showers by this point and seemed to be being told I was imagining it! Then, on the Saturday night, I broke a glass in the bathroom and needed help clearing it up. We waited an hour for housekeeping to either turn up or call us and let us know they were on their way - nothing. I cleared the glass as best I could with my bare hands so we could use the basin to clean our teeth. Two hours later a new shift of staff came on duty and we were called to see if the glass had been taken care of. It was gone midnight and we were asleep so the call woke us. I told them I'd dealt with it. For a five star hotel with prices to match this was not the kind of service we expected. We were unimpressed, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wt88
Reviews.Content: Recently stay at this hotel during the hottest days in Chicago. We stay at the new tower on the 25th floor. The room was small but nicely decorated. The a/c fan was non-stop and it was noisy, but it kept the room cool. The heated pool was excellent for lap swimmers, very ornate and old world. The location is excellent. Hightly recommend for touris and anyone want to stay in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl210
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the International Rotary Convention at McCormick Place in Chicago, having spent seven nights at the Intercontinental Hotel on N. Michigan Avenue. From the first night we had problems with the air conditioning unit in our room. First the thermostat was replaced, but still the fan whined day and night, keeping my husband *sleepless in Chicago*. A second thermostat was installed and the fan worked properly for an hour, finally cooling off the room, when it promptly died yet again. A hot, sticky, muggy room at $229 per night plus tax is unacceptable. They offered to give us a half rate on the last night but my husband was so perturbed at that point that he decided to fly home and dispute charges with our credit card company. This from a wonderfully mellow fellow (and local incoming Rotary president) who rarely ever becomes angry about anything. We would have changed hotels had the city not been booked solid.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes up for shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here each time we travel to Chicago (2-5 times a year.) Overall our experiences have been positive. Rooms are nice and always clean. Bar and restaurant are excellent and pricey but comparitive to others in the area. Fitness center and pool are great! I agree with another review that the Bell Service is only OK. Overall, it's a good place to stay with great views of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: jhannon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and it was beautiful! The rooms were big and very modern. The bathroom was gorgeous! Our only complaint was that the A/C didn't work very well and it was stuffy. Otherwise, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: AndreasHamburg
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Close to everything. The building itself is worth to take a look at. The service is sub average. The bell staff didn't help us with our bags. The check in was friendly but not doing her job good. As a member of their Six Conbtinents Club they guarantee a quick check in and an upgrade. Guess what - we didn't receive any. The next day other promised stuff still wasn't in our room. So I went to the manager. Friendly again. But no help only promises. Two days before we left there was a written apology and a bottle of champagne delivered to our room, but the room wasn't made up. The room itself in the historic tower ("business") was well appointed, the bed comfi, the ac too loud.

Reviews.Title: “The Junior Suite had Everything!”
Reviews.Author: SportsTraveler
Reviews.Content: May be the best hotel experience I have ever had. We got upgraded on New Year's Eve to the Junior Suite. What a great upgrade from the standard room we are accustomed to. This room has TWO full bathrooms and a great sitting area. Everything about this place spells class. The front desk appeared happy to see us and everthing exceeded our expectations. Great view of Michigan Avenue, but not noisy. We live in the Chicago area and don't stay downtown that often, but when we do we will certainly look here first.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it - bad, bad service!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAK_IV
Reviews.Content: Good location, but we had no hot water for our showers in the morning (they ran out)! They also failed to clean up a broken glass in our bathroom despite calling housekeeping three times, and they stole a woman's top from us that we left in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Intercontinental over the Memorial holiday weekend, and I first must say that it is in the ideal location. It seems to be smack dab in the middle of all the touristy sites just at the southern end of the Magnificent Mile, great for you shoppers, and just north of Millenium Park, the Art Institute and the other museums. It is also about the same distance from Navy Pier. I could not think of a hotel with a better location. I stayed in a room in the historic building with a view of the Chicago Tribune building, the NBC building, The Wrigley Building and, ahem some less thrilling views of air conditioners on a smaller building, but nothing is perfect, right? The hotel's service was very good in that they made every accomodation I requested. However, there were a few things that I was supposed to receive as an ambassador member that I had to ask for, which should have been automatic. The business center is also expensive (minuimum 7 dollars for 15 min) and was closed for the holiday, which I thought was strangely inconvenient. Other than that, the rooms were nice, clean, well-sized and quiet. I can't speak for the main-bulding rooms though. I am giving the hotel an "Excellent" rating, although it is more 4.5 star. Be sure not to miss Garrett's Popcorn on Michigan Ave. It's the best caramel corn you will ever have!
